original: zhes pa ni gzugs dang reg bya la sogs pa'i yul la de nyid dang lus kyi dbang po la sogs pa las yul der snang ba byung zhing de'i rjes su skyes pa'i bde ba la mngon par zhen pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni gzugs dang reg bya la sogs pa'i yul la de nyid dang lus kyi dbang po la sogs pa las yul der snang ba byung zhing de'i rjes su skyes pa'i bde ba la mngon par zhen pa'o //
translated: This is attachment to pleasure that arises from objects such as form and tactility, and from the sense faculties such as the body, and that arises in dependence on those objects.

original: da ltar bde la ma 'ongs pa na sdug bsngal skye ba'i rgyur gyur pa ni ji skad du 'phags pa ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyal po las /
analyzed: da ltar bde la ma 'ongs pa na sdug bsngal skye ba'i rgyur gyur pa ni ji skad du 'phags pa ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyal po las /
translated: That which is pleasant now but becomes a cause of suffering in the future is like the following passage from the noble SamaÃÑdhiraÃÑja-suÃÑtra:

original: bud med las 'byung 'dod chags gang //
analyzed: bud med las 'byung 'dod chags gang //
translated: Whatever attachment arises from women

original: 'dod chags nang na 'di che ste //
analyzed: 'dod chags nang na 'di che ste //
translated: Is the greatest attachment.

original: bud med chags pas yid bcings pa //
analyzed: bud med chags pas yid bcings pa //
translated: Those whose minds are bound by attachment to women

original: phyi nas me yis sreg par byed //üîΩces gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyi nas me yis sreg par byed // ces gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Are later burned by fire.

original: khu tshur dang thal mo ni rjes su chags pas rtsed mo'i don du'o //
analyzed: khu tshur dang thal mo ni rjes su chags pas rtsed mo'i don du'o //
translated: Fist and palm are for the purpose of play, through passion.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi bde ba la gnas pa thob pas spangs zhes pa ni phul du byung bas 'dod chags dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi bde ba la gnas pa thob pas spangs zhes pa ni phul du byung bas 'dod chags dang bral ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúHaving attained the pleasure of samadhi, one abandons‚Äù means that one is free from passion through excellence.

original: yang nyes dmigs mthong ba la sogs pa gnyen po gzhan yang ngo //üîΩde las gzhan mya ngan las 'das pa rtogs par 'dod pa'am /
analyzed: yang nyes dmigs mthong ba la sogs pa gnyen po gzhan yang ngo // de las gzhan mya ngan las 'das pa rtogs par 'dod pa'am /
translated: Also, the other antidotes, such as seeing the faults, are not abandoned.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi bde ba 'dod pa la sogs pa ni ma spangs pa'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi bde ba 'dod pa la sogs pa ni ma spangs pa'o //
translated: But those who desire to realize nirvana, or who desire the bliss of samadhi, and so on, do not abandon them.

original: lan cig phyir 'ong ba yang rnam pa gsum du 'gyur te /
analyzed: lan cig phyir 'ong ba yang rnam pa gsum du 'gyur te /
translated: Also, once-returners are of three types:

original: 'dod khams kyi nyon mongs pa lnga pa man chod spangs pa phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la zhugs pa dang / drug ba spangs pas 'bras bu khyad par can ma yin pa dang / bdun pa dang brgyad pa'i bar spangs pa 'bras bu khyad par can bar chad gcig pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod khams kyi nyon mongs pa lnga pa man chod spangs pa phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la zhugs pa dang / drug ba spangs pas 'bras bu khyad par can ma yin pa dang / bdun pa dang brgyad pa'i bar spangs pa 'bras bu khyad par can bar chad gcig pa'o //
translated: those who enter the result of nonreturner by abandoning up to five afflictions of the desire realm, those who are not of the special result by abandoning the sixth, and those who are once-returners with one obstruction by abandoning up to the seventh and eighth afflictions.

original: de'i don yang 'phags pa phyir mi 'ong ba dang nyon mongs pa gcig las bar na med do //
analyzed: de'i don yang 'phags pa phyir mi 'ong ba dang nyon mongs pa gcig las bar na med do //
translated: The meaning of that is that there is no obstruction between the arya nonreturner and one affliction.

original: chig gi don bshad pa ni /
analyzed: chig gi don bshad pa ni /
translated: The meaning of one is explained.

original: 'di lta ste spyi dang bye brag gi mtshan mar lta ba'i don gzugs la sogs pa mtshan gyi gzhi dang / de rnams kyi mtshan nyid med pa zhes pa ni mtshan gzhi dang mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir zhes pa ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste spyi dang bye brag gi mtshan mar lta ba'i don gzugs la sogs pa mtshan gyi gzhi dang / de rnams kyi mtshan nyid med pa zhes pa ni mtshan gzhi dang mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir zhes pa ste /
translated: The meaning of the phrase ‚Äúthe view of the signs of the general and the specific‚Äù is as follows: the bases of the signs are the objects such as form, etc.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúthe nonexistence of the characteristics of those‚Äù means that the bases of the signs and the characteristics do not exist.

original: des bsgrub par bya ba'i don ni de dag med bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid du snang zhing zhen pa ni rnam par rtog pa nyid yin zhes pa'o //
analyzed: des bsgrub par bya ba'i don ni de dag med bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid du snang zhing zhen pa ni rnam par rtog pa nyid yin zhes pa'o //
translated: The meaning that is to be established is that the appearance and the conception of the characteristics of form, etc., while they do not exist, are just conceptualization.

original: de 'dra ba'i rtog pa lan cig 'byung zhing de nyid kyi phyir 'dod pa'i 'dod chags ma spangs pas tshe brjes nas kyang 'dod pa'i khams kyi 'jig rten 'dir lan cig 'ongs nas zhes pa ste /
analyzed: de 'dra ba'i rtog pa lan cig 'byung zhing de nyid kyi phyir 'dod pa'i 'dod chags ma spangs pas tshe brjes nas kyang 'dod pa'i khams kyi 'jig rten 'dir lan cig 'ongs nas zhes pa ste /
translated: Such a conception occurs once, and because of that, since the desire realm‚Äôs desire is not abandoned, after changing lives, it comes once to this world of the desire realm.

original: mi dang lha rnams kyi nang du skye ba lan re re blangs nas bsam gtan gyi yul gyi mtshan nyid mngon du mthong ba ste /
analyzed: mi dang lha rnams kyi nang du skye ba lan re re blangs nas bsam gtan gyi yul gyi mtshan nyid mngon du mthong ba ste /
translated: Having taken birth once among humans and gods, it sees the characteristics of the objects of concentration.

original: dbang po rtul po'i dbang du byas na /
analyzed: dbang po rtul po'i dbang du byas na /
translated: From the perspective of those of dull faculties,

original: sngar bstan pa byis pa nyer @170b spyod kyi bsam gtan gyi yul gang zag la bdag med pa tsam mthong bas rang nyid kyi sdug bsngal mthar dbyung ba'i phyir yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'o //
analyzed: sngar bstan pa byis pa nyer @170b spyod kyi bsam gtan gyi yul gang zag la bdag med pa tsam mthong bas rang nyid kyi sdug bsngal mthar dbyung ba'i phyir yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'o //
translated: The nirvƒÅ·πáa of the ≈õrƒÅvakas is the nirvƒÅ·πáa that is attained by the ≈õrƒÅvakas who are of duller faculties and who, as previously explained, see only the selflessness of persons, the object of the concentration of the enjoyment of the childish.

original: dbang po rnon po'i dbang du byas na mtshan gzhi dang mtshan nyid med pa la de ltar rtogs pas mtshan nyid la sogs par snang ba'i rnam par rtog pa lan cig byung zhing /
analyzed: dbang po rnon po'i dbang du byas na mtshan gzhi dang mtshan nyid med pa la de ltar rtogs pas mtshan nyid la sogs par snang ba'i rnam par rtog pa lan cig byung zhing /
translated: From the perspective of those of sharper faculties, the conceptualization that arises once with respect to the appearance of characteristics, such as the appearance of the characterized and the characteristic, is eliminated.

original: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags ma spangs pas snga ma ltar 'jig rten 'dir lan cig 'ongs nas bsam gtan gyi yul gyi mtshan nyid chos la bdag med pa'i de kho na nyid rab tu mthong bas rang gi sdug bsngal mthar 'byin pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags ma spangs pas snga ma ltar 'jig rten 'dir lan cig 'ongs nas bsam gtan gyi yul gyi mtshan nyid chos la bdag med pa'i de kho na nyid rab tu mthong bas rang gi sdug bsngal mthar 'byin pa'o //
translated: And because they have not abandoned the attachment of the desire realm, as before, they come once to this world and, by seeing the reality of the selflessness of phenomena, the object of the concentration of the enjoyment of the childish, they put an end to their suffering.

original: yang 'phags pa phyir mi 'ong ba ni 'dod pa'i khams kyi nyon mongs pa dgu pa spangs pas de nas tshe brjes kyang 'dod pa'i khams su skye ba mi len pa'o //
analyzed: yang 'phags pa phyir mi 'ong ba ni 'dod pa'i khams kyi nyon mongs pa dgu pa spangs pas de nas tshe brjes kyang 'dod pa'i khams su skye ba mi len pa'o //
translated: Also, ƒÅryas who are nonreturners abandon the ninth affliction of the desire realm and do not take birth in the desire realm even after changing their life.

original: de yang 'phags pa mya ngan las 'das pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: de yang 'phags pa mya ngan las 'das pa'i mdo las /
translated: This is stated in the ƒÄrya nirvƒÅ·πáa s≈´tra:

original: rgyas par phye na rnam pa bdun du gsungs te /
analyzed: rgyas par phye na rnam pa bdun du gsungs te /
translated: If it is extensively classified, it is said to be seven types.

original: de  ltar 'dod pa'i khams kyi rten la phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu thob nas brtson 'grus nan tan du byas pas khams gsum gyi nyon mongs pa spangs te mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
analyzed: de  ltar 'dod pa'i khams kyi rten la phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu thob nas brtson 'grus nan tan du byas pas khams gsum gyi nyon mongs pa spangs te mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
translated: Thus, having obtained the result of nonreturn on the basis of the desire realm, through the practice of diligence, one abandons the afflictions of the three realms and attains nirvƒÅ·πáa.

original: de yang bstan bcos dag las /
analyzed: de yang bstan bcos dag las /
translated: Also, the treatises state:

original: mthong ba'i chos la zhi ba zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: mthong ba'i chos la zhi ba zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Peace in this life is taught.

original: yang gzugs kyi rten la phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu thob nas snga ma ltar mya ngan las 'da' ba dang / bar ma dor mya ngan las 'da' ba dang / skyes nas mya ngan las 'da' ba dang / spyod pa dang bcas pas mya ngan las 'da' pa dang /
analyzed: yang gzugs kyi rten la phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu thob nas snga ma ltar mya ngan las 'da' ba dang / bar ma dor mya ngan las 'da' ba dang / skyes nas mya ngan las 'da' ba dang / spyod pa dang bcas pas mya ngan las 'da' pa dang /
translated: Furthermore, having obtained the fruit of non-returner in the realm of form, one attains nirvana as previously explained, or one attains nirvana in the intermediate state, or one attains nirvana after being born, or one attains nirvana with practice,

original: spyod pa med pas mya ngan las 'da' ba dang / rgyun rab kyis mya ngan las 'da' ba'o //
analyzed: spyod pa med pas mya ngan las 'da' ba dang / rgyun rab kyis mya ngan las 'da' ba'o //
translated: or one attains nirvana without practice, or one attains nirvana by the highest stream.

original: de la spyod pas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba la yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la spyod pas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba la yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Attaining nirvana through practice is also of two kinds:

original: gzugs kyi khams su skye ba gnyis blangs nas mya ngan las 'da' ba dang skye ba bzhi len pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams su skye ba gnyis blangs nas mya ngan las 'da' ba dang skye ba bzhi len pa'o //
translated: attaining nirvana after taking two births in the realm of form, and taking four births.

original: de la snga ma ni dbang po rnon po'o //
analyzed: de la snga ma ni dbang po rnon po'o //
translated: The former is of sharp faculty,

original: gnyis pa ni dbang po rtul ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni dbang po rtul ba zhes bya'o //
translated: the latter is of dull faculty.

original: de la sogs pa'i dbye ba'i tshul gzhan yang bstan to //
analyzed: de la sogs pa'i dbye ba'i tshul gzhan yang bstan to //
translated: This and other ways of classifying are taught.

original: spyod pa dang spyod pa med pa de dag ni mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas pa dang / 'du byed pa med pa zhes kyang bya'o //
analyzed: spyod pa dang spyod pa med pa de dag ni mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas pa dang / 'du byed pa med pa zhes kyang bya'o //
translated: These are also called ‚Äúwith-outflows‚Äù and ‚Äúwithout-outflows.‚Äù

original: de la bar ma dor mya ngan las 'da' ba ni byed pa'i las dang / skye ba len pa'i las gnyis las /üîΩskye ba len pa'i las ni spangs shing byed pa'i las 'ba' zhig la brten nas 'dod pa'i khams kyi @171a * //
analyzed: de la bar ma dor mya ngan las 'da' ba ni byed pa'i las dang / skye ba len pa'i las gnyis las / skye ba len pa'i las ni spangs shing byed pa'i las 'ba' zhig la brten nas 'dod pa'i khams kyi @171a * //
translated: ‚ÄúIntermediate nirvana‚Äù means that one has abandoned the karma of taking rebirth,üîΩand only relies on the karma of action.

original: phung po spangs nas gzugs khams su skye ba'i bar du gnyen po mngon du byas nas mya ngan las 'da' ba ste /
analyzed: phung po spangs nas gzugs khams su skye ba'i bar du gnyen po mngon du byas nas mya ngan las 'da' ba ste /
translated: Having abandoned the aggregates of the desire realm, one attains nirvana by manifesting the antidote up to the time of taking rebirth in the form realm.

original: de yang dbang po rno bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de yang dbang po rno bar gyur pa'o //
translated: This is for those of sharp faculties.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: It says:

original: rigs kyi bu 'dod pa'i khams dang / gzugs kyi khams kyi sems can rnams la las rnam pa gnyis yod de /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu 'dod pa'i khams dang / gzugs kyi khams kyi sems can rnams la las rnam pa gnyis yod de /
translated: ‚ÄúSon of noble family, the sentient beings of the desire realm and the form realm have two types of karma:

original: byed pa'i las dang / skye ba len pa'i las so //
analyzed: byed pa'i las dang / skye ba len pa'i las so //
translated: the karma of action and the karma of taking rebirth.

original: bar du mya ngan las 'da' ba ni byed pa'i las 'ba' zhig yod de /
analyzed: bar du mya ngan las 'da' ba ni byed pa'i las 'ba' zhig yod de /
translated: Those who attain nirvana in the intermediate state have only the karma of action.

original: skye ba len pa'i las med do //
analyzed: skye ba len pa'i las med do //
translated: There is no karma to take rebirth.

original: de bas na bar du yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de bas na bar du yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba zhes bya ste /
translated: Therefore, it is called ‚Äúintermediate nirvana.‚Äù

original: 'dod pa'i khams kyi phung po ni bor dbang po rno ba'i phyir gzugs kyi khams su ma phyin par mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams kyi phung po ni bor dbang po rno ba'i phyir gzugs kyi khams su ma phyin par mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur te /
translated: Because they have abandoned the aggregates of the desire realm and their faculties are sharp, they attain nirvana without reaching the form realm.

original: de ni bar du mya ngan las 'da' ba'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de ni bar du mya ngan las 'da' ba'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: This is called ‚Äúintermediate nirvana.‚Äù

original: las de dag nyid la mngon par 'grub pa'i kun du sbyor ba dang / skye ba'i kun du sbyor ba zhes kyang bstan bcos dag las bshad do //
analyzed: las de dag nyid la mngon par 'grub pa'i kun du sbyor ba dang / skye ba'i kun du sbyor ba zhes kyang bstan bcos dag las bshad do //
translated: Also, treatises explain that these karmas are called the fetters of manifest existence and the fetters of birth.

original: phung po blangs nas mya ngan las 'da' ba ni las de dag gnyis ka ma spangs pas des 'dod khams kyi phung po bor nas gzugs kyi phung po len te /
analyzed: phung po blangs nas mya ngan las 'da' ba ni las de dag gnyis ka ma spangs pas des 'dod khams kyi phung po bor nas gzugs kyi phung po len te /
translated: Attaining nirvana after taking up the aggregates is attaining nirvana after abandoning neither of those two karmas and after abandoning the aggregates of the desire realm and taking up the aggregates of the form realm.

original: der lam la brtson 'grus nan tan du byas pas mya ngan las 'da' ba'o //
analyzed: der lam la brtson 'grus nan tan du byas pas mya ngan las 'da' ba'o //
translated: Through striving on the path there, one attains nirvana.

original: spyod pas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ni sngar bstan pa ltar gzugs khams kyi skye ba gnyis sam bzhi po de rnams kyi bar la rtag tu lam la nan tan byed de /
analyzed: spyod pas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ni sngar bstan pa ltar gzugs khams kyi skye ba gnyis sam bzhi po de rnams kyi bar la rtag tu lam la nan tan byed de /
translated: Those who attain nirvana through practice are those previously explained who always practice the path between two or four births in the form realm.

original: 'dus byas kyi ting nge 'dzin gyi shugs kyis nyon mongs pa yongs su bcad nas mya ngan las 'da' ba'o //
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi ting nge 'dzin gyi shugs kyis nyon mongs pa yongs su bcad nas mya ngan las 'da' ba'o //
translated: They attain nirvana by completely severing afflictions through the power of conditioned concentration.

original: spyod pa med par yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ni gang zag des nges par mya ngan las 'da' bar shes nas de'i phyir le lo byed do //
analyzed: spyod pa med par yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ni gang zag des nges par mya ngan las 'da' bar shes nas de'i phyir le lo byed do //
translated: Those who attain nirvana without practice are those who know for certain that they will attain nirvana and therefore are lazy.

original: des kyang 'dus byas kyi ting nge 'dzin gyi shugs kyis nyon mongs pa spangs shing tshe'i dus byas nas mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: des kyang 'dus byas kyi ting nge 'dzin gyi shugs kyis nyon mongs pa spangs shing tshe'i dus byas nas mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: They attain nirvana by abandoning afflictions through the power of conditioned concentration and then dying.

original: rgyun rab kyis mya ngan las 'da' ba ni gang zhig bsam gtan bzhi thob nas rkyen 'ga' zhig gis bsam gtan de rnams las nyams te /
analyzed: rgyun rab kyis mya ngan las 'da' ba ni gang zhig bsam gtan bzhi thob nas rkyen 'ga' zhig gis bsam gtan de rnams las nyams te /
translated: Those who attain nirvana through the highest degree of continuity are those who obtain the four absorptions but due to some condition they degenerate from those absorptions.

original: yang bsam gtan dang po la dga' ba'i sems skyes te /
analyzed: yang bsam gtan dang po la dga' ba'i sems skyes te /
translated: Again, a mind of joy arises in the first concentration.

original: de ltar nan tan du byas pas bsam gtan dang po thob cing /
analyzed: de ltar nan tan du byas pas bsam gtan dang po thob cing /
translated: By practicing in that way, one obtains the first concentration.

original: de nas tshe 'phos nas bsam gtan dang po'i lhar skye ba dang / de la bsam gtan gnyis pa thob cing /
analyzed: de nas tshe 'phos nas bsam gtan dang po'i lhar skye ba dang / de la bsam gtan gnyis pa thob cing /
translated: Then, after death, one is born as a god of the first concentration, and then one obtains the second concentration.

original: de 'dra ba'i lam gyi rgyun gyis bsam gtan gnyis pa nas bzhi @171b pa'i bar du skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de 'dra ba'i lam gyi rgyun gyis bsam gtan gnyis pa nas bzhi @171b pa'i bar du skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By the continuity of such a path, one is born in the second concentration up to the fourth concentration.

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa de la yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa de la yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The fourth concentration also has two types:

original: gzugs med pa'i khams su 'gro ba dang / gnas gtsang ma'i ris lngar 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams su 'gro ba dang / gnas gtsang ma'i ris lngar 'gro ba'o //
translated: going to the formless realm and going to the five pure abodes.

original: de'i rgyu mtshan yang ting nge 'dzin la dga' ba ni nam mkha' mtha' yas kyi skye mched la sogs pa mngon du byas nas de nas tshe 'phos shing srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar gyi ngas gzhan bzhi po de rnams su skye bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: de'i rgyu mtshan yang ting nge 'dzin la dga' ba ni nam mkha' mtha' yas kyi skye mched la sogs pa mngon du byas nas de nas tshe 'phos shing srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar gyi ngas gzhan bzhi po de rnams su skye bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: The reason for that is that after manifesting the base of infinite space and so on, one who delights in concentration passes from there and is born in the other four, up to the summit of existence.

original: de'i rjes la mya ngan las 'da' ba'o //
analyzed: de'i rjes la mya ngan las 'da' ba'o //
translated: After that, one attains nirvana.

original: de nyid bstan bcos dag las srid pa'i rtse mo'i mthar thug bar 'gro ba zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de nyid bstan bcos dag las srid pa'i rtse mo'i mthar thug bar 'gro ba zhes bshad do //
translated: The treatises explain that this is the state of going to the peak of cyclic existence.

original: gnyis pa ni shes rab la mngon par dga' ba ste /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni shes rab la mngon par dga' ba ste /
translated: The second is the state of delight in wisdom.

original: shes rab kyis yongs su zin pa'i zag pa med pa'i bsam gtan gtso bor bsgoms pas 'phags pa'i gnas de rnams su skye bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyis yongs su zin pa'i zag pa med pa'i bsam gtan gtso bor bsgoms pas 'phags pa'i gnas de rnams su skye bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: One is born in those states of the ƒÅryas through cultivating uncontaminated meditative stabilization that is governed by wisdom.

original: de yang bsam gtan bzhi'i khyad par sngar bsgom pa ste /
analyzed: de yang bsam gtan bzhi'i khyad par sngar bsgom pa ste /
translated: Moreover, one cultivates the distinctive four meditative stabilizations in order.

original: tha ma dang / 'bring dang / rab dang / rab kyi 'bring dang / rab kyi yang rab bo //
analyzed: tha ma dang / 'bring dang / rab dang / rab kyi 'bring dang / rab kyi yang rab bo //
translated: The least, middling, best, best of the middling, and best of the best.

original: de rnams kyis kyang go rims bzhin du mi che ba la sogs pa rnam par lnga ru skye bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyis kyang go rims bzhin du mi che ba la sogs pa rnam par lnga ru skye bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: And one is born in the five states of the MahƒÅbrahmƒÅs, and so on, in that order.

original: de yang bstan chos dag las /
analyzed: de yang bstan chos dag las /
translated: The treatises explain that

original: bsam gtan zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa spel mar bsgom pa ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa spel mar bsgom pa ste /
translated: one cultivates contaminated and uncontaminated meditative stabilization in alternation.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said,

original: gsum du spel ba dang / drug tu spel ba dang / dgu dang bcu gnyis dang bco lnga'i bar du ste /
analyzed: gsum du spel ba dang / drug tu spel ba dang / dgu dang bcu gnyis dang bco lnga'i bar du ste /
translated: one cultivates in alternation three, six, nine, twelve, and fifteen moments.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa ni sum char bsgom zhing /
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa ni sum char bsgom zhing /
translated: The contaminated is cultivated for three parts,

original: zag med sum gnyis su bya ste spel mar bsgom pa'o zhes bshad do //
analyzed: zag med sum gnyis su bya ste spel mar bsgom pa'o zhes bshad do //
translated: and the uncontaminated is cultivated for two and a half parts.üîΩThus they alternate in cultivating the four truths.

original: de ltar de gnyis kyang gcig ni smra ba la dga' ba dang / gcig ni zhi ba la dga' ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar de gnyis kyang gcig ni smra ba la dga' ba dang / gcig ni zhi ba la dga' ba'o //
translated: Also, one of those two is delighting in speech and the other is delighting in peace.

original: de la zhi ba la dga' ba ni gzugs med pa'i khams su 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: de la zhi ba la dga' ba ni gzugs med pa'i khams su 'gro ba'o //
translated: Among them, those delighting in peace go to the formless realm.

original: smra ba la dga' ba ni gnas gtsang ma'i ris lngar 'gro'o //
analyzed: smra ba la dga' ba ni gnas gtsang ma'i ris lngar 'gro'o //
translated: Those delighting in speech go to the five pure abodes.

original: de'i don ni rang nyid de kho na nyid rtogs pa'i shes rab dang ldan zhing /
analyzed: de'i don ni rang nyid de kho na nyid rtogs pa'i shes rab dang ldan zhing /
translated: The meaning of that is that they possess the wisdom that realizes suchness themselves

original: gzhan la yang de 'dra ba'i lam smra ba la dga' ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan la yang de 'dra ba'i lam smra ba la dga' ba'o //
translated: and delight in teaching the path that is similar to that to others.

original: yang gzugs med pa'i khams su 'gro ba ni bsam gtan bzhi dang khyad par lnga bsgom mi nus so //
analyzed: yang gzugs med pa'i khams su 'gro ba ni bsam gtan bzhi dang khyad par lnga bsgom mi nus so //
translated: Also, those who go to the formless realm are unable to cultivate the four absorptions and the five special ones.

original: de ltar bsgom par nus pa ni 'og min gyi mthar thug par 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: de ltar bsgom par nus pa ni 'og min gyi mthar thug par 'gro ba ste /
translated: Those who are able to cultivate them go to the limit of Akani·π£·π≠ha.

original: de yang bstan bcos dag las /
analyzed: de yang bstan bcos dag las /
translated: Also, the treatises say:

original: 'phar ba dang / phyed du 'phar ba dang / gnas thams cad du 'chi 'pho ba dang rnam pa gsum du gsungs pa las @172a * //
analyzed: 'phar ba dang / phyed du 'phar ba dang / gnas thams cad du 'chi 'pho ba dang rnam pa gsum du gsungs pa las @172a * //
translated: and those who die in all abodes and are reborn in the same abode, or in a higher abode, or in a still higher abode.

original: 'di ni tha ma'i dbang du byas pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni tha ma'i dbang du byas pa'o //
translated: This is from the perspective of the last of these.

original: gnyis po yang don gyis blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: gnyis po yang don gyis blta bar bya'o //
translated: The other two should be understood by the meaning.

original: de la bsam gtan gyi gnas gzhan bcu gnyis las /
analyzed: de la bsam gtan gyi gnas gzhan bcu gnyis las /
translated: From among the twelve abodes of the absorptions,

original: tshangs pa chen po ni gtso bo gcig tu nges pa'i sa dang / lta ba ngan pa'i gnas yin pas 'phags pa rnams der skye ba mi len la /
analyzed: tshangs pa chen po ni gtso bo gcig tu nges pa'i sa dang / lta ba ngan pa'i gnas yin pas 'phags pa rnams der skye ba mi len la /
translated: the MahƒÅbrahmƒÅs are the abode of the single leader and the abode of bad views, so ƒÅryas do not take birth there.

original: de las gzhan pa'i bcu gcig dang / gnas lngar brgyud nas mya ngan las 'da' ba'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i bcu gcig dang / gnas lngar brgyud nas mya ngan las 'da' ba'o //
translated: They attain nirvƒÅ·πáa in the eleven abodes other than that and in the five abodes.

original: gal te 'dir bar ma dor mya ngan las 'da' ba dbang po rnon po yin na /
analyzed: gal te 'dir bar ma dor mya ngan las 'da' ba dbang po rnon po yin na /
translated: If those who attain nirvƒÅ·πáa in the intermediate state are of sharp faculty,

original: ci'i slad du da ltar gyi dus 'dod pa'i khams kyi rten 'di nyid la mya ngan las mi 'da' zhes pa dang / gzhan yang /
analyzed: ci'i slad du da ltar gyi dus 'dod pa'i khams kyi rten 'di nyid la mya ngan las mi 'da' zhes pa dang / gzhan yang /
translated: why do they not attain nirvƒÅ·πáa in this life in the desire realm?

original: 'dod pa'i khams nas gzugs kyi khams su 'pho ba la bar du mya ngan las 'da' ba mchis la /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams nas gzugs kyi khams su 'pho ba la bar du mya ngan las 'da' ba mchis la /
translated: The bodhisattva KƒÅ≈õyapa asked, Why is it that there is nirvana in the middle of the transition from the desire realm to the form realm,

original: gzugs kyi khams nas gzhan du 'pho ba la bar du mya ngan las 'da' ba ma mchis pa ci'i slad du lags zhes byang chub sems dpa' 'od srungs kyis zhus pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams nas gzhan du 'pho ba la bar du mya ngan las 'da' ba ma mchis pa ci'i slad du lags zhes byang chub sems dpa' 'od srungs kyis zhus pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: but there is no nirvana in the middle of the transition from the form realm to another? The BhagavƒÅn replied,

original: rigs kyi bu de ni da ltar gyi dus na chen po bzhi zhan pas lam bsgom mi nus te /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu de ni da ltar gyi dus na chen po bzhi zhan pas lam bsgom mi nus te /
translated: Son of noble family, in the present time, the four great elements are weak and one is unable to cultivate the path.

original: dge slong dag chen po bzhi po de yang gnas khang dang / bsod snyoms dang / gos dang mal cha dang / nad kyi rkyen sman la sogs pa'i yo byad rnams so //
analyzed: dge slong dag chen po bzhi po de yang gnas khang dang / bsod snyoms dang / gos dang mal cha dang / nad kyi rkyen sman la sogs pa'i yo byad rnams so //
translated: Bhik·π£us, the four great elements are the requisites of a dwelling, alms, clothing, bedding, medicine, and so on.

original: de dang mi ldan na da ltar gyi dus su mya ngan las 'da' bar mi 'gyur ro zhes sngon gyi gleng gzhi dang bcas te rgyas par gsungs so //
analyzed: de dang mi ldan na da ltar gyi dus su mya ngan las 'da' bar mi 'gyur ro zhes sngon gyi gleng gzhi dang bcas te rgyas par gsungs so //
translated: If one does not have those, one will not attain nirvana in the present time.

original: gzhan yang / da ltar 'dod pa'i khams kyi rten la sems can de dag gi phan pa'i don mang po byed pa la dga' bas brel te /
analyzed: gzhan yang / da ltar 'dod pa'i khams kyi rten la sems can de dag gi phan pa'i don mang po byed pa la dga' bas brel te /
translated: they delight in now acting for the benefit of sentient beings in the desire realm, and are busy doing so.üîΩSince they have not attained meditative stabilization, they do not now attain nirvana.

original: ting nge 'dzin thob par ma gyur pas da ltar mya ngan las 'das par ma gyur to zhes pa dang / yang brtsad pa gnyis pa'i lan du 'dod pa'i khams pa'i sems can rnams la sred pa rnams pa gnyis te /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin thob par ma gyur pas da ltar mya ngan las 'das par ma gyur to zhes pa dang / yang brtsad pa gnyis pa'i lan du 'dod pa'i khams pa'i sems can rnams la sred pa rnams pa gnyis te /
translated: In response to the second objection, the text says that sentient beings in the desire realm have two kinds of craving:

original: 'dod pa la srad  pa dang / gzugs la srad  pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa la srad  pa dang / gzugs la srad  pa'o //
translated: craving for desire realm objects and craving for form realm objects.

original: de la sred pa de gnyis kyi nyes skyon la sogs pa rtogs nas sems rtse gcig tu de dag la smod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la sred pa de gnyis kyi nyes skyon la sogs pa rtogs nas sems rtse gcig tu de dag la smod par 'gyur te /
translated: Having understood the faults and so on of these two kinds of craving, they one pointedly disparage them.

original: de ltar smad nas de'i bar du mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar smad nas de'i bar du mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Having disparaged them, they attain nirvana in the interim.

original: gzhan yang / 'dod pa'i khams na nyon mongs pa sbom po smad pa'i gnas su gyur pa 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang khrel ba med pa dang 'dzem pa med pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang / 'dod pa'i khams na nyon mongs pa sbom po smad pa'i gnas su gyur pa 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang khrel ba med pa dang 'dzem pa med pa ste /
translated: Moreover, in the desire realm there are four coarse afflictions that are the basis of disparagement: attachment, hostility, shamelessness, and lack of embarrassment.

original: de rnams la smod cing yid byung bas de nas 'pho ba'i bar du mya ngan @172b las 'das pa thob par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de rnams la smod cing yid byung bas de nas 'pho ba'i bar du mya ngan @172b las 'das pa thob par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Having reviled and become disgusted with those, they attain nirvana without transferring to another place.

original: gzugs kyi khams na ni de lta bu'i nyon mongs pa sbom po dang / 'dod pa la sred pa la sogs pa'i nyes dmigs rtogs par 'gyur ba'i rkyen de dag med de /
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams na ni de lta bu'i nyon mongs pa sbom po dang / 'dod pa la sred pa la sogs pa'i nyes dmigs rtogs par 'gyur ba'i rkyen de dag med de /
translated: In the form realm, those conditions for realizing the faults of the craving for desire realm objects and so on, such as the coarse afflictions, do not exist.

original: bsam gtan gyi bde ba la gnas pa de dag gi gnyen po bsgom pa mad pa'i phyir de nas gzhan du 'pho ba'i bar du mya ngan las 'da' ba mi 'thad ces pa la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi bde ba la gnas pa de dag gi gnyen po bsgom pa mad pa'i phyir de nas gzhan du 'pho ba'i bar du mya ngan las 'da' ba mi 'thad ces pa la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Because they cultivate the antidote to the bliss of meditative stabilization, it is not tenable that they attain nirvana without transferring to another place and so on.

original: yang bar du mya ngan las 'da' ba la dbye na rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: yang bar du mya ngan las 'da' ba la dbye na rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Again, if intermediate nirvana is classified, there are three types:

original: rab dang / 'bring dang / tha ma'o //
analyzed: rab dang / 'bring dang / tha ma'o //
translated: the best, the medium and the least.

original: de la rab ni phung po spangs nas 'dod pa'i khams dang ma bral bar yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'o //
analyzed: de la rab ni phung po spangs nas 'dod pa'i khams dang ma bral bar yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'o //
translated: The best is attaining nirvana without separating from the desire realm after abandoning the aggregates.

original: 'bring ni 'dod pa'i khams dang bral ma thag la gzugs kyi khams su ma phyin par yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'o //
analyzed: 'bring ni 'dod pa'i khams dang bral ma thag la gzugs kyi khams su ma phyin par yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'o //
translated: The intermediate is one who passes into nirvƒÅ·πáa immediately after separating from the desire realm but before reaching the form realm.

original: tha ma ni 'dod pa'i khams dang bral nas gzugs kyi khams la bsnyen te mya ngan las 'das pa'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: tha ma ni 'dod pa'i khams dang bral nas gzugs kyi khams la bsnyen te mya ngan las 'das pa'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: The final is one who passes into nirvƒÅ·πáa after separating from the desire realm and approaching the form realm.

original: yang 'phags bstug po bkod pa'i rgyan las /
analyzed: yang 'phags bstug po bkod pa'i rgyan las /
translated: Moreover, the Dense Array Ornament of the Noble Sutra states:

original: shes pa rnams dang slob pa bcu //
analyzed: shes pa rnams dang slob pa bcu //
translated: Those with knowledge and the ten traineesüîΩif they have many, they are the seven-time at most,

original: brgyad pa mang na lan bdun dang // rigs nas rigs dang lan cig 'ong //
analyzed: brgyad pa mang na lan bdun dang // rigs nas rigs dang lan cig 'ong //
translated: the one-to-one family,üîΩthe person with one obstruction,üîΩthe one who passes into nirvƒÅ·πáa in the intermediate state,

original: bar chad gcig pa'i gang zag dang // bar mar mya ngan 'da' ba dang // gzhan skyes mya ngan las 'da' ba //
analyzed: bar chad gcig pa'i gang zag dang // bar mar mya ngan 'da' ba dang // gzhan skyes mya ngan las 'da' ba //
translated: the one who passes into nirvƒÅ·πáa after being born,

original: mngon par 'du byed ma byas pa //
analyzed: mngon par 'du byed ma byas pa //
translated: and the one who does not apply themselves.

original: steng ma'i rgyud kyang de bzhin te //üîΩzhes gsungs te /
analyzed: steng ma'i rgyud kyang de bzhin te // zhes gsungs te /
translated: The upper stream is also like that.

original: de la shes pa rnams zad pa dang / mi skye ba shes pa'i ye shes thob pa'i dgra bcom pa dang / rang sangs rgyas mi slob pa rnams yin la /
analyzed: de la shes pa rnams zad pa dang / mi skye ba shes pa'i ye shes thob pa'i dgra bcom pa dang / rang sangs rgyas mi slob pa rnams yin la /
translated: Those with knowledge are the arhats and pratyekabuddhas who are beyond training and have attained the wisdom of the knowledge of elimination and the knowledge of nonarising.

original: slob pa bcu las brgyad pa ni sngar bstan pa ltar rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la zhugs pa yin la /üîΩrigs nas rigs ni snga ma ltar lha dang mi rnams kyi nang du skye ba gsum mam /
analyzed: slob pa bcu las brgyad pa ni sngar bstan pa ltar rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la zhugs pa yin la / rigs nas rigs ni snga ma ltar lha dang mi rnams kyi nang du skye ba gsum mam /
translated: From among the ten learners, the eighth is the one who enters the result of stream entry, as previously explained.

original: lnga blangs nas mya ngan las 'da' ba'o //
analyzed: lnga blangs nas mya ngan las 'da' ba'o //
translated: From family to family means that, as before, one takes birth three or five times among gods and humans and attains nirvana.

original: lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la zhugs pa 'dir ma gsungs pa ni nyon mongs pa lnga pa spangs pa yang lan cig phyir 'ong ba nyid du 'dus par dgongs pa'o //üîΩbrgyad pa ni de ltar ma yin te /
analyzed: lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la zhugs pa 'dir ma gsungs pa ni nyon mongs pa lnga pa spangs pa yang lan cig phyir 'ong ba nyid du 'dus par dgongs pa'o // brgyad pa ni de ltar ma yin te /
translated: The one who enters the result of once return is not mentioned here because it is thought that abandoning five afflictions is included in once return.

original: 'bras bu mngon du ma byas pas der ma 'dus pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu mngon du ma byas pas der ma 'dus pa'o //
translated: The eighth is not like that because the result is not actualized and it is not included there.

original: gzhan yang phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la zhugs pa nyon mongs pa brgyad pa man chad spangs pa yin no zhes chos mngon pa kun las bsdus pa las bshad pa ni @173a * //
analyzed: gzhan yang phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la zhugs pa nyon mongs pa brgyad pa man chad spangs pa yin no zhes chos mngon pa kun las bsdus pa las bshad pa ni @173a * //
translated: Moreover, the Abhidharma Synthesis explains that the one who enters the result of nonreturn is one who abandons the eighth affliction and so on.

original: 'dir bar chad gcig pa'i gang zag tu 'dus pas mdo sde dag las logs su bshad pa med do //
analyzed: 'dir bar chad gcig pa'i gang zag tu 'dus pas mdo sde dag las logs su bshad pa med do //
translated: Since the person of one obstruction is included here, it is not explained separately in the s≈´tras.

original: yang mdzod kyi bstan bcos las ni /
analyzed: yang mdzod kyi bstan bcos las ni /
translated: Moreover, the treatise Abhidharmako≈õa explains:

original: dgu pa spang ba'i don du lam la brtson 'grus nan tan du byed pa ni phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la zhugs pa'o zhes bshad de /
analyzed: dgu pa spang ba'i don du lam la brtson 'grus nan tan du byed pa ni phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la zhugs pa'o zhes bshad de /
translated: The ninth is the path of application that is diligent effort for the sake of abandoning objects to be abandoned and is the approach to the result of nonreturn.

original: de lta na par chad gcig pa dang mi 'dra bas tha dad du bstan kyang 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: de lta na par chad gcig pa dang mi 'dra bas tha dad du bstan kyang 'gal ba med do //
translated: Thus it is not contradictory that it is explained separately from the person of one obstruction.

original: steng ma'i rgyud kyang zhes pa'i sngar bstan pa'i rgyu na rab kyis mya ngan las 'da' ba nyid do //
analyzed: steng ma'i rgyud kyang zhes pa'i sngar bstan pa'i rgyu na rab kyis mya ngan las 'da' ba nyid do //
translated: Also, the continuum of the higher realms is the approach to nirvƒÅ·πáa that was previously explained.

original: gal te 'dir 'dod pa'i khams kyi nyon mongs pa mtha' dag spangs pa 'phags pa phyir mi 'ong ba nyid du 'gyur ba yin na /
analyzed: gal te 'dir 'dod pa'i khams kyi nyon mongs pa mtha' dag spangs pa 'phags pa phyir mi 'ong ba nyid du 'gyur ba yin na /
translated: If the complete abandonment of afflictions of the desire realm is the approach to the result of nonreturn,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mdo las /
translated: then it would contradict the perfection of wisdom s≈´tras, which state:

original: tha ma'i cha can gyi kun du sbyor ba lnga spangs pas phyir mi 'ong ba'o zhes gsungs pa dang 'gal lo zhe na /
analyzed: tha ma'i cha can gyi kun du sbyor ba lnga spangs pas phyir mi 'ong ba'o zhes gsungs pa dang 'gal lo zhe na /
translated: Through abandoning the five fetters of the lower level, one is a nonreturner.

original: skyon med de /
analyzed: skyon med de /
translated: There is no error.

original: de ni sngar bstan pa ltar gtso bo nye bar bsdu ba'i don du ste /
analyzed: de ni sngar bstan pa ltar gtso bo nye bar bsdu ba'i don du ste /
translated: As previously explained, they are the principal ones in order to subsume the others.

original: ci'i phyir de rnams gtso bo nyid du 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de rnams gtso bo nyid du 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Why are they principal?

original: 'gro ba tham dang khams tha ma'i rgyur gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gro ba tham dang khams tha ma'i rgyur gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are the cause of the three lower rebirths and the three realms.üîΩAmong them, the first three views, overesteeming inferior ethical conduct and asceticism and doubt, do not transcend the three lower rebirths, which are the three lower realms.

original: de la dang po 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / the tshom gyis ni 'gro ba tha ma ngan song gsum las mi 'da' bas de'i rgyu nyid do //
analyzed: de la dang po 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / the tshom gyis ni 'gro ba tha ma ngan song gsum las mi 'da' bas de'i rgyu nyid do //
translated: They are the cause of the three lower rebirths.

original: 'dod pa la 'dun pa dang / gnod sems gnyis kyis ni khams tha ma 'dod pa'i khams las mi 'da' bas /
analyzed: 'dod pa la 'dun pa dang / gnod sems gnyis kyis ni khams tha ma 'dod pa'i khams las mi 'da' bas /
translated: The two, longing for objects and malice, do not transcend the desire realm, which is the lowest of the three realms.

original: de'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir zhes /
analyzed: de'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir zhes /
translated: They are the cause of the desire realm.

original: chos mngon pa'i bstan chos dag las bshad do //
analyzed: chos mngon pa'i bstan chos dag las bshad do //
translated: This is explained in the Abhidharma teachings.

original: 'phags pa dgra bcom pa ni khams gsum gyi nyon mongs pa spangs pa ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa dgra bcom pa ni khams gsum gyi nyon mongs pa spangs pa ste /
translated: ƒÄryas who are arhats abandon afflictions of the three realms.

original: de la cig car spong ba'i dbang du byas ni lan cig phyir mi 'ong ba dang mi 'dra ba'i khyad par ni sngar bstan pa ltar ram /
analyzed: de la cig car spong ba'i dbang du byas ni lan cig phyir mi 'ong ba dang mi 'dra ba'i khyad par ni sngar bstan pa ltar ram /
translated: In terms of simultaneous abandonment, the distinction of this path from the once returner is as previously explained.

original: yang na khams gsum gyi nyon mongs pa dgu spong ba'i lam la zhugs pa ste /
analyzed: yang na khams gsum gyi nyon mongs pa dgu spong ba'i lam la zhugs pa ste /
translated: Or, it is the path that abandons the nine degrees of affliction of the three realms.

original: de'i don du brtson par byed pa ni 'phags pa phyir mi 'ong ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de'i don du brtson par byed pa ni 'phags pa phyir mi 'ong ba zhes bya ste /
translated: One who strives for that is called a noble nonreturner.

original: de yang bstan bcos dag las dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu la zhugs pa zhes kyang bstan to //
analyzed: de yang bstan bcos dag las dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu la zhugs pa zhes kyang bstan to //
translated: Also, in the treatises, it is taught that this is the path of entry to the result of an arhat.

original: de spangs pa'i rnam par grol ba thob pa ni dgra bcom pa'o //
analyzed: de spangs pa'i rnam par grol ba thob pa ni dgra bcom pa'o //
translated: Attaining the liberation that abandons that is an arhat.

original: gzhan 'dir bsam gtan du bya ba la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa med pas dgra bcom pa zhes pa'i don ni dbang po rtul po'i dbang du byas na de dag gi mtshan mar rtog pa la nyes dmigs @173b su lta ba'i sgo nas /
analyzed: gzhan 'dir bsam gtan du bya ba la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa med pas dgra bcom pa zhes pa'i don ni dbang po rtul po'i dbang du byas na de dag gi mtshan mar rtog pa la nyes dmigs @173b su lta ba'i sgo nas /
translated: Here, in terms of those of duller faculties, the meaning of arhat is that they are free of the concepts of the objects of meditation and so on.

original: de ltar rtog pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin zag pa med pa'i dbyings na gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar rtog pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin zag pa med pa'i dbyings na gnas pa'o //
translated: Thus, the meaning of arhat is that they abide in the uncontaminated realm in a concentration free of concepts.

original: dbang po rnon po'i dbang du byas nas byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang mthun par brtag bya'i yul stong pan yid du rtogs pas rnam par rtog pa med pa'o //
analyzed: dbang po rnon po'i dbang du byas nas byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang mthun par brtag bya'i yul stong pan yid du rtogs pas rnam par rtog pa med pa'o //
translated: In terms of those of sharp faculties, it is nonconceptual, since it realizes the emptiness that is the object of observation that is concordant with the bodhisattvas.

original: bsam gtan du bya ba ni de'i dmigs pa'i yul lo /
analyzed: bsam gtan du bya ba ni de'i dmigs pa'i yul lo /
translated: The object of observation of that is the object of observation of concentration.

original: nyon mongs pa dang sdug bsngal la rtog pa med pa ni de dag nye bar spangs pa'i sgo nas so //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang sdug bsngal la rtog pa med pa ni de dag nye bar spangs pa'i sgo nas so //
translated: It is nonconceptual with regard to afflictions and suffering because it abandons them.

original: gal te 'dir khams gsum gyi nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pas dgra bcom pa nyid du 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te 'dir khams gsum gyi nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pas dgra bcom pa nyid du 'gyur na /
translated: If all afflictions of the three realms are abandoned here, then it would be arhatship.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mdo las /
translated: In the Perfection of Wisdom S≈´tras it says:

original: gong ma'i cha can gyi kun du sbyor ba lnga spangs pa dgra bcom pa'o zhes gsungs pa dang 'gal lo zhe na /
analyzed: gong ma'i cha can gyi kun du sbyor ba lnga spangs pa dgra bcom pa'o zhes gsungs pa dang 'gal lo zhe na /
translated: ‚ÄúThe five fetters of the higher realms are abandoned and one is an arhat.‚Äù

original: skyon med do //
analyzed: skyon med do //
translated: There is no error.

original: sngar bstan pa ltar gtso bo nye bar bsdu ba'i don du'o //
analyzed: sngar bstan pa ltar gtso bo nye bar bsdu ba'i don du'o //
translated: As was previously explained, it is for the purpose of subsuming the main ones.

original: de rnams gtso bor 'gyur ba yang khams gong ma nye bar len pa dang / blangs pa mi gtong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnams gtso bor 'gyur ba yang khams gong ma nye bar len pa dang / blangs pa mi gtong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The reason they are primary is that they appropriate the higher realms and they do not relinquish what has been appropriated.

original: de la gong ma nye bar len pa ni gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i 'dod chags te /
analyzed: de la gong ma nye bar len pa ni gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i 'dod chags te /
translated: Among them, appropriating the higher realms is attachment to the form and formless realms.

original: de dag gis khams de dag tu skyed pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gis khams de dag tu skyed pa'o //
translated: They generate birth in those realms.

original: blangs pa mi gtong ba ni rgod pa dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa ste de rnams kyis sred pa dang / nga rgyal dang / the tshom shas che ba'i bsam gtan la gnas shing /
analyzed: blangs pa mi gtong ba ni rgod pa dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa ste de rnams kyis sred pa dang / nga rgyal dang / the tshom shas che ba'i bsam gtan la gnas shing /
translated: Not relinquishing what has been appropriated is excitation, pride and ignorance. They abide in the concentrations of craving, pride and doubt.

original: des khams de dag ba kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des khams de dag ba kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are afflicted by those realms.

original: gal te 'dir gsung rab dag las dgra bcom pa rnam pa gsum du bka' stsal na /
analyzed: gal te 'dir gsung rab dag las dgra bcom pa rnam pa gsum du bka' stsal na /
translated: If here in the scriptures three types of arhat are mentioned,

original: skabs 'dir bstan pa ni de rnams kyi nang nas gang zhig lags zhes zhus pa la /
analyzed: skabs 'dir bstan pa ni de rnams kyi nang nas gang zhig lags zhes zhus pa la /
translated: then which of them is taught here?

original: de rnams kyi don yang zhi ba phyogs gcig gi lam rab tu thob pa ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa 'ba' zhig nye bar zhi ba'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi don yang zhi ba phyogs gcig gi lam rab tu thob pa ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa 'ba' zhig nye bar zhi ba'o //
translated: The meaning of these is as follows: The attainment of the path of one-sided peace is the pacification of only the afflictive obstructions.

original: lam zhes pa ni de gnas skabs kyi 'bras bu tsam yin gyi mthar thug pa ma yin pas so //
analyzed: lam zhes pa ni de gnas skabs kyi 'bras bu tsam yin gyi mthar thug pa ma yin pas so //
translated: The path is merely the temporary result, not the ultimate.

original: byang chub tu smon lam goms par dge ba'i rtsa ba la rmongs pa ni byang chub chen por sems bskyed cing smon lam btab kyang /
analyzed: byang chub tu smon lam goms par dge ba'i rtsa ba la rmongs pa ni byang chub chen por sems bskyed cing smon lam btab kyang /
translated: The delusion about the roots of virtue through the force of aspiration for enlightenment is the generation of the thought of the great enlightenment and the making of the aspiration for it.

original: de thob par byed pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba 'khor gsum sgyu ma lta bur rtogs pa'i shes rab kyis zin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang mi ldan zhing /
analyzed: de thob par byed pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba 'khor gsum sgyu ma lta bur rtogs pa'i shes rab kyis zin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang mi ldan zhing /
translated: But one is not endowed with the perfections that are embraced by the wisdom that realizes the three spheres to be like illusions, the roots of virtue that bring about the attainment of that.

original: gang zag la bdag med pa tsam rtogs pas re zhig dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu mngon par 'du byas pa'o //üîΩ'phrul pas sprul pa ni byang chub @174a * //
analyzed: gang zag la bdag med pa tsam rtogs pas re zhig dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu mngon par 'du byas pa'o // 'phrul pas sprul pa ni byang chub @174a * //
translated: By the realization of the mere selflessness of the person, one actualizes the result of an arhat.

original: sems dpa' nyid sems can gyi don du nyan thos su sprul pa ste /
analyzed: sems dpa' nyid sems can gyi don du nyan thos su sprul pa ste /
translated: The emanation of emanations is the bodhisattva himself emanated as a ≈õrƒÅvaka for the sake of sentient beings.

original: gnas brtan sh'a ri'i bu la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: gnas brtan sh'a ri'i bu la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: like the elder Sariputra and so on.

original: lan gyi don ni 'dir zhi ba phyogs gcig pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: lan gyi don ni 'dir zhi ba phyogs gcig pa nyid yin te /
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúresponse‚Äù here is the one-sided peace,

original: de ni dus yun ring du zag pa med pa'i dbyings na gnas shing /
analyzed: de ni dus yun ring du zag pa med pa'i dbyings na gnas shing /
translated: because he abides for a long time in the uncontaminated realm,

original: srid par nyid mtshams 'brel bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: srid par nyid mtshams 'brel bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and because he does not link up with existence.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: And thus it is said:

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi myos pas myos pa bskal pa'i bar du mi sad do zhes pa la sogs pa 'og nas kyang ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi myos pas myos pa bskal pa'i bar du mi sad do zhes pa la sogs pa 'og nas kyang ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: ‚ÄúIntoxicated by the intoxication of samadhi, he does not awaken for eons.‚Äù

original: de las gzhan byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa spyad par smra ba ni sngar bstan pa'i smon lam goms pa ste /
analyzed: de las gzhan byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa spyad par smra ba ni sngar bstan pa'i smon lam goms pa ste /
translated: The one who speaks of the practice of the bodhisattva other than that is one who is habituated to the previously taught aspiration,

original: smon lam sngon du 'gro zhes pa dang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: smon lam sngon du 'gro zhes pa dang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: and he should be connected with ‚Äúaspiration preceding.‚Äù

original: 'phrul pas sprul pa ni bden pa gnyis kyi thabs la mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: 'phrul pas sprul pa ni bden pa gnyis kyi thabs la mkhas pa'o //
translated: Emanation is the skill in the means of the two realities.

original: de dag ni sangs rgyas kyi 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor mdzes par bya ba ste /
analyzed: de dag ni sangs rgyas kyi 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor mdzes par bya ba ste /
translated: They are the ones who beautify the circle of the Buddha‚Äôs retinue.

original: nyan thos dang byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun gyis spang pa'o //
analyzed: nyan thos dang byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun gyis spang pa'o //
translated: The Sangha consists of the Hearers and Bodhisattvas.

original: gzhan yang zhing de dag la gnas pa'i gdul bya'i khyad par rnams rjes su gzung ba'i don du nyan thos la sogs pa'i gzugs su skye zhing nying mtshams 'brel pa lta bur ston pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang zhing de dag la gnas pa'i gdul bya'i khyad par rnams rjes su gzung ba'i don du nyan thos la sogs pa'i gzugs su skye zhing nying mtshams 'brel pa lta bur ston pa'o //
translated: Moreover, in order to take care of the special disciples who are in those fields, they are born in the form of Hearers, etc., and show themselves to be reborn.

original: spyod pa spyad par smra zhes pa ni yang dag pa'i shes rab kyis zin pa med pas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa dngos ni ma yin zhes pa'o //
analyzed: spyod pa spyad par smra zhes pa ni yang dag pa'i shes rab kyis zin pa med pas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa dngos ni ma yin zhes pa'o //
translated: They are said to practice the practice because they are not possessed of right wisdom, and so are not really practicing the Bodhisattva practice.

original: sangs rgyas kyi 'phrul pas sprul zhes pa ni byang chub sems dpa' de rnams bdag nyid kyi mthu yang yin mod kyi de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyis kyang mthu dang spobs pa la sogs pa khyad par can du gyur pa'i nyan thos kyi gzugs su bstan
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi 'phrul pas sprul zhes pa ni byang chub sems dpa' de rnams bdag nyid kyi mthu yang yin mod kyi de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyis kyang mthu dang spobs pa la sogs pa khyad par can du gyur pa'i nyan thos kyi gzugs su bstan
translated: They are said to be emanations by the Buddha's magic power because those Bodhisattvas do have their own power, but they also show themselves in the form of Hearers who have become especially powerful and eloquent by the Tathagata's blessing.

original: pa'o // blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pa ni 'phags pa nyan thos de rnams kyis kyang chos kyi bdag med pa ma rtogs shing /
analyzed: pa'o // blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pa ni 'phags pa nyan thos de rnams kyis kyang chos kyi bdag med pa ma rtogs shing /
translated: The passage beginning ‚ÄúMahƒÅmati, those noble ≈õrƒÅvakas‚Äù explains that those noble ≈õrƒÅvakas have not realized the selflessness of phenomena.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i dngos por zhen pas na mya ngan las 'das pa'i 'bras bu thob pa mi 'thad pas de dag tu zhen pa las ldog par bya'o zhes gsungs pas te /
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i dngos por zhen pas na mya ngan las 'das pa'i 'bras bu thob pa mi 'thad pas de dag tu zhen pa las ldog par bya'o zhes gsungs pas te /
translated: Since they are attached to things such as the apprehended and the apprehender, it is not tenable that they have attained the result of nirvƒÅ·πáa. Therefore it is said that one should turn away from such attachments.

original: de la 'bras bu thob par bya ba ni 'jig rten pa rnams kyi skye ba'i bsam gtan dang po la sogs pa dang / rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'bras bu thob par bya ba ni 'jig rten pa rnams kyi skye ba'i bsam gtan dang po la sogs pa dang / rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: In this context, the attainment of the result is the mundane first concentration of birth and so on and the stream enterer and so on.

original: bsam gtan pa ni de la snyoms par 'jug pa'i gang zag go //
analyzed: bsam gtan pa ni de la snyoms par 'jug pa'i gang zag go //
translated: The meditator is the person who enters into meditative equipoise on those.

original: de ltar 'khor gsum du snang ba ni bden pa'i dngos por med cing rang gi @174b sems snang ba tsam du rtogs shing khas len pas 'bras bu thob pa'i mtshan nyid 'di bstan to zhes pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar 'khor gsum du snang ba ni bden pa'i dngos por med cing rang gi @174b sems snang ba tsam du rtogs shing khas len pas 'bras bu thob pa'i mtshan nyid 'di bstan to zhes pa ste /
translated: Thus the appearance of the three spheres does not exist as a real thing. It is realized and accepted as being the mere appearance of one‚Äôs mind. This is taught to be the definition of the attainment of the result.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i 'bras bu des thob par nus kye gzhan du ma yin zhes pa'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i 'bras bu des thob par nus kye gzhan du ma yin zhes pa'o //
translated: The result of nirvana is able to be attained by that, not otherwise.

original: de nyid gsal bar bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de nyid gsal bar bstan pa ni /
translated: That itself is clearly taught:

original: gzhan yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Moreover, if the person is imagined to be different from the aggregates, then the person would not be dependently arisen.üîΩIf the person is not dependently arisen, then it would not be tenable for it to be an object of expression or of knowledge.üîΩIf the person is not an object of expression or of knowledge, then it is not tenable for it to be an object of the view of self and so on.üîΩIf the person is not an object of the view of self and so on, then it is not tenable for it to be the support of the view of self and so on.üîΩIf the person is not the support of the view of self and so on, then it is not tenable for it to be bound by the view of self and so on.üîΩIf the person is not bound by the view of self and so on, then it is not tenable for it to be liberated by the view of selflessness and so on.

original: gnyis su 'gyur zhes pa ni spang bya dang spang byas dben pa'i gang zag gnyis su rtogs pas de nyid de'i bdag tu lta ba la sogs par ltung bar 'gyur te /üîΩsngar bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: gnyis su 'gyur zhes pa ni spang bya dang spang byas dben pa'i gang zag gnyis su rtogs pas de nyid de'i bdag tu lta ba la sogs par ltung bar 'gyur te / sngar bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: If the person is not liberated by the view of selflessness and so on, then it is not tenable for it to be an ƒÅrya.üîΩIf the person is not an ƒÅrya, then it is not tenable for it to attain the result of the ƒÅrya.üîΩIf the person does not attain the result of the ƒÅrya, then it is not tenable for it to attain nirvana.üîΩIf the person does not attain nirvana, then it is not tenable for it to be liberated.üîΩIf the person is not liberated, then it is not tenable for it to be omniscient.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa la sbyar ba ji lta ba bzhin du dgra bcom par khas len pa rnams kyi zad pa shes pa dang / mi skye ba shes pa'i ye shes kyang phyin ci log nyid du 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa la sbyar ba ji lta ba bzhin du dgra bcom par khas len pa rnams kyi zad pa shes pa dang / mi skye ba shes pa'i ye shes kyang phyin ci log nyid du 'gyur ba'o //
translated: If the person is not omniscient, then it is not tenable for it to be the teacher.

original: gal te de lta na sems snang ba tsam gyi bdag nyid don dam pa'i dngos por grub cing /
analyzed: gal te de lta na sems snang ba tsam gyi bdag nyid don dam pa'i dngos por grub cing /
translated: If the person is not the teacher, then it is not tenable for it to be the founder of the Dharma.üîΩIf the person is not the founder of the Dharma, then it is not tenable for it to be the leader of the world.üîΩIf the person is not the leader of the world, then it is not tenable for it to be the guide.

original: der 'dzin pa phyin ci ma log pa'i lam ma yin pa snyam du sems na /üîΩgzhan yang zhes pa la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: der 'dzin pa phyin ci ma log pa'i lam ma yin pa snyam du sems na /üîΩgzhan yang zhes pa la sogs pa smos te /
translated: If the person is not the guide, then it is not tenable for it to be the one who subdues the non-Buddhists.

original: de yang phyin ci lkog yin pas sems khams gsum las 'da' bar 'dod pa rnams de las 'da' bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de yang phyin ci lkog yin pas sems khams gsum las 'da' bar 'dod pa rnams de las 'da' bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Since that is a distortion, those who wish to transcend the three realms must transcend it.

original: rang gi sems snang ba'i mtshan nyid don dam pa'i dngos por 'dzin pa las kyang ldog par bya ste /
analyzed: rang gi sems snang ba'i mtshan nyid don dam pa'i dngos por 'dzin pa las kyang ldog par bya ste /
translated: Therefore, one should also turn away from the apprehension of the characteristics of one‚Äôs mind‚Äôs appearances as ultimate entities.

original: de'i phyir snyoms par 'jug pa'i khyad par rnams dang / bsam gtan dang ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa thams cad kyang sems kyi ngo bor gyur pa'i chos yin pas de rnams de kho na nyid du grub pa ma yin no zhes shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir snyoms par 'jug pa'i khyad par rnams dang / bsam gtan dang ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa thams cad kyang sems kyi ngo bor gyur pa'i chos yin pas de rnams de kho na nyid du grub pa ma yin no zhes shes par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should understand that the distinctions of meditative attainment, all concentrations, samƒÅdhis, and so on are phenomena that are the nature of mind and are therefore not established in reality.

original: sems tsam la ni yod pa min //
analyzed: sems tsam la ni yod pa min //
translated: They do not exist in mind only.

original: zhes pa ni de rnams kun rdzob tu sems nyid yin mod kyi /
analyzed: zhes pa ni de rnams kun rdzob tu sems nyid yin mod kyi /
translated: Although they are the mind itself conventionally,

original: de kho na nyid du myong rig tsam gyi sems kun rdzob pa 'di la yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de kho na nyid du myong rig tsam gyi sems kun rdzob pa 'di la yod pa ma yin te /
translated: they do not exist in this conventional mind of mere reflexive awareness in reality.

original: rang gi rang bzhin don dam par stong pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi rang bzhin don dam par stong pa'o //
translated: Their nature is ultimately empty.

original: spod dang bden pa mthong ba dang // zhes pa ni snga ma ltar bden pa bzhi'i chos bcu drug gi rnam par mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams spong ba'o //
analyzed: spod dang bden pa mthong ba dang // zhes pa ni snga ma ltar bden pa bzhi'i chos bcu drug gi rnam par mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams spong ba'o //
translated: The elimination of the afflictions is the elimination of the afflictions to be eliminated by seeing, by seeing the sixteen aspects of the four noble truths, as explained above.

original: 'di rnams kyang /
analyzed: 'di rnams kyang /
translated: These are also

original: rang rgyal rgyal sras nyan thos kyi //
analyzed: rang rgyal rgyal sras nyan thos kyi //
translated: the pratyekabuddhas, bodhisattvas, and ≈õrƒÅvakas.üîΩWhy do they have a hundred transformations?

original: ci slad 'gyur ba brgya bo dang // snang ba med pa brgya po yang //
analyzed: ci slad 'gyur ba brgya bo dang // snang ba med pa brgya po yang //
translated: Why do they have a hundred nonappearances?

original: ci slad 'gyur ba bdag la gsungs //
analyzed: ci slad 'gyur ba bdag la gsungs //
translated: Please tell me why.

original: zhes dris pa'i lan du yang don gyis sbyar bar bya ste /
analyzed: zhes dris pa'i lan du yang don gyis sbyar bar bya ste /
translated: The answer to this question should be applied by implication:

original: brgya nyid du 'gyur ba'i tshul ni 'dri ba'i tshig gi skabs su bstan to //
analyzed: brgya nyid du 'gyur ba'i tshul ni 'dri ba'i tshig gi skabs su bstan to //
translated: The way of having a hundred is explained in the context of the question.

original: gzhan yang blo gros chen po zhes pa @175a * //
analyzed: gzhan yang blo gros chen po zhes pa @175a * //
translated: Moreover, MahƒÅmati...

original: la sogs pas shes bya ji ltar rnam par dag ces dris pa'i lan du shes bya'i gnas thams cad ni re zhig bden pa gnyis su 'dus la /
analyzed: la sogs pas shes bya ji ltar rnam par dag ces dris pa'i lan du shes bya'i gnas thams cad ni re zhig bden pa gnyis su 'dus la /
translated: and so on. The question is, How is the knowable purified? The answer is that all bases of the knowable are included in the two truths.

original: de dag gi rang bzhin ji lta ba bzhin du shes shing goms pas de dag nyid kyi dri ma spong ba'o //
analyzed: de dag gi rang bzhin ji lta ba bzhin du shes shing goms pas de dag nyid kyi dri ma spong ba'o //
translated: By knowing and familiarizing oneself with their nature just as it is, one abandons the stains of those very [concepts].

original: de la rnam par rtog pa'i mtshan nyid 'dzin pa la zhes pa ni gzhan gyi dbang gi rnam par rtog pa don du snang zhing 'dzin pa la /
analyzed: de la rnam par rtog pa'i mtshan nyid 'dzin pa la zhes pa ni gzhan gyi dbang gi rnam par rtog pa don du snang zhing 'dzin pa la /
translated: As for grasping the characteristics of conceptualization, it is the dependent nature's conceptualization appearing as objects and grasping them.

original: mngon par chags pas rab tu 'jog pa'i blo zhes pa ste /
analyzed: mngon par chags pas rab tu 'jog pa'i blo zhes pa ste /
translated: It is the mind that is well-established through attachment.

original: kun rdzob tu don dang rjes su mthun pa'i blo 'ga' zhig gis kun rdzob kyi tshul rnam par 'jog pa'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu don dang rjes su mthun pa'i blo 'ga' zhig gis kun rdzob kyi tshul rnam par 'jog pa'o //
translated: It is the mind that is in accordance with objects on the conventional level, and by some such mind, the conventional mode is posited.

original: blo gang gis zhes pa ni de kho na nyid rnam par 'byed pa'i shes rab gang gis zhes pa'o //
analyzed: blo gang gis zhes pa ni de kho na nyid rnam par 'byed pa'i shes rab gang gis zhes pa'o //
translated: As for the mind by which, it is the wisdom that discerns suchness by which.

original: mtha' bzhi dang bral ba mi dmigs zhes pa ni mtha' bzhir 'dzin pa dang bral ba la mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: mtha' bzhi dang bral ba mi dmigs zhes pa ni mtha' bzhir 'dzin pa dang bral ba la mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: The non-observation of freedom from the four extremes is the non-observation of freedom from grasping at the four extremes.

original: mtha' bzhi po 'dis chos thams cad yongs su brtag pa la rab tu sbyar bar bya'o zhes pa ni mtha' bzhir rnam par brtags la de rnams mi dmigs pa'i sgo nas don dam par stong pa nyid du brtag cing sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: mtha' bzhi po 'dis chos thams cad yongs su brtag pa la rab tu sbyar bar bya'o zhes pa ni mtha' bzhir rnam par brtags la de rnams mi dmigs pa'i sgo nas don dam par stong pa nyid du brtag cing sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: One should apply this tetralemma to the examination of all phenomena.

original: rnam pa gcig tu na rnam par rtog pa'i zhes pa ni don dang mthun pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i blo ste /
analyzed: rnam pa gcig tu na rnam par rtog pa'i zhes pa ni don dang mthun pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i blo ste /
translated: In one sense, the phrase ‚Äúconceptualization‚Äù refers to the mind that conceptualizes in accordance with its object.

original: de nyid kyis kun rdzob tu tsha zhing gsher ba la sogs pa rang rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa'i dngos po rnams la de dang mthun par mngon par chags pa'i blo gang gis zhes sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyis kun rdzob tu tsha zhing gsher ba la sogs pa rang rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa'i dngos po rnams la de dang mthun par mngon par chags pa'i blo gang gis zhes sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: By that very [mind], one should apply the phrase ‚Äúthe mind that is attached in accordance with its object‚Äù to things that hold their own characteristics, such as heat and wetness in the case of fire and water, respectively.

original: yongs su rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid ces pa ni de rnams rtogs pa'i blo las gzhan ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid ces pa ni de rnams rtogs pa'i blo las gzhan ma yin pa'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe characteristic of conceptualization‚Äù means that they are not different from the mind that conceptualizes them.

original: rgyu ni de rnams blo'i bdag nyid du grub pa'i gtan tshigs te /
analyzed: rgyu ni de rnams blo'i bdag nyid du grub pa'i gtan tshigs te /
translated: The reason is the proof that they are established as having the nature of mind.

original: lhan cig dmigs pa nges pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: lhan cig dmigs pa nges pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: [The reason] is the certainty of simultaneous observation and so forth.

original: mtshan nyid ni de ltar snang ba'i blo'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid ni de ltar snang ba'i blo'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The definition is that it has the definition of a mind that appears in that way.

original: dpe yang sngar bstan pa ltar chos gnyis dang ldan pa'i dpe'o //
analyzed: dpe yang sngar bstan pa ltar chos gnyis dang ldan pa'i dpe'o //
translated: The example is an example that has the two dharmas as taught above.üîΩBy being attached to those, the nature of mind is reified in the manner of a real entity.üîΩAll dharmas are engaged in being mind only.üîΩAs such, the two minds that posit the mind as the relative and the mind as an illusion in the ultimate have the characteristics of the two minds.

original: de dag la mngon par chags pas sems kyi ngo bo nyid yang dag pa'i dngos por sgro 'dogs pa'i tshul gyis sgro 'dogs pa ste /
analyzed: de dag la mngon par chags pas sems kyi ngo bo nyid yang dag pa'i dngos por sgro 'dogs pa'i tshul gyis sgro 'dogs pa ste /
translated: The definition is that it has the definition of a mind that appears in that way.üîΩThe example is an example that has the two dharmas as taught above.üîΩBy being attached to those, the nature of mind is reified in the manner of a real entity.

original: chos thams cad sems tsam nyid du rnam par 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad sems tsam nyid du rnam par 'jug pa'o //
translated: All dharmas are engaged in being mind only.üîΩAs such, the two minds that posit the mind as the relative and the mind as an illusion in the ultimate have the characteristics of the two minds.üîΩThe definition is that it has the definition of a mind that appears in that way.üîΩThe example is an example that has the two dharmas as taught above.

original: de ltar kun rdzob tu sems nyid yin pa dang / don dam par sems nyid sgyu ma lta bur 'jog pa'i blo gnyis kyi mtshan nyid gang dang ldan pas zhes pa la sogs pa ste don go bar zad do //
analyzed: de ltar kun rdzob tu sems nyid yin pa dang / don dam par sems nyid sgyu ma lta bur 'jog pa'i blo gnyis kyi mtshan nyid gang dang ldan pas zhes pa la sogs pa ste don go bar zad do //
translated: By being attached to those, the nature of mind is reified in the manner of a real entity.üîΩAll dharmas are engaged in being mind only.üîΩAs such, the two minds that posit the mind as the relative and the mind as an illusion in the ultimate have the characteristics of the two minds.

original: snang ba med pa ni mnyam @175b par gzhag pa'i ye shes so so rang rig pa'o //
analyzed: snang ba med pa ni mnyam @175b par gzhag pa'i ye shes so so rang rig pa'o //
translated: The definition is that it has the definition of a mind that appears in that way.üîΩThe example is an example that has the two dharmas as taught above.üîΩBy being attached to those, the nature of mind is reified in the manner of a real entity.üîΩAll dharmas are engaged in being mind only.üîΩAs such, the two minds that posit the mind as the relative and the mind as an illusion in the ultimate have the characteristics of the two minds.

original: spyod pa'i sa ni snang ba dang bcas pa'i gnas skabs so //
analyzed: spyod pa'i sa ni snang ba dang bcas pa'i gnas skabs so //
translated: The definition is that it has the definition of a mind that appears in that way.üîΩThe example is an example that has the two dharmas as taught above.üîΩBy being attached to those, the nature of mind is reified in the manner of a real entity.üîΩAll dharmas are engaged in being mind only.üîΩAs such, the two minds that posit the mind as the relative and the mind as an illusion in the ultimate have the characteristics of the two minds.üîΩThe definition is

original: bskal pa brgyar thog ma'i mtha' dang tha ma'i mthar 'jug pa zhes pa ni dus de snyed kyi bar du rang dang gzhan gyi tshe rabs snga ma dang phyi ma shes pa'o //
analyzed: bskal pa brgyar thog ma'i mtha' dang tha ma'i mthar 'jug pa zhes pa ni dus de snyed kyi bar du rang dang gzhan gyi tshe rabs snga ma dang phyi ma shes pa'o //
translated: Engaging in the beginning and end for a hundred eons means knowing one's own and others' past and future lives for that length of time.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing brgya yang 'od kyis snang bar byed pa dang / sprul pa brgya 'gyed par nus pa la sogs pa 'phags pa sa bcu pa las rgyas par gsungs pa bzhin du blta'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing brgya yang 'od kyis snang bar byed pa dang / sprul pa brgya 'gyed par nus pa la sogs pa 'phags pa sa bcu pa las rgyas par gsungs pa bzhin du blta'o //
translated: One should understand this as it is extensively taught in the noble Dashabhumika-sutra: One is able to illuminate with one's light a hundred buddha-fields, to emanate a hundred magical creations, and so on.

original: sa'i mtshan nyid kyi cho ga ni go rims so //
analyzed: sa'i mtshan nyid kyi cho ga ni go rims so //
translated: The order is the rule for the characteristics of the stages.

original: smon lam gyi bye brag gis zhes pa ni sa dang po la smon lam chen po bcu grub cing de nyid kyang gong nas gong du khyad par du 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: smon lam gyi bye brag gis zhes pa ni sa dang po la smon lam chen po bcu grub cing de nyid kyang gong nas gong du khyad par du 'gyur ba'o //
translated: By the different kinds of vows means that on the first stage one accomplishes the ten great vows, and these are developed more and more.

original: mthar thug pa'i gnas bcu ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu yongs su rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: mthar thug pa'i gnas bcu ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu yongs su rdzogs pa'o //
translated: The ten ultimate states are the complete perfection of the ten powers of the Tathagata.

original: skabs kyi don 'di dang 'di'i rang bzhin can sngar bstan pa thams cad kyang ji ltar sal 'jug par 'gyur /
analyzed: skabs kyi don 'di dang 'di'i rang bzhin can sngar bstan pa thams cad kyang ji ltar sal 'jug par 'gyur /
translated: How does one enter into this topic and its nature, which have been taught above?

original: gang gis sa'i rim par 'gyur zhes dris pa'i lan du yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: gang gis sa'i rim par 'gyur zhes dris pa'i lan du yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: This should also be applied in response to the question, ‚ÄúBy what is there a progression of stages?‚Äù

original: blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pas ni sngar bstan pa'i tsha ba dang gsher ba la sogs pa'i 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa rnams ni kun rdzob tu sems nyid yin zhing /
analyzed: blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pas ni sngar bstan pa'i tsha ba dang gsher ba la sogs pa'i 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa rnams ni kun rdzob tu sems nyid yin zhing /
translated: ‚ÄúMahƒÅmati, and so on‚Äù extensively explains that the elements and the derivatives of the elements, such as heat and moisture, which were taught above, are the mind itself conventionally.

original: don dam par sems kyi ngo bo grub pa med par rgyas par 'chad de /
analyzed: don dam par sems kyi ngo bo grub pa med par rgyas par 'chad de /
translated: Ultimately, the essence of the mind is not established.

original: ming dang rnam par rtog pa tsam zhes pa de nyid gsal bar bstan pa ni /
analyzed: ming dang rnam par rtog pa tsam zhes pa de nyid gsal bar bstan pa ni /
translated: ‚ÄúName and mere conception‚Äù clarifies that.

original: ming dang rang gi sems zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ming dang rang gi sems zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúName and one‚Äôs mind‚Äù and so on.

original: de'i don ni ming dang rnam par rtog pa nyid kyang mtha' bzhi dang bral bas stong pa nyid ces pa'o //
analyzed: de'i don ni ming dang rnam par rtog pa nyid kyang mtha' bzhi dang bral bas stong pa nyid ces pa'o //
translated: The meaning of that is that even name and conception are empty, free from the four extremes.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid kyi gnas yang dag pa ji lta ba ni rig pa dang stong pa zung du 'jug pa'i gnas lugs don dam pa'i dngos por ma skyes pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid kyi gnas yang dag pa ji lta ba ni rig pa dang stong pa zung du 'jug pa'i gnas lugs don dam pa'i dngos por ma skyes pa'o //
translated: The nature of the basis of the characteristics, just as it is, is the ultimate reality, the abiding reality of the union of awareness and emptiness, which is unborn.

original: rab tu mthong ngo zhes pa ni ji ltar na mkhas pa yin zhes dris pa'i lan du sbyar te /
analyzed: rab tu mthong ngo zhes pa ni ji ltar na mkhas pa yin zhes dris pa'i lan du sbyar te /
translated: The line they see it well is applied to the answer to the question How are they wise?
