original: tshul lugs de ltar mthong zhes mkhas pa yin zhes pa'o //
analyzed: tshul lugs de ltar mthong zhes mkhas pa yin zhes pa'o //
translated: The line they see it in that way is applied to the answer to the question How are they wise?

original: de la blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pas ni de rnams ngo bo nyid med pa yin na /
analyzed: de la blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pas ni de rnams ngo bo nyid med pa yin na /
translated: With the line Mahamati, and so forth, it is thought that if those are essenceless,

original: 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur ba'i gzugs de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs shing /
analyzed: 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur ba'i gzugs de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs shing /
translated: the Tathagata taught the form of the elements and the element-derived form,üîΩand this is well known.

original: rab tu grags pa 'di nyid mi 'thad do snyam na /
analyzed: rab tu grags pa 'di nyid mi 'thad do snyam na /
translated: This is not tenable.

original: skyon med de /üîΩde ltar snang zhing grags pa ni rtog pa'i sa bon yongs su smin pa las byung ba blo nyid kyi rang bzhin @176a * //
analyzed: skyon med de / de ltar snang zhing grags pa ni rtog pa'i sa bon yongs su smin pa las byung ba blo nyid kyi rang bzhin @176a * //
translated: There is no fault.

original: du gyur ba'o zhes gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: du gyur ba'o zhes gsungs pa ste /
translated: It is said, What appears and is known arises from the ripening of the seeds of thought, and it is the nature of the mind itself.

original: gsher bar rnam par rtog pa nyid 'byung ba chen po ni zhes pa de ltar rnam par rtog pa nyid 'byung ba chen po yin gyi /
analyzed: gsher bar rnam par rtog pa nyid 'byung ba chen po ni zhes pa de ltar rnam par rtog pa nyid 'byung ba chen po yin gyi /
translated: The line The conception of wetness itself is the great element means that the conception itself is the great element.

original: rtog pa las tha dad pa phyi rol gyi ngo bor gyur pa ni med ces pa'o //
analyzed: rtog pa las tha dad pa phyi rol gyi ngo bor gyur pa ni med ces pa'o //
translated: It is not that there is an external entity that is different from the conception.

original: de 'dra ba'i rtog pa'i sa bon yongs su smin pa las phyi dang nang sems can gyi rgyud kyis bsdus pa'i chu'i khams su snang ba sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: de 'dra ba'i rtog pa'i sa bon yongs su smin pa las phyi dang nang sems can gyi rgyud kyis bsdus pa'i chu'i khams su snang ba sgrub pa'o //
translated: From the full maturation of the seeds of such thoughts, the water element appears, which is included within the mindstreams of sentient beings, both externally and internally.

original: gzugs kyi bye brag 'byed pa rnam par rtog pa 'byung ba chen po ni ji ltar ri dang khang bzangs dang shing la sogs pa nam mkha' stong pas bar du chod pas de rnams tha dad pa nyid du bye brag 'byed pa rnam par rtog pa'i 'byung ba
analyzed: gzugs kyi bye brag 'byed pa rnam par rtog pa 'byung ba chen po ni ji ltar ri dang khang bzangs dang shing la sogs pa nam mkha' stong pas bar du chod pas de rnams tha dad pa nyid du bye brag 'byed pa rnam par rtog pa'i 'byung ba
translated: The great element of the conceptualization that distinguishes forms is the great element of conceptualization that distinguishes forms, such as mountains, mansions, trees, and so on, because they are separated by empty space.

original: chen po zhes pa ste snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: chen po zhes pa ste snga ma bzhin no //
translated: It is the great element of conceptualization, as before.

original: log pa la bden pa zhes pa la sogs pas ni sems can gyi rgyud kyis bsdus pa'i phung po lnga dang / 'byung ba las gyur pa gzugs dang reg pa rnam pa ji ltar byung ba'i tshul bstan pa ste /
analyzed: log pa la bden pa zhes pa la sogs pas ni sems can gyi rgyud kyis bsdus pa'i phung po lnga dang / 'byung ba las gyur pa gzugs dang reg pa rnam pa ji ltar byung ba'i tshul bstan pa ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúfalse reality‚Äù and so on teaches the way in which the five aggregates included within the mindstreams of sentient beings and the forms and tactile objects that are derived from the elements arise.

original: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed zhes pa la sogs pa sngar gsungs pa dang mtshungs so //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed zhes pa la sogs pa sngar gsungs pa dang mtshungs so //
translated: This is similar to what was stated earlier, ‚ÄúConditioned by ignorance, there are the karmic formative forces‚Äù and so on.

original: de nyid gsal bar bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de nyid gsal bar bstan pa ni /
translated: The elucidation of that is:

original: blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúMahƒÅmati, etc.‚Äù

original: mngon par chags shing 'dod pa ni sred pa dang len pa ste /
analyzed: mngon par chags shing 'dod pa ni sred pa dang len pa ste /
translated: Attachment and desire are craving and grasping,

original: 'du byed mthu dang ldan par byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'du byed mthu dang ldan par byed pa'o //
translated: which make the formative forces powerful.

original: sa'i 'byung ba zhes pa la sogs pas de rnams su snang ba la phyi rol tha dad pa 'gog pa'i rgyu mtshan nyid ston te /
analyzed: sa'i 'byung ba zhes pa la sogs pas de rnams su snang ba la phyi rol tha dad pa 'gog pa'i rgyu mtshan nyid ston te /
translated: The appearance in those is taught to be the reason for refuting external difference, with ‚Äúthe appearance of the elements of earth, etc.‚Äù

original: sa'i 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa nyid du snang ba rnams la ni rgyu 'byung ba chen po ste /
analyzed: sa'i 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa nyid du snang ba rnams la ni rgyu 'byung ba chen po ste /
translated: In the appearance as the elements of earth and the element derivatives, the cause is the great elements.

original: sngar gsungs pa ltar gsher ba dang tsha bar rnam par rtog pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i 'byung ba chen po rnams rgyu nyid du yod kyi phyi rol gyi ngo bor gyur pa'i 'byung ba chen po rnams ni med do //
analyzed: sngar gsungs pa ltar gsher ba dang tsha bar rnam par rtog pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i 'byung ba chen po rnams rgyu nyid du yod kyi phyi rol gyi ngo bor gyur pa'i 'byung ba chen po rnams ni med do //
translated: As previously stated, the great elements that have the nature of the concepts of fluidity and heat exist as the cause, but the external great elements do not exist.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: dngos po dang mtshan ma dang zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: dngos po dang mtshan ma dang zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: It is stated: ‚Äúentity, sign, etc.‚Äù

original: rdul phra rab bam rags pa'i dngos po dang / de rnams mtshon par byed pa'i mtshan ma glo bur ba ste /
analyzed: rdul phra rab bam rags pa'i dngos po dang / de rnams mtshon par byed pa'i mtshan ma glo bur ba ste /
translated: and the subtle or gross entities, and the adventitious signs that characterize them.üîΩFor example, it is like saying ‚Äúthe house of Devadatta,‚Äù where the crow is the possessor and the house is the possession.

original: ji ltar bya rog chags pa ni lha sbyin gyi khang pa'o zhes pa lta bu dang / rang gi rang bzhin du gyur ba'i chos thun mong ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid gsher ba dang tsha ba la sogs pa dang / grub zhi la sogs pa'i dbyibs dang /
analyzed: ji ltar bya rog chags pa ni lha sbyin gyi khang pa'o zhes pa lta bu dang / rang gi rang bzhin du gyur ba'i chos thun mong ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid gsher ba dang tsha ba la sogs pa dang / grub zhi la sogs pa'i dbyibs dang /
translated: And it is like saying ‚Äúthe fluidity, heat, etc.,‚Äù where the nature of the thing itself is the common characteristic.

original: smin pa dang sdud pa la sogs pa'i bya ba'i bdag nyid de /
analyzed: smin pa dang sdud pa la sogs pa'i bya ba'i bdag nyid de /
translated: And it is like saying ‚Äúthe shape of a pot,‚Äù where the shape is the action of the pot.

original: de rnams tshogs pa 'am rdul phra rab rnams sbyor zhing 'phrod @176b ba dang 'du ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnams tshogs pa 'am rdul phra rab rnams sbyor zhing 'phrod @176b ba dang 'du ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no aggregation of those, or no conjunction, or no combination of the subtle particles.

original: de'i don yang rdul phra rab rnams phyogs gcig dang mtha' dag gis sbyor ba mi 'thad pa nyid du rgyas par bstan to //
analyzed: de'i don yang rdul phra rab rnams phyogs gcig dang mtha' dag gis sbyor ba mi 'thad pa nyid du rgyas par bstan to //
translated: The meaning of that is extensively explained in the demonstration that it is not tenable that the subtle particles are conjoined by one part or by the whole.

original: yang bye brag pa rnams ni rdul phra mo rtag pa'i rdzas rnams las rags pa yan lag can gyi rdzas rtsom pa na thog mar bya ba dang 'brel te rtsom pa las 'dis bya ba'i bdag nyid dang sbyor ba med pas zhes pa de dang 'brel pa med
analyzed: yang bye brag pa rnams ni rdul phra mo rtag pa'i rdzas rnams las rags pa yan lag can gyi rdzas rtsom pa na thog mar bya ba dang 'brel te rtsom pa las 'dis bya ba'i bdag nyid dang sbyor ba med pas zhes pa de dang 'brel pa med
translated: Again, the Vai≈õe·π£ikas say that when coarse, part-possessing substances are formed from permanent, partless particles, they are formed first in connection with activity, but since they are not connected with the nature of activity, they are not connected with activity.

original: pas rtsom pa mi 'thad ces pa'o //
analyzed: pas rtsom pa mi 'thad ces pa'o //
translated: Since they are not connected with activity, formation is not tenable.

original: dngos po dang zhes pa la sogs pas ni de nyid rjes su 'gro ba'i sgo nas ston to //
analyzed: dngos po dang zhes pa la sogs pas ni de nyid rjes su 'gro ba'i sgo nas ston to //
translated: ‚Äú Entity‚Äù and so on teaches that very point through concomitance.

original: bya ba 'dus pa las skye zhes pa ni las su bya ba ste /
analyzed: bya ba 'dus pa las skye zhes pa ni las su bya ba ste /
translated: ‚Äú Arising from the assembly of activity‚Äù means that which is to be acted upon.

original: 'bras bu nyid la sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu nyid la sbyar ro //
translated: It is applied to the effect.

original: mtshan ma dang mi ldan zhes pa ni dngos po dang mtshan ma la sogs pa tshogs shing sbyor ba med par 'byung ba chen po rnams mi skye ba ste /
analyzed: mtshan ma dang mi ldan zhes pa ni dngos po dang mtshan ma la sogs pa tshogs shing sbyor ba med par 'byung ba chen po rnams mi skye ba ste /
translated: ‚Äú Not endowed with characteristics‚Äù means that the great elements do not arise without the assembly and connection of entities, characteristics, and so on.

original: ldog pa'i sgo nas bstan pa'o //
analyzed: ldog pa'i sgo nas bstan pa'o //
translated: This is taught through the reverse mode.

original: gzhan yang blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pas ni kun rdzob tsam du phung po la sogs pa'i rnam par gzhag pa ji ltar yin pa gsungs so //
analyzed: gzhan yang blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pas ni kun rdzob tsam du phung po la sogs pa'i rnam par gzhag pa ji ltar yin pa gsungs so //
translated: Moreover, ‚ÄúMahƒÅmati‚Äù and so on explain how the aggregates and so on are posited as mere conventionalities.

original: de rang bzhin ni kun rdzob tsam du mtshan gzhi gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos po'o //
analyzed: de rang bzhin ni kun rdzob tsam du mtshan gzhi gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos po'o //
translated: Their nature is the entities of the bases of characteristics, such as form, that are mere conventionalities.

original: yang rnam pa gcig tu na de rnams kyi rang bzhin de kho na nyid skye ba med pa dang / mtshan nyid med pa dang / mtshan nyid kyang don dam par mtshan nyid med pa'i mtshan nyid do /
analyzed: yang rnam pa gcig tu na de rnams kyi rang bzhin de kho na nyid skye ba med pa dang / mtshan nyid med pa dang / mtshan nyid kyang don dam par mtshan nyid med pa'i mtshan nyid do /
translated: Moreover, in one sense, their nature is suchness, which is nonarising, the characteristic, and the characteristic of the ultimate that is without characteristics.

original: ji skad du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las /
analyzed: ji skad du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las /
translated: As it says in the Perfection of Wisdom:

original: gzugs ni gzhig cing gzhom du rung ba'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: gzugs ni gzhig cing gzhom du rung ba'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: ‚ÄúForm has the characteristic of being destructible and perishable.

original: de ni mtshan nyid med par de bzhin gshegs pas mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so zhes pa nas /
analyzed: de ni mtshan nyid med par de bzhin gshegs pas mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so zhes pa nas /
translated: The TathƒÅgata fully and perfectly realized that it is without characteristics.‚Äù

original: de bzhin du tshor ba ni nyams su myong ba'i mtshan nyid dang / 'du shes ni mtshan mar 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid dang / 'du byed ni sems mngon par 'du byed pa'i mtshan nyid dang / rnam par shes pa ni dmigs pa rnam par rig pa'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba ni nyams su myong ba'i mtshan nyid dang / 'du shes ni mtshan mar 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid dang / 'du byed ni sems mngon par 'du byed pa'i mtshan nyid dang / rnam par shes pa ni dmigs pa rnam par rig pa'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: and consciousness has the characteristic of the perception of the object.

original: de ni mtshan nyid med par de bzhin gshegs pas mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so zhes pa'i bar du gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: de ni mtshan nyid med par de bzhin gshegs pas mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so zhes pa'i bar du gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: The TathƒÅgata has fully awakened to the absence of the characteristic of these.

original: de la phung po bzhi ni ming bzhi'i phung po'o //
analyzed: de la phung po bzhi ni ming bzhi'i phung po'o //
translated: Among these, the four aggregates are the four name aggregates.

original: 'byung ba bzhi las gyur pa ni phyi dang nang gi skye mched gzugs can nyid du grags pa rnam pa bcu'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba bzhi las gyur pa ni phyi dang nang gi skye mched gzugs can nyid du grags pa rnam pa bcu'o //
translated: The ten kinds of form that are known as the internal and external form sense spheres derived from the four great elements.

original: rnam par rig byed ma yin pa ni ha cang yang 'khrul bar gyur pa'i sde pa rnams kyis @177a * //üîΩbrtags pas te /
analyzed: rnam par rig byed ma yin pa ni ha cang yang 'khrul bar gyur pa'i sde pa rnams kyis @177a * // brtags pas te /
translated: Non-informative form is imagined by the Sa·πÖgha that is extremely confused.

original: 'dir smos par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dir smos par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: It is not to be mentioned here.

original: phan tshun du mtshan nyid mi mthun pa ni gsher ba dang sreg pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: phan tshun du mtshan nyid mi mthun pa ni gsher ba dang sreg pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The characteristics of the form aggregate are mutually different, such as wetness, heat, and so on.

original: gzugs med pa la bzhir bgrang ba med ces pa'i don ni ji ltar gzugs rags par 'jug pa rtogs par sla ba nyid kyis 'di dang de'o zhes bgrang bar nus pa ltar gzugs med pa rnams ni ma yin zhes pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs med pa la bzhir bgrang ba med ces pa'i don ni ji ltar gzugs rags par 'jug pa rtogs par sla ba nyid kyis 'di dang de'o zhes bgrang bar nus pa ltar gzugs med pa rnams ni ma yin zhes pa'o //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúthe formless is not counted as four‚Äù is that, unlike form, which is coarse and easy to understand, the formless cannot be counted as this or that.

original: yang don dam par ni phung po lnga po thams cad nam mkha' dang 'dra zhing spros pa dang bral bas gcig dang gnyis la sogs pa'i grangs dang / bgrang bya'i dngos po las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: yang don dam par ni phung po lnga po thams cad nam mkha' dang 'dra zhing spros pa dang bral bas gcig dang gnyis la sogs pa'i grangs dang / bgrang bya'i dngos po las 'das pa'o //
translated: Moreover, in the ultimate truth, all five aggregates are like space and free from conceptual elaborations. Therefore they transcend being counted as one, two, and so on, and they transcend being a thing that is counted.

original: de ltar yin kyang byis pa rnams kyis thogs par byed pa'i dngos po dang bral ba gcig ni nam mkha'o zhes rnam par rtog pa de bzhin du 'di ni tshor ba dang zhes pa la sogs par grangs dang bgrang bya'i dngos por brjod pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar yin kyang byis pa rnams kyis thogs par byed pa'i dngos po dang bral ba gcig ni nam mkha'o zhes rnam par rtog pa de bzhin du 'di ni tshor ba dang zhes pa la sogs par grangs dang bgrang bya'i dngos por brjod pa'o //
translated: Even though that is the case, childish beings conceive of space as being one thing that is free from being an obstructive thing. In the same way, the formless is described as a thing that is counted and as a thing that is enumerated, such as ‚Äúthis is feeling‚Äù and so on.

original: gnas gzhan du ma yin zhes pa ni rmi lam dang gzugs brnyan gyi skyes bu ltar don dam par phung po 'dus pa'i sems can gyi skye gnas gzhan tha dad pa ma yin kyang /
analyzed: gnas gzhan du ma yin zhes pa ni rmi lam dang gzugs brnyan gyi skyes bu ltar don dam par phung po 'dus pa'i sems can gyi skye gnas gzhan tha dad pa ma yin kyang /
translated: ‚ÄúIn no other place‚Äù means that, like the person in a dream or a reflection, ultimately there is no other place of birth for sentient beings, who are a composite of the aggregates.

original: 'phags pa'i ye shes ma thob pa'i byis pa rnams la /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i ye shes ma thob pa'i byis pa rnams la /
translated: However, for the childish who have not attained the wisdom of the noble ones,

original: de 'dra ba'i phung po'i rnam par rtog pa'i blo nyid rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: de 'dra ba'i phung po'i rnam par rtog pa'i blo nyid rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: the mind that conceptualizes such aggregates is conceptual.

original: blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pas ni de 'dra ba'i rnam par rtog pa spangs la /
analyzed: blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pas ni de 'dra ba'i rnam par rtog pa spangs la /
translated: ‚ÄúMahƒÅmati, ‚Ä¶‚Äù and so forth advise that one should abandon such concepts

original: rang dang gzhan gyi don la sbyar bar bya'o zhes gdams pa'o //
analyzed: rang dang gzhan gyi don la sbyar bar bya'o zhes gdams pa'o //
translated: and apply oneself to one‚Äôs own and others‚Äô welfare.

original: rab tu dben pa'i chos bstan pa byas pas ni chos la bdag med pa mthong ba rnam par dag par 'gyur zhes pa ni de ltar goms shing tshogs bsags pas sa dang po la bden pa bzhi'i chos nyid mthong ba gong nas gong du rnam par dag par
analyzed: rab tu dben pa'i chos bstan pa byas pas ni chos la bdag med pa mthong ba rnam par dag par 'gyur zhes pa ni de ltar goms shing tshogs bsags pas sa dang po la bden pa bzhi'i chos nyid mthong ba gong nas gong du rnam par dag par
translated: ‚ÄúBy teaching the doctrine of complete isolation, the vision of the selflessness of phenomena becomes pure‚Äù means that by becoming familiar with that and accumulating the collections, on the first ground one sees the reality of the four truths, which becomes increasingly pure.

original: 'gyur zhing / sa bdun pa ring du song ba'i sa la yang rab tu 'jug par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'gyur zhing / sa bdun pa ring du song ba'i sa la yang rab tu 'jug par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: and he enters the seventh ground, the Gone Afar.

original: des de la rab tu zhugs pas ting nge 'dzin du ma la dbang bsgyur zhing yid kyi lus rab tu thob pas sa brgyad pa la sgyu ma lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin rab tu thob po //
analyzed: des de la rab tu zhugs pas ting nge 'dzin du ma la dbang bsgyur zhing yid kyi lus rab tu thob pas sa brgyad pa la sgyu ma lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin rab tu thob po //
translated: Having entered that ground, he masters many meditative stabilizations, and having attained the mental body, on the eighth ground he attains the illusion-like meditative stabilization.

original: gzhan yang sa de nyid la de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mngon par shes pa drug dang / dbang bcu po rnams rtogs par khong du chud pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang sa de nyid la de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mngon par shes pa drug dang / dbang bcu po rnams rtogs par khong du chud pa ste /
translated: Moreover, on that ground he realizes and comprehends the ten powers of the TathƒÅgata, the six superknowledges, and the ten masteries.

original: de rnams so so rang rig pa'i tshul gyis rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams so so rang rig pa'i tshul gyis rtogs pa'o //
translated: He realizes them by the method of individual self-knowledge.

original: de la de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dang mi 'jigs @177b pa la sogs pa'i yon tan gyi rigs rnams byang chub sems dpa'i sa brgyad pa la thob kyang /
analyzed: de la de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dang mi 'jigs @177b pa la sogs pa'i yon tan gyi rigs rnams byang chub sems dpa'i sa brgyad pa la thob kyang /
translated: There, although the types of qualities such as the powers and fearlessnesses of the TathƒÅgata are attained on the eighth bodhisattva ground,

original: de rnams rnam par dag cing yongs su rdzogs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de rnams rnam par dag cing yongs su rdzogs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: they are not purified and perfected.

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' nyid kyi stobs bcu la sogs pa yang 'phags pa rnam par 'phrul pa'i rgyal pos zhus pa las bstan te sngar bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' nyid kyi stobs bcu la sogs pa yang 'phags pa rnam par 'phrul pa'i rgyal pos zhus pa las bstan te sngar bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: Moreover, the ten powers of a bodhisattva and so on are explained in the sutra requested by the noble king of manifestations just as they were explained above.

original: mngon par shes pa rnams kyi yul dang mtshan nyid la sogs pa yang chos mngon pa'i bstan bcos dang / 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las shes par bya'o //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa rnams kyi yul dang mtshan nyid la sogs pa yang chos mngon pa'i bstan bcos dang / 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las shes par bya'o //
translated: The objects, characteristics and so on of the higher perceptions should be understood from the Abhidharma treatises and the sutra of the perfection of wisdom.

original: de rnams thob pa'i rgyu ni 'phral gyi mngon par 'du byed pa dang ; sngon gyi las te de la dang po ni bsam gtan bzhi pas thams cad kyis rung bar byas pa 'phel ba rab kyi mthar thug pa ste /
analyzed: de rnams thob pa'i rgyu ni 'phral gyi mngon par 'du byed pa dang ; sngon gyi las te de la dang po ni bsam gtan bzhi pas thams cad kyis rung bar byas pa 'phel ba rab kyi mthar thug pa ste /
translated: The causes of attaining them are the present manifestor and past karma. The first is the culmination of the increase of the fourth absorption that is suitable for all.

original: ji ltar bsam gtan dang po nas srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar bsam gtan bzhi dang / gzugs med pa bzhi la go rims bzhin du lugs dang mthun par snyoms par 'jug cing /
analyzed: ji ltar bsam gtan dang po nas srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar bsam gtan bzhi dang / gzugs med pa bzhi la go rims bzhin du lugs dang mthun par snyoms par 'jug cing /
translated: Just as one enters meditative attainment in the forward order from the first absorption to the summit of existence,

original: yang srid pa'i rtse mo nas bsam gtan dang po'i bar du go rims bzhin du lugs las ldog pa'i tshul gyis snyoms par zhugs te /
analyzed: yang srid pa'i rtse mo nas bsam gtan dang po'i bar du go rims bzhin du lugs las ldog pa'i tshul gyis snyoms par zhugs te /
translated: Again, in the reverse order, they enter meditative attainment from the summit of existence down to the first absorption.

original: de nas bsam gtan bzhi pa'i bar du go rims bzhin snyoms par zhugs shing /
analyzed: de nas bsam gtan bzhi pa'i bar du go rims bzhin snyoms par zhugs shing /
translated: Then, in the reverse order, they enter meditative attainment from the fourth absorption down to the first absorption.

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa de la brten nas rdzu 'phrul thob par 'dod pa na /üîΩrang gi lus shing bal lta bur yang ba nyid du yid la byed pa dang / mig dang rna ba'i mngon par shes pa la sogs pa thob par 'dod pa na /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa de la brten nas rdzu 'phrul thob par 'dod pa na / rang gi lus shing bal lta bur yang ba nyid du yid la byed pa dang / mig dang rna ba'i mngon par shes pa la sogs pa thob par 'dod pa na /
translated: When they wish to obtain supernatural power based on the fourth absorption,üîΩthey mentally attend to their body becoming as light as cotton wool and they obtain the higher perception of the eye and ear and so on.

original: gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa'i yul rnams dbang po'i nye 'khor na gnas par yid la byed cing /
analyzed: gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa'i yul rnams dbang po'i nye 'khor na gnas par yid la byed cing /
translated: When they wish to obtain the higher perception of knowing the minds of others, they mentally attend to objects such as form and sound that are located near the sense faculties.

original: de'i rjes su de rnams kyi ngo bor mi rtog pa'i ye shes la gnas nas de las langs pa'i rjes kyi shes pa la de rnams ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa'i mngon par shes pa 'byung ba'o //üîΩde skad du yang /
analyzed: de'i rjes su de rnams kyi ngo bor mi rtog pa'i ye shes la gnas nas de las langs pa'i rjes kyi shes pa la de rnams ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa'i mngon par shes pa 'byung ba'o //üîΩde skad du yang /
translated: Subsequently, they abide in nonconceptual wisdom that is the nature of those objects and the higher perception of knowing the minds of others arises in the subsequent consciousness that arises from that.üîΩSimilarly, when they wish to obtain the higher perception of knowing past lives, they mentally attend to the objects of past lives.

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa shin du dag thob nas //
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa shin du dag thob nas //
translated: Having attained the fourth concentration,üîΩand being sustained by nonconceptual wisdom,

original: mi rtog ye shes yongs su bzung ba dang // ji ltar rnam gnas yid la byad pa las //
analyzed: mi rtog ye shes yongs su bzung ba dang // ji ltar rnam gnas yid la byad pa las //
translated: from the mental attention of abiding in that way,

original: mthu grub pa yi dam pa thob par 'gyur //üîΩzhes gsungs pas so //
analyzed: mthu grub pa yi dam pa thob par 'gyur // zhes gsungs pas so //
translated: they will attain the supreme accomplishment of power.

original: gzhan yang 'di rnams sngon gyi las kyi dbang gis kyang 'byung bar gsungs te /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'di rnams sngon gyi las kyi dbang gis kyang 'byung bar gsungs te /
translated: It is also said that these occur through the power of past karma.

original: de skad du 'phags pa dkon mchog brtsegs pa las /
analyzed: de skad du 'phags pa dkon mchog brtsegs pa las /
translated: In the Heap of Jewels it says:

original: ji ltar lha yi mig thob 'gyur //
analyzed: ji ltar lha yi mig thob 'gyur //
translated: ‚ÄúHow does one attain the divine eye?

original: lha yi rna ba ji @178a * //
analyzed: lha yi rna ba ji @178a * //
translated: How does one attain the divine ear?

original: ltar thob // sems can 'chi 'pho skye ba dag /'dren pa gang gis 'tshal bar 'gyur //
analyzed: ltar thob // sems can 'chi 'pho skye ba dag /'dren pa gang gis 'tshal bar 'gyur //
translated: Guide, how does one know the death and rebirth of sentient beings?‚Äù

original: zhes dris pa'i lan du 'dren pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis /
analyzed: zhes dris pa'i lan du 'dren pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis /
translated: In response to this question, the guide, the perfect, complete Buddha, said:

original: mar me byin pas mig thob 'gyur //
analyzed: mar me byin pas mig thob 'gyur //
translated: ‚ÄúBy giving lamps, one attains the eye.üîΩBy music, one attains the ear.

original: rol mo sgra yis rna ba dag /'chi 'pho skye ba ye shes kyis //
analyzed: rol mo sgra yis rna ba dag /'chi 'pho skye ba ye shes kyis //
translated: By the wisdom of death and rebirth,

original: de dag de ltar 'grub par 'gyur //
analyzed: de dag de ltar 'grub par 'gyur //
translated: one will accomplish these.‚Äù

original: zhes gsungs nas yang /
analyzed: zhes gsungs nas yang /
translated: Then:

original: 'dren pa byang chub sems dpa' yi //
analyzed: 'dren pa byang chub sems dpa' yi //
translated: The guide, the bodhisattva,

original: zag pa gang gis bas par 'gyur //
analyzed: zag pa gang gis bas par 'gyur //
translated: by what is his defilement exhausted?

original: tshe rabs snga dran cis 'gyur lags //
analyzed: tshe rabs snga dran cis 'gyur lags //
translated: By what is there recollection of former lives?

original: rdzu 'phrul ci yis thob par 'gyur //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul ci yis thob par 'gyur //
translated: By what is there attainment of the superknowledges?

original: zhes dris pa'i lan du /
analyzed: zhes dris pa'i lan du /
translated: In reply to these questions, it is said:

original: bzhon pa byin pas rdzu 'phrul 'thob //
analyzed: bzhon pa byin pas rdzu 'phrul 'thob //
translated: By giving vehicles, there is attainment of the superknowledges.

original: dran pa bsgoms pas rjes su dran //
analyzed: dran pa bsgoms pas rjes su dran //
translated: By cultivating recollection, there is recollection of former lives.

original: mtha' gnyis rab tu spangs byas nas //
analyzed: mtha' gnyis rab tu spangs byas nas //
translated: Having thoroughly abandoned the two extremes,

original: zag pa zad pa reg par 'gyur //
analyzed: zag pa zad pa reg par 'gyur //
translated: one reaches the exhaustion of defilements.

original: zhes rgya cher gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes rgya cher gsungs so //
translated: This is stated in detail.

original: 'di rnams kyang /
analyzed: 'di rnams kyang /
translated: These are also to be applied in reply to the questions:

original: 'jig rten mngon shes ji ltar 'byung //
analyzed: 'jig rten mngon shes ji ltar 'byung //
translated: How do the mundane superknowledges arise?

original: 'jig rten 'das kyi'ang ji lta bu //üîΩzhes dris pa'i lan du sbyar bar bya ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'das kyi'ang ji lta bu // zhes dris pa'i lan du sbyar bar bya ste /
translated: And how do the supramundane ones?

original: de la mngon par shes pa lnga ni 'jig rten pa rnams dang thun mong pa'o //üîΩzag pa zad pa ni 'phags pa nyan thos la sogs pa slob pa'i sa las 'das pa'am /
analyzed: de la mngon par shes pa lnga ni 'jig rten pa rnams dang thun mong pa'o // zag pa zad pa ni 'phags pa nyan thos la sogs pa slob pa'i sa las 'das pa'am /
translated: Among them, the five superknowledges are common to both mundane and supramundane.üîΩThe exhaustion of defilements is included in the stage of the noble ≈õrƒÅvakas and so on who have transcended the stage of training,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sa brgyad pa yan chod kyi gnas skabs kyis bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sa brgyad pa yan chod kyi gnas skabs kyis bsdus pa'o //
translated: or in the bodhisattvas from the eighth stage onward.

original: de la dbang rnam pa bcu ni 'phags pa chos yang dag par sdud pa las ji skad du /
analyzed: de la dbang rnam pa bcu ni 'phags pa chos yang dag par sdud pa las ji skad du /
translated: The ten masteries are as described in the noble Dharma-samgiti:

original: tshe la dbang ba dang / sems la dbang ba dang / yo byad la dbang ba dang / las la dbang ba dang / skye ba la dbang ba dang / rdzu 'phrul la dbang ba dang / mos pa la dbang ba dang / smon lam la dbang ba dang /
analyzed: tshe la dbang ba dang / sems la dbang ba dang / yo byad la dbang ba dang / las la dbang ba dang / skye ba la dbang ba dang / rdzu 'phrul la dbang ba dang / mos pa la dbang ba dang / smon lam la dbang ba dang /
translated: mastery over life, mastery over mind, mastery over equipment, mastery over action, mastery over birth, mastery over aspiration, mastery over miraculous powers, mastery over conviction, mastery over knowledge, and mastery over the Dharma.

original: ye shes la dbang ba dang ; chos la dbang ba ste de dag ni dbang bcu'o //
analyzed: ye shes la dbang ba dang ; chos la dbang ba ste de dag ni dbang bcu'o //
translated: These are the ten masteries.

original: de la bdud rtsi thob pa'i phyir tshe la dbang ba'o //
analyzed: de la bdud rtsi thob pa'i phyir tshe la dbang ba'o //
translated: Among them, mastery over life is due to the attainment of immortality.

original: sems tsam du yongs su shes pa'i phyir sems la dbang ba'o //
analyzed: sems tsam du yongs su shes pa'i phyir sems la dbang ba'o //
translated: Mastery over mind is due to the thorough knowledge of mind only.

original: lag na rin po che dang nam mkha' mdzod kyi ting nge 'dzin rab tu rnyed pa'i phyir yo byang la dbang ba'o //
analyzed: lag na rin po che dang nam mkha' mdzod kyi ting nge 'dzin rab tu rnyed pa'i phyir yo byang la dbang ba'o //
translated: Mastery over equipment is due to the attainment of the samadhis of the precious hand and the sky treasury.

original: bag chags dang bcas pa'i las kyi lam kun chad pa'i phyir las la dbang ba'o //
analyzed: bag chags dang bcas pa'i las kyi lam kun chad pa'i phyir las la dbang ba'o //
translated: Mastery over action is due to the complete severance of the paths of action together with their instincts.

original: ting nge 'dzin rnams bzlog pa'i bsam gtan rnyed pa'i phyir skye ba la dbang ba'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin rnams bzlog pa'i bsam gtan rnyed pa'i phyir skye ba la dbang ba'o //
translated: Mastery of birth is for the sake of attaining concentration that turns back the absorptions.

original: lhun gyis grub par bya ba la 'jug pa thob pa'i phyir rdzu 'phrul la dbang ba'o //üîΩzad par gyi skye mched thob par bya ba'i @178b phyir mos pa la dbang ba'o //
analyzed: lhun gyis grub par bya ba la 'jug pa thob pa'i phyir rdzu 'phrul la dbang ba'o // zad par gyi skye mched thob par bya ba'i @178b phyir mos pa la dbang ba'o //
translated: Mastery of magical powers is for the sake of attaining spontaneous performance.üîΩMastery of aspiration is for the sake of attaining the bases of mastery.

original: bsam pa tsam gyis don thob par 'gyur ba'i phyir smon lam la dbang ba'o //
analyzed: bsam pa tsam gyis don thob par 'gyur ba'i phyir smon lam la dbang ba'o //
translated: Mastery of vows is for the sake of attaining the superknowledges.

original: ye shes sngon du 'gro ba'i lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las thob pa'i phyir ye shes la dbang ba'o //
analyzed: ye shes sngon du 'gro ba'i lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las thob pa'i phyir ye shes la dbang ba'o //
translated: Mastery of knowledge is for the sake of attaining the karma of body, speech, and mind preceded by knowledge.

original: de bzhin nyid dang chos kyi dbyings dang yang dag pa'i mtha' mnyam pa'i ye shes dri ma med pa'i phyir chos la dbang ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid dang chos kyi dbyings dang yang dag pa'i mtha' mnyam pa'i ye shes dri ma med pa'i phyir chos la dbang ba'o //
translated: Mastery of Dharma is for the sake of attaining stainless knowledge equal to reality, the realm of the Dharma, and the finality of existence.

original: gzhan yang rigs kyi bu 'jig rten ni 'chi bas 'jigs skrag ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang rigs kyi bu 'jig rten ni 'chi bas 'jigs skrag ste /
translated: Moreover, son of noble family, the world is terrified by the fear of death.

original: de'i gnyen por tshe la dbang ba'o //
analyzed: de'i gnyen por tshe la dbang ba'o //
translated: The antidote to that is mastery of life.

original: 'jig rten ni sems kun nas nyon mongs pas 'jigs skrag ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten ni sems kun nas nyon mongs pas 'jigs skrag ste /
translated: The world is terrified by the fear of the afflictions of the mind.

original: de'i gnyen por sems la dbang ba'o //
analyzed: de'i gnyen por sems la dbang ba'o //
translated: The antidote to that is mastery of mind.

original: 'jig rten ni yo byad kyis 'jigs skrag ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten ni yo byad kyis 'jigs skrag ste /
translated: The world is terrified by fear of material goods.

original: de'i gnyen por yo byad la dbang ba'o //
analyzed: de'i gnyen por yo byad la dbang ba'o //
translated: The antidote to that is mastery of material goods.

original: 'jig rten ni nyes par spyod pas 'jigs skrag ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten ni nyes par spyod pas 'jigs skrag ste /
translated: The world is terrified by fear of bad behavior.

original: de'i gnyen por las la dbang ba'o //
analyzed: de'i gnyen por las la dbang ba'o //
translated: The antidote to that is mastery of action.

original: 'jig rten ni ngan 'gros 'jigs skrag ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten ni ngan 'gros 'jigs skrag ste /
translated: The world is terrified by fear of bad rebirth.

original: de'i gnyen por skye ba la dbang ba'o //
analyzed: de'i gnyen por skye ba la dbang ba'o //
translated: The antidote to that is mastery of birth.

original: 'jig rten ni kun nas tshol ba'i rtsol bas 'jigs skrag ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten ni kun nas tshol ba'i rtsol bas 'jigs skrag ste /
translated: The world is terrified by fear of the effort of searching everywhere.

original: de'i gnyen por rdzu 'phrul la dbang ba'o //
analyzed: de'i gnyen por rdzu 'phrul la dbang ba'o //
translated: The antidote to that is mastery of magic powers.

original: 'jig rten ni dam pa'i chos kyis 'phongs par 'gyur ba'i las kyis 'jigs skrag ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten ni dam pa'i chos kyis 'phongs par 'gyur ba'i las kyis 'jigs skrag ste /
translated: The world is terrified by fear of the karma of being deprived of the holy Dharma.

original: de'i gnyen por mos pa la dbang ba'o //
analyzed: de'i gnyen por mos pa la dbang ba'o //
translated: The antidote to that is mastery of aspiration.

original: 'jig rten ni 'dod pa'i 'ching bas 'jigs skrag ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten ni 'dod pa'i 'ching bas 'jigs skrag ste /
translated: The world is terrified by fear of the bonds of desire.

original: de'i gnyen por smon lam la dbang ba'o //
analyzed: de'i gnyen por smon lam la dbang ba'o //
translated: The antidote to that is mastery of prayer.

original: 'jig rten ni the tsom gyi zug rdus 'jigs skrag ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten ni the tsom gyi zug rdus 'jigs skrag ste /
translated: The world is terrified by fear of the pain of doubt.

original: de'i gnyen por ye shes la dbang ba'o //
analyzed: de'i gnyen por ye shes la dbang ba'o //
translated: The antidote to that is mastery of gnosis.

original: 'jig rten ni 'khor gyi nang na bag tsha bas 'jigs skrag ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten ni 'khor gyi nang na bag tsha bas 'jigs skrag ste /
translated: The world is frightened and terrified by the terrors of cyclic existence.

original: de'i gnyen por chos la dbang ba'o //
analyzed: de'i gnyen por chos la dbang ba'o //
translated: The antidote to that is mastery of phenomena.

original: gzhan yang rigs kyi bu srog gcod pa spangs shing sems can thams cad la khong khro ba'i sems med pa ni tshe la dbang ba thob par bya ba'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang rigs kyi bu srog gcod pa spangs shing sems can thams cad la khong khro ba'i sems med pa ni tshe la dbang ba thob par bya ba'i rgyu'o //
translated: Moreover, son of noble family, abandoning killing and having no angry thoughts toward any sentient being is the cause for attaining mastery over life.

original: bde ba rnams la sgrib pa med pa'i byams pa chen po dang / sdug bsngal ba rnams la sgrib pa med pa'i snying rje chen po ni sems la dbang ba thob pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: bde ba rnams la sgrib pa med pa'i byams pa chen po dang / sdug bsngal ba rnams la sgrib pa med pa'i snying rje chen po ni sems la dbang ba thob pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: Great love, which is unobstructed with regard to happiness, and great compassion, which is unobstructed with regard to suffering, is the cause for attaining mastery over mind.

original: sems snyoms shing dngos po thams cad yongs su gtong ba byang chub tu bsngo ba ni yo byad la dbang ba thob par bya ba'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: sems snyoms shing dngos po thams cad yongs su gtong ba byang chub tu bsngo ba ni yo byad la dbang ba thob par bya ba'i rgyu'o //
translated: Having an impartial mind and giving away all things while dedicating to awakening is the cause for attaining mastery over resources.

original: las dang bya ba la zhugs nas lus dang ngag dang yid yongs su dag pa'i las kyis las kyi bya ba /
analyzed: las dang bya ba la zhugs nas lus dang ngag dang yid yongs su dag pa'i las kyis las kyi bya ba /
translated: Having engaged in actions and activities, the action of pure physical, verbal, and mental activity

original: las bdag gir bya ba la 'jug par ston pa ni las @179a * //
analyzed: las bdag gir bya ba la 'jug par ston pa ni las @179a * //
translated: is the cause for attaining mastery over wisdom.

original: la dbang ba thob par bya ba'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: la dbang ba thob par bya ba'i rgyu'o //
translated: is the cause for obtaining the mastery of the stages.üîΩ

original: byang chub kyi sems kyis yang dag par bsdus pa'i dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam ni skye ba la dbang ba thob par bya ba'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems kyis yang dag par bsdus pa'i dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam ni skye ba la dbang ba thob par bya ba'i rgyu'o //
translated: The cause of attaining mastery over birth is the ten wholesome courses of action, which are included in the thought of awakening.

original: rnyed pa dang bkur sti dang tshigs su bcad pa thams cad sbyin pa dang / bzhon pa sbyin pa ni rdzu 'phrul la dbang ba thob par bya ba'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: rnyed pa dang bkur sti dang tshigs su bcad pa thams cad sbyin pa dang / bzhon pa sbyin pa ni rdzu 'phrul la dbang ba thob par bya ba'i rgyu'o //
translated: The cause of attaining mastery over miracles is giving all one has, giving with respect, giving with one‚Äôs own hand, giving without harming others, giving vehicles, and giving gifts to those who are in need.

original: sems can thams cad dkon mchog gsum la bkod cing 'dzud de mos par byed pa ni mos pa la dbang ba thob par bya ba'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad dkon mchog gsum la bkod cing 'dzud de mos par byed pa ni mos pa la dbang ba thob par bya ba'i rgyu'o //
translated: The cause of attaining mastery over intention is establishing, introducing, and inspiring all beings to have faith in the Three Jewels.

original: sems can thams cad kyi lus dang ngag dang / yid yongs su dag ba sgrub pa ni smon lam la dbang thob par bya ba'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi lus dang ngag dang / yid yongs su dag ba sgrub pa ni smon lam la dbang thob par bya ba'i rgyu'o //
translated: The cause of attaining mastery over prayer is accomplishing the purification of the body, speech, and mind of all beings.

original: zang zing med pa'i sems kyis chos sbyin pa ni ye shes la dbang ba thob par bya ba'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: zang zing med pa'i sems kyis chos sbyin pa ni ye shes la dbang ba thob par bya ba'i rgyu'o //
translated: The cause of attaining mastery over knowledge is giving the gift of the Dharma with a mind free of material desires.

original: sems can thams cad la chos mnyan pa nyid khong du chud par byed pa dang / chos mtshungs par ston pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku ni chos kyi sku ste zang zing gi sku ma yin no zhes yongs su 'byed pa ni chos la dbang ba thob par bya ba'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad la chos mnyan pa nyid khong du chud par byed pa dang / chos mtshungs par ston pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku ni chos kyi sku ste zang zing gi sku ma yin no zhes yongs su 'byed pa ni chos la dbang ba thob par bya ba'i rgyu'o //
translated: It is the cause for attaining mastery of phenomena, since it causes all sentient beings to understand the listening to the Dharma, it teaches the Dharma equally, and it distinguishes the body of the Tathagata, saying, ‚ÄúThe body of the Tathagata is the body of Dharma, not a material body.‚Äù

original: rigs kyi bu 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dbang bcu'o zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dbang bcu'o zhes gsungs te /
translated: Son of the family! These are the ten masteries of the bodhisattvas.

original: de rnams spang bya gang gi gnyen po yin pa dang / rgyu gang las mngon par grub pa ste /
analyzed: de rnams spang bya gang gi gnyen po yin pa dang / rgyu gang las mngon par grub pa ste /
translated: They are the antidotes to the ten obscurations, and they are accomplished from the ten perfections.

original: de yang sngon gyi las dang 'phral gyi 'du bya ba gnyis su shes par bya ste /
analyzed: de yang sngon gyi las dang 'phral gyi 'du bya ba gnyis su shes par bya ste /
translated: Moreover, they should be understood as the two, former karma and present effort.

original: mngon par shes pa'i skabs su ji ltar bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa'i skabs su ji ltar bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: As was taught in the section on the superknowledges.

original: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems can thams cad kyi 'tsho bar gyur pa ni sangs rgyas kyi mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i rjes su mthun par 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems can thams cad kyi 'tsho bar gyur pa ni sangs rgyas kyi mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i rjes su mthun par 'gyur ba ste /
translated: Thus, the bodhisattva becomes the life of all sentient beings, and this accords with the Buddha's non-abiding nirvana.

original: de yang byang chub sems dpa'i sa brgyad pa nas thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de yang byang chub sems dpa'i sa brgyad pa nas thob par 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, this is attained from the eighth bodhisattva stage.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it has been said:

original: sa brgyad pa la mi gnas mya ngan las 'das pa dang zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sa brgyad pa la mi gnas mya ngan las 'das pa dang zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: On the eighth stage, there is non-abiding nirvana.

original: de ltar na rang dang gzhan gyi sde pa rnams kyis 'dod pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i rnam par dbye ba dang / de'i rang bzhin phyin ci ma log pa gang yin snyam du dogs pa bsal ba'i don du de nyid ston pa ni /
analyzed: de ltar na rang dang gzhan gyi sde pa rnams kyis 'dod pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i rnam par dbye ba dang / de'i rang bzhin phyin ci ma log pa gang yin snyam du dogs pa bsal ba'i don du de nyid ston pa ni /
translated: Thus, in order to remove doubts about the classification of nirvana as it is asserted by our own and other schools, and about what its unmistaken nature is, the teaching of that is presented.

original: gzhan yang blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Moreover, Mahamati... and so on.

original: de la dngos po'i rang bzhin med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa ni gang gi tshe na rnal 'byor can rnams kyis zhi ba ro gcig pa'i ting nge 'dzin thob pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: de la dngos po'i rang bzhin med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa ni gang gi tshe na rnal 'byor can rnams kyis zhi ba ro gcig pa'i ting nge 'dzin thob pa de'i tshe /
translated: Regarding nirvana that is the absence of the nature of things, when yogis attain the samƒÅdhi of one taste of peace,

original: bdag @179b dang bdag gi mtshan mar brtags pa'i dngos po'i rang bzhin med pa ste /
analyzed: bdag @179b dang bdag gi mtshan mar brtags pa'i dngos po'i rang bzhin med pa ste /
translated: the nature of things imputed as the signs of ‚ÄúI‚Äù and ‚Äúmine‚Äù does not exist.

original: de ltar brtags pa dang rtog pa'i mtshan ma zhi ba /
analyzed: de ltar brtags pa dang rtog pa'i mtshan ma zhi ba /
translated: Thus the signs of imputation and conception are pacified.

original: bdag rtag pa gcig pu'i rang bzhin mngon du byas pa ste /
analyzed: bdag rtag pa gcig pu'i rang bzhin mngon du byas pa ste /
translated: The nature of a permanent, unitary self is manifested.

original: de 'dra ba'i dngos po ni khas len pa'o zhes slob dpon ye shes dpal gyis gsungs so //üîΩmtshan nyid sna tshogs kyi dngos po med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa ni tshangs pa smra ba rnams kyis don dam pa'i tshangs pa smra ba rnam rig gnyis su med pa rtag pa gcig pu'i rang bzhin mngon du byas pa na de las gzhan mtshan nyid sna
analyzed: de 'dra ba'i dngos po ni khas len pa'o zhes slob dpon ye shes dpal gyis gsungs so // mtshan nyid sna tshogs kyi dngos po med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa ni tshangs pa smra ba rnams kyis don dam pa'i tshangs pa smra ba rnam rig gnyis su med pa rtag pa gcig pu'i rang bzhin mngon du byas pa na de las gzhan mtshan nyid sna
translated: Master J√±ƒÅna≈õrƒ´ says that such a thing is accepted.

original: tshogs kyi dngos po med pa ste /
analyzed: tshogs kyi dngos po med pa ste /
translated: Regarding nirvana that is the absence of things with various natures, when the brahmins who speak of the ultimate, the nondual cognition that speaks of BrahmƒÅ, manifest the nature of a permanent, unitary self, things with various natures do not exist apart from that.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it has been said:

original: bu zhig tshangs pa mchog tu bden //
analyzed: bu zhig tshangs pa mchog tu bden //
translated: ‚ÄúA son, Brahma, is supremely true,

original: rig pa'i dbang phyug mun mtha' yas //
analyzed: rig pa'i dbang phyug mun mtha' yas //
translated: the lord of knowledge, infinite,

original: 'ga' zhig yod pa nyid smra ba //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig yod pa nyid smra ba //
translated: and some say he is existent.

original: de yang zhags par rab tu brjod //
analyzed: de yang zhags par rab tu brjod //
translated: He too is called a noose.üîΩ‚Äù

original: ces bstan pa dang / gzhan yang /
analyzed: ces bstan pa dang / gzhan yang /
translated: And also:üîΩ‚ÄúMere consciousness is always pure.‚Äù

original: rnam rig tsam ni rtag tu rnam par dag / ces pa la sogs pa sngar bstan pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: rnam rig tsam ni rtag tu rnam par dag / ces pa la sogs pa sngar bstan pa lta bu'o //
translated: As was taught above.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid kyi dngos po med par rtogs pa ni grangs can pa rnams kyis ji ltar skyes bu shes pa rig pas yon tan gsum cha mnyam pa gtso bo'i rang bzhin yul du byas pa na /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid kyi dngos po med par rtogs pa ni grangs can pa rnams kyis ji ltar skyes bu shes pa rig pas yon tan gsum cha mnyam pa gtso bo'i rang bzhin yul du byas pa na /
translated: The non-existence of things with intrinsic identity is understood by the SƒÅ·πÉkhyas when they take as their object the nature of the principal, the equilibrium of the three universals, by means of the knowledge of the person.

original: mi mnyam pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid kyi dngos po sna tshogs med par rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: mi mnyam pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid kyi dngos po sna tshogs med par rtogs pa'o //
translated: They understand the non-existence of the various things with intrinsic identity that are not in equilibrium.

original: yang rang gi sde pa rnams kyi dbang du byas na /
analyzed: yang rang gi sde pa rnams kyi dbang du byas na /
translated: Now, from the point of view of our own schools,

original: dngos po'i rang bzhin med pa ni nyan thos sde pa rnams kyis 'du byed kyi 'jug pa thams cad rgyun chad nas med pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
analyzed: dngos po'i rang bzhin med pa ni nyan thos sde pa rnams kyis 'du byed kyi 'jug pa thams cad rgyun chad nas med pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
translated: The nonexistence of the nature of things is the nirvana of the sriivaka schools, which is the cessation of the continuum of all the operations of compounded phenomena.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it has been said:

original: ma zhum pa yi sems kyis ni //
analyzed: ma zhum pa yi sems kyis ni //
translated: With a mind that is not faint

original: tshor ba dang du blang mi bya //
analyzed: tshor ba dang du blang mi bya //
translated: one does not accept feeling.

original: mar me shi bar gyur pa bzhin //
analyzed: mar me shi bar gyur pa bzhin //
translated: Just as a lamp is extinguished

original: de yi sems ni rnam par zhi //üîΩzhes bstan pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: de yi sems ni rnam par zhi // zhes bstan pa lta bu'o //
translated: his mind is totally pacified.

original: gzhan yang sangs rgyas kyi ye shes rgyun chad par 'dod pa rnams kyang 'di nyid dang rjes su mthun pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang sangs rgyas kyi ye shes rgyun chad par 'dod pa rnams kyang 'di nyid dang rjes su mthun pa'o //
translated: Moreover, those who assert that the wisdom of the Buddha is discontinuous are also in agreement with this.üîΩThe meaning of the second line is this.

original: gnyis pa'i don ni sems tsam rnam pa brdzun par smra ba gang dag / da ltar so so skye bo'i dus na gzung 'dzin gyi rnam pa sna tshogs su snang ba ni brdzun pa nyid de /
analyzed: gnyis pa'i don ni sems tsam rnam pa brdzun par smra ba gang dag / da ltar so so skye bo'i dus na gzung 'dzin gyi rnam pa sna tshogs su snang ba ni brdzun pa nyid de /
translated: Those who say that consciousness only is true and that images are false say that the various appearances of subject and object that occur at the time of ordinary beings are false.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it has been said:

original: rig bya rig byed rnam pa med //
analyzed: rig bya rig byed rnam pa med //
translated: The object of knowledge and the knower are devoid of aspect,

original: skra sogs shes pa'i tha dad bzhin //
analyzed: skra sogs shes pa'i tha dad bzhin //
translated: like the consciousness of hair-nets and so on.

original: gang tshe gzung 'dzin rnam phye ba'i //
analyzed: gang tshe gzung 'dzin rnam phye ba'i //
translated: When there is no distinction of object and subject

original: mtshan nyid rnam par bslad pa can //üîΩzhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid rnam par bslad pa can // zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: The characteristics are distorted.

original: de'i phyir de ltar snang ba ni thog ma med pa'i 'khrul pa'i bag chags @180a * //üîΩkyi dbang gis te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar snang ba ni thog ma med pa'i 'khrul pa'i bag chags @180a * // kyi dbang gis te /
translated: Thus, it appears in that way due to the power of beginningless predispositions for error.

original: des na bag chags thams cad spangs pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas la ni mtshan nyid sna tshogs su snang ba'i rnam pas dben pa gnyis su med pa'i rang rig pa 'ba' zhig ste /
analyzed: des na bag chags thams cad spangs pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas la ni mtshan nyid sna tshogs su snang ba'i rnam pas dben pa gnyis su med pa'i rang rig pa 'ba' zhig ste /
translated: Therefore, for a perfect buddha who has abandoned all predispositions, there is only reflexive awareness, which is nondual and devoid of the appearance of various characteristics.

original: de 'dra ba ni sangs rgyas kyi mya ngan las 'das pa zhes khas len pa'o //
analyzed: de 'dra ba ni sangs rgyas kyi mya ngan las 'das pa zhes khas len pa'o //
translated: We accept that to be the nirvana of a buddha.

original: de yang sems tsam gyi gnas skabs ni shes pa gnyis med kyi ngo bo yul gyi rnam pas kha ma bsgyur ba don dam pa'i dngos por 'dod de /
analyzed: de yang sems tsam gyi gnas skabs ni shes pa gnyis med kyi ngo bo yul gyi rnam pas kha ma bsgyur ba don dam pa'i dngos por 'dod de /
translated: Moreover, the CittamƒÅtra assert that the state of mind only, the nature of nondual consciousness, is not affected by the aspect of an object and is an ultimate entity.

original: de yang skad cig gi bdag nyid pas na phyi rol pa rnams dang mi mtshungs pa'o //
analyzed: de yang skad cig gi bdag nyid pas na phyi rol pa rnams dang mi mtshungs pa'o //
translated: Since that is also momentary, it is not the same as the non-Buddhist philosophers.

original: 'di ni mi 'thad de /üîΩshel sgong dag pa 'dra ba yi //
analyzed: 'di ni mi 'thad de / shel sgong dag pa 'dra ba yi //
translated: This is untenable.üîΩThe consciousness that is like a pure crystal sphere

original: shes pa rab tu tshor ba med //
analyzed: shes pa rab tu tshor ba med //
translated: is not at all felt.

original: ces gsungs pa de 'dra ba la sgrub byed med pa dang / skad cig gi dngos po ni rgyu med pa mi 'thad la /
analyzed: ces gsungs pa de 'dra ba la sgrub byed med pa dang / skad cig gi dngos po ni rgyu med pa mi 'thad la /
translated: There is no proof for such a position, and it is not tenable that a momentary thing is without a cause.

original: rgyu las skye ba'i phyogs kyang sngar bkag zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu las skye ba'i phyogs kyang sngar bkag zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And the position that it arises from a cause has already been refuted.üîΩThe realization that there is no real entity with intrinsic identity is the direct realization by the proponents of consciousness-only that form, etc., do not have a real entity with intrinsic identity as an external reality.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid kyi dngos po med par rtogs pa ni rnam par rig pa tsam du smra ba rnams kyis gzugs la sogs pa phyi rol gyi ngo bor gyur pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid kyi dngos po med par mngon sum du rtogs pa'i ye shes don dam
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid kyi dngos po med par rtogs pa ni rnam par rig pa tsam du smra ba rnams kyis gzugs la sogs pa phyi rol gyi ngo bor gyur pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid kyi dngos po med par mngon sum du rtogs pa'i ye shes don dam
translated: The ultimate is the direct realization that there is no real entity with intrinsic identity as an external reality.

original: pa dngos por gyur pa spangs pa dang / rtog pa rab kyi mthar thug pas phye ba ni sangs rgyas kyi mya ngan las 'das pa nyid du 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: pa dngos por gyur pa spangs pa dang / rtog pa rab kyi mthar thug pas phye ba ni sangs rgyas kyi mya ngan las 'das pa nyid du 'dod pa'o //
translated: The rejection of the ultimate as a real entity and the division into the highest and ultimate thought are asserted to be the Buddha‚Äôs nirvana itself.

original: phung po rnams kyi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi rgyud kyi rgyun chad pa ni nyan thos snga ba rnams kyis zag pa dang bcas pa'i phung po'i rgyu rgyun chad pa zag pa med pa'i dbyings na ting nge 'dzin gyi lus tsam du gnas pa ni mya nganüîΩlas 'das pa'o zhes khas len pa'o //
analyzed: phung po rnams kyi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi rgyud kyi rgyun chad pa ni nyan thos snga ba rnams kyis zag pa dang bcas pa'i phung po'i rgyu rgyun chad pa zag pa med pa'i dbyings na ting nge 'dzin gyi lus tsam du gnas pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa'o zhes khas len pa'o //
translated: The cessation of the continuum of the aggregates, their general and specific characteristics, is the nirvana of the early Sravakas. They accept that the cessation of the continuum of the cause of the aggregates with outflows is the realm without outflows, where one abides in the body of samadhi alone.

original: de dag ni blo gros chen po mu stegs byed rnams kyis 'dod pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa yin te /
analyzed: de dag ni blo gros chen po mu stegs byed rnams kyis 'dod pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa yin te /
translated: The great beings, the Bodhisattvas, accept that the cessation of the continuum of the aggregates is nirvana.üîΩThey say, These are the nirvanas accepted by the tirthikas, but not by me in my scriptures.

original: nga'i gsung rab la ni ma yin no zhes pa la 'dir mu stegs byed ni grub pa'i mtha' phyin ci log pa thams cad do zhes 'og nas ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nga'i gsung rab la ni ma yin no zhes pa la 'dir mu stegs byed ni grub pa'i mtha' phyin ci log pa thams cad do zhes 'og nas ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: Here, the tirthikas are all those who have perverted tenets. This will be shown later.

original: de rnams mya ngan las 'das pa ma yin pa'i rgyu mtshan yang /
analyzed: de rnams mya ngan las 'das pa ma yin pa'i rgyu mtshan yang /
translated: The reason that these are not nirvanas is

original: dngos por mngon zhen yod na ni //
analyzed: dngos por mngon zhen yod na ni //
translated: because if one has manifest clinging to entities,

original: 'dod chags zhe sdang mi bzad 'byung //
analyzed: 'dod chags zhe sdang mi bzad 'byung //
translated: then attachment and hatred will arise.

original: zhes pa la sogs pa sngar rgyas par bstan no //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa sngar rgyas par bstan no //
translated: This has been extensively taught above.

original: ji ltar yid kyi rnam par shes pa ldog par 'gyur la zhes pa'i don ni ji ltar byis pa'i skye bo'i rnam par shes pa'i tshogs brgyad log cing gnas @180b par gyur pa mya ngan las 'das pa'o zhes mi gsung bar /
analyzed: ji ltar yid kyi rnam par shes pa ldog par 'gyur la zhes pa'i don ni ji ltar byis pa'i skye bo'i rnam par shes pa'i tshogs brgyad log cing gnas @180b par gyur pa mya ngan las 'das pa'o zhes mi gsung bar /
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúhow does mental consciousness stop?‚Äù is that it is not said that nirvana is the cessation and pacification of the eightfold group of consciousnesses of ordinary beings.

original: rtog pa dang bcas pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa 'ba' zhig log par mya ngan las 'das pa'o zhes dmigs kyis bsal ba dang bcas te gsungs pa dang mi 'thad ces rgol ba'o //
analyzed: rtog pa dang bcas pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa 'ba' zhig log par mya ngan las 'das pa'o zhes dmigs kyis bsal ba dang bcas te gsungs pa dang mi 'thad ces rgol ba'o //
translated: It is not tenable to say that nirvana is the cessation of the conceptual mental consciousness alone, which is a specific case.

original: lam gyi don ni 'dir nyon mongs pa can gyi yid dang lhan cig pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa kun gzhi las byung zhing kun gzhi la dmigs pa /
analyzed: lam gyi don ni 'dir nyon mongs pa can gyi yid dang lhan cig pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa kun gzhi las byung zhing kun gzhi la dmigs pa /
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúpath‚Äù here is that mental consciousness that is concomitant with afflicted mental consciousness arises from the foundation consciousness and focuses on the foundation consciousness.

original: sgo lnga'i rnam par shes pa dang / de dag gi yul la bye brag 'byed cing /
analyzed: sgo lnga'i rnam par shes pa dang / de dag gi yul la bye brag 'byed cing /
translated: It distinguishes the objects of the five sense consciousnesses and their objects.

original: dngos po'i rang bzhin du rnam par rtog pa ni kun gzhi la rnam par shes pa thams cad kyi bag chags 'jog cing rgyas par byed pas de la brten nas 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa thams cad 'byung zhing /
analyzed: dngos po'i rang bzhin du rnam par rtog pa ni kun gzhi la rnam par shes pa thams cad kyi bag chags 'jog cing rgyas par byed pas de la brten nas 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa thams cad 'byung zhing /
translated: The refutation of the nature of things is the refutation of the alaya because it is the alaya that stores and increases the habitual tendencies of all consciousnesses.üîΩSince all the active consciousnesses arise in dependence on it, when it is refuted, all seven consciousnesses are refuted.

original: de nyid bzlog pa rnam par shes pa bdun po thams cad kyang ldog par 'gyur bas de nyid log pa mya ngan las 'das pa yin no zhes dmigs kyis bstan pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid bzlog pa rnam par shes pa bdun po thams cad kyang ldog par 'gyur bas de nyid log pa mya ngan las 'das pa yin no zhes dmigs kyis bstan pa ste /
translated: The refutation of that is nirvana.

original: phyin ci log gi rnam par shes pa de 'dra ba log cing yang dag pa'i shes rab kyis rnam par shes pa de rnams kyi rang bzhin stong pa nyid du rtogs na bag chags la sogs par mi byed pas phyin ci log gi rnam par shes pa thamsüîΩcad ldog pa'o //
analyzed: phyin ci log gi rnam par shes pa de 'dra ba log cing yang dag pa'i shes rab kyis rnam par shes pa de rnams kyi rang bzhin stong pa nyid du rtogs na bag chags la sogs par mi byed pas phyin ci log gi rnam par shes pa thamsüîΩcad ldog pa'o //
translated: When the consciousnesses are realized to be empty of nature by the perfect wisdom that refutes such a distorted consciousness, the habitual tendencies and so on are not created, and all distorted consciousnesses are therefore reversed.

original: 'dir tshig gi don bshad pa la de'i rgyu dang dmigs pa'i phyir zhes pa ni 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa de'i rgyu dang dmigs pa ni kun gzhi yin pa'i phyir de'i phyir de la brten nas bdun po rnams 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: 'dir tshig gi don bshad pa la de'i rgyu dang dmigs pa'i phyir zhes pa ni 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa de'i rgyu dang dmigs pa ni kun gzhi yin pa'i phyir de'i phyir de la brten nas bdun po rnams 'byung ba'o //
translated: Here, in the explanation of the meaning of the words, ‚Äúbecause it is the cause and object of that‚Äù means that the cause and object of that engaging consciousness is the fundamental consciousness, and therefore, on the basis of that, the seven are produced.

original: tshul ji ltar 'byung zhe na /
analyzed: tshul ji ltar 'byung zhe na /
translated: In what way do they occur?

original: blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúMahƒÅmati, etc.‚Äù

original: sngar bstan pa ltar yid kyi rnam par shes pas de rnams dngos po'i rang bzhin du brtags pas kun gzhi la bag chags rgyas par byas pa'i tshul gyis 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: sngar bstan pa ltar yid kyi rnam par shes pas de rnams dngos po'i rang bzhin du brtags pas kun gzhi la bag chags rgyas par byas pa'i tshul gyis 'byung ba'o //
translated: As previously explained, the mental consciousness, by imagining them as the nature of things, causes the fundamental consciousness to be pervaded by the propensities, and in that way they occur.

original: de nyid gsal bar bstan pa ni yid dang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid gsal bar bstan pa ni yid dang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: That itself is clearly taught in ‚Äúthe mind, etc.‚Äù

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi yid dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa lhan cig tu kun gzhi la bdag dang bdag gir mngon par chags pas ngar sems pa ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi yid dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa lhan cig tu kun gzhi la bdag dang bdag gir mngon par chags pas ngar sems pa ste /
translated: The afflicted mind and the mental consciousness, together, by attachment to ‚ÄúI‚Äù and ‚Äúmine‚Äù in the fundamental consciousness, think ‚ÄúI.‚Äù

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi yid dang mthun par rjes su 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi yid dang mthun par rjes su 'jug pa'o //
translated: They are in accord with the afflicted mind and follow it.

original: de ltar 'jug pa'i dbang gis kun gzhi la bag chags rgyas par byas pas kun gzhi rnam par shes pa de nyid rnam par shes pa thams cad kyi rgyu dang dmigs par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar 'jug pa'i dbang gis kun gzhi la bag chags rgyas par byas pas kun gzhi rnam par shes pa de nyid rnam par shes pa thams cad kyi rgyu dang dmigs par gyur pa'o //
translated: Thus, by the power of engagement, the latent impressions are increased in the foundation consciousness, and that foundation consciousness becomes the cause and object of all consciousnesses.

original: @181a * // lus tha dad pa ma yin zhes pa ni sngar bstan pa ltar rgya mtsho dang rlabs bzhin du gnas pa'o //üîΩgcig gi rgyur gcig gyur pa ni bag chags dang bcas pa'i kun gzhi yang 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pas skyed la /
analyzed: @181a * // lus tha dad pa ma yin zhes pa ni sngar bstan pa ltar rgya mtsho dang rlabs bzhin du gnas pa'o // gcig gi rgyur gcig gyur pa ni bag chags dang bcas pa'i kun gzhi yang 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pas skyed la /
translated: ‚ÄúThe body is not different‚Äù means that, as previously explained, it is like the ocean and waves.üîΩ‚ÄúThey become the cause of each other‚Äù means that the foundation consciousness with its latent impressions is produced by the active consciousnesses,

original: de las kyang 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa 'byung ba dang / 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams kyang phan tshun gcig gi rgyur gcig 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: de las kyang 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa 'byung ba dang / 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams kyang phan tshun gcig gi rgyur gcig 'gyur ba ste /
translated: and active consciousnesses arise from it, and the active consciousnesses are mutually the cause of each other.

original: don zhib tu ni sngar bstan no //
analyzed: don zhib tu ni sngar bstan no //
translated: The meaning of this has been explained in detail above.üîΩI do not attain nirvana as an entity,

original: bya ba dang ni mtshan nyid dang // dngos por mya ngan nga mi 'da' //
analyzed: bya ba dang ni mtshan nyid dang // dngos por mya ngan nga mi 'da' //
translated: as an action, or as an attribute.

original: zhes pa'i don ni ji ltar sprul pa'i sku mya ngan las 'da' ba yang sems can gyi don byed pa'i bya ba phrin las nyid yin la gzhan yang tshe'i dus byed pa lta bur ston pa'i mtshan nyid dang / de la sogs pa pur zhugs la bzhen pa dang /
analyzed: zhes pa'i don ni ji ltar sprul pa'i sku mya ngan las 'da' ba yang sems can gyi don byed pa'i bya ba phrin las nyid yin la gzhan yang tshe'i dus byed pa lta bur ston pa'i mtshan nyid dang / de la sogs pa pur zhugs la bzhen pa dang /
translated: The meaning of this passage is as follows: The activity of the emanation body, even when it passes into nirvana, is the activity of benefiting sentient beings. Moreover, the characteristics of the emanation body are that it displays the end of life and so on, and it displays the cremation of the body and so forth.

original: sku gdung la sogs pa'i dngos por ston pa ni gdul bya'i snang ba nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: sku gdung la sogs pa'i dngos por ston pa ni gdul bya'i snang ba nyid yin gyi /
translated: These are the appearances of those to be trained,

original: sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin la de 'dra ba med ces pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin la de 'dra ba med ces pa'o //
translated: but the nature of the Buddha does not have such characteristics.

original: de rgyu de la dmigs zhes pa la sogs pas ni kun gzhi de nyid rnam par shes pa thams cad kyi rgyu dang dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: de rgyu de la dmigs zhes pa la sogs pas ni kun gzhi de nyid rnam par shes pa thams cad kyi rgyu dang dmigs pa ste /
translated: The line ‚ÄúThe cause and the object of all consciousness‚Äù means that the foundation consciousness is the cause and the object of all consciousness.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de la brten nas nyon mongs pa can dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i rgyud kyang rgyun chags su gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de la brten nas nyon mongs pa can dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i rgyud kyang rgyun chags su gnas pa'o //
translated: For that reason, the continuum of afflicted consciousness and mental consciousness also endures in dependence on it.

original: sems kyi rgyu rnams de 'byin zhes pa ni sa bon dang bcas pa'i kun gzhis 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams 'byin pa ste /
analyzed: sems kyi rgyu rnams de 'byin zhes pa ni sa bon dang bcas pa'i kun gzhis 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams 'byin pa ste /
translated: The line ‚Äúthe causes of mind are eliminated‚Äù means that the consciousnesses that engage due to the all-base along with its seeds are eliminated.

original: des na rnam par shes pa'i rgyun kyang rab tu gnas shing 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: des na rnam par shes pa'i rgyun kyang rab tu gnas shing 'byung ba'o //
translated: Therefore, the continuum of consciousness is also completely arrested and ceases.

original: rnam pa sna tshogs kyang 'gags pa zhes pa ni sa bon sna tshogs so //
analyzed: rnam pa sna tshogs kyang 'gags pa zhes pa ni sa bon sna tshogs so //
translated: The line ‚Äúthe cessation of the various aspects‚Äù means the various seeds.

original: de ltar na rtog pa dang bcas pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pas kun brtags pa'i rang bzhin rab tu dbye ba'i tshul ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar na rtog pa dang bcas pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pas kun brtags pa'i rang bzhin rab tu dbye ba'i tshul ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: In that case, how does the conceptual mind consciousness conceive the imagined nature?

original: gzhan yang blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The passage beginning with ‚ÄúMoreover, MahƒÅmati‚Ä¶‚Äù

original: kun brtags pa'i rang bzhin sngar bstan pa de nyid rab tu dbye ba'i sgo nas rgyas par ston to //
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i rang bzhin sngar bstan pa de nyid rab tu dbye ba'i sgo nas rgyas par ston to //
translated: teaches in detail the imagined nature that was previously taught by way of its divisions.

original: de ltar bstan pas kyang kun brtags pa'i rang bzhin ji lta ba bzhin rtogs pas de ltar rtog pa'i blo nyid ldog par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar bstan pas kyang kun brtags pa'i rang bzhin ji lta ba bzhin rtogs pas de ltar rtog pa'i blo nyid ldog par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: By teaching in that way, since the imagined nature is realized as it is, the mind that conceives it in that way is reversed.

original: gang la gnas te brjod par 'jug par 'gyur zhes pa ni shes bya gang la dmigs te brjod pa 'jug par 'gyur ba'i brjod bya yod do zhes pa'o //
analyzed: gang la gnas te brjod par 'jug par 'gyur zhes pa ni shes bya gang la dmigs te brjod pa 'jug par 'gyur ba'i brjod bya yod do zhes pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúWhat is the basis for the expression?‚Äù means that there is an object of expression that is the basis for the expression.

original: rgyu'i @181b mtshan nyid la skye ba yod pa dang med pa snang bar byed pa ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa nyid du dmigs pa'o //üîΩyang na sngar nas yod pa'i dngos po rgyu dang rkyen gyis gsal bar byed pa'am /
analyzed: rgyu'i @181b mtshan nyid la skye ba yod pa dang med pa snang bar byed pa ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa nyid du dmigs pa'o // yang na sngar nas yod pa'i dngos po rgyu dang rkyen gyis gsal bar byed pa'am /
translated: The characteristic of the cause is the appearance of the existence and nonexistence of arising, which is the observation of the presence and absence of the cause.üîΩOr, it is the manifestation of an existent entity by a cause and condition,

original: sngar med pa nyid rgyu dang rkyen gyis snang bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: sngar med pa nyid rgyu dang rkyen gyis snang bar byed pa ste /
translated: or the appearance of a nonexistent entity by a cause and condition,

original: grangs can dang bye brag pa la sogs bas 'dod pa bzhin no //
analyzed: grangs can dang bye brag pa la sogs bas 'dod pa bzhin no //
translated: as asserted by the SƒÅ·πÉkhya, Vai≈õe·π£ika, and so on.

original: rig pa la rnam par rtog pa ni ji ltar bdag rtag pa'i ngo bo 'ga' zhig med na /
analyzed: rig pa la rnam par rtog pa ni ji ltar bdag rtag pa'i ngo bo 'ga' zhig med na /
translated: ‚ÄúConceptualization in terms of awareness‚Äù means that if there is no permanent self,

original: las dang 'bras bu'i 'brel pa mi 'thad par 'gyur ba las de nyid yod pa'i phyir gang zag gi bdag yod cing /
analyzed: las dang 'bras bu'i 'brel pa mi 'thad par 'gyur ba las de nyid yod pa'i phyir gang zag gi bdag yod cing /
translated: the connection between action and effect would be untenable. Because that is so, the self of persons exists.

original: de la ltos nas bzhag pa bdag gi ba'i mtshan nyid kyang yod de /
analyzed: de la ltos nas bzhag pa bdag gi ba'i mtshan nyid kyang yod de /
translated: The characteristic of what belongs to a self is posited in dependence on that.

original: de ltar 'jog pa ni rigs pa dam pa yin no zhes rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar 'jog pa ni rigs pa dam pa yin no zhes rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: Such a positing is the highest reasoning.

original: skye ba la rtog pa ni 'bras bu'i phyogs nas so //
analyzed: skye ba la rtog pa ni 'bras bu'i phyogs nas so //
translated: Imagining origination is from the side of the effect.

original: mi skye ba la rnam par rtog pa ni rgyang 'phen pa rnams kyis sems can gyi rgyud kyis bsdus pa'i dngos po thams cad sngon gyi las dang nyon mongs pa'i rgyus skyed ba ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: mi skye ba la rnam par rtog pa ni rgyang 'phen pa rnams kyis sems can gyi rgyud kyis bsdus pa'i dngos po thams cad sngon gyi las dang nyon mongs pa'i rgyus skyed ba ni ma yin gyi /
translated: Imagining nonorigination is that all things included in the continuum of sentient beings are not produced by the cause of previous karma and afflictions.

original: 'on kyang sngar med pa las sa la sogs pa'i 'byung ba 'dus pa'i rkyen gyis spang las sha mo rdol ba'i tshul du glo bur du byung ba'o zhes rtog pa'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang sngar med pa las sa la sogs pa'i 'byung ba 'dus pa'i rkyen gyis spang las sha mo rdol ba'i tshul du glo bur du byung ba'o zhes rtog pa'o //
translated: Rather, they suddenly occur like mushrooms, by the condition of the aggregation of the elements, earth and so on, from what did not exist previously.

original: de ltar na rgyu la rnam par rtog pa dang / skye ba la rnam par rtog pa dang / mi skye ba la rnam par rtog pa gsum ni ldog pa mi 'dra ba'i sgo nas so sor bstan kyang rgyu 'bras la rnam par rtog pa gcig nyid du 'dus pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar na rgyu la rnam par rtog pa dang / skye ba la rnam par rtog pa dang / mi skye ba la rnam par rtog pa gsum ni ldog pa mi 'dra ba'i sgo nas so sor bstan kyang rgyu 'bras la rnam par rtog pa gcig nyid du 'dus pa'o //
translated: Thus, the three‚Äîthe conceptualization of cause, the conceptualization of origination, and the conceptualization of non-origination‚Äîare taught individually from the point of view of different negations, but they are included in the single conceptualization of cause and effect.

original: 'brel pa ni bdag nyid gcig pa dang de las byung ba'am /
analyzed: 'brel pa ni bdag nyid gcig pa dang de las byung ba'am /
translated: Connection is either identity or origination.

original: yang phyi rol pa rnams kyis brtags pa'i sbyor ba dang / 'du ba'i 'brel ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: yang phyi rol pa rnams kyis brtags pa'i sbyor ba dang / 'du ba'i 'brel ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Or, it is the connection of application and connection of aggregation imagined by non-Buddhists.

original: bcings pa dang ma bcings pa la rnam par rtog pa ni 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa'am /
analyzed: bcings pa dang ma bcings pa la rnam par rtog pa ni 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa'am /
translated: The conceptualization of bondage and non-bondage is either sa·πÉsƒÅra and nirvƒÅ·πáa,

original: de las gzhan 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du bya ba'i bcings pa dang ma bcings pa'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du bya ba'i bcings pa dang ma bcings pa'o //
translated: or bondage and non-bondage that are worldly conventions other than those.

original: blo gros chen po de dag ni zhes pa rnam par rtog pa de rnams kyis brtags pa'o //
analyzed: blo gros chen po de dag ni zhes pa rnam par rtog pa de rnams kyis brtags pa'o //
translated: MahƒÅmati, those are the conceptualizations.

original: 'dir kun brtags pa'i rang bzhin gyi rnam par dbye ba 'di rnams las mang ba 'am nyung ba nyid du mi ston par 'di rnams 'ba' zhig tsam bstan pa ni gdul bya nye ba'i bsam pa la dgongs pa ste /
analyzed: 'dir kun brtags pa'i rang bzhin gyi rnam par dbye ba 'di rnams las mang ba 'am nyung ba nyid du mi ston par 'di rnams 'ba' zhig tsam bstan pa ni gdul bya nye ba'i bsam pa la dgongs pa ste /
translated: Here, the reason for teaching just these divisions of the imagined nature, neither more nor less, is the thought of the disciples' immediate understanding.

original: 'di dag tsam bstan pas gdul ba nyid du gzigs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di dag tsam bstan pas gdul ba nyid du gzigs pa'o //
translated: It is seen that they are to be trained by just this teaching.

original: de las gzhan pa'i grangs nges pa'i rgyu mtshan ni ma @182a * //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i grangs nges pa'i rgyu mtshan ni ma @182a * //
