translated: I do not see any other reason for the definiteness of number.

original: mthong ngo // gal te kun brtags pa'i rang bzhin ni rnam pa thams cad du med pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: mthong ngo // gal te kun brtags pa'i rang bzhin ni rnam pa thams cad du med pa ma yin nam /
translated: If the imagined nature is completely nonexistent,

original: de'i phyir byis pa'i skye po mngon par chags pa'i yul du mi 'thad do zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir byis pa'i skye po mngon par chags pa'i yul du mi 'thad do zhe na /
translated: then it is not tenable as the object of attachment of foolish beings.

original: blo gros chen po gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid la zhes pa la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: blo gros chen po gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid la zhes pa la sogs pa smos te /
translated: MahƒÅmati, the imagined nature is the object of the mind that is the dependent nature, and so on.

original: sngar bshad pa ltar rnam grangs kyi kun du brtags pa blo'i snang ba de nyid blo'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i gzhan gyi dbang yang de yin te /
analyzed: sngar bshad pa ltar rnam grangs kyi kun du brtags pa blo'i snang ba de nyid blo'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i gzhan gyi dbang yang de yin te /
translated: As explained above, the imagined nature that is categorized is the appearance to the mind. That itself is the dependent nature that is the nature of the mind.

original: de nyid la mngon par chags shing rtog pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid la mngon par chags shing rtog pa'o //
translated: One becomes attached to that and conceptualizes it.

original: de yang ji ltar sgyu mas sprul pa'i gnas sna tshogs su snang ba la phyi rol gyi rta dang glang po la sogs par mthong ba bzhin du byis pa rnams kyis sems nyid rig pa'i sgyu ma la gzung 'dzin gyi rnam pa sna tshogs su mthong zhing zhen
analyzed: de yang ji ltar sgyu mas sprul pa'i gnas sna tshogs su snang ba la phyi rol gyi rta dang glang po la sogs par mthong ba bzhin du byis pa rnams kyis sems nyid rig pa'i sgyu ma la gzung 'dzin gyi rnam pa sna tshogs su mthong zhing zhen
translated: Just as various things emanated by a magical illusion appear as places, and childish beings see them as external horses, elephants, and so on, in the same way, the mind itself, the illusion of awareness, is seen by the childish as various aspects of percepts and perceivers.

original: pa'i blos rnam par rtog ste /
analyzed: pa'i blos rnam par rtog ste /
translated: The conceptual mind fixates on them.

original: blo gros chen po de la rnam pa sna tshogs su snang ba dang / sems nyid rig pa'i sgyu ma ni gcig pa ma yin te /
analyzed: blo gros chen po de la rnam pa sna tshogs su snang ba dang / sems nyid rig pa'i sgyu ma ni gcig pa ma yin te /
translated: MahƒÅmati, the various appearances and the illusion of the mind itself are not the same.

original: sngar rnam ba bden pa'i phyogs dgag pa rgyas bar bstan no //
analyzed: sngar rnam ba bden pa'i phyogs dgag pa rgyas bar bstan no //
translated: Previously, the position of the Proponents of True Features was extensively refuted.

original: yang rnam pa sna tshogs sems las tha dad pa'i phyi rol gyi ngo bo gyur pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: yang rnam pa sna tshogs sems las tha dad pa'i phyi rol gyi ngo bo gyur pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Also, the various appearances are not a different external nature from the mind.

original: rnam pa sna tshogs su snang ba sems kyi rgyu las byung ba ma yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnam pa sna tshogs su snang ba sems kyi rgyu las byung ba ma yin par 'gyur te /
translated: The various appearances would not arise from the causes of the mind.

original: khyab pa'i don ni sngar bstan te //
analyzed: khyab pa'i don ni sngar bstan te //
translated: The meaning of the pervasion has been presented above.

original: de ste sna tshogs dang sgyu ma tha mi dad pa de gcig nyid yin na ni /
analyzed: de ste sna tshogs dang sgyu ma tha mi dad pa de gcig nyid yin na ni /
translated: If the variety and illusion were not different,

original: de dag bye brag med bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dag bye brag med bar 'gyur te /
translated: then they would be without distinction.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: gang phyir sna tshogs ngo bo ru //
analyzed: gang phyir sna tshogs ngo bo ru //
translated: Because of the variety,üîΩthe things that appear as one

original: snang ba can gyi dngos por gcig / rnam pa rnams bden ji ltar 'gyur //
analyzed: snang ba can gyi dngos por gcig / rnam pa rnams bden ji ltar 'gyur //
translated: how could the aspects be true?

original: gcig pa nyid de nyams phyir ro //üîΩzhes pa la sogs pa gsungs pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde'i don yang pha rol po sna tshogs gnyis su med par smra ba rnams kyis rnam pa sna tshogs su snang ba ni shes pa gcig gi bdag nyid du bden par 'dod pa la de lta na shes pa gcig po nyid du mar 'gyur te du ma dang
analyzed: gcig pa nyid de nyams phyir ro // zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs pa'i phyir ro // de'i don yang pha rol po sna tshogs gnyis su med par smra ba rnams kyis rnam pa sna tshogs su snang ba ni shes pa gcig gi bdag nyid du bden par 'dod pa la de lta na shes pa gcig po nyid du mar 'gyur te du ma dang
translated: Because of the loss of oneness.

original: tha mi dad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: tha mi dad pa'i phyir /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows: The opponents who advocate the nonduality of the variety say that the appearance of the variety is truly existent as the nature of a single consciousness. In that case, the single consciousness would become multiple, because it is not different from the multiple.

original: dper na skar ma'i dkar po bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na skar ma'i dkar po bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the whiteness of the stars.

original: de bzhin du rnam pa rnams kyang gcig nyid du 'gyur te gcig dang tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam pa rnams kyang gcig nyid du 'gyur te gcig dang tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Likewise, the aspects would also become one, because they are not different from the one.

original: gal te rnam pa rnams gcig tu 'gyur ba ni 'dod pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: gal te rnam pa rnams gcig tu 'gyur ba ni 'dod pa nyid yin la /
translated: If you assert that the aspects become one,

original: shes pa du ma nyid du 'gyur ba la du ma dngos dang tha mi dad pa'i phyir zhes gtan tshigs su spyor na ni gtan tshigs 'di ma grub par 'gyur la /
analyzed: shes pa du ma nyid du 'gyur ba la du ma dngos dang tha mi dad pa'i phyir zhes gtan tshigs su spyor na ni gtan tshigs 'di ma grub par 'gyur la /
translated: and you posit the reason that ‚Äúmany consciousnesses would arise because they are not different from the many entities of the aspects,‚Äù then this reason is not established.

original: du mar snang ba dang tha @182b mi dad pa'i phyir zhes gtan tshigs su sbyor na ni khyab pa ma grub ste du mar snang ba ni du mar bden pa ma yin zhing rang bzhin gcig nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: du mar snang ba dang tha @182b mi dad pa'i phyir zhes gtan tshigs su sbyor na ni khyab pa ma grub ste du mar snang ba ni du mar bden pa ma yin zhing rang bzhin gcig nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: If you posit the reason that ‚Äúbecause they are not different from the appearance of many,‚Äù then the inclusion is not established, because the appearance of many is not truly many and is of a single nature.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: This is not so.

original: du mar snang ba dngos po'i bdag nyid du bden pa dang / skye 'gag gi rnam par 'gal ba ste /
analyzed: du mar snang ba dngos po'i bdag nyid du bden pa dang / skye 'gag gi rnam par 'gal ba ste /
translated: The appearance of many is truly the nature of an entity, and it is contradictory for it to be a single nature.

original: ji ltar dkar po'i rnam par snang ba 'gags kyang dmar po'i rnam par snang ba mi 'gag cing /
analyzed: ji ltar dkar po'i rnam par snang ba 'gags kyang dmar po'i rnam par snang ba mi 'gag cing /
translated: Just as the appearance of white ceases, the appearance of red does not cease.

original: de bzhin du de 'gags kyang cig shos mi 'gag la gcig skyes kyang gzhan mi skye bas de rnams su snang ba ni du ma nyid yin zhing /
analyzed: de bzhin du de 'gags kyang cig shos mi 'gag la gcig skyes kyang gzhan mi skye bas de rnams su snang ba ni du ma nyid yin zhing /
translated: Likewise, even though one is stopped, the other is not stopped, and even though one is produced, the other is not produced. Therefore, the appearance as those is multiplicity.

original: de dang tha mi dad pas du ma nyid du 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de dang tha mi dad pas du ma nyid du 'gyur ba'o //
translated: And because it is not different from that, it would be multiplicity.

original: de nyid kyi phyir sna tshogs su snang ba gcig nyid du 'dod pa la yang mngon sum la sogs pa'i bsam pa 'jug pas /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir sna tshogs su snang ba gcig nyid du 'dod pa la yang mngon sum la sogs pa'i bsam pa 'jug pas /
translated: Therefore, even in the assertion that the appearance of multiplicity is a single thing, the thought of direct perception, etc.üîΩis not applicable.

original: de ltar rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, it is not reasonable.

original: de nyid kyi phyir sgyu ma dang sna tshogs kyi bye brag mthong bas na gcig ba yang ma yin la snga ma ltar rgyu 'bras nyid du mi 'thad pas tha dad pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir sgyu ma dang sna tshogs kyi bye brag mthong bas na gcig ba yang ma yin la snga ma ltar rgyu 'bras nyid du mi 'thad pas tha dad pa yang ma yin no //
translated: For that very reason, since the difference of illusion and multiplicity is seen, it is not a single thing. And since cause and effect are not tenable as before, it is not different.

original: sems ni yul dang kun du 'brel //
analyzed: sems ni yul dang kun du 'brel //
translated: The mind is related to the object.

original: zhes pa la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gcig gis ni rnam par shes pa 'jug pa'i tshul ston te /
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gcig gis ni rnam par shes pa 'jug pa'i tshul ston te /
translated: One verse shows the mode of engagement of consciousness:

original: de la kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni lus dang longs spyod la sogs par snang yul dang 'brel zhing /
analyzed: de la kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni lus dang longs spyod la sogs par snang yul dang 'brel zhing /
translated: The foundation consciousness is related to the appearing objects of the body, enjoyments, and so on.

original: de las gzhan pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams kyang rtog pas brtags pa'i don la 'dzin pa'o //üîΩsnang ba med dang bye brag la //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams kyang rtog pas brtags pa'i don la 'dzin pa'o // snang ba med dang bye brag la //
translated: The other consciousnesses also apprehend objects that are imputed by thought.

original: shes rab yang dag rab tu 'jug / ces pa ni /üîΩsnang ba med pa'i de bzhin nyid la ni don dam pa shes pa'i shes rab 'jug par 'gyur la /üîΩgzhan gyi dbang gis bsdus pa kun rdzob pa'i bye brag la ni kun rdzob shes pa'i shes rab 'jug pa'o //üîΩkun brtags pa'i rang bzhin zhes pa la sogs pas ni /üîΩgzhan dbang don dam pa nyid 'gog pa ste /
analyzed: shes rab yang dag rab tu 'jug / ces pa ni /üîΩsnang ba med pa'i de bzhin nyid la ni don dam pa shes pa'i shes rab 'jug par 'gyur la /üîΩgzhan gyi dbang gis bsdus pa kun rdzob pa'i bye brag la ni kun rdzob shes pa'i shes rab 'jug pa'o //üîΩkun brtags pa'i rang bzhin zhes pa la sogs pas ni /üîΩgzhan dbang don dam pa nyid 'gog pa ste /
translated: In the absence of appearance and in particulars,

original: de la sngar bstan pa ltar rnam grangs kyi kun brtags rtog pa'i gzung ba ni kun rdzob tu rtog pa'i blo nyid du yod cing blo'i ngo bor gyur pa'i gzhan dbang ni de kho na nyid du med pa ste /
analyzed: de la sngar bstan pa ltar rnam grangs kyi kun brtags rtog pa'i gzung ba ni kun rdzob tu rtog pa'i blo nyid du yod cing blo'i ngo bor gyur pa'i gzhan dbang ni de kho na nyid du med pa ste /
translated: conceptual mind. The dependent, which is the nature of the mind, does notüîΩexist in reality.

original: de lta na blo'i ngo bo don dam pa nyid du myong ba mi 'thad do zhe na /üîΩnor ba dag gis brtags pa snang //
analyzed: de lta na blo'i ngo bo don dam pa nyid du myong ba mi 'thad do zhe na / nor ba dag gis brtags pa snang //
translated: If that is so, then it is not tenable that the nature of the mind is experienced in reality.

original: zhes pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ste /
translated: The erroneous is perceived by the erroneous.üîΩThe appearance of the dependent nature as the imagined nature is the

original: de ltar snang ba ni phyin ci log gi blos brtags pa nyid rtog pa'i blo'i ngo na snang ba ste /üîΩphyin ci log yin pa'i @183a * //
analyzed: de ltar snang ba ni phyin ci log gi blos brtags pa nyid rtog pa'i blo'i ngo na snang ba ste / phyin ci log yin pa'i @183a * //
translated: appearance of the object of the erroneous conceptual mind.üîΩSince it is erroneous, it is taught that one should not conceptualize it in

original: phyir de la de ltar mi brtag ces nye bar gdams pa'o //
analyzed: phyir de la de ltar mi brtag ces nye bar gdams pa'o //
translated: that way.

original: de yang ji ltar sngags dang sman la sogs pa'i yan lag mang pos grub pa'i sgyu ma'i glang po la sogs par snang ba dbang po ma bslad pa rnams kyi blo'i ro  na ma grub pa de bzhin du gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan ma sna tshogs kyang
analyzed: de yang ji ltar sngags dang sman la sogs pa'i yan lag mang pos grub pa'i sgyu ma'i glang po la sogs par snang ba dbang po ma bslad pa rnams kyi blo'i ro  na ma grub pa de bzhin du gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan ma sna tshogs kyang
translated: Just as the illusory elephant, which appears through the power of many factors such as mantras and medicine, is not established in the mind of those whose senses are unimpaired, so the various dependent characteristics

original: / yang dag ba'i rigs pas brtags na mi 'grub pa'o //
analyzed: / yang dag ba'i rigs pas brtags na mi 'grub pa'o //
translated: are not established when examined with correct reasoning.

original: de nyid gzhan gyi dbang du ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de nyid gzhan gyi dbang du ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How is that very [nature] dependent?

original: mtshan ma gnas ngan len gyi dngos zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: mtshan ma gnas ngan len gyi dngos zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: It is said, The entity of negative tendencies of characteristics...

original: rnam par rtog pa'i mtshan ma dang / des bsgos pa'i bag chags kyis byis pa'i skye bo 'ching bar byed pa ni /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i mtshan ma dang / des bsgos pa'i bag chags kyis byis pa'i skye bo 'ching bar byed pa ni /
translated: The characteristics of conceptual thoughts and the latent tendencies of their imprints bind childish beings.

original: sems nyid snga ma rnams las byung bas kun rdzob tu gzhan gyi dbang nyid yin la /
analyzed: sems nyid snga ma rnams las byung bas kun rdzob tu gzhan gyi dbang nyid yin la /
translated: Since they arise from previous mind-only, they are conventionally dependent.

original: de nyid mi shes pa rnams kyis don dam pa'i dngos por gzhag pa ni kun brtags pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid mi shes pa rnams kyis don dam pa'i dngos por gzhag pa ni kun brtags pa ste /
translated: The ignorant posit them as ultimate entities, which is the imagined.

original: gzhan gyi dbang don dam pa nyid du rnam par rtog pas brtags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang don dam pa nyid du rnam par rtog pas brtags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the other-dependent is imagined by the imagination of the ultimate.

original: gal te kun du brtags pa blo'i ngo bor yod na /
analyzed: gal te kun du brtags pa blo'i ngo bor yod na /
translated: If the imagined exists as the nature of the intellect,

original: de nyid rgyu med pa mi 'thad pas gzhan gyi dbang du 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de nyid rgyu med pa mi 'thad pas gzhan gyi dbang du 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: since it is not tenable that it is without cause, it would be other-dependent.

original: rnam grangs kyis na 'gyur ba'o zhes ston pa ni gang 'di zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: rnam grangs kyis na 'gyur ba'o zhes ston pa ni gang 'di zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The statement that it is so in terms of enumeration is ‚Äúthat which is called . . .‚Äù

original: tshigs su bcad pa phyed snga ma ni phyed phyi mas bshad pa'o //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa phyed snga ma ni phyed phyi mas bshad pa'o //
translated: The first half of the verse is explained by the second half.

original: kun rdzob dang ni zhes pa la sogs pas ni ngo bo nyid gsum ka yang don dam pa'i dngos por ma grub pa nyid du gsungs te /
analyzed: kun rdzob dang ni zhes pa la sogs pas ni ngo bo nyid gsum ka yang don dam pa'i dngos por ma grub pa nyid du gsungs te /
translated: By ‚Äúthe conventional . . .‚Äù and so forth, all three natures are said to be non-established as ultimate things.

original: de la don dam pa ni de bcad 'phags pa'i spyod yul zhes pa gzhan gyi dbang la kun brtags pa'i rang bzhin gyis stong pa /
analyzed: de la don dam pa ni de bcad 'phags pa'i spyod yul zhes pa gzhan gyi dbang la kun brtags pa'i rang bzhin gyis stong pa /
translated: Therein, the ultimate is the object of the noble ones‚Äô activity, which is the other-dependent that is empty of the nature of the imagined.

original: 'phags pa so so rang gis rig pa'i spyod yul don dam pa yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: 'phags pa so so rang gis rig pa'i spyod yul don dam pa yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: The ultimate that is the object of the noble ones‚Äô individual self-knowledge is the thoroughly established nature.

original: rgyu las skye ba ni gzhan gyi dbang ngo //
analyzed: rgyu las skye ba ni gzhan gyi dbang ngo //
translated: The dependent is that which arises from causes.

original: rnal 'byor can gyis zhes pa la sogs pas kun du brtags pa dngos po med pa nyid du ston te /
analyzed: rnal 'byor can gyis zhes pa la sogs pas kun du brtags pa dngos po med pa nyid du ston te /
translated: The imagined is taught to be non-existent, beginning with ‚ÄúThe yogi/nƒ´ . . .‚Äù

original: de la rnal 'byor can gyi dngos po ni gnyis su med pa'i rang gi rig pa'i don dam la sems rtse gcig tu gnas pa ste /
analyzed: de la rnal 'byor can gyi dngos po ni gnyis su med pa'i rang gi rig pa'i don dam la sems rtse gcig tu gnas pa ste /
translated: There, the yogi/nƒ´‚Äôs thing is the ultimate, non-dual self-awareness, and the mind is one-pointedly placed in that.

original: de ltar gnas pa na sna tshogs su snang ba shes pa'i rang bzhin gcig nyid du rnam par mdzes kyang zhes pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar gnas pa na sna tshogs su snang ba shes pa'i rang bzhin gcig nyid du rnam par mdzes kyang zhes pa ste /
translated: When it is placed in that way, the single nature of the appearance of diversity is beautiful.

original: rang bzhin gcig nyid la sna tshogs su snang ba'i rnam pas spras shing snang ba'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gcig nyid la sna tshogs su snang ba'i rnam pas spras shing snang ba'o //
translated: The single nature is adorned with and appears as the aspect of the appearance of diversity.

original: de ltar snang yang shes pa'i rang bzhin la sna tshogs yod pa ma yin pa de bzhin @183b du brtags pa'i mtshan nyid kyang med pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar snang yang shes pa'i rang bzhin la sna tshogs yod pa ma yin pa de bzhin @183b du brtags pa'i mtshan nyid kyang med pa'o //
translated: Although it appears in that way, the nature of consciousness is not diverse. In the same way, the imagined characteristic does not exist.

original: ji ltar zhes pa la sogs pas gzhan gyi dbang ngo bo nyid med par ston te /
analyzed: ji ltar zhes pa la sogs pas gzhan gyi dbang ngo bo nyid med par ston te /
translated: The dependent is taught to be natureless, beginning with ‚ÄúJust as . . .‚Äù

original: ji ltar rab rib kyis dbang po nyams pa rnams la skra shad la sogs par snang ba'i gzugs la /
analyzed: ji ltar rab rib kyis dbang po nyams pa rnams la skra shad la sogs par snang ba'i gzugs la /
translated: Just as the forms that appear as hairs and so forth to those whose sense faculties are impaired by eye diseases,

original: de ltar bden pa'i gzugs sna tshogs su brtags pa na rtog pa'i gzung ba de dag bden pa'i gzugs ma yin zhing de ltar snang ba shes pa'i ngo bor yod pas rnam pa thams cad du med pa yang ma yin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: de ltar bden pa'i gzugs sna tshogs su brtags pa na rtog pa'i gzung ba de dag bden pa'i gzugs ma yin zhing de ltar snang ba shes pa'i ngo bor yod pas rnam pa thams cad du med pa yang ma yin pa de bzhin du /
translated: are not real forms, but exist as the nature of the consciousness that appears in that way, and are therefore not completely nonexistent,

original: mkhas pa rnams kyis gzhan gyi dbang zung 'jug sgyu ma lta bur rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: mkhas pa rnams kyis gzhan gyi dbang zung 'jug sgyu ma lta bur rtogs par bya'o //
translated: in the same way, the wise should understand the dependent nature to be a union, like an illusion.

original: ji ltar zhes pa la sogs pas yongs grub dngos por mi 'thad pa nyid ston te /
analyzed: ji ltar zhes pa la sogs pas yongs grub dngos por mi 'thad pa nyid ston te /
translated: The line ‚ÄúJust as the purified gold‚Äù and so on teaches that the thoroughly established nature is not tenable as a thing.

original: gser la sogs pa glo bur gyi dri ma spangs pa bzhin du sems nyid rig pa'i de bzhin nyid glo bur gyi dri ma don dam pa'i dngos por gyur pa sngar nas gnas pa dang bral ba'i ngo bo nyid du brtags pa ni de ltar mi bden zhes
analyzed: gser la sogs pa glo bur gyi dri ma spangs pa bzhin du sems nyid rig pa'i de bzhin nyid glo bur gyi dri ma don dam pa'i dngos por gyur pa sngar nas gnas pa dang bral ba'i ngo bo nyid du brtags pa ni de ltar mi bden zhes
translated: Just as gold and so on are free from adventitious stains, the suchness of the mind, which is awareness, is free from adventitious stains. The nature of the mind is not tenable as a thing that has existed from the beginning.

original: pa'o // brtags pa la ni zhes pa la sogs pas ngo bo nyid gnyis kyi rang bzhin ji lta ba nyid ston te /
analyzed: pa'o // brtags pa la ni zhes pa la sogs pas ngo bo nyid gnyis kyi rang bzhin ji lta ba nyid ston te /
translated: The way things really are, the nature of the two realities, is taught by ‚ÄúThe imagined is not a real thing, etc.‚Äù

original: yongs su grub pa la de ltar brtags pa'am /
analyzed: yongs su grub pa la de ltar brtags pa'am /
translated: The imagined is not a real thing,

original: gzhan yang rung ste kun brtags pa ni /
analyzed: gzhan yang rung ste kun brtags pa ni /
translated: but the relative is like an illusion.

original: ji ltar brtags pa bzhin dngos por med la gzhan gyi dbang ni sgyu ma lta bur yod pa ste /
analyzed: ji ltar brtags pa bzhin dngos por med la gzhan gyi dbang ni sgyu ma lta bur yod pa ste /
translated: The imagined is not a real thing in the way it is imagined, but the relative is like an illusion.

original: de dag las bzlog ste sgro 'dogs pa dang skur ba 'debs pa ni skye ba gzhan du bde 'gro dang thar pa thob pa las nyams par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de dag las bzlog ste sgro 'dogs pa dang skur ba 'debs pa ni skye ba gzhan du bde 'gro dang thar pa thob pa las nyams par byed pa'o //
translated: The opposite of these two, reification and repudiation, cause one to fall from the attainment of happy rebirth and liberation in other lives.

original: 'dir gzhung nyid kyang sgro 'dogs pa dang skur ba 'debs pa'i mthar rtog pa ni rlag par 'gyur zhes 'don par byed do //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung nyid kyang sgro 'dogs pa dang skur ba 'debs pa'i mthar rtog pa ni rlag par 'gyur zhes 'don par byed do //
translated: Here the text itself says, ‚ÄúThe conception of the extremes of reification and repudiation is destroyed.‚Äù

original: yang gzhung 'di ltar na mtha' gnyis su brtags pa'i don rigs pas rnam par brtags na 'jig par 'gyur zhes pa'o //
analyzed: yang gzhung 'di ltar na mtha' gnyis su brtags pa'i don rigs pas rnam par brtags na 'jig par 'gyur zhes pa'o //
translated: This text says that when the meaning of the two extremes is conceptually analyzed, it is destroyed.

original: gal te zhes pa la sogs pas brtags pa rnam pa thams cad du med cing /
analyzed: gal te zhes pa la sogs pas brtags pa rnam pa thams cad du med cing /
translated: ‚ÄúIf the imagined were nonexistent, etc.‚Äù shows that the imagined does not exist in any way,

original: gzhan dbang don dam pa pa dgag pa nyid du tshul gzhan gyi sgo nas ston te /
analyzed: gzhan dbang don dam pa pa dgag pa nyid du tshul gzhan gyi sgo nas ston te /
translated: The other-dependent is refuted as ultimate reality itself by another method.

original: de'i don yang rnam grangs kyi kun tu brtags pa dang / gzhan gyi dbang ni ngo bo gcig pa dang / yang snga phyir gyur pa rnams phan tshun rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid du yang sngar gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i don yang rnam grangs kyi kun tu brtags pa dang / gzhan gyi dbang ni ngo bo gcig pa dang / yang snga phyir gyur pa rnams phan tshun rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid du yang sngar gsungs te /
translated: The meaning of that is as follows: The imagined in its categories and the other-dependent are the same in nature, and it has been said previously that they are mutually cause and effect, occurring earlier and later.üîΩTherefore, since they are the same, the other-dependent would be a thing, since the imagined is a non-thing.

original: des na de dag gcig pas brtags pa dngos po med par gzhan gyi dbang gi dngos po nyid 'gyur ba'am /üîΩde bzhin du dngos po @184a * //
analyzed: des na de dag gcig pas brtags pa dngos po med par gzhan gyi dbang gi dngos po nyid 'gyur ba'am / de bzhin du dngos po @184a * //
translated: Therefore, since they are the same, the imputed would become the dependent nature.üîΩOr,üîΩ

original: nyid du yang dngos po med par 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: nyid du yang dngos po med par 'gyur ba ste /
translated: in the same way, the other-dependent would be a non-thing, since it is a thing.

original: 'gal ba bdag nyid gcig tu 'gyur //üîΩzhes pa'o // gzhan yang de dag rgyu 'bras nyid yin pa'i phyir dngos po med pa las dngos po skye bar 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: 'gal ba bdag nyid gcig tu 'gyur // zhes pa'o // gzhan yang de dag rgyu 'bras nyid yin pa'i phyir dngos po med pa las dngos po skye bar 'gyur ba'am /
translated: There would be the contradiction of a single nature.üîΩMoreover, since they are cause and effect, a thing would arise from a non-thing.

original: ming dang mtshan mas 'brel ba'i gzhan gyi dbang gi dngos po las kun brtags pa'i dngos po med pa skye bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: ming dang mtshan mas 'brel ba'i gzhan gyi dbang gi dngos po las kun brtags pa'i dngos po med pa skye bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Or, a non-thing, the imagined, would arise from a thing, the other-dependent, which is connected with names and signs.

original: kun brtags pa la gnas nas ni //
analyzed: kun brtags pa la gnas nas ni //
translated: Abiding in the imagined,

original: gzhan gyi dbang ni nye bar dmigs //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang ni nye bar dmigs //
translated: one perceives the relative.

original: zhes pa ni rgyu 'bras kyi don nyid gsal bar bstan pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ni rgyu 'bras kyi don nyid gsal bar bstan pa ste /
translated: This clearly teaches the meaning of cause and effect.

original: sngar bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: sngar bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: It is as explained above.

original: ming dang mtshan ma 'brel zhes pa ni brjod pa dang 'dres par snang ba rtog pa'i gzung ba ste /
analyzed: ming dang mtshan ma 'brel zhes pa ni brjod pa dang 'dres par snang ba rtog pa'i gzung ba ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe connection between names and signs‚Äù refers to the apprehended object of the imagination, which appears as a mixture of expressions.

original: rtog pa nyid kyi bdag nyid du gyur pa'i gzhan gyi dbang ngo //
analyzed: rtog pa nyid kyi bdag nyid du gyur pa'i gzhan gyi dbang ngo //
translated: It is the relative, which is the nature of the imagination itself.

original: brtags pa shin du ma grub ste /
analyzed: brtags pa shin du ma grub ste /
translated: The imagined is not at all established.

original: gzhan las 'byung ba ni ma yin no zhes pa ni thal ba las bzlog pa'i don te /
analyzed: gzhan las 'byung ba ni ma yin no zhes pa ni thal ba las bzlog pa'i don te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúit does not arise from another‚Äù is the opposite of the reductio argument.

original: nam mkha'i padma ltar shin du ma grub pa ni gzhan las 'byung ba'i 'bras bur mi 'thad ces pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha'i padma ltar shin du ma grub pa ni gzhan las 'byung ba'i 'bras bur mi 'thad ces pa'o //
translated: It is not tenable that something that is not at all established, like a sky flower, arises from another.

original: de'i phyir rnam grangs kyi kun du brtags pa ni kun rdzob tu blo'i bdag nyid du yod la /
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam grangs kyi kun du brtags pa ni kun rdzob tu blo'i bdag nyid du yod la /
translated: Therefore, the imagined, which is the nominal object, exists as the nature of the mind conventionally.

original: blo'i ngo bo gyur pa'i gzhan dbang yang don dam pa'i dngos por mi 'thad de /
analyzed: blo'i ngo bo gyur pa'i gzhan dbang yang don dam pa'i dngos por mi 'thad de /
translated: But it is not tenable that the relative, which is the transformation of the mind, is an ultimate entity.

original: sngar bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: sngar bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: This is as explained above.

original: yang 'di dag gi khyad par ni mtshan nyid yongs su chad pa'i kun du brtags pa ni kun rdzob tsam du yang med la /
analyzed: yang 'di dag gi khyad par ni mtshan nyid yongs su chad pa'i kun du brtags pa ni kun rdzob tsam du yang med la /
translated: Moreover, the difference between these two is that the imagined, which is completely cut off from reality, does not exist even as a superficial reality.

original: gzhan gyi dbang ni yod pa ste sngar bstan pa dang 'gal ba med pa ni rtogs par sla'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang ni yod pa ste sngar bstan pa dang 'gal ba med pa ni rtogs par sla'o //
translated: The relative, on the other hand, does exist, and it is easy to understand that it is not contradictory to what has been taught above.

original: thal ba las bzlog pa'i gtan tshigs gzhan yang dngos po dngos po med par 'gyur ba med pa yin pa dang / dngos po med pa las dngos po skye ba mi 'thad pa'i phyir yang rnam grangs kyi kun brtags kun rdzob tu yang med la /
analyzed: thal ba las bzlog pa'i gtan tshigs gzhan yang dngos po dngos po med par 'gyur ba med pa yin pa dang / dngos po med pa las dngos po skye ba mi 'thad pa'i phyir yang rnam grangs kyi kun brtags kun rdzob tu yang med la /
translated: The other syllogism, which is the opposite of the reductio, is: ‚ÄúThe imagined, which is a nominal reality, does not exist even as a superficial reality, because it is not tenable that a thing becomes a non-thing, and because it is not tenable that a thing arises from a non-thing.‚Äù

original: gzhan dbang bden par yod ba mi 'thad ces pa'o //üîΩde tshe don dam rang bzhin ni //
analyzed: gzhan dbang bden par yod ba mi 'thad ces pa'o // de tshe don dam rang bzhin ni //
translated: The relative, on the other hand, truly exists.

original: zhes pa la sogs pas don de ltar rtogs pa'i phan yon 'chad do //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pas don de ltar rtogs pa'i phan yon 'chad do //
translated: The next verse and so on explain the benefits of understanding the meaning in this way.

original: de nas tshig rkang gnyis kyis de dag gi dbye ba ston to //
analyzed: de nas tshig rkang gnyis kyis de dag gi dbye ba ston to //
translated: The next two verses teach the divisions of the two realities.

original: sngar bstan pa ltar kun du brtags pa gsum ni rgyu 'bras su brtags pa gcig nyid du 'dus pas bcu gnyis su gsungs pa dang mi 'gal lo //
analyzed: sngar bstan pa ltar kun du brtags pa gsum ni rgyu 'bras su brtags pa gcig nyid du 'dus pas bcu gnyis su gsungs pa dang mi 'gal lo //
translated: As previously explained, the three imputations are included in the single imputation of cause and effect, so there is no contradiction with the statement of twelve.

original: gal te theg pa chen po'i tshul la rnam par shes pa'i tshogs brgyad nyid du khas len @184b pas gzhan gyi dbang drug tu mi 'thad do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te theg pa chen po'i tshul la rnam par shes pa'i tshogs brgyad nyid du khas len @184b pas gzhan gyi dbang drug tu mi 'thad do zhe na /
translated: If one accepts the Mahayana system of eight collections of consciousness, it is not tenable to have six dependent natures.

original: de ltar bden mod kyi kun gzhi dang nyon mongs pa can gyi yid ni rgyu ba cha phra ba rnam pa gsal ba med pas 'dir ma smos pa tsam du zad do //
analyzed: de ltar bden mod kyi kun gzhi dang nyon mongs pa can gyi yid ni rgyu ba cha phra ba rnam pa gsal ba med pas 'dir ma smos pa tsam du zad do //
translated: That is true, but the foundation consciousness and afflicted mind are subtle in their movement and do not have clear aspects, so they are simply not mentioned here.

original: so so rang gis zhes pa la sogs pas so so rang gis rig pa'i de bzhin nyid la de 'dra ba'i bye brag tu dbye ba mi 'thad pa nyid du ston te /
analyzed: so so rang gis zhes pa la sogs pas so so rang gis rig pa'i de bzhin nyid la de 'dra ba'i bye brag tu dbye ba mi 'thad pa nyid du ston te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúeach for itself‚Äù and so on teaches that such a classification is not tenable in the suchness that is individually cognized.

original: sna tshogs su rnam par gzhag pa ni de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bo ro gcig cing /
analyzed: sna tshogs su rnam par gzhag pa ni de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bo ro gcig cing /
translated: The various classifications are of one taste in the essence of suchness.

original: de nyid rnal 'byor can rnams kyis rtogs shing /
analyzed: de nyid rnal 'byor can rnams kyis rtogs shing /
translated: That is realized by yogis.

original: goms na de bzhin nyid mngon du gyur pa chos sku'i rang bzhin thob pa las mi 'da' ba'o //
analyzed: goms na de bzhin nyid mngon du gyur pa chos sku'i rang bzhin thob pa las mi 'da' ba'o //
translated: When one is accustomed to that, one does not go beyond the attainment of the nature of the dharmakƒÅya, the actualization of suchness.

original: gal te brjod pa dang 'dres par snang ba gzhan gyi dbang nyid du 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te brjod pa dang 'dres par snang ba gzhan gyi dbang nyid du 'gyur na /
translated: If the appearance mixed with expression were the other-dependent,

original: ming dang mtshan ma dag mtshungs pa yin nam snyam du sems na ni mtshan ma dag ni zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: ming dang mtshan ma dag mtshungs pa yin nam snyam du sems na ni mtshan ma dag ni zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: one might think that names and signs are the same.  In response to that, [the text] says, ‚ÄúThe signs . . .‚Äù and so on.

original: 'di'i don ni sngar bstan no //
analyzed: 'di'i don ni sngar bstan no //
translated: The meaning of this is as it was previously explained.

original: kun brtags pa zhes pa la sogs pas ni sngar bstan pa ltar rnam grangs kyi kun du brtags pa dang / mtshan ma ni gzhan gyi dbang snga ma rnams las 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: kun brtags pa zhes pa la sogs pas ni sngar bstan pa ltar rnam grangs kyi kun du brtags pa dang / mtshan ma ni gzhan gyi dbang snga ma rnams las 'byung ba'o //
translated: As it was previously explained, the imagined is the imagined in terms of synonyms, and the signs are the other-dependent that arise from the former.

original: blos zhes pa la sogs pas ni ngo bo nyid gsum dngos la med pa nyid du bsdus te bstan pa'o //
analyzed: blos zhes pa la sogs pas ni ngo bo nyid gsum dngos la med pa nyid du bsdus te bstan pa'o //
translated: With ‚ÄúThe mind . . .‚Äù and so on, the three natures are summarized and taught as being nonexistent in reality.

original: ci zhig rnam par brtag ces pa ni khyad par gyi chos ci dang ci 'dra bar rnam par brtag ste /
analyzed: ci zhig rnam par brtag ces pa ni khyad par gyi chos ci dang ci 'dra bar rnam par brtag ste /
translated: ‚Äú What is imagined?‚Äù refers to what kind of specific phenomena are imagined.

original: brtag bya'i don de 'dra ba grub ba med ces pa'o //
analyzed: brtag bya'i don de 'dra ba grub ba med ces pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú The object of imagination does not exist in that way‚Äù means that the object of imagination does not exist in that way.

original: gal te 'dir yod pa dang med pa'i mtha' gnyis spangs pa'i grub pa'i dngos po rnam par rig pa tsam gyis dbu ma don dam pa'i dngos por yod do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te 'dir yod pa dang med pa'i mtha' gnyis spangs pa'i grub pa'i dngos po rnam par rig pa tsam gyis dbu ma don dam pa'i dngos por yod do zhe na /
translated: If you say that the middle free from the extremes of existence and nonexistence is the ultimate reality of the Madhyamaka, which is a real existent, a mere representation,

original: de 'dra ba 'gal te yod pa dang med pa ni rnam gcod dang yongs gcod kyi 'gal ba yin pas gcig bkag pas gzhan grub pa la ltos pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de 'dra ba 'gal te yod pa dang med pa ni rnam gcod dang yongs gcod kyi 'gal ba yin pas gcig bkag pas gzhan grub pa la ltos pa'i phyir /
translated: then that is contradictory, because existence and nonexistence are mutually exclusive, and the establishment of one depends on the negation of the other.

original: de dag gnyis las grol ba ni phyir zhing gnyis ka'i bdag nyid du 'gyur na de 'dra ba ni mi srid pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gnyis las grol ba ni phyir zhing gnyis ka'i bdag nyid du 'gyur na de 'dra ba ni mi srid pa'o //
translated: If something is free from those two, it must be the nature of both, but that is impossible.

original: de lta na de 'dra ba'i 'gal ba gang la srid ce na /üîΩkun brtags pa yi rang bzhin la //
analyzed: de lta na de 'dra ba'i 'gal ba gang la srid ce na / kun brtags pa yi rang bzhin la //
translated: In that case, what is it that is subject to such a contradiction?üîΩThe imagined nature

original: rang bzhin gnyis ni rab gnas te //üîΩzhes pa de ltar rtog pa'i blo phyin ci log gi ngo na yod pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gnyis ni rab gnas te // zhes pa de ltar rtog pa'i blo phyin ci log gi ngo na yod pa'o //
translated: is the basis of the two kinds of intrinsic nature.üîΩIt exists from the perspective of the erroneous mind that conceives it in that way.

original: de ltar 'gal ba sna tshogs su snang ba ni brtags pa yin la /
analyzed: de ltar 'gal ba sna tshogs su snang ba ni brtags pa yin la /
translated: The various appearances of such contradictions are imagined.

original: de 'dra ba'i phyin ci log rnam par dag pa 'phags pa rnams kyis so so rang gis rig par bya ba yongs su grub pa'o //
analyzed: de 'dra ba'i phyin ci log rnam par dag pa 'phags pa rnams kyis so so rang gis rig par bya ba yongs su grub pa'o //
translated: Such a pure absence of error is the thoroughly established nature, which is to be realized personally by the noble ones.

original: @185a * // brtags pa sna tshogs su snang ba'i blo ni gzhan gyi dbang sgyu ma lta bu ste /
analyzed: @185a * // brtags pa sna tshogs su snang ba'i blo ni gzhan gyi dbang sgyu ma lta bu ste /
translated: The mind that appears as various imaginations is the dependent, which is like an illusion.

original: de ltar na kun rdzob tu ngo bo nyid gsum gyi tshul ma 'dres par rnam par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar na kun rdzob tu ngo bo nyid gsum gyi tshul ma 'dres par rnam par gzhag pa'o //
translated: Thus, the three natures are presented in a non-mixed way in the relative.

original: rnam pa gzhan du zhes pa la sogs pa ni gzhan gyi dbang sgyu ma las gzhan don dam pa'i dngos por brtags na ni phyin ci log nyid du 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du zhes pa la sogs pa ni gzhan gyi dbang sgyu ma las gzhan don dam pa'i dngos por brtags na ni phyin ci log nyid du 'gyur ba'o //
translated: ‚Äú In another way‚Äù and so on means that if the dependent, which is like an illusion, is imagined to be an ultimate entity, it would be erroneous.

original: de'i phyir de ltar rtogs pas gzhag pa ni brtags pa ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar rtogs pas gzhag pa ni brtags pa ste /
translated: Therefore, the presentation of the dependent as it is realized is the imagined.

original: ji ltar brtags pa bzhin du ma grub la /
analyzed: ji ltar brtags pa bzhin du ma grub la /
translated: It is not established as it is imagined.

original: rtog pa'i blo ni mthong zhing myong ba'i phyir kun rdzob tu rgyu las byung ba'i gzhan dbang ngo //
analyzed: rtog pa'i blo ni mthong zhing myong ba'i phyir kun rdzob tu rgyu las byung ba'i gzhan dbang ngo //
translated: The conceptual mind is the relative, the dependent that arises from causes, because it is seen and experienced.

original: rnam rtog gnyis las grol ba ste /
analyzed: rnam rtog gnyis las grol ba ste /
translated: It is free from the two types of conceptualization.

original: mtha' gnyis su rtog pa spangs pa'i rigs pa sgyu ma lta bu ni yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: mtha' gnyis su rtog pa spangs pa'i rigs pa sgyu ma lta bu ni yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The illusion-like reasoning that abandons the two extremes is the characteristic of the consummate.

original: yang blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pas ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po sbyong bar byed pa'i lam dang / 'bras bu'i bdag nyid kyi theg pa gcig nyid rgyas par ston pa ste /
analyzed: yang blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pas ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po sbyong bar byed pa'i lam dang / 'bras bu'i bdag nyid kyi theg pa gcig nyid rgyas par ston pa ste /
translated: Again, ‚ÄúMahƒÅmati, the tathƒÅgatagarbha is purified by the path‚Äù and so on extensively teaches the single vehicle that has the nature of the path and the result.

original: de la 'phags pa so so rang gi ye shes ni lam gyis rtogs par bya ba'am thob par bya ba'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: de la 'phags pa so so rang gi ye shes ni lam gyis rtogs par bya ba'am thob par bya ba'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: Here, the ƒÅrya‚Äôs own wisdom is the result that is to be realized or attained by the path.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la gzhan gyi dring la mi 'jog ces pa ni theg pa chen po'i tshul lugs rtogs pa nyid sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la gzhan gyi dring la mi 'jog ces pa ni theg pa chen po'i tshul lugs rtogs pa nyid sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad rtogs pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúIt is not dependent on another with respect to all the qualities of the buddhas‚Äù means that by realizing the system of the MahƒÅyƒÅna, all the qualities of the buddhas are realized.

original: sngar gsungs pa ltar thams cad kyang de nyid rtogs pa'i yan lag tu gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngar gsungs pa ltar thams cad kyang de nyid rtogs pa'i yan lag tu gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: As stated earlier, all of them are taught as being branches of the realization of thatness.

original: 'dir lan gyi don la dang po 'phags pa so so rang gi ye shes rtogs pa ni rjes su dpag pa la sogs pa'i tshad ma dang / yid ches pa'i lung gis de bzhin nyid kyi don spyi'i tshul du gtan la phab nas /
analyzed: 'dir lan gyi don la dang po 'phags pa so so rang gi ye shes rtogs pa ni rjes su dpag pa la sogs pa'i tshad ma dang / yid ches pa'i lung gis de bzhin nyid kyi don spyi'i tshul du gtan la phab nas /
translated: Here, the first of the answers is the realization of the individual intuitive wisdom of the noble ones. Having established the meaning of thusness in the manner of a universal by means of the valid cognitions of inference and so forth, and by means of authoritative scriptures,

original: zhi gnas kyi rgyu mtshan nam yan lag tu gcig pu dben par song ste sngar bstan pa ltar dran pa dang shes rab kyi char gtogs pa chos zab mo la bzod pa'i rgyur gyur ba'i gzungs thob par 'gyur ba'i thabs 'ga' zhig la brten nas de bzhin nyid
analyzed: zhi gnas kyi rgyu mtshan nam yan lag tu gcig pu dben par song ste sngar bstan pa ltar dran pa dang shes rab kyi char gtogs pa chos zab mo la bzod pa'i rgyur gyur ba'i gzungs thob par 'gyur ba'i thabs 'ga' zhig la brten nas de bzhin nyid
translated: one should go to a solitary place and, as previously explained, rely on some means of attaining the dhƒÅra·πáƒ´ that is a cause of the forbearance of the profound Dharma, which is included in mindfulness and wisdom.

original: kyi spyi'i rnam par sgro 'dogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i dri ma zhi bar bya ste /
analyzed: kyi spyi'i rnam par sgro 'dogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i dri ma zhi bar bya ste /
translated: By that means, one should pacify the stains of conceptual thoughts that are superimpositions onto the universal of thusness.

original: rnam par rtog pa med pa'i shes rab kyis ji lta ba bzhin du yul du byas nas sgom par byed pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa med pa'i shes rab kyis ji lta ba bzhin du yul du byas nas sgom par byed pa ste /
translated: One should meditate by means of nonconceptual wisdom, taking that as the object just as it is.

original: de ltar bsgoms pa'i stobs yongs su rdzogs pa na thob par 'gyur ba'i ye shes so //
analyzed: de ltar bsgoms pa'i stobs yongs su rdzogs pa na thob par 'gyur ba'i ye shes so //
translated: The wisdom that is attained when the power of such meditation is perfected is the second answer.

original: theg pa gcig po rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid ni theg pa chen po gcig gi lam rig cing khong du chud pas @185b theg pa gcig po rtogs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: theg pa gcig po rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid ni theg pa chen po gcig gi lam rig cing khong du chud pas @185b theg pa gcig po rtogs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The characteristic of realizing the One Vehicle is that, by knowing and comprehending the path of the One Great Vehicle, it is called ‚Äúrealizing the One Vehicle.‚Äù

original: de nyid rig cing khong du chud pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de nyid rig cing khong du chud pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is meant by ‚Äúknowing and comprehending that itself‚Äù?

original: 'di lta ste zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di lta ste zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: It is as stated in the following lines:üîΩApart from the mind that appears and is realized in the form of subject and object, there is no other phenomenon, as has been explained above.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i rnam par snang zhing rtogs pa'i blo las ma gtogs pa chos gzhan ni sngar bstan pa ltar kun rdzob tsam du yang mi srid la ;
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i rnam par snang zhing rtogs pa'i blo las ma gtogs pa chos gzhan ni sngar bstan pa ltar kun rdzob tsam du yang mi srid la ;
translated: Even on the conventional level, it is impossible for there to be any other phenomenon.

original: / blo de nyid kyis de bzhin nyid yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pas /
analyzed: / blo de nyid kyis de bzhin nyid yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pas /
translated: By means of that very mind, one realizes suchness, the way things really are.

original: sna tshogs kyi rnam par rtog pa mi 'byung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sna tshogs kyi rnam par rtog pa mi 'byung ba'i phyir /
translated: And because the various thoughts do not arise,

original: theg pa gcig po khong du chud par byas pa yin no //
analyzed: theg pa gcig po khong du chud par byas pa yin no //
translated: one comprehends the One Vehicle.

original: de'i don yang de ltar rtogs par bya ba'i don ni rtogs pa sna tshogs kyis dben pa'i chos kyi dbyings dbyer med pa yin la /
analyzed: de'i don yang de ltar rtogs par bya ba'i don ni rtogs pa sna tshogs kyis dben pa'i chos kyi dbyings dbyer med pa yin la /
translated: The meaning of that is as follows: The meaning that is to be realized is the indivisible dharmadhƒÅtu, which is devoid of the various thoughts.

original: de la de bzhin nyid du rtogs pas rnam par rtog pa mi 'byung zhing /
analyzed: de la de bzhin nyid du rtogs pas rnam par rtog pa mi 'byung zhing /
translated: Since one realizes thatness, conceptualization does not occur.

original: de yang dbyer med pa'i rang bzhin mthar thug pa'i don gcig nyid yin pas de ltar rtogs pa'i lam gyi bdag nyid kyi theg pa yang mthar thug pa gcig yin zhes khong du chud par byas pa'o //
analyzed: de yang dbyer med pa'i rang bzhin mthar thug pa'i don gcig nyid yin pas de ltar rtogs pa'i lam gyi bdag nyid kyi theg pa yang mthar thug pa gcig yin zhes khong du chud par byas pa'o //
translated: Moreover, since the single ultimate meaning is the nature of inseparability, one should understand that the vehicle that is the path of such realization is also the single ultimate vehicle.

original: ji lta ba bzhin du gnas pa ni rtogs pa'i don no //
analyzed: ji lta ba bzhin du gnas pa ni rtogs pa'i don no //
translated: Abiding in suchness is the meaning of realization.

original: khong du chud pa 'di ni zhes pa ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pa mthar thug pa'o //
analyzed: khong du chud pa 'di ni zhes pa ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pa mthar thug pa'o //
translated: This realization is the ultimate realization of suchness.

original: des na de'i phyir zhes pa ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas la sogs pas thob pa'i rtogs pa la brten nas 'bras bu mthar thug par 'byin ma nus pas /
analyzed: des na de'i phyir zhes pa ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas la sogs pas thob pa'i rtogs pa la brten nas 'bras bu mthar thug par 'byin ma nus pas /
translated: Therefore, since ≈õrƒÅvakas, pratyekabuddhas, and so on are unable to give rise to the ultimate result based on the realization they have attained,

original: de dag gi rtogs pa ni mthar thug pa'i lam ma yin zhing theg pa chen po'i lam gyi yan lag nyid du 'gyur gyi gzhan du ma yin pas theg pa gcig ces pa ste /
analyzed: de dag gi rtogs pa ni mthar thug pa'i lam ma yin zhing theg pa chen po'i lam gyi yan lag nyid du 'gyur gyi gzhan du ma yin pas theg pa gcig ces pa ste /
translated: their realization is not the ultimate path. It becomes a branch of the MahƒÅyƒÅna path, but not anything else. Therefore, there is a single vehicle.

original: 'di'i don zhib tu ni sngar bstan no //
analyzed: 'di'i don zhib tu ni sngar bstan no //
translated: The meaning of this has been taught in detail above.

original: blo gros chen pos gsol ba zhes pa la sogs pas de nyid la rtsod pa spangs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: blo gros chen pos gsol ba zhes pa la sogs pas de nyid la rtsod pa spangs pa gsungs te /
translated: The reply of the great being, etc. , states the avoidance of the objection to that.

original: 'di dag gi don ni nyan thos pa la sogs pa theg pa gsum du bstan pas 'dul bar 'gyur gyi gzhan du ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: 'di dag gi don ni nyan thos pa la sogs pa theg pa gsum du bstan pas 'dul bar 'gyur gyi gzhan du ma yin pa ste /
translated: The meaning of this is that one is disciplined by the teaching of the three vehicles, the ≈örƒÅvakayƒÅna, etc. , and not otherwise.

original: rgyas par sngar gtan la phab po //
analyzed: rgyas par sngar gtan la phab po //
translated: This has been established in detail above.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'dul ba dang zhes pa la sogs pa'i don ni gdul bya'i bsam pa la ltos nas chos 'dul ba sna tshogs thabs kyi bye brag bstan pa dang / 'du 'dzi la sogs pas dben pa'i rnal 'byor gyi lung gis grol ba ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'dul ba dang zhes pa la sogs pa'i don ni gdul bya'i bsam pa la ltos nas chos 'dul ba sna tshogs thabs kyi bye brag bstan pa dang / 'du 'dzi la sogs pas dben pa'i rnal 'byor gyi lung gis grol ba ste /
translated: The discipline of the TathƒÅgatas, etc. , means that the various teachings of the Dharma and the various methods of discipline are taught in dependence on the thoughts of those to be disciplined, and that one is liberated by the transmission of yoga that is free from distraction, etc.

original: khyad par du rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi dbang du byas pa'o //üîΩrang gis ma yin zhes pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i @186a * //üîΩbstan pa la ma ltos par /
analyzed: khyad par du rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi dbang du byas pa'o // rang gis ma yin zhes pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i @186a * // bstan pa la ma ltos par /

original: rang gi shes rab kyis grol zhing mya ngan las 'da' ba ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi shes rab kyis grol zhing mya ngan las 'da' ba ma yin pa'o //
translated: Not by themselves means that they are not liberated and do not attain nirvƒÅ·πáa by their own wisdom without relying on the teaching of the TathƒÅgatas.

original: las kyi bag chags ma spangs zhes pa ni ji skad du /
analyzed: las kyi bag chags ma spangs zhes pa ni ji skad du /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe latent traces of karma are not abandoned‚Äù is like the following statement:

original: nyon mongs med kyang de dag la //
analyzed: nyon mongs med kyang de dag la //
translated: ‚ÄúEven though they are without afflictions,

original: las kyi nyes pa mthong ba bzhin //
analyzed: las kyi nyes pa mthong ba bzhin //
translated: they see the faults of karma.‚Äù

original: zhes gsungs pa lta bu dang / gzhan yang nyon mongs pa'i bag la nyal yang ma spangs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa lta bu dang / gzhan yang nyon mongs pa'i bag la nyal yang ma spangs pa'o //
translated: Moreover, the latent tendencies of the afflictions are also not abandoned.

original: bsam gyis mi khyab par yongs su bsgyur ba'i shi 'pho ma thob ces pa la /
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab par yongs su bsgyur ba'i shi 'pho ma thob ces pa la /
translated: ‚ÄúThe inconceivable transformation of death is not attained‚Äù
