analyzed: de nyid thob pa dang ma thob pa'i bye brag ni sngar bstan pa ltar shes par bya'o //
translated: . The difference between attaining that and not attaining that should be understood as previously explained.

original: yang 'jig rten gyi dang zhes pa la sogs pa'i don ni dag pa 'jig rten pa rjes kyis shes pas sbyin pa la sogs pa'i tshogs rdzogs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: yang 'jig rten gyi dang zhes pa la sogs pa'i don ni dag pa 'jig rten pa rjes kyis shes pas sbyin pa la sogs pa'i tshogs rdzogs par byed pa'o //
translated: Moreover, the meaning of ‚Äúmundane‚Äù and so on is that the pure mundane gnosis completes the accumulations of generosity and so on through subsequent gnosis.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa zag pa med pa ni mnyam par gzhag pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa zag pa med pa ni mnyam par gzhag pa'i ye shes so //
translated: The supramundane, uncontaminated gnosis is the gnosis of meditative equipoise.

original: de la / lha dang tshangs pa'i theg pa ni //
analyzed: de la / lha dang tshangs pa'i theg pa ni //
translated: The vehicle of gods and BrahmƒÅ

original: snyan par smra zhing khro mi bya //
analyzed: snyan par smra zhing khro mi bya //
translated: is speaking pleasantly and not being angry.

original: slong na chung yang sbyin par bya //
analyzed: slong na chung yang sbyin par bya //
translated: If one is asked, one should give even if one has little.

original: rnam pa 'di gsum gnas pas ni //
analyzed: rnam pa 'di gsum gnas pas ni //
translated: These three aspects, when present,

original: lhar skye ba yi rgyu yin no //üîΩzhes gsungs pa lta bu'am /
analyzed: lhar skye ba yi rgyu yin no // zhes gsungs pa lta bu'am /
translated: are the cause for rebirth as a god.

original: gzhan yang bsam gtan dang gzugs med kyi ting nge 'dzin bsgoms pa dang / de dag gi 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang bsam gtan dang gzugs med kyi ting nge 'dzin bsgoms pa dang / de dag gi 'bras bu'o //
translated: Or, alternatively, the cultivation of the meditative concentrations and formless absorptions, and their results.

original: tshangs pa'i theg pa ni khyad par du yang ting nge 'dzin gyis yongs su gzung ba'i tshad med pa rnams so //
analyzed: tshangs pa'i theg pa ni khyad par du yang ting nge 'dzin gyis yongs su gzung ba'i tshad med pa rnams so //
translated: The vehicle of BrahmƒÅ is the immeasurables, which are especially embraced by meditative concentration.

original: ji srid sems rnams 'jug gi bar //
analyzed: ji srid sems rnams 'jug gi bar //
translated: As long as the mind engages,

original: zhes pa ni phyin ci log gi sa bon dang bcas pa'i kun gzhi 'jug pa'i bar la de las byung ba'i gnas skabs kyi lam dang / 'bras bu'i gnas thug pa med pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni phyin ci log gi sa bon dang bcas pa'i kun gzhi 'jug pa'i bar la de las byung ba'i gnas skabs kyi lam dang / 'bras bu'i gnas thug pa med pa'o //
translated: this refers to the path of the stage that arises from that, and the stage of the result that is endless, as long as the foundation consciousness with the seeds of error engages.

original: de 'dra ba gnas gyur cing snang ba med pa'i ye shes mngon du byas pa'i spyod yul la ni theg pa med cing /
analyzed: de 'dra ba gnas gyur cing snang ba med pa'i ye shes mngon du byas pa'i spyod yul la ni theg pa med cing /
translated: In the domain where such a transformation has occurred and the wisdom of nonappearance is realized, there is no vehicle.

original: de la brten nas grol ba'i gang zag la sogs pa'i spros pa nye bar zhi ba'o //
analyzed: de la brten nas grol ba'i gang zag la sogs pa'i spros pa nye bar zhi ba'o //
translated: And based on that, the elaborations of the person who is liberated and so on are completely pacified.

original: de ltar na sna tshogs su gsungs pa ci zhe na /üîΩtheg pa rnam par gzhag ces pa la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de ltar na sna tshogs su gsungs pa ci zhe na / theg pa rnam par gzhag ces pa la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: It is taught in the statement the vehicles are presented as three.

original: de la rnam par grol ba gsum ni nyon mongs pa spangs pa nyid du mtshungs pa'i byang chub rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: de la rnam par grol ba gsum ni nyon mongs pa spangs pa nyid du mtshungs pa'i byang chub rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: Among them, the three liberations are the three kinds of enlightenment, which are similar in that they are the abandonment of afflictions.

original: chos la bdag med de nyid dang // zhes pa la sogs pas ni don dam pa'i de bzhin nyid dang / de rtogs pa'i ye shes nyon mongs pa las grol zhing shes bya'i sgrib pa yang spangs pas te /
analyzed: chos la bdag med de nyid dang // zhes pa la sogs pas ni don dam pa'i de bzhin nyid dang / de rtogs pa'i ye shes nyon mongs pa las grol zhing shes bya'i sgrib pa yang spangs pas te /
translated: The statement the reality of the selflessness of phenomena and so on refers to ultimate suchness and the gnosis that realizes it, which is liberated from afflictions and also abandons the obstructions to omniscience.üîΩThis is the Great Vehicle that is the nature of the result.üîΩThe statement that the hearers do not abandon those is

original: 'bras bu'i bdag nyid kyi theg pa @186b chen po'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i bdag nyid kyi theg pa @186b chen po'o //
translated: The statement just as the world is confused by the characteristics of forms and so on.üîΩAmong them, distracted by characteristics means distracted by the various specific and general characteristics of the aggregates and so on.üîΩ üîΩConfused by the characteristics of forms means confused by the characteristics of forms and so on.üîΩ üîΩConfused by the characteristics of the world means confused by the characteristics of the world.üîΩ

original: nyan thos rnams kyis de dag spangs pas ma yin pa nyid du gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: nyan thos rnams kyis de dag spangs pas ma yin pa nyid du gsungs pa ni /
translated: Confused by the characteristics of the elements means confused by the characteristics of the elements.

original: ji ltar zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: ji ltar zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: üîΩConfused by the characteristics of the aggregates means confused by the characteristics of the aggregates.üîΩ üîΩConfused by the characteristics of the sense spheres means confused by the characteristics of the sense spheres.üîΩ

original: de la mtshan nyid rnams kyis rab tu g-yengs zhes pa ni phung po la sogs pa'i rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid sna tshogs su rtogs pas g-yengs pa ste /
analyzed: de la mtshan nyid rnams kyis rab tu g-yengs zhes pa ni phung po la sogs pa'i rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid sna tshogs su rtogs pas g-yengs pa ste /
translated: Confused by the characteristics of the constituents means confused by the characteristics of the constituents.üîΩ üîΩConfused by the characteristics of the truths means confused by the characteristics of the truths.üîΩ üîΩConfused by the characteristics of the transcendent perfections means confused by the characteristics of the transcendent perfections.üîΩ üîΩConfused by the characteristics of the levels means confused by the characteristics of the levels.üîΩ üîΩConfused by the characteristics of the factors of enlightenment means confused by the characteristics of the factors of enlightenment.üîΩ üîΩConfused by the characteristics of the vehicles means confused by the characteristics of the vehicles.üîΩ üîΩConfused by the characteristics of the three times means confused by the characteristics of the three times.üîΩ üîΩConfused by the characteristics of the past means confused by the characteristics of the past.üîΩ üîΩConfused by the characteristics of the future means confused by the characteristics of the future.üîΩ üîΩConfused by

original: shes bya'i sgrib pa ma spangs pa'o //
analyzed: shes bya'i sgrib pa ma spangs pa'o //
translated: The obscurations to omniscience have not been eliminated.

original: de bzhin nyid du nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa mngon du rgyu ba spangs mod kyi /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid du nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa mngon du rgyu ba spangs mod kyi /
translated: The afflictive obscurations have been eliminated in terms of their manifest activity.

original: bag la nyal ba ma spangs pa'o //üîΩde rnams kyang tshor ba dang / 'du shes la skyon du lta ba'i sgo nas de dag nye bar zhi ba'i thabs 'ga' zhig la brten te /
analyzed: bag la nyal ba ma spangs pa'o // de rnams kyang tshor ba dang / 'du shes la skyon du lta ba'i sgo nas de dag nye bar zhi ba'i thabs 'ga' zhig la brten te /
translated: But their latent tendencies have not been eliminated.

original: de kho na nyid rtogs pa'i shes rab dang bral ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyi myos pas myos shing /
analyzed: de kho na nyid rtogs pa'i shes rab dang bral ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyi myos pas myos shing /
translated: Moreover, they are intoxicated by the intoxication of samƒÅdhi, which is divorced from the wisdom that realizes suchness, by means of some method that is based on the pacification of feelings and discriminations, which they view as faults.

original: nyon mongs pa mngon rgyu spangs pas /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa mngon rgyu spangs pas /
translated: Since they have eliminated the manifest causes of the afflictions,

original: zag pa med pa'i dbyings na 'khod pa'o //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i dbyings na 'khod pa'o //
translated: they abide in the uncontaminated dhƒÅtu.

original: de nyid rang gi 'bras bu mthar thug pa yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: de nyid rang gi 'bras bu mthar thug pa yin nam zhe na /
translated: Is that their ultimate fruition?

original: mthar mar phyin pa de las med ces pa'o //
analyzed: mthar mar phyin pa de las med ces pa'o //
translated: It is said that there is no going beyond that.

original: de lta na phyir zhing 'khor bar ldog gam snyam na /
analyzed: de lta na phyir zhing 'khor bar ldog gam snyam na /
translated: If that is so, then do they return to sa·πÉsƒÅra?

original: phyir kyang de las mi ldog ste /
analyzed: phyir kyang de las mi ldog ste /
translated: They do not return from that.

original: gang zag gi bdag med pa 'du byed pa skad cig ma nyid du rtogs pa dang / bdag nyid bya ba byas pa nyid du shes pas 'khor bar skye ba'i las sog pa med pa dang / sred pa dang len pa mngon du rgyu ba'i rkyen nyid ma tshang ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: gang zag gi bdag med pa 'du byed pa skad cig ma nyid du rtogs pa dang / bdag nyid bya ba byas pa nyid du shes pas 'khor bar skye ba'i las sog pa med pa dang / sred pa dang len pa mngon du rgyu ba'i rkyen nyid ma tshang ba'i phyir te /
translated: The selflessness of persons is realized as momentary compositional activity, and one‚Äôs own actions are recognized as having been done. Therefore, there is no accumulation of karma for rebirth in cyclic existence, and the conditions for the manifest craving and grasping are incomplete.

original: ji ltar rgya mtshor bsgyur ba'i shing gting du mi nub pa dang / yul gcig na gnas shing nges pa ma yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ji ltar rgya mtshor bsgyur ba'i shing gting du mi nub pa dang / yul gcig na gnas shing nges pa ma yin pa bzhin no //
translated: Just as a ship in the ocean does not sink, and just as a tree in one place is not certain.

original: zag pa med pa'i dbyings na dus ji srid kyi bar du 'khod cing gnas snyam na /
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i dbyings na dus ji srid kyi bar du 'khod cing gnas snyam na /
translated: If one wonders how long they remain and abide in the uncontaminated realm,

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: it is said, ‚Äúthrough samƒÅdhi, and so on.‚Äù

original: de na de dag nga yi yang //
analyzed: de na de dag nga yi yang //
translated: In that, they are also mine.

original: zhes pa la sogs pa ni sngar bstan pa ltar de dag nyid kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba'i sa bon dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyis nam zhig na zag pa med pa'i dbyings nas sad nas byang chub mchog tu sems bskyed de /
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa ni sngar bstan pa ltar de dag nyid kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba'i sa bon dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyis nam zhig na zag pa med pa'i dbyings nas sad nas byang chub mchog tu sems bskyed de /
translated: As was previously explained, by the power of the roots of virtue and the blessings of the Tathagata, they will awaken from the uncontaminated realm and generate the supreme mind of enlightenment.

original: tshogs gnyis su kha bskangs nas /
analyzed: tshogs gnyis su kha bskangs nas /
translated: Then, having completed the two collections,

original: chos kyi sku thob par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: chos kyi sku thob par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: they will attain the dharmakaya.

original: 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa las chos thams cad bsdus pa zhes bya ba'i le'u ste gnyis pa'i bshad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa las chos thams cad bsdus pa zhes bya ba'i le'u ste gnyis pa'i bshad pa rdzogs so /
translated: This completes the explanation of the second chapter of the Sutra on Entering Lanka called ‚ÄúThe Summary of All Dharmas.‚Äù

original: // / de la le'u lhag ma 'di rnams kyis kyang chos thams cad bsdus pa'i don shes par bya ba'i gnas dang / de rnams kyi de kho na nyid de @187a * //
analyzed: // / de la le'u lhag ma 'di rnams kyis kyang chos thams cad bsdus pa'i don shes par bya ba'i gnas dang / de rnams kyi de kho na nyid de @187a * //
translated: In the remaining chapters, the meaning of the summary of all dharmas should be understood in terms of the basis, the suchness of those dharmas, which is the tathiigata essence,

original: bzhin gshegs pa'i snying por 'gyur ba dang / de sbyong bar byed pa'i lam dang / lam gyis thob par bya ba'i 'bras bu ste /
analyzed: bzhin gshegs pa'i snying por 'gyur ba dang / de sbyong bar byed pa'i lam dang / lam gyis thob par bya ba'i 'bras bu ste /
translated: the path that purifies that essence, and the result that is attained by the path.

original: bzhi po de rnams nyid rtsod pa spangs pa la sogs pa'i sgo nas rgyas par ston te /
analyzed: bzhi po de rnams nyid rtsod pa spangs pa la sogs pa'i sgo nas rgyas par ston te /
translated: These four are taught extensively by way of abandoning disputes and so forth.

original: des na mdo sde 'di'i don ni rnam pa bzhi po de rnams su 'dus shing de rnams kyang kun rdzob tu sems kyi rnam par 'phrul pa yin pa la /
analyzed: des na mdo sde 'di'i don ni rnam pa bzhi po de rnams su 'dus shing de rnams kyang kun rdzob tu sems kyi rnam par 'phrul pa yin pa la /
translated: Thus, the meaning of this sutra is included in these four topics, and they are also mental emanations in the relative.

original: don dam par stong pa nyid de /
analyzed: don dam par stong pa nyid de /
translated: In the ultimate, they are emptiness.

original: de ltar na rig pa dang stong pa zung du 'jug pa rnam par rig pa tsam gyis dbu ma nyid 'di'i brjod par bya ba yin no zhes sngar bstan no //
analyzed: de ltar na rig pa dang stong pa zung du 'jug pa rnam par rig pa tsam gyis dbu ma nyid 'di'i brjod par bya ba yin no zhes sngar bstan no //
translated: Thus, the object of expression of this Madhyamaka is the union of awareness and emptiness, mere awareness.

original: de la le'u gsum pa 'di ni don rnam pa bcu bzhis ston pa las /
analyzed: de la le'u gsum pa 'di ni don rnam pa bcu bzhis ston pa las /
translated: In this third chapter, among the fourteen topics taught,

original: dang po sngar bstan pa'i yid kyi lus nyid rgyas par ston pa ni /
analyzed: dang po sngar bstan pa'i yid kyi lus nyid rgyas par ston pa ni /
translated: the first is the extensive teaching on the mental body that was previously mentioned.

original: de nas yang zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de nas yang zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: This is the topic of the passage beginning with ‚ÄúThen, again‚Ä¶‚Äù

original: de yang don rnam pa drug gi sgo nas shes par bya ste /
analyzed: de yang don rnam pa drug gi sgo nas shes par bya ste /
translated: This should be understood in terms of six topics.

original: de la dang po yid kyi lus thob par byed pa'i rgyu ni ting nge 'dzin khyad par can te /
analyzed: de la dang po yid kyi lus thob par byed pa'i rgyu ni ting nge 'dzin khyad par can te /
translated: First, the cause for attaining the mental body is special samƒÅdhi.

original: de yang sa gsum pa la byang chub sems dpa' rnams ting nge 'dzin dang thos pa'i gzungs khyad par du 'phags pa thob par gsungs pas yid kyi lus kyang dang por thob pa'i sa mtshams ni gnas skabs de nyid nas yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de yang sa gsum pa la byang chub sems dpa' rnams ting nge 'dzin dang thos pa'i gzungs khyad par du 'phags pa thob par gsungs pas yid kyi lus kyang dang por thob pa'i sa mtshams ni gnas skabs de nyid nas yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: Moreover, since it is said that on the third ground the bodhisattvas attain the especially exalted concentration and retention of hearing, it should be understood that the level at which they first attain the mental body is from that point on.

original: 'di'i rang gi ngo bo yang rdul phra rab 'dus pa ma yin pa ting nge 'dzin dang ye shes kyi ngo bor gyur pa'o //
analyzed: 'di'i rang gi ngo bo yang rdul phra rab 'dus pa ma yin pa ting nge 'dzin dang ye shes kyi ngo bor gyur pa'o //
translated: Its nature is not a composite of subtle particles, but is the essence of concentration and gnosis.

original: rnam pa ni mtshan gyi me tog gis brgyan par 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur ba lta bur kha dog dang dbyibs kyi rnam par snang ba'o //
analyzed: rnam pa ni mtshan gyi me tog gis brgyan par 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur ba lta bur kha dog dang dbyibs kyi rnam par snang ba'o //
translated: Its aspect is that it appears in the form of color and shape, like a flower ornamenting the tree of the major marks, or like the elements and what is derived from the elements.

original: nges pa'i tshig gam sgra bshad pa'i rgyu mtshan ni sngar bshad pa ltar yid ltar mgyogs shing thogs pa med pa dang / cha shas 'dus pas yid kyi lus zhes pa'o //
analyzed: nges pa'i tshig gam sgra bshad pa'i rgyu mtshan ni sngar bshad pa ltar yid ltar mgyogs shing thogs pa med pa dang / cha shas 'dus pas yid kyi lus zhes pa'o //
translated: The reason for the definition or the etymology is that, as explained above, it is called the mental body because it is swift and unimpeded like the mind and because it is a composite of parts.

original: rnam par dbye ba ni gsum du 'gyur ba las /
analyzed: rnam par dbye ba ni gsum du 'gyur ba las /
translated: The classification is threefold.

original: dang po ting nge 'dzin gyi bde ba la snyoms par 'jug pa'i yid kyi lus ni sa gsum pa nas bdun pa'i bar la rnam par shes pa'i tshogs brgyad gnas ma gyur ba rnam pa mang por snang ba /
analyzed: dang po ting nge 'dzin gyi bde ba la snyoms par 'jug pa'i yid kyi lus ni sa gsum pa nas bdun pa'i bar la rnam par shes pa'i tshogs brgyad gnas ma gyur ba rnam pa mang por snang ba /
translated: First, the mental body that enters into the bliss of samadhi is from the third to the seventh bhumis.üîΩThe many appearances of the eight consciousnesses that have not transformed are realized to be empty of their own entities.

original: rang rang gi ngo bos dben par rtogs shing bsgoms pa kun gzhi'i rgya mtsho la 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa'i rlabs kyi mtshan nyid zag pa dang bcas pa'i bde ba la snyoms par 'jug pa'i yid mi 'byung ste /
analyzed: rang rang gi ngo bos dben par rtogs shing bsgoms pa kun gzhi'i rgya mtsho la 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa'i rlabs kyi mtshan nyid zag pa dang bcas pa'i bde ba la snyoms par 'jug pa'i yid mi 'byung ste /
translated: The mind that enters into the bliss of the samadhi of the waves of the consciousness that enters the ocean of the alaya does not arise.

original: srid pa shas che ba la sogs pa'i bsam gtan nyon mongs pa can spang ba'o //
analyzed: srid pa shas che ba la sogs pa'i bsam gtan nyon mongs pa can spang ba'o //
translated: The samadhi of the afflictions, such as the predominance of existence, and so on, are abandoned.

original: des na zag pa @187b med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi bde ba la reg par gnas pa ste /
analyzed: des na zag pa @187b med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi bde ba la reg par gnas pa ste /
translated: Therefore, one abides in the bliss of the undefiled samadhi.

original: rang gi sems snang ba'i spyod yul kun rdzob sems kyi dngos por yod pa dang / don dam pa'i dngos por med pa ste /
analyzed: rang gi sems snang ba'i spyod yul kun rdzob sems kyi dngos por yod pa dang / don dam pa'i dngos por med pa ste /
translated: The objects of one's mind are the conventional things that exist as the mind and do not exist as ultimate things.

original: zung 'jug gi don shes pa'i shes rab dang ting nge 'dzin gyi chos su gyur pas yid kyi lus zhes bya'o //
analyzed: zung 'jug gi don shes pa'i shes rab dang ting nge 'dzin gyi chos su gyur pas yid kyi lus zhes bya'o //
translated: Since it is the wisdom and samadhi that understand the meaning of union, it is called the mental body.

original: glegs bam 'ga' zhig las /
analyzed: glegs bam 'ga' zhig las /
translated: In some texts,

original: bde ba la snyoms par 'jug pa'i yid kyi lus 'byung ste zhes ston pa'i skabs su ni /
analyzed: bde ba la snyoms par 'jug pa'i yid kyi lus 'byung ste zhes ston pa'i skabs su ni /
translated: it is taught that the mental body that enters into the bliss arises.

original: gnas skabs der rnam par shes pa'i gnas ma gyur ba dang / dben par rtogs pa'i shes rab dang ting nge 'dzin thob pas de 'dra ba'i bde ba la snyoms par 'jug pa'i yid kyi lus thob ces pa'o //
analyzed: gnas skabs der rnam par shes pa'i gnas ma gyur ba dang / dben par rtogs pa'i shes rab dang ting nge 'dzin thob pas de 'dra ba'i bde ba la snyoms par 'jug pa'i yid kyi lus thob ces pa'o //
translated: At that time, since the transformation of the abode of consciousness and the wisdom and samadhi that realize voidness are attained, the mental body that enters into such bliss is attained.

original: gzhan yang 'dir sa gsum dang zhes pa ni /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'dir sa gsum dang zhes pa ni /
translated: Furthermore, in this context, the three bhumis are

original: dang po nas gsum pa'i bar te /
analyzed: dang po nas gsum pa'i bar te /
translated: from the first to the third.

original: sa dang po la yang nam mkha' mdzod gyi ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa thob par gsungs pas gnas skabs de nyid nas yid kyi lus thob par 'gyur ba la yang 'gal ba med de /
analyzed: sa dang po la yang nam mkha' mdzod gyi ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa thob par gsungs pas gnas skabs de nyid nas yid kyi lus thob par 'gyur ba la yang 'gal ba med de /
translated: Since it is taught that on the first bhumi the samadhi of the sky treasury and so forth are attained, there is no contradiction in the mental body being attained from that very time.

original: ji skad du 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las /
analyzed: ji skad du 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las /
translated: As it says in the noble Perfection of Wisdom:

original: mthong ba'i lam thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la ni /
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la ni /
translated: Bodhisattvas who have attained the path of seeing

original: mig gi nad la sogs pa 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mig gi nad la sogs pa 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: do not develop eye diseases and so on.

original: de la chos kyi ngo bo nyid rtogs pa'i yid kyi lus ni /
analyzed: de la chos kyi ngo bo nyid rtogs pa'i yid kyi lus ni /
translated: The mental body that realizes the reality of phenomena

original: khyad par du byang chub sems dpa' sa brgyad pa la snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin thob nas /
analyzed: khyad par du byang chub sems dpa' sa brgyad pa la snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin thob nas /
translated: is the special body of the bodhisattva on the eighth level, who has attained the concentration of absence of appearance.

original: de ltar zhi ba'i bsam gtan la snyoms par zhugs pa na /
analyzed: de ltar zhi ba'i bsam gtan la snyoms par zhugs pa na /
translated: When he enters into such a peaceful concentration,

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyis de'i tshogs gnyis rdzogs par bya ba'i don du /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyis de'i tshogs gnyis rdzogs par bya ba'i don du /
translated: the buddhas, in order to perfect his two collections,

original: ting nge 'dzin las langs nas rjes kyi shes pa la chos thams cad sgyu ma la sogs pa dang 'dra bar rtogs pa dang / stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyi rigs thob cing /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin las langs nas rjes kyi shes pa la chos thams cad sgyu ma la sogs pa dang 'dra bar rtogs pa dang / stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyi rigs thob cing /
translated: cause him to rise from that concentration and in the subsequent cognition to realize that all phenomena are like illusions and so on and to attain the potential for all the qualities of buddhahood, such as the powers and fearlessnesses.

original: de rnams kyi rang bzhin ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pa dang / de 'dra ba'i lus kyis sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad du song zhing /
analyzed: de rnams kyi rang bzhin ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pa dang / de 'dra ba'i lus kyis sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad du song zhing /
translated: The nature of those is just as it is realized, and with such a body one goes to all the buddhafields.

original: de rnams las the tshom gyi gnas thams cad bcad pas chos kyi ngo bo nyid ji lta ba bzhin rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams las the tshom gyi gnas thams cad bcad pas chos kyi ngo bo nyid ji lta ba bzhin rtogs pa'o //
translated: And since all the bases of doubt are eliminated, the nature of phenomena is just as it is realized.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: And thus it is said:

original: sa bdun dag ni sems yin te //
analyzed: sa bdun dag ni sems yin te //
translated: The seven stages are the mind.

original: snang ba med pas brgyad pa'o //üîΩzhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snang ba med pas brgyad pa'o // zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The eighth is the absence of appearance.

original: 'dir sgyu ma la sogs pa'i chos la snang ba med pa'i rab tu rnam par 'byed zhes pa ni @188a * //
analyzed: 'dir sgyu ma la sogs pa'i chos la snang ba med pa'i rab tu rnam par 'byed zhes pa ni @188a * //
translated: Here, the discernment of the absence of appearance with regard to phenomena such as illusion

original: snga ma ltar snang ba med pa las langs nas rjes kyi gnas skabs na sgyu ma la sogs pa'i chos la rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'o //
analyzed: snga ma ltar snang ba med pa las langs nas rjes kyi gnas skabs na sgyu ma la sogs pa'i chos la rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'o //
translated: is, as before, the discernment of phenomena such as illusion in the subsequent state, having arisen from the absence of appearance.

original: sems kyi gnas ni rnam par shes pa rnams kyi ma dag pa'i snang ba gnas gyur ba'o //
analyzed: sems kyi gnas ni rnam par shes pa rnams kyi ma dag pa'i snang ba gnas gyur ba'o //
translated: The abode of mind is the transformation of the impure appearances of the consciousnesses.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo gzhan ni thod rgal gyi ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo gzhan ni thod rgal gyi ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa'o //
translated: Other doors of samadhi are the samadhis of skipping, etc.

original: gzhan yang mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / dbang bcu la sogs pa'i me tog gi rgyan gyis rgyas par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / dbang bcu la sogs pa'i me tog gi rgyan gyis rgyas par bya'o //
translated: Moreover, one should be adorned with the flowers of the thirty-two marks, the ten powers, etc.

original: de la ris su lhan cig skyes pa'i 'du byed kyi bya ba'i yang kyi lus ni sa brgyad pa de nyid la byang chub sems dpa' theg pa gzhan dang ma 'dres pa sangs rgyas nyid kyi ris su lhan cig skyes pa /
analyzed: de la ris su lhan cig skyes pa'i 'du byed kyi bya ba'i yang kyi lus ni sa brgyad pa de nyid la byang chub sems dpa' theg pa gzhan dang ma 'dres pa sangs rgyas nyid kyi ris su lhan cig skyes pa /
translated: Therein, the body of the bodhisattva who is born in the family of the Buddha, who is not mixed with other vehicles, who is born in the family of the Buddha on that eighth stage,

original: mtshan ma dang rtsol ba med cing lhun gyis grub par sems can gyi bya ba la sogs pa byed pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi tshogs su gyur ba'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma dang rtsol ba med cing lhun gyis grub par sems can gyi bya ba la sogs pa byed pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi tshogs su gyur ba'o //
translated: is the accumulation of samadhis which are spontaneously accomplished without signs and effort, and which perform the activities of beings, etc.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad rang gis rig pa ni sngar bstan pa ltar sangs rgyas kyi stobs la sogs pa'i yon tan gyi rigs rnams thob pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad rang gis rig pa ni sngar bstan pa ltar sangs rgyas kyi stobs la sogs pa'i yon tan gyi rigs rnams thob pa'o //
translated: The self-realization of all the qualities of the Buddha is the attainment of the types of good qualities such as the powers of the Buddha, as previously explained.

original: 'dir sa brgyad pa nas theg pa gzhan dang ma 'dres pa yang /
analyzed: 'dir sa brgyad pa nas theg pa gzhan dang ma 'dres pa yang /
translated: Here, the eighth ground and above are not mixed with other vehicles.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa las sa brgyad pa yan chod ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi thun mong ma yin pa'i lam nyid du gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa las sa brgyad pa yan chod ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi thun mong ma yin pa'i lam nyid du gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the Commentary on the Perfection of Wisdom says that from the eighth ground onward is the very uncommon path of bodhisattvas.

original: tshigs su bcad pa'i don ni bden pa gnyis la ltos te shes par bya'o //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa'i don ni bden pa gnyis la ltos te shes par bya'o //
translated: The meaning of the verse should be understood in terms of the two truths.

original: de nas yang byang chub sems dpa' zhes pa la sogs pas sngar bstan pa'i dgongs pa can gyi mdo'i don gsal bar 'chad de /
analyzed: de nas yang byang chub sems dpa' zhes pa la sogs pas sngar bstan pa'i dgongs pa can gyi mdo'i don gsal bar 'chad de /
translated: Then, beginning with ‚ÄúThen the bodhisattva,‚Äù it clearly explains the meaning of the sutra that was taught with an implied teaching.

original: de yang rnam pa bzhir 'gyur ba las dang po don gzhan la dgongs pa ni gang du bcom ldan 'das kyis mtshams med pa lnga'i las byas na rnam par shes par gsungs pa lta bu 'am /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa bzhir 'gyur ba las dang po don gzhan la dgongs pa ni gang du bcom ldan 'das kyis mtshams med pa lnga'i las byas na rnam par shes par gsungs pa lta bu 'am /
translated: This is fourfold. The first is the intention regarding another meaning, such as when the Bhagavat said, ‚ÄúIf one commits the five heinous actions, one will be born in the hell of Unceasing.‚Äù

original: gzhan yang mtshams med pa lnga'i las byas kyang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i byin gyi rlabs kyis thar ba la mi sgrab pa nyid du gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang mtshams med pa lnga'i las byas kyang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i byin gyi rlabs kyis thar ba la mi sgrab pa nyid du gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: Moreover, it is said that even if one has committed the five heinous actions, one is not prevented from liberation by the blessings of the buddhas and bodhisattvas.

original: de la dag dang po'i dgongs gzhi ni sred pa dang ma rig pa la sogs pa ma dang pha la sogs pa dang cung zad chos mthun pa stong pa nyid du rtogs pa'i shes rab kyis bcad cing bsad par gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de la dag dang po'i dgongs gzhi ni sred pa dang ma rig pa la sogs pa ma dang pha la sogs pa dang cung zad chos mthun pa stong pa nyid du rtogs pa'i shes rab kyis bcad cing bsad par gyur ba'o //
translated: The first intention is that the mother and father, etc., are killed by the wisdom that realizes emptiness, which is slightly similar to craving, ignorance, etc.

original: dgongs pa ni gang la la dag gis mi dge ba ru gtogs pa'i phyi rol gyi mtshams med pa'i las byas shing /
analyzed: dgongs pa ni gang la la dag gis mi dge ba ru gtogs pa'i phyi rol gyi mtshams med pa'i las byas shing /
translated: The intention is that some people commit the external heinous actions that are included in nonvirtue,

original: 'gyod pa chen pos @188b yid zil gyis mnan te /
analyzed: 'gyod pa chen pos @188b yid zil gyis mnan te /
translated: and their minds are overwhelmed by great regret.

original: gnyen po bsgom pa la brtson par mi byed par gnas pa nas de dag la mtshams med pa'i las byas nas phyir zhing grol bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan pas thog ma nyid du dbugs 'byin pa ste mya ngan gyi gdung ba sel ba'o //
analyzed: gnyen po bsgom pa la brtson par mi byed par gnas pa nas de dag la mtshams med pa'i las byas nas phyir zhing grol bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan pas thog ma nyid du dbugs 'byin pa ste mya ngan gyi gdung ba sel ba'o //
translated: They do not strive to cultivate the antidotes, and they think, We are liberated from those actions of immediate retribution.

original: yang de dag gis dgongs don thos par gyur ba na /
analyzed: yang de dag gis dgongs don thos par gyur ba na /
translated: When they hear the teaching of the interpretable meaning, they think, We are liberated from those actions of immediate retribution.üîΩ They think, We are liberated from those actions of immediate retribution.

original: phyir zhing skrag par 'gyur ba'am /üîΩde las gzhan yang rung ste /üîΩsprul pa'i nyan thos 'ga' zhig gi mthus /
analyzed: phyir zhing skrag par 'gyur ba'am / de las gzhan yang rung ste / sprul pa'i nyan thos 'ga' zhig gi mthus /
translated: They think, We are liberated from those actions of immediate retribution.üîΩ They think, We are liberated from those actions of immediate retribution.üîΩ They think, We are liberated from those actions of immediate retribution.üîΩ They think, We are liberated from those actions of immediate retribution.üîΩ They think, We are liberated from those actions of immediate retribution.üîΩ They think, We are liberated from those actions of immediate retribution.

original: phyi rol gyi mtshams med pa byas kyang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i byin gyi rlabs kyis de dag gis sgrib par mi 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi mtshams med pa byas kyang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i byin gyi rlabs kyis de dag gis sgrib par mi 'gyur zhing /
translated: They think, We are liberated from those actions of immediate retribution.üîΩ They think, We are liberated from those actions of immediate retribution.üîΩ They think, We are liberated from those actions of immediate retribution.üîΩ They think, We are liberated from those actions of immediate retribution.üîΩ They think, We are liberated from those actions of immediate retribution.üîΩ They think, We are liberated from those actions of immediate retribution.üîΩ They think, We are liberated from those actions of immediate retribution.üîΩ They think, We are liberated from those actions of immediate retribution.üîΩ They think, We are liberated from those actions of immediate retribution.üîΩ They think, We are liberated from those actions of immediate retribution.üîΩ They think, We are liberated from those actions of immediate retribution.üîΩ They think, We are liberated from those actions of immediate retribution.üîΩ They think, We are liberated from those actions of immediate retribution.üîΩ They think, We are liberated from those actions of immediate retribution.üîΩ They think, We are liberated from those actions of immediate retribution.üîΩ They think, We are liberated from those actions of immediate retribution.üîΩ They think, We are liberated from those actions of immediate retribution.üîΩ They think, We are liberated from those actions of immediate retribution.

original: phyir zhing mngon par rtogs pa thob par 'gyur ro zhes ston pa la sogs pa ste /üîΩde yang ji ltar rgyal po ma skyes dgra'i 'gyod pa bsal ba las /
analyzed: phyir zhing mngon par rtogs pa thob par 'gyur ro zhes ston pa la sogs pa ste /üîΩde yang ji ltar rgyal po ma skyes dgra'i 'gyod pa bsal ba las /
translated: They think, We are liberated from those actions of immediate retribution.üîΩ They think, We are liberated from those actions of immediate

original: ji ltar rgyal po des bcom ldan 'das la pha bsad pa'i 'gyod pa bsal ba'i thabs zhus pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis 'gyod pa la sogs pa de dag 'phags pa 'jam dpal gyis lhag ma ma lus par sel nus pa nyid du dgongs nas /üîΩsangs rgyas kyi mthus tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus /
analyzed: ji ltar rgyal po des bcom ldan 'das la pha bsad pa'i 'gyod pa bsal ba'i thabs zhus pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis 'gyod pa la sogs pa de dag 'phags pa 'jam dpal gyis lhag ma ma lus par sel nus pa nyid du dgongs nas / sangs rgyas kyi mthus tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus /
translated: The king asked the Bhagavat how to remove the remorse of having killed his father, and the Bhagavat thought, Only the noble Manjusri can remove that remorse and so forth without remainder.

original: rgyal po ma skyes dgra la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: rgyal po ma skyes dgra la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: By the power of the Buddha, the venerable Shariputra said to King Ajatashatru,üîΩGreat King, invite the youthful Manjusri for a meal tomorrow, and he will remove your evil doubts.

original: rgyal po chen po 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa sang bshos la spyan drangs shig dang / des khyod kyi the tshom ngan pa de yang bsal bar 'gyur ro zhes pa la sogs pa dang / rgyal po des kyang sh'a ri'i bus ji ltar bsgos pa bzhin du spyan drangs shing bshos drangs nas 'phags pa 'jam dpal bdag gi 'gyod pa de bsal du gsol zhes byas pa dang /
analyzed: rgyal po chen po 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa sang bshos la spyan drangs shig dang / des khyod kyi the tshom ngan pa de yang bsal bar 'gyur ro zhes pa la sogs pa dang / rgyal po des kyang sh'a ri'i bus ji ltar bsgos pa bzhin du spyan drangs shing bshos drangs nas 'phags pa 'jam dpal bdag gi 'gyod pa de bsal du gsol zhes byas pa dang /
translated: And the king, just as he was instructed by Shariputra, invited him and served him a meal, saying, Noble Manjusri, please remove my remorse.

original: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
translated: Manjusri said,

original: khyod kyi 'gyod pa de ni sangs rgyas gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyis kyang bsal bar mi nus so zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: khyod kyi 'gyod pa de ni sangs rgyas gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyis kyang bsal bar mi nus so zhes gsungs so //
translated: Even the buddhas, as numerous as the grains of sand in the Ganges river, would not be able to remove your regret.‚Äù

original: de nas rgyal po de shing bcad pa bzhin du sa chen po 'di la 'gyel bar gyur to //
analyzed: de nas rgyal po de shing bcad pa bzhin du sa chen po 'di la 'gyel bar gyur to //
translated: Then the king fell to the ground like a felled tree.

original: de nas gnas brtan 'od srungs chen pos rgyal po la 'di skad ces smras te /
analyzed: de nas gnas brtan 'od srungs chen pos rgyal po la 'di skad ces smras te /
translated: The elder MahƒÅkƒÅ≈õyapa said to the king,üîΩ‚ÄúGreat king, do not be afraid or terrified. The youthful Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´ is skilled in explaining the intention. Ask him what he was thinking when he taught that.‚Äù

original: rgyal po chen po ma 'jigs ma skrag cig /'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa ni dgongs pa'i bshad pa la mkhas pa yin gyis 'di ci la dgongs te de skad du ston ces zhus shig / de nas rgyal po des sa'i steng nas slar langs te /üîΩde bzhin du @189a * //
analyzed: rgyal po chen po ma 'jigs ma skrag cig /'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa ni dgongs pa'i bshad pa la mkhas pa yin gyis 'di ci la dgongs te de skad du ston ces zhus shig / de nas rgyal po des sa'i steng nas slar langs te / de bzhin du @189a * //
translated: Then the king rose up from the groundüîΩand asked Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´ just as he had been instructed.

original: zhus pa dang 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
analyzed: zhus pa dang 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
translated: Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´ said,

original: rgyal po chen po de ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: rgyal po chen po de ji snyam du sems /
translated: ‚ÄúGreat king, what do you think?

original: chos gang chos gang gis kyang skyed par mi 'gyur ba'i chos des chos gang yang bsal bar nus sam /
analyzed: chos gang chos gang gis kyang skyed par mi 'gyur ba'i chos des chos gang yang bsal bar nus sam /
translated: Can a phenomenon that does not produce any other phenomenon remove any other phenomenon?‚Äù

original: gsol pa / 'jam dpal de ma lags so //
analyzed: gsol pa / 'jam dpal de ma lags so //
translated: He replied, ‚ÄúMa√±ju≈õrƒ´, it is not so.‚Äù

original: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
translated: Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´ said,

original: ngas de la dgongs te sangs rgyas de snyed kyis khyod kyi 'gyod pa de bsal bar mi nus so zhes de skad smra'o zhes pa la sogs pa'i bar rgyas par gsungs te /
analyzed: ngas de la dgongs te sangs rgyas de snyed kyis khyod kyi 'gyod pa de bsal bar mi nus so zhes de skad smra'o zhes pa la sogs pa'i bar rgyas par gsungs te /
translated: ‚ÄúI was thinking of that when I said that all those buddhas will not be able to clear away your regret.‚Äù

original: don dam pa'i de bzhin nyid la bsal bar bya rgyu la sogs pa med pas bsal mi nus so zhes zab mo bstan pas des snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin thob cing /
analyzed: don dam pa'i de bzhin nyid la bsal bar bya rgyu la sogs pa med pas bsal mi nus so zhes zab mo bstan pas des snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin thob cing /
translated: Since there is nothing to be cleared away in ultimate suchness, it is said that it cannot be cleared away. By teaching this profound truth, the king attained the samƒÅdhi of nonappearance.

original: gzhan yang bstan pa 'di bstan pa'i tshe rgyal po ma skyes dgras mthun pa'i chos la bzod pa thob par gyur to zhes pa la sogs pa rgyas par gsungs te /
analyzed: gzhan yang bstan pa 'di bstan pa'i tshe rgyal po ma skyes dgras mthun pa'i chos la bzod pa thob par gyur to zhes pa la sogs pa rgyas par gsungs te /
translated: Moreover, when this teaching was given, King AjƒÅta≈õatru attained acceptance of the concordant dharma.

original: de dag gi 'gyod pa la sogs pa bsal te mthar gyis bskal pa mthong na dga' zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de dag gi 'gyod pa la sogs pa bsal te mthar gyis bskal pa mthong na dga' zhes bya ba la /
translated: Having cleared away his regret and so on, he eventually attained the eon called Delightful to Behold.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams 'dam gyi rnyog pa med par de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas yul rnam par dag pa zhes bya bar 'gyur te zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams 'dam gyi rnyog pa med par de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas yul rnam par dag pa zhes bya bar 'gyur te zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: The world system will be free of the mud of conflict, and the Tathagata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One will be called Pure Domain.

original: sh'a ri'i bu la sogs pa yang sprul pa'i nyan thos su sngar bstan no //
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu la sogs pa yang sprul pa'i nyan thos su sngar bstan no //
translated: And Shariputra and so forth are previously taught to be emanation shravakas.

original: de la 'dir tshig gi don bshad pa la /üîΩdga' ba'i 'dod chags dang ldan pa ni dga' ba la mngon par zhen pa'am /
analyzed: de la 'dir tshig gi don bshad pa la / dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang ldan pa ni dga' ba la mngon par zhen pa'am /
translated: Here, the meaning of the words is explained.

original: de dang lhan cig pa'i 'dod chags te /
analyzed: de dang lhan cig pa'i 'dod chags te /
translated: Possessing the desire for joy means either attachment to joy or desire that is concomitant with it.

original: de dang 'brel ba'i sems rgyud yang srid pa mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i sred pa ste /
analyzed: de dang 'brel ba'i sems rgyud yang srid pa mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i sred pa ste /
translated: It is the craving that is the cause for the mindstream connected with that to accomplish rebirth.

original: 'dod chags nyid dang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags nyid dang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: It should be applied to desire itself.

original: de yang bu la rjes su chags par gyur pa'i ma dang chos mthun pas ma zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de yang bu la rjes su chags par gyur pa'i ma dang chos mthun pas ma zhes bya'o //
translated: And that is called mother because it is similar to a mother who is attached to her child.

original: ji ltar pha ni bu rnams la kha zas dang grong khyer skyed cing gtod par byed pa ltar ma rig pas kyang zag pa dang bcas pa'i las mngon par 'du byas pa'i sgo nas skye mched kyi grong skyed cing gtod par byed pas pha zhes pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar pha ni bu rnams la kha zas dang grong khyer skyed cing gtod par byed pa ltar ma rig pas kyang zag pa dang bcas pa'i las mngon par 'du byas pa'i sgo nas skye mched kyi grong skyed cing gtod par byed pas pha zhes pa'o //
translated: Just as a father produces and hands over food and a city to his sons, so too ignorance produces and hands over the city of the sense bases by way of the manifest karma of those with defilements.

original: de gnyis shin tu rtsa ba nas bcad pa ni stong pa nyid du rtogs pa'i shes rab kyi ral gris so //
analyzed: de gnyis shin tu rtsa ba nas bcad pa ni stong pa nyid du rtogs pa'i shes rab kyi ral gris so //
translated: Those two are completely cut from the root by the sword of the wisdom that realizes emptiness.

original: sgrib pa gnyis kyi bag la nyal ba ni skabs su bab pa na sdug bsngal skyed par byed pas ngag dang mtshungs pa ste /
analyzed: sgrib pa gnyis kyi bag la nyal ba ni skabs su bab pa na sdug bsngal skyed par byed pas ngag dang mtshungs pa ste /
translated: The latent states of the two obstructions generate suffering when the occasion arises, and so they are like a snake.

original: dpe gzhan yang skyes bu'i lus la byi ba'i dug zhugs pa na /
analyzed: dpe gzhan yang skyes bu'i lus la byi ba'i dug zhugs pa na /

analyzed: de ma thag tu sdug @189b bsngal skyed par byed pa ma yin kyang /

original: dus phyis 'byung ba chen po'i rkyen gzhan dang tshogs pa na sdug bsngal skyed par byed pa bzhin du las dang nyon mongs pa'i bag chags rnams kyang ste /
analyzed: dus phyis 'byung ba chen po'i rkyen gzhan dang tshogs pa na sdug bsngal skyed par byed pa bzhin du las dang nyon mongs pa'i bag chags rnams kyang ste /

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /

original: lus can rnams kyi las rnams ni //
analyzed: lus can rnams kyi las rnams ni //

original: bskal pa brgyar yang chud mi za //
analyzed: bskal pa brgyar yang chud mi za //

original: zhes pa la sogs ba gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs ba gsungs pa lta bu'o //

original: de dag bcom pa ni snga ma ltar ro //
analyzed: de dag bcom pa ni snga ma ltar ro //

original: dge 'dun gyi dbyen ni phung po phan tshun mtshan nyid mi mthun pa'i las dang srid pa'i srad bus bsdus shing tshogs nyid du byas pa ste /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi dbyen ni phung po phan tshun mtshan nyid mi mthun pa'i las dang srid pa'i srad bus bsdus shing tshogs nyid du byas pa ste /
translated: A schism in the Sa·πÖgha is a collection of aggregates that are bound together by the thread of karma and existence, with discordant characteristics.

original: ji ltar tshogs su gyur pa'i mchog dge 'dun no zhes bstan pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ji ltar tshogs su gyur pa'i mchog dge 'dun no zhes bstan pa lta bu'o //
translated: As it is taught: ‚ÄúThe Sa·πÖgha is the supreme collection.‚Äù

original: de rnam par phye zhing dengs par byas pa ni yang dag pa'i shes rab kyis so //
analyzed: de rnam par phye zhing dengs par byas pa ni yang dag pa'i shes rab kyis so //
translated: It is divided and dispersed by right wisdom.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni phung po la sogs pa'i rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid shes pa'am /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni phung po la sogs pa'i rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid shes pa'am /
translated: The TathƒÅgata is the knowledge of the general and specific characteristics of the aggregates and so on.

original: de rnams rang gi sems snang ba tsam du shes par byed pa dang tha ma la pa'i shes pa gzugs la sogs pa'i ngo bo tsam 'dzin pa /
analyzed: de rnams rang gi sems snang ba tsam du shes par byed pa dang tha ma la pa'i shes pa gzugs la sogs pa'i ngo bo tsam 'dzin pa /
translated: One should understand that all of these are merely appearances of one's own mind.

original: rnam par shes pa brgyad kyi tshogs te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa brgyad kyi tshogs te /
translated: The last is the collection of the eight consciousnesses, which apprehend the mere entity of form, etc.

original: shes bya'i yul rigs pas de bzhin gshegs pa dang rjes su mthun pa'o //
analyzed: shes bya'i yul rigs pas de bzhin gshegs pa dang rjes su mthun pa'o //
translated: The object of cognition is the TathƒÅgata, in accordance with reasoning.

original: de rnams rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum rtogs pa /
analyzed: de rnams rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum rtogs pa /
translated: One who realizes those three gates of liberation

original: zag pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab kyi gnod sems kyis bcom zhing khrag phyung ba'o //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab kyi gnod sems kyis bcom zhing khrag phyung ba'o //
translated: is one who has destroyed and drawn blood with the malice of uncontaminated samƒÅdhi and wisdom.

original: mngon par rtogs pa'i chos can ni bden pa mngon par rtogs pa ste rnam par grol ba'o //
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa'i chos can ni bden pa mngon par rtogs pa ste rnam par grol ba'o //

original: de ltar chos mthun pa la dgongs te tshig de skad du gsungs pa'i dgos pa ni sngar bstan pa ltar ro //
analyzed: de ltar chos mthun pa la dgongs te tshig de skad du gsungs pa'i dgos pa ni sngar bstan pa ltar ro //

translated: In order to dispel that, he says ‚ÄúMoreover‚Ä¶‚Äù and so forth.

analyzed: sprul pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyis mngon par rtogs pa ni ma rtogs so zhes pa la /

original: de nyid gsal bar bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de nyid gsal bar bstan pa ni /
translated: That is clearly explained:

original: de'i byin gyi rlabs kyis tshul ji ltar mngon par rtogs par 'gyur snyam na /
analyzed: de'i byin gyi rlabs kyis tshul ji ltar mngon par rtogs par 'gyur snyam na /
translated: If one thinks, ‚ÄúHow is that realization by the blessing of that [emanation]?‚Äù

original: @190a * // nyan thos de nyid gang zag gang la la mtshams med pa byas pa 'gyod pas yid zil gyis non pa rnams kyi thad du song ste /
analyzed: @190a * // nyan thos de nyid gang zag gang la la mtshams med pa byas pa 'gyod pas yid zil gyis non pa rnams kyi thad du song ste /
translated: The ≈õrƒÅvaka, having gone to the side of some person who has committed an immediate [negative action] and whose mind is overcome with remorse,

analyzed: de'i 'gyod pa bsal zhing slar rab tu spro bar byed par 'gyur snyam nas /

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i byin rlabs sam /

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyis khyod kyi sdig pa 'di dag las grol zhing myur du thar par 'gyur bas de dag gi thad du song zhing tshogs sog la thabs zhus shig ces rab tu bstan pas so //

translated: or the blessing of the tathƒÅgatas, you will be freed from these misdeeds and will quickly be liberated. Therefore, go to them, accumulate the collections, and request the method.‚Äù

original: blo gros chen po mtshams med pa zhes pa la sogs pas de 'dra ba'i tshig kyang de ltar bden pa'i don can ma yin te /
analyzed: blo gros chen po mtshams med pa zhes pa la sogs pas de 'dra ba'i tshig kyang de ltar bden pa'i don can ma yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúMahƒÅmati, as for the so-called immediate [negative actions],‚Äù and so forth, such words are also not true in meaning.

analyzed: 'ga' zhig de ltar 'gyur ba srid pa tsam la dgongs pa'o //
translated: It is intended that it is possible that some will become like that.

analyzed: gal te brgya lam na zhes pa ni sprul pa'i nyan thos kyis bstan pa'am /
translated: ‚ÄúIf perchance‚Äù is the teaching of the emanated ≈õrƒÅvaka.

original: de las gzhan pa'i sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang phrad pa las chos thams cad dben par rtogs pa na nyes pa las grol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang phrad pa las chos thams cad dben par rtogs pa na nyes pa las grol bar 'gyur ro //

original: mtshams med par ni mtshams bcad pas zhes pa ni 'jam dpal mtshams med pa zhes bgyi ba ni chos kyi dbyings su mtshams ma mchis pa'i tshig bla dags so zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs so //

translated: As for the interruption of the interruption, it is as stated in the Manjusrimula: The so-called interruption is a synonym for the interruption of the interruption of the dharmadhatu.

analyzed: gzhan yang gnyen po ye shes kyi rgyun rgyud la phyin ci log gi par mtshams med pa /

analyzed: de 'dra ba'i bar mtshams bcad pas de ni mtshams med pa'i las zhes bya ste /

original: thun mong gi nges pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: thun mong gi nges pa'i tshig go //

translated: The intended meaning is that when the ≈õrƒÅvakas and pratyekabuddhas eventually attain the qualities of realizing the selflessness of phenomena and persons, etc., they become buddhas, so there is only the single ultimate MahƒÅyƒÅna.

translated: It is delightful, it is all-knowing, it is fully aware, it is reasonable, it is connected, it is free from the fault of repetition, it has the power of the lion‚Äôs roar, it has the voice of the elephant‚Äôs trumpeting,

original: 'brug gi sgra dbyangs dang / klu'i dbang po'i sgra dang / dri za'i glu dbyangs dang / bya ka la ping ka'i sgra dbyangs dang / tshangs pa'i sgra dbyangs bsgrags pa dang / shang shang te'u'i sgra dbyangs su bsgrags pa dang / lha'i dbang po'i sgra dbyangs ltar snyan pa dang /

translated: it has the sound of the dragon‚Äôs voice, it has the voice of the king of the nƒÅgas, it has the melody of the gandharva‚Äôs song, it has the melody of the kalavi·πÖka‚Äôs song, it has the melody of BrahmƒÅ‚Äôs voice, it has the melody of the ki·πÉnara‚Äôs song, it has the pleasant melody of the lord of the gods,

original: rnga'i sgra dang / ma khengs pa dang / mi dma' ba dang / sgra thams cad kyi rjes su zhugs pa dang / tshig zur chags pa med pa /
analyzed: rnga'i sgra dang / ma khengs pa dang / mi dma' ba dang / sgra thams cad kyi rjes su zhugs pa dang / tshig zur chags pa med pa /
translated: it has the sound of the drum, it is not arrogant, it is not low, it is in accord with all sounds, and it is not interrupted by words.

original: dang ; / ma tshang ba med pa dang / ma zhum pa dang / mi zhan pa dang / rab tu dga' ba dang / khyab ba dang / chub pa dang / rgyun chags pa dang / 'brel pa dang / sgra thams cad rdzogs par byed pa dang /
analyzed: dang ; / ma tshang ba med pa dang / ma zhum pa dang / mi zhan pa dang / rab tu dga' ba dang / khyab ba dang / chub pa dang / rgyun chags pa dang / 'brel pa dang / sgra thams cad rdzogs par byed pa dang /
translated: It is complete, not deficient, not timid, not weak, very joyful, pervasive, comprehensive, continuous, connected, and it fulfills all sounds.

original: dbang po thams cad tshim par byed pa dang / ma smad pa dang / mi 'gyur ba dang / ma brtags pa dang / 'khor kun du grag pa dang / 'dod chags zhi bar byed pa dang / zhe sdang 'dul ba dang / gti mug sel ba dang /
analyzed: dbang po thams cad tshim par byed pa dang / ma smad pa dang / mi 'gyur ba dang / ma brtags pa dang / 'khor kun du grag pa dang / 'dod chags zhi bar byed pa dang / zhe sdang 'dul ba dang / gti mug sel ba dang /
translated: It satisfies all faculties, is not contemptible, is unchanging, is not contrived, resounds throughout the retinue, pacifies attachment, subdues aversion, and clears away confusion.

original: bdud tshar gcod pa dang / rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan par 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: bdud tshar gcod pa dang / rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan par 'byung ba ste /
translated: It conquers Mara and arises endowed with all supreme aspects.

original: zhi ba'i blo gros de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung ni yan lag drug cu rtsa bzhi po de dag dang ldan par 'byung ngo zhes gsungs pa dang sbyar ro //

translated: Santimatil, the Tathagata's speech arises endowed with these sixty-four aspects.

original: ka la ping ka ni rgya mtsho chen po'i gling la gnas pa'i bya'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: ka la ping ka ni rgya mtsho chen po'i gling la gnas pa'i bya'i khyad par ro //

original: 'dir gsung mtshungs pa yang 'du la ba'i dbang gis de bzhin gshegs pa rnams gsung sna tshogs su ston pa ni ma gtogs so zhes 'di yang sbyar te /
analyzed: 'dir gsung mtshungs pa yang 'du la ba'i dbang gis de bzhin gshegs pa rnams gsung sna tshogs su ston pa ni ma gtogs so zhes 'di yang sbyar te /
translated: Here, the speech is also similar in that it is not the case that the tathƒÅgatas teach a variety of speech except in accordance with the power of those to be tamed.

original: 'on kyang 'dul ba'i dbang gis sku dang gsung sna tshogs su ston pa yang sangs rgyas gcig gis ston pa bzhin du gzhan gyis kyang ston par spyod pas mtshungs pa nyid ces bya'o //
