translated: However, just as one buddha teaches a variety of bodies and speech in accordance with the power of those to be tamed, so also do others. Therefore, it is called ‚Äúsimilarity.‚Äù

original: 'dir de ltar bstan pa'i dgos pa ni dbang po dman pa gang dag sangs rgyas sh'akya thub pa ni @191b snyigs ma lnga'i dus su 'khrungs pa /
analyzed: 'dir de ltar bstan pa'i dgos pa ni dbang po dman pa gang dag sangs rgyas sh'akya thub pa ni @191b snyigs ma lnga'i dus su 'khrungs pa /
translated: The purpose of teaching in this way is to dispel the doubts of those of lesser capacity who think, ‚ÄúThe buddha ≈öƒÅkyamuni was born at a time of five degenerations,

original: sangs rgyas gzhan rnams las sku tshe thung zhing bsod nams dman pa'o snyam du dogs pa sel ba'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas gzhan rnams las sku tshe thung zhing bsod nams dman pa'o snyam du dogs pa sel ba'o //
translated: and his lifespan and merit are less than those of other buddhas.‚Äù

original: yang blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pas don gzhan la dgongs pa ste /
analyzed: yang blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pas don gzhan la dgongs pa ste /
translated: Again, the other intended meaning is stated by ‚ÄúMahƒÅmati, the tathƒÅgatas, arhats, completely perfect buddhas do not teach the Dharma with the sound of words and letters.‚Äù

original: yi ge med par ji ltar gsungs zhes pa'i lan du yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: yi ge med par ji ltar gsungs zhes pa'i lan du yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: This should also be applied in response to the question, ‚ÄúHow can it be taught without letters?‚Äù

original: 'di'i don ni gsung rab kyi phyogs 'ga' zhig las /
analyzed: 'di'i don ni gsung rab kyi phyogs 'ga' zhig las /
translated: The meaning of this is that in some parts of the scriptures,

original: de bzhin gshegs pas tshig dang gang gi rnam par rig byed kyi sgo nas zhal dang ljags kyi dbang pos chos bstan pa med pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas tshig dang gang gi rnam par rig byed kyi sgo nas zhal dang ljags kyi dbang pos chos bstan pa med pa ste /
translated: the TathƒÅgata does not teach the dharma with his mouth and tongue, in the form of words and the expressions that indicate them.

original: de 'dra ba ni ngag kun nas slong ba'i rnam par rtog pa la ltos shing /
analyzed: de 'dra ba ni ngag kun nas slong ba'i rnam par rtog pa la ltos shing /
translated: This is because such speech depends on conceptual thoughts that motivate speech,üîΩand the TathƒÅgata is free of conceptual thoughts.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la ni rnam par rtog pa mi mnga' ba'i phyir ro zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs pas 'dir yan lag drug cu rtsa bzhi par gsungs pa dang 'gal bar mi 'gyur ram /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la ni rnam par rtog pa mi mnga' ba'i phyir ro zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs pas 'dir yan lag drug cu rtsa bzhi par gsungs pa dang 'gal bar mi 'gyur ram /
translated: Since this is stated, is there not a contradiction with the teaching of sixty-four aspects here?

original: de'i phyir de rnams gang la dgongs te gsungs pa yin zhes dris pa'i lan du rnam pa gnyis la dgongs te gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de rnams gang la dgongs te gsungs pa yin zhes dris pa'i lan du rnam pa gnyis la dgongs te gsungs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, in response to the question, ‚ÄúWith what intention was that taught?‚Äù it is said, ‚ÄúIt was taught with two aspects in mind.‚Äù

original: de la dang po'i don ni de bzhin gshegs pa de dag gis thugs su chud pa so so rang rig pa'i ye shes kyi cha ni /
analyzed: de la dang po'i don ni de bzhin gshegs pa de dag gis thugs su chud pa so so rang rig pa'i ye shes kyi cha ni /
translated: The meaning of the first is that the aspect of the gnosis of individual intuitive awareness realized by those tathƒÅgatas

original: sngar bstan pa ltar sgra dang rnam par rtog pa'i yul ma yin pas /
analyzed: sngar bstan pa ltar sgra dang rnam par rtog pa'i yul ma yin pas /
translated: is not an object of sound and discursive thought, as was previously explained.

original: de la dgongs te sgra'i sgo nas chos bstan pa med ces pa'o //
analyzed: de la dgongs te sgra'i sgo nas chos bstan pa med ces pa'o //
translated: With that in mind, it is said that there is no teaching of the Dharma through sound.

original: gnyis pa'i don ni yang sangs rgyas rnams kyis thugs su chud pa'i chos rnams kyi sngon gyi lugs kyi chos nyid ni /
analyzed: gnyis pa'i don ni yang sangs rgyas rnams kyis thugs su chud pa'i chos rnams kyi sngon gyi lugs kyi chos nyid ni /
translated: The meaning of the second is that the previous mode of the dharmatƒÅ of the Dharmas realized by the buddhas

original: stong pa nyid spros pa thams cad dang bral ba shin tu yang sgra'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: stong pa nyid spros pa thams cad dang bral ba shin tu yang sgra'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: is also not an object of sound because it is emptiness free from all elaborations.

original: sgra'i sgo nas bstan pa med ces pa'o //
analyzed: sgra'i sgo nas bstan pa med ces pa'o //
translated: Therefore it is said that there is no teaching through sound.

original: 'dir nges pa'i don ni sprul pa'i sku'i sangs rgyas mtshan dang dpe byad kyi rnam par snang ba dang / gsung chos 'chad par snang ba ni gdul bya 'ba' zhig gi snang ba yin gyi sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin la med pas /
analyzed: 'dir nges pa'i don ni sprul pa'i sku'i sangs rgyas mtshan dang dpe byad kyi rnam par snang ba dang / gsung chos 'chad par snang ba ni gdul bya 'ba' zhig gi snang ba yin gyi sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin la med pas /
translated: Here the definitive meaning is that the buddhas‚Äô nirmƒÅ·πáakƒÅya, which appears in the aspect of the signs and features, and the Dharma of their speech that appears to be teaching the Dharma, are only the appearances of those to be tamed and do not exist in the nature of the buddhas.

original: de 'dra ba'i chos ston pa'i sgrar snang ba ni sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa ma yin la /
analyzed: de 'dra ba'i chos ston pa'i sgrar snang ba ni sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa ma yin la /
translated: The appearance of sound teaching such a doctrine is not the speech of the Buddha.

original: chos kyi sku yang de 'dra pa'i spros pa dang bral bas sgra'i sgo nas chos ston pa med do //
analyzed: chos kyi sku yang de 'dra pa'i spros pa dang bral bas sgra'i sgo nas chos ston pa med do //
translated: And the Dharma body is free from such conceptual elaborations, so it does not teach the Dharma by means of sound.

original: 'on kyang 'dir longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku mtshan dang dpe byad kyi rnam par snang ba dang / gsung chos ston par snang ba ni sangs rgyas nyid kyi ye shes la yod cing /üîΩde yang ye shes de nyid kyi bdag nyid yin @192a * //
analyzed: 'on kyang 'dir longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku mtshan dang dpe byad kyi rnam par snang ba dang / gsung chos ston par snang ba ni sangs rgyas nyid kyi ye shes la yod cing / de yang ye shes de nyid kyi bdag nyid yin @192a * //
translated: However, the enjoyment body that appears here in the aspect of the major and minor marks and the appearance of its teaching the Dharma are in the Buddha‚Äôs gnosis.

original: pas gsung dbyangs yan lag drug cu pa la sogs pas bstan pa ni kun rdzob tu yod de /
analyzed: pas gsung dbyangs yan lag drug cu pa la sogs pas bstan pa ni kun rdzob tu yod de /
translated: And since that is the nature of that gnosis, the teaching by means of the sixty melodious qualities and so on exists conventionally.

original: de'i phyir med par bstan pas ni snga ma ltar dgongs pa can yin zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir med par bstan pas ni snga ma ltar dgongs pa can yin zhes pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the statement that it does not exist is intended in the above way.

original: gzhan yang chos kyi sku dang sprul pa'i sku la sngar bstan pa ltar bshad pa mi 'thad pas de la dgongs nas kyang yi ge gcig kyang ma bshad ces pa la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: gzhan yang chos kyi sku dang sprul pa'i sku la sngar bstan pa ltar bshad pa mi 'thad pas de la dgongs nas kyang yi ge gcig kyang ma bshad ces pa la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Moreover, it is not tenable to explain the dharma body and emanation body as previously explained. With that in mind, it is said that not even a single syllable was explained.

original: de ltar bstan pa'i dgongs pa yang byis pa'i skye bo gang dag sangs rgyas rnams kyi gsung phan tshun 'gal ba'am /
analyzed: de ltar bstan pa'i dgongs pa yang byis pa'i skye bo gang dag sangs rgyas rnams kyi gsung phan tshun 'gal ba'am /
translated: The intention of that teaching is to dispel the doubts of childish beings who think that the speech of the buddhas is mutually contradictory,

original: gcig la zab mo bstan pa ni nged cag lam bstan pas thugs rje chen po nyi tshe bar 'gyur ram snyam pa la sogs pa'i dogs pa sel ba'o //
analyzed: gcig la zab mo bstan pa ni nged cag lam bstan pas thugs rje chen po nyi tshe bar 'gyur ram snyam pa la sogs pa'i dogs pa sel ba'o //
translated: or that the teaching of the profound to some but not to others is a limited form of great compassion.

original: de gnyis yul las rnam par grol ba ni rang gi mtshan nyid brjod bya rjod byed kyi yul las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: de gnyis yul las rnam par grol ba ni rang gi mtshan nyid brjod bya rjod byed kyi yul las 'das pa'o //
translated: Liberated from objects refers to being beyond the objects of expression and means of expression, that is, of intrinsic character.

original: lhag chad med par khong du chud ces pa ni sangs rgyas snga ma rnams kyis rtogs pa bzhin du ste /
analyzed: lhag chad med par khong du chud ces pa ni sangs rgyas snga ma rnams kyis rtogs pa bzhin du ste /
translated: Comprehending without addition or subtraction is just as it was realized by the buddhas of the past.

original: de 'dra ba ni sgra'i yul ma yin no //
analyzed: de 'dra ba ni sgra'i yul ma yin no //
translated: Such is not the domain of words.

original: sngon gyi lugs kyi chos nyid mi 'gyur zhing de rtogs shing goms pa las /
analyzed: sngon gyi lugs kyi chos nyid mi 'gyur zhing de rtogs shing goms pa las /
translated: The nature of things according to the ancient system does not change.üîΩ

original: yon tan thams cad 'byung ba ni rin po che'i 'byung khungs sam /
analyzed: yon tan thams cad 'byung ba ni rin po che'i 'byung khungs sam /
translated: The unchanging reality of the former system, and the arising of all good qualities from the realization and cultivation of that,üîΩare like a source of jewels,

original: grong khyer snying po'i lam dang mtshungs pa'o //
analyzed: grong khyer snying po'i lam dang mtshungs pa'o //
translated: or like the path to the city of the essence.

original: de'i chos nyid dang chos kyi gnas nyid ni chos rnams kyi stong pa nyid dang / de nyid rtogs shing goms pas yon tan thams cad 'byung ba'i gnas su gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de'i chos nyid dang chos kyi gnas nyid ni chos rnams kyi stong pa nyid dang / de nyid rtogs shing goms pas yon tan thams cad 'byung ba'i gnas su gyur pa'o //
translated: Its reality and the nature of things are the emptiness of phenomena, and that itself is the source of the arising of all good qualities through realization and cultivation.

original: gang la yongs su mya ngan las 'das zhes pa ni sprul pa'i sku tshe'i dus byas nas mya ngan las 'da' bar bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gang la yongs su mya ngan las 'das zhes pa ni sprul pa'i sku tshe'i dus byas nas mya ngan las 'da' bar bstan pa'o //
translated: With regard to ‚Äúnirvana,‚Äù the nirvana of the emanation body is shown to be the nirvana of passing away.

original: sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin la ni de 'dra ba yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin la ni de 'dra ba yod pa ma yin te /
translated: But the buddha nature does not have such a thing,

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: because it is said:

original: sangs rgyas mya ngan yongs mi 'da' //
analyzed: sangs rgyas mya ngan yongs mi 'da' //
translated: The Buddha does not pass into nirvana.

original: zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And so on.

original: so so rang rig chos lugs rnams //
analyzed: so so rang rig chos lugs rnams //
translated: The individual self-aware systems

original: zhes bya ba ni so so rang gi rig pa dang / sngon gyi chos nyid kyi chos lugs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni so so rang gi rig pa dang / sngon gyi chos nyid kyi chos lugs so //
translated: This is the individual intuition and the former way of the Dharma-nature.

original: cung zad bye brag byas pa med //
analyzed: cung zad bye brag byas pa med //
translated: There is no difference at all.

original: ces pa ni chos nyid la khyad par tha dad pa byas pa med pa'o //
analyzed: ces pa ni chos nyid la khyad par tha dad pa byas pa med pa'o //
translated: This means that there is no difference made in the Dharma-nature.

original: de nas yang byang chub sems dpa' zhes pa la sogs pas ni mtha' gnyis rnam par bkag pa nyid tshul gzhan gyi sgo nas rgyas par ston pa'o //
analyzed: de nas yang byang chub sems dpa' zhes pa la sogs pas ni mtha' gnyis rnam par bkag pa nyid tshul gzhan gyi sgo nas rgyas par ston pa'o //
translated: Then, beginning with the words ‚ÄúMoreover, the Bodhisattva,‚Äù he teaches in detail the avoidance of the two extremes by another method.

original: yod pa dang med pa la gnas zhes pa ni de dag gi mtshan mar @192b 'dzin cing blo'i mdun du byed pa'o //
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa la gnas zhes pa ni de dag gi mtshan mar @192b 'dzin cing blo'i mdun du byed pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúDwelling in existence and non-existence‚Äù means to apprehend their signs and to bring them to mind.

original: skye ba dang mi skye ba la mos pa yang de dag nyid dang go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: skye ba dang mi skye ba la mos pa yang de dag nyid dang go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: ‚ÄúFaith in production and non-production‚Äù is to be connected with those two respectively.

original: yod pa skye ba skye ste mad pa ma yin no zhes pa ni grangs can pa rnams kyi 'dod pa ltar thog ma nas yod pa'am /
analyzed: yod pa skye ba skye ste mad pa ma yin no zhes pa ni grangs can pa rnams kyi 'dod pa ltar thog ma nas yod pa'am /
translated: ‚ÄúProduction of the existent is not non-existent‚Äù means that it is not as the Samkhyas believe, that it is existent from the beginning.

original: yang 'ga' zhig gi lugs kyis phyis 'bras bu'i dus na yod pa thog ma nyid du skye zhing de nyid kyi rigs mthun pa rgyun chags su 'jug pas skye ba skye zhes tshig gnyis smos pa'o //
analyzed: yang 'ga' zhig gi lugs kyis phyis 'bras bu'i dus na yod pa thog ma nyid du skye zhing de nyid kyi rigs mthun pa rgyun chags su 'jug pas skye ba skye zhes tshig gnyis smos pa'o //
translated: Also, according to the system of some, that which exists at the time of the effect is produced at the very beginning, and that very homogeneous continuum is produced. Therefore, the two words ‚Äúproduction‚Äù and ‚Äúproduction‚Äù are stated.

original: blo gros chen po de de skad du rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po dag don dam par yod par smra na /
analyzed: blo gros chen po de de skad du rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po dag don dam par yod par smra na /
translated: Mahamati, if you say that the things of cause and effect exist ultimately,

original: phyir zhing rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po bkag pa yin te /
analyzed: phyir zhing rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po bkag pa yin te /
translated: then again the things of cause and effect are refuted.

original: don dam pa'i dngos por yod pa la sngar bstan pa'i chad ma'i gnod pa 'jug pa dang / skye ba sgyu ma lta bu khas mi len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don dam pa'i dngos por yod pa la sngar bstan pa'i chad ma'i gnod pa 'jug pa dang / skye ba sgyu ma lta bu khas mi len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the previously explained fault of nihilism applies to what exists as an ultimate thing, and because you do not accept that production is like an illusion.

original: de nas rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyang med cing rab tu grags pa'i 'jig rten gyi ngo bo yang rgyu med pa las yod par smra ba nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de nas rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyang med cing rab tu grags pa'i 'jig rten gyi ngo bo yang rgyu med pa las yod par smra ba nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: Then, since causes and conditions would also not exist, it would follow that you would be advocating that the nature of the world, which is well known, exists without a cause.

original: de 'dra ba ni mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de 'dra ba ni mi 'thad do //
translated: That is not tenable.

original: med pa la gnas pa ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas gang dag sngar gnyen po ma skyes pa'i dus na /
analyzed: med pa la gnas pa ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas gang dag sngar gnyen po ma skyes pa'i dus na /
translated: As for the position of nonexistence, the ≈õrƒÅvakas and pratyekabuddhas, when the antidotes have not yet arisen,

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i spang bya don dam pa'i dngos por yod pa nyid du khas blangs nas /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i spang bya don dam pa'i dngos por yod pa nyid du khas blangs nas /
translated: accept that the objects to be abandoned, such as attachment, exist as ultimate entities.

original: phyi sa gnyen po skye ba'i dus na de rnams med pa nyid du rnam par rtog pa ste /
analyzed: phyi sa gnyen po skye ba'i dus na de rnams med pa nyid du rnam par rtog pa ste /
translated: When the antidotes arise, they conceive of those objects as nonexistent.

original: 'di yang mi 'thad pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'di yang mi 'thad pa nyid do //
translated: This is also untenable.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The passage beginning ‚ÄúMahƒÅmati, those who assert that . . .‚Äù

original: dbu ma pa gang dag kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i dngos po rnams /
analyzed: dbu ma pa gang dag kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i dngos po rnams /
translated: The MƒÅdhyamikas assert that the things of affliction and purification

original: dngos por snang ba nyid kyi dus na rang rang gi mtshan nyid don dam pa bas stong pas don dam pa'i dngos po yong par khas mi len pa dang / sngar bden pa'i dngos por yod pa phyis gnyen pos de rnams spangs nas dben pa'i phyir de dag yod par khas mi len te /
analyzed: dngos por snang ba nyid kyi dus na rang rang gi mtshan nyid don dam pa bas stong pas don dam pa'i dngos po yong par khas mi len pa dang / sngar bden pa'i dngos por yod pa phyis gnyen pos de rnams spangs nas dben pa'i phyir de dag yod par khas mi len te /
translated: Since at the time of appearing as entities, they are empty of their own characteristics ultimately, they do not accept that ultimately entities exist.üîΩSince what previously existed as real entities is later abandoned by antidotes and is therefore isolated, they do not accept that they exist.

original: de lta na sngar ni yod pa la phyis ni med ces smras pa dang / sngar bstan pa ltar dbu ma ba rang bzhin gyis dben par smra ba 'di gnyis las /
analyzed: de lta na sngar ni yod pa la phyis ni med ces smras pa dang / sngar bstan pa ltar dbu ma ba rang bzhin gyis dben par smra ba 'di gnyis las /
translated: Thus, they say, ‚ÄúPreviously it existed, but later it does not,‚Äù and, as previously explained, they say that the Followers of the Middle Way are proponents of emptiness who are devoid of any nature.

original: dngos po 'jig par byed pa'i lta ba gang yin zhes brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: dngos po 'jig par byed pa'i lta ba gang yin zhes brtag par bya'o //
translated: Which of these two views is the one that destroys entities?

original: blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pa'i don ni go bar bshad do //
analyzed: blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pa'i don ni go bar bshad do //
translated: The meaning of the passage beginning with ‚ÄúMahƒÅmati‚Ä¶‚Äù is self-evident.

original: med pa 'ba' zhig rnam par 'jig par byed pa ma yin zhes pa ni sngar gyi spang bya'i dngos po phyis med ces pa'i dgag bya'i @193a * //
analyzed: med pa 'ba' zhig rnam par 'jig par byed pa ma yin zhes pa ni sngar gyi spang bya'i dngos po phyis med ces pa'i dgag bya'i @193a * //
translated: The phrase ‚ÄúIt does not destroy mere nonexistence‚Äù means that the object of refutation, the previously existing entity, does not later become nonexistent.

original: don sngar yod pa 'ba' zhig rnam par 'jig par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: don sngar yod pa 'ba' zhig rnam par 'jig par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not that it merely destroys an already existing object.

original: 'on kyang byang chub rnam pa gsum yang 'jig par byed pa ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang byang chub rnam pa gsum yang 'jig par byed pa ste /
translated: It also destroys the three kinds of enlightenment,

original: phyin ci log gi lta bar gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyin ci log gi lta bar gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is a false view.

original: de'i don yang nyon mongs pa rnams don dam par gcig dang du ma dang bral zhing /
analyzed: de'i don yang nyon mongs pa rnams don dam par gcig dang du ma dang bral zhing /
translated: Moreover, the meaning of that is that the afflictions are ultimately devoid of oneness and manyness,

original: lus kyi nang dang phyi rol du btsal na ma rnyed pa'i phyir don dam pa'i dngos por med cing /
analyzed: lus kyi nang dang phyi rol du btsal na ma rnyed pa'i phyir don dam pa'i dngos por med cing /
translated: and are not found to exist as ultimate entities when sought in the body or outside it.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de sngon du song ba'i dngos po med pa yang mi bdan  pas de ltar 'dzin pa ni log par lta ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de sngon du song ba'i dngos po med pa yang mi bdan  pas de ltar 'dzin pa ni log par lta ba'o //
translated: Therefore, the apprehension of them as existing in that way is a false view.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: Thus it is said:

original: nyon mongs pa rnams ni sems kyi chos yin la de yang /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams ni sems kyi chos yin la de yang /
translated: The afflictions are mental phenomena, and that mind

original: yang dag du na rnam par shes //
analyzed: yang dag du na rnam par shes //
translated: Is ultimately consciousness.

original: lus kyi nang na'ang yod ma yin //
analyzed: lus kyi nang na'ang yod ma yin //
translated: It does not exist inside the bodyüîΩOr outside it, or in both, or as a mere name.

original: zhes pa la sogs pa sngar bstan no //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa sngar bstan no //
translated: And so on. This has been explained above.

original: gzhan yang 'dod chags la sogs pa rnam pa dang bcas pa'i lus ris su yongs su bcad pa med pa'i phyir nang dang phyi rol tu mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang 'dod chags la sogs pa rnam pa dang bcas pa'i lus ris su yongs su bcad pa med pa'i phyir nang dang phyi rol tu mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: Moreover, since attachment and so forth are not completely divided up into parts of the body with features, they are not observed internally or externally.

original: blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pas skabs kyi don bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pas skabs kyi don bsdu ba'o //
translated: The line MahƒÅmati, and so forth, summarizes the topic.

original: bcing bar bya ba dang zhes pa la sogs pas de nyid rnam grangs gzhan gyi sgo nas ston pa ste /
analyzed: bcing bar bya ba dang zhes pa la sogs pas de nyid rnam grangs gzhan gyi sgo nas ston pa ste /
translated: The line that which is to be bound, and so forth, teaches the same point from another perspective.

original: don dam par de 'dra ba'i nyon mongs pas bcing bar bya ba'i sems can gyi rgyu dang / bcing ba'i rgyu med pa'i phyir bcings pa med pas de sngon du song ba'i phyir grol ba yang med de /
analyzed: don dam par de 'dra ba'i nyon mongs pas bcing bar bya ba'i sems can gyi rgyu dang / bcing ba'i rgyu med pa'i phyir bcings pa med pas de sngon du song ba'i phyir grol ba yang med de /
translated: Since ultimately there is no sentient being that is bound by such afflictions and there is no cause of bondage, there is no bondage. Since that is the case, there is also no liberation.

original: des na rang bzhin gyis rnam par grol zhing mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: des na rang bzhin gyis rnam par grol zhing mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: Therefore, [sentient beings] are naturally liberated and nirvƒÅ·πáa.

original: de'i phyir bcings pa dang grol ba'i dngos por smra ba yang byang chub gsum 'jig par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir bcings pa dang grol ba'i dngos por smra ba yang byang chub gsum 'jig par byed pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the proponents of bondage and liberation destroy the three types of enlightenment.

original: de ltar na yod pa dang med pa'i phyogs la gnas pa gnyis ka  yang kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang bas bsdus pa'i bden pa rnam par 'jig par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na yod pa dang med pa'i phyogs la gnas pa gnyis ka  yang kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang bas bsdus pa'i bden pa rnam par 'jig par byed pa yin te /
translated: Thus, both of those who abide in the positions of existence and nonexistence destroy the truths subsumed by affliction and purification.

original: don 'di nyid sngar yang bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: don 'di nyid sngar yang bstan pa yin no //
translated: This point has been taught previously as well.

original: blo gros chen po ngas de la dgongs nas zhes pa la sogs pa'i don ni 'phags pa dkon mchog brtsegs pa las /
analyzed: blo gros chen po ngas de la dgongs nas zhes pa la sogs pa'i don ni 'phags pa dkon mchog brtsegs pa las /
translated: The meaning of ‚ÄúMahƒÅmati, I think of this‚Äù and so on is as explained in the Heap of Jewels:

original: gang zag tu lta ba ri rab tsam yang bla'i yod pa dang med pa nyid du mngon pa'i nga rgyal can stong pa nyid du lta ba ni ma yin no zhes bshad pa ste /
analyzed: gang zag tu lta ba ri rab tsam yang bla'i yod pa dang med pa nyid du mngon pa'i nga rgyal can stong pa nyid du lta ba ni ma yin no zhes bshad pa ste /
translated: It is better to have a view of the person that is as big as Mount Meru than to be a conceited person who is empty of the view of existence and nonexistence.

original: ji ltar gang zag gi bdag tu lta ba chen po ni de'i yul rags pa rtogs par sla ba nyid kyis myur du de las bzlog par nus pas thar pa'i @193b gegs chen po ma yin la /
analyzed: ji ltar gang zag gi bdag tu lta ba chen po ni de'i yul rags pa rtogs par sla ba nyid kyis myur du de las bzlog par nus pas thar pa'i @193b gegs chen po ma yin la /
translated: A great view of a self of persons is not a great hindrance to liberation because its object is coarse and easy to realize, and thus it can be quickly reversed.

original: 'di 'dra ba'i stong pa nyid du 'dzin pa ni phyin ci log yin zhing de yang ldog par dka' ba nyid kyis thar pa'i gegs chen por 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'di 'dra ba'i stong pa nyid du 'dzin pa ni phyin ci log yin zhing de yang ldog par dka' ba nyid kyis thar pa'i gegs chen por 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Such a grasping at emptiness is a perversion, and since it is difficult to reverse, it becomes a great obstacle to liberation.

original: mngon pa'i nga rgyal can ni yang dag pa'i lta ba thob par bya rgyu ma thob bzhin du thob par 'dzin pa'i sgo nas sems khengs pa'o //
analyzed: mngon pa'i nga rgyal can ni yang dag pa'i lta ba thob par bya rgyu ma thob bzhin du thob par 'dzin pa'i sgo nas sems khengs pa'o //
translated: Those who are arrogant are those whose minds are inflated by the thought I have attained the correct view, when in fact they have not attained it.

original: yang zhes pa ni phan tshun bsdu ba'i don to //
analyzed: yang zhes pa ni phan tshun bsdu ba'i don to //
translated: The word also means mutually.

original: gal te de ltar na 'phags pa rnams kyis nyon mongs pa la sogs pa spong ba'i tshul ji lta zhe na /üîΩspyod yul rnam par spangs nas ni //
analyzed: gal te de ltar na 'phags pa rnams kyis nyon mongs pa la sogs pa spong ba'i tshul ji lta zhe na / spyod yul rnam par spangs nas ni //
translated: If that is so, how do the noble ones eliminate the afflictions and so on?üîΩHaving abandoned the objects of the senses,

original: sems kyang yang dag 'gag par 'gyur //
analyzed: sems kyang yang dag 'gag par 'gyur //
translated: the mind will cease.

original: zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te ;
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te ;
translated: Thus it is said.

original: / kun rdzob tsam du mtha' gnyis su rtogs pa'i yul spangs na kun nas nyon mongs pa'i sa bon dang bcas pa'i sems 'gag par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: / kun rdzob tsam du mtha' gnyis su rtogs pa'i yul spangs na kun nas nyon mongs pa'i sa bon dang bcas pa'i sems 'gag par 'gyur zhing /
translated: If one abandons the objects that are conceived as the two extremes, merely conventionally, the mind that is endowed with the seeds of affliction will cease.

original: de nyid kyis yul la 'dzin pa'i phyin ci log la sogs pa 'gog pa med pa ma yin te /üîΩkun rdzob tu ni thams cad yod //
analyzed: de nyid kyis yul la 'dzin pa'i phyin ci log la sogs pa 'gog pa med pa ma yin te / kun rdzob tu ni thams cad yod //
translated: Therefore, it is not that the errors of apprehending objects are not refuted by that.

original: ces ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ces ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: It teaches that all things exist conventionally.

original: des na mtha' gnyis spangs pa de bzhin nyid kyi gnas 'phags pa'i spyod yul ni de bzhin du bden pa'o //
analyzed: des na mtha' gnyis spangs pa de bzhin nyid kyi gnas 'phags pa'i spyod yul ni de bzhin du bden pa'o //
translated: Thus, the reality of the noble domain, which is the abandonment of the two extremes, is true in that way.

original: de las gzhan du don dam par rkyen gyis yod pa ste /
analyzed: de las gzhan du don dam par rkyen gyis yod pa ste /
translated: Apart from that, it is asserted that ultimately things exist by conditions,

original: sngar ma byung ba las rkyen gyi rjes thogs su gang zhig skye zhing /üîΩyang rkyen gyis med pa ste byung nas 'gal rkyen gyis 'jig par 'gyur ba nyid du khas len pa ni nga'i bstan pa'i de kho na nyid la blo gros mi gnas pa ste /
analyzed: sngar ma byung ba las rkyen gyi rjes thogs su gang zhig skye zhing / yang rkyen gyis med pa ste byung nas 'gal rkyen gyis 'jig par 'gyur ba nyid du khas len pa ni nga'i bstan pa'i de kho na nyid la blo gros mi gnas pa ste /
translated: that something arises from the subsequent condition of what did not occur previously,üîΩand that again, things do not exist by conditions, that having arisen, they are destroyed by opposing conditions.

original: de kho na nyid ma rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: de kho na nyid ma rtogs pa'o //
translated: Those who do not abide in the mind of my teaching of reality do not understand reality.

original: 'dir glegs bam 'ga' zhig las /üîΩma byung ba las gang byung zhing //
analyzed: 'dir glegs bam 'ga' zhig las / ma byung ba las gang byung zhing //
translated: In some texts, it says:üîΩWhat arises from what did not occur

original: byung nas kyang ni rnam 'jig pa //
analyzed: byung nas kyang ni rnam 'jig pa //
translated: and having arisen, is destroyed

original: rkyen las yod dang med de dag / nga yi bstan la de mi gnas //
analyzed: rkyen las yod dang med de dag / nga yi bstan la de mi gnas //
translated: and ‚Äúexistence and non-existence from conditions‚Äù are not in my teaching.

original: zhes 'byung ba der ni tshig gi don shin tu yang 'grig par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ba der ni tshig gi don shin tu yang 'grig par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Here the meaning of the words is very well ordered.

original: rkyen gyis yod par ma bsgrub ces pa ni don dam par yod pa nyid du bsgrub pa'i mthu med pas so //
analyzed: rkyen gyis yod par ma bsgrub ces pa ni don dam par yod pa nyid du bsgrub pa'i mthu med pas so //
translated: ‚ÄúNot established as existent by conditions‚Äù means that they do not have the power to establish ultimate existence.

original: de nyid kyis na yod pa sngon du song ba'i med pa yang mi 'thad ces pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyis na yod pa sngon du song ba'i med pa yang mi 'thad ces pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: And by that same reasoning, ‚Äúnon-existence preceded by existence is not tenable‚Äù and so on.

original: don go bar zad do //
analyzed: don go bar zad do //
translated: The meaning is exhausted.

original: de ltar stong pa nyid du lta ba bkag pa ni dgongs pa can nyid du gsungs pas sngar bstan pa ltar chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin stong pa nyid ni nges pa'i don phyin ci ma log pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar stong pa nyid du lta ba bkag pa ni dgongs pa can nyid du gsungs pas sngar bstan pa ltar chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin stong pa nyid ni nges pa'i don phyin ci ma log pa'o //
translated: Thus, the negation of the view of emptiness is said to be intentional, and so, as previously explained, the emptiness of the nature of all phenomena is the unerring definitive meaning.

original: 'dir dgongs pa dang ldem @194a * //
analyzed: 'dir dgongs pa dang ldem @194a * //
translated: Here, the intention and the

original: por dgongs pa'i rnam par dbye ba zhib tu ni theg pa chen po mdo sde'i rgyan la sogs pa las gsungs bas de dag gi rnam par bshad pa'i rjes su 'brangs te rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: por dgongs pa'i rnam par dbye ba zhib tu ni theg pa chen po mdo sde'i rgyan la sogs pa las gsungs bas de dag gi rnam par bshad pa'i rjes su 'brangs te rtogs par bya'o //
translated: The detailed classification of the intentions of the Buddha is taught in the Ornament of the MahƒÅyƒÅna S≈´tras and so forth. Therefore, one should understand it by following the explanations in those texts.

original: de nas yang byang chub sems dpa' zhes pa la sogs pa sngar bstan pa'i grub pa'i mtha' dang / bshad pa'i tshul rnam pa gzhan gyi sgo nas ston te /
analyzed: de nas yang byang chub sems dpa' zhes pa la sogs pa sngar bstan pa'i grub pa'i mtha' dang / bshad pa'i tshul rnam pa gzhan gyi sgo nas ston te /
translated: Then, the verse beginning ‚ÄúThen, again, the bodhisattva‚Äù and so forth teaches the previously presented tenets and the mode of explanation from another perspective.

original: de yang / khyod kyi grub mtha' rnam pa du //
analyzed: de yang / khyod kyi grub mtha' rnam pa du //
translated: Moreover, it is a response to the question, ‚ÄúHow many types of tenets do you have?

original: lta ba dag kyang rnam pa du //üîΩzhes dris pa'i lan du sbyar bar bya ste /
analyzed: lta ba dag kyang rnam pa du // zhes dris pa'i lan du sbyar bar bya ste /
translated: And how many types of views?‚Äù

original: zhib tu ni 'og nas ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhib tu ni 'og nas ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: The detailed explanation will be given below.

original: 'dir bsgrub pa'i mtha'i bye brag ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pas sangs rgyas pa rnams kyi rtog ge pa dang / mu stegs byed pa sogs pa gzhan gyis bstan pa la rag ma las pa ste /
analyzed: 'dir bsgrub pa'i mtha'i bye brag ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pas sangs rgyas pa rnams kyi rtog ge pa dang / mu stegs byed pa sogs pa gzhan gyis bstan pa la rag ma las pa ste /
translated: Here, by understanding the specific tenets, the Buddhists do not rely on the teachings of others, such as the logicians and tƒ´rthikas.

original: ston pa gzhan la mi rten pa'o //
analyzed: ston pa gzhan la mi rten pa'o //
translated: They do not rely on other teachers.

original: so so rang gis rig pa'i bye brag gi mtshan nyid de zhes pa la sogs pa'i don ni chos kyi dbyings kyi phyogs 'ga' zhig gang zag la bdag med pa dang / gzung ba ngo bo nyid med par mngon sum du rtogs pa'i ye shes so so rang gis rig par bya ba'i don sgra dang rnam par rtog pa'i yul las 'das pa ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyis bsgrub pa'i mtha'i tshul yin la /
analyzed: so so rang gis rig pa'i bye brag gi mtshan nyid de zhes pa la sogs pa'i don ni chos kyi dbyings kyi phyogs 'ga' zhig gang zag la bdag med pa dang / gzung ba ngo bo nyid med par mngon sum du rtogs pa'i ye shes so so rang gis rig par bya ba'i don sgra dang rnam par rtog pa'i yul las 'das pa ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyis bsgrub pa'i mtha'i tshul yin la /
translated: The meaning of the phrase ‚Äúthe reality of the individual intuitive wisdom‚Äù and so on is that the reality of the ultimate element is the object of the intuitive wisdom of the individual intuitive wisdom of the selflessness of persons and the nonentityness of the apprehended, which is the mode of the culmination of practice of the ≈õrƒÅvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: sems kyi chos nyid ji lta ba bzhin du bdag nyid thams cad nas rtogs pa'i ye shes mthar thug pa'i don ni sangs rgyas rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: sems kyi chos nyid ji lta ba bzhin du bdag nyid thams cad nas rtogs pa'i ye shes mthar thug pa'i don ni sangs rgyas rnams kyi'o //
translated: The meaning of the ultimate wisdom that realizes the reality of the mind just as it is in all ways is that of the buddhas.

original: zag pa med pa'i dbyings rtogs pa thob par byed pa ni so so rang rang gis mi slob pa'i 'bras bu thob par byed pa'o //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i dbyings rtogs pa thob par byed pa ni so so rang rang gis mi slob pa'i 'bras bu thob par byed pa'o //
translated: The attainment of the realization of the uncontaminated element is the attainment of the individual‚Äôs own state of no more learning.

original: mu stegs can dang bdud thams cad spangs pa ni de rnams bcom pa ste /
analyzed: mu stegs can dang bdud thams cad spangs pa ni de rnams bcom pa ste /
translated: The abandonment of all tƒ´rthikas and mƒÅras is the destruction of those.

original: gang zag tu lta ba spangs pa dang mthar gyis mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa thob par 'gyur gyi /üîΩ'khor bar ldog pa med pa ste //
analyzed: gang zag tu lta ba spangs pa dang mthar gyis mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa thob par 'gyur gyi / 'khor bar ldog pa med pa ste //
translated: One abandons the view of the person and attains nirvana without abiding in the end.üîΩThere is no return to cyclic existence.

original: phyir ldog pa yang yod ma yin //
analyzed: phyir ldog pa yang yod ma yin //
translated: There is no return.

original: zhes pa la sogs pa sngar bstan pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa sngar bstan pa'o //
translated: This and so on were taught above.

original: gzhan yang so so'i skye bo'i gnas skabs na rtog pa dang bcas pa'i tshad mas gang zag gi bdag med pa la sogs pa spyi'i tshul du gtan la 'bebs pa thos pa dang bsam pa'i shes rab kyis bsdus pa yang rjes su mthun pa'i grub pa'i mtha' ste
analyzed: gzhan yang so so'i skye bo'i gnas skabs na rtog pa dang bcas pa'i tshad mas gang zag gi bdag med pa la sogs pa spyi'i tshul du gtan la 'bebs pa thos pa dang bsam pa'i shes rab kyis bsdus pa yang rjes su mthun pa'i grub pa'i mtha' ste
translated: Moreover, in the state of ordinary beings, the valid knowledge that is conceptual, which is included in the wisdom of hearing and contemplation, determines the selflessness of the person and so on in a general way. This is a philosophical tenet that is concordant with

original: rang rang gi 'dod pa'i don ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rang rang gi 'dod pa'i don ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: but does not exactly realize the meaning that is asserted by each of the philosophical systems.

original: de @194b la bshad pa'i tshul ni bstan pa'i chos gsung rab yan lag dgu gdul bya'i mos pa ji lta ba bzhin du sna tshogs su bshad pa'o //
analyzed: de @194b la bshad pa'i tshul ni bstan pa'i chos gsung rab yan lag dgu gdul bya'i mos pa ji lta ba bzhin du sna tshogs su bshad pa'o //
translated: The way of explaining that is as follows. The Dharma that is taught is the nine branches of scripture, which are explained in various ways in accordance with the inclinations of those to be tamed.

original: de la gsung rab yan lag dgu ni 'phags pa mya ngan las 'das pa las kyang dgu nyid du gsungs te /
analyzed: de la gsung rab yan lag dgu ni 'phags pa mya ngan las 'das pa las kyang dgu nyid du gsungs te /
translated: The nine branches of scripture are also stated to be nine in the noble Extensive Mother.

original: mdo'i sde dang / dbyangs kyis bsnyad pa'i sde dang / lung du bstan pa'i sde dang / tshigs su bcad pa'i sde dang / ched du brjod pa'i sde dang / de lta bu byung ba'i sde dang / skyes pa'i rabs kyi sde dang / shin tu rgyas pa'i sde dang /üîΩrmad du byung ba'i chos kyi sde rnams so zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: mdo'i sde dang / dbyangs kyis bsnyad pa'i sde dang / lung du bstan pa'i sde dang / tshigs su bcad pa'i sde dang / ched du brjod pa'i sde dang / de lta bu byung ba'i sde dang / skyes pa'i rabs kyi sde dang / shin tu rgyas pa'i sde dang / rmad du byung ba'i chos kyi sde rnams so zhes gsungs so //
translated: They are: sutra, geya, vyakarana, gatha, udana, nidana, avadana, itivrttaka, and jataka.

original: gal te de lta na gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis su bstan pa ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de lta na gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis su bstan pa ji ltar zhe na /
translated: If that is so, how are the twelve branches of scripture taught?

original: de ni rgyas pa dang / bsdus pa'i sog nas phye ba ste /
analyzed: de ni rgyas pa dang / bsdus pa'i sog nas phye ba ste /
translated: They are distinguished by extensive and concise collections.

original: shin tu spros na chos kyi phung po brgyad khri bzhi stong la sogs pas kyang bstan la /
analyzed: shin tu spros na chos kyi phung po brgyad khri bzhi stong la sogs pas kyang bstan la /
translated: If they are very extensive, they are taught by the eighty-four thousand aggregates of Dharma and so on.

original: shin tu bsdus na sde snod gsum du yang 'du bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: shin tu bsdus na sde snod gsum du yang 'du bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: If they are very concise, they are included in the three scriptural collections.

original: de la yan lag bcu gnyis kyi dbang du byas na mdo'i sde ni 'di skad bdag gis thos la zhes pa nas dga' nas rjes su yi rang ngo zhes pa'i bar du chos mdor bsdus te bstan pa ste /
analyzed: de la yan lag bcu gnyis kyi dbang du byas na mdo'i sde ni 'di skad bdag gis thos la zhes pa nas dga' nas rjes su yi rang ngo zhes pa'i bar du chos mdor bsdus te bstan pa ste /
translated: If one considers the twelve branches of that, the sutra collection is the concise teaching of the Dharma from this is how I heard to joyfully rejoice.

original: de ltar bstan pa'i dgongs pa yang bsdus te bstan pa'i don de nyid go rims bzhin du so sor phye ste don rnam par 'jog pa na /
analyzed: de ltar bstan pa'i dgongs pa yang bsdus te bstan pa'i don de nyid go rims bzhin du so sor phye ste don rnam par 'jog pa na /
translated: The purpose of teaching that is to establish the meaning of the concise teaching in order through analyzing it individually.

original: sdud pa po'i ston pa la sogs pas gzhag par sla ba dang / phyi rabs kyi 'chad pa po dang nyan pa po rnams kyis bshad pa dang gzung bar sla ba la sogs pa'i phan yon rnam pa bcu 'phags pa thogs med kyis gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdud pa po'i ston pa la sogs pas gzhag par sla ba dang / phyi rabs kyi 'chad pa po dang nyan pa po rnams kyis bshad pa dang gzung bar sla ba la sogs pa'i phan yon rnam pa bcu 'phags pa thogs med kyis gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The benefits of that are the ten benefits stated by arya Asanga: it is easy to establish for the teacher and so on who teaches it, it is easy to explain and retain for those who explain and listen to it in later generations and so on.

original: dbyangs kyis bsnyad pa'i sde ni mdo'i sde de nyid du dbus dang tha mar tshigs su bcad de dbyangs kyis bsnyad pa ste /
analyzed: dbyangs kyis bsnyad pa'i sde ni mdo'i sde de nyid du dbus dang tha mar tshigs su bcad de dbyangs kyis bsnyad pa ste /
translated: The verse collection is the verses at the beginning and end of the sutra collection.

original: sngon bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong rnams la bden pa bzhi phan yon dang bcas pa ston pa'i mdo sde gsungs nas de'i tshe na skye bo dbang po rnon po dag de'i 'og tu chos nyan pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi spyan sngar lhags te /
analyzed: sngon bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong rnams la bden pa bzhi phan yon dang bcas pa ston pa'i mdo sde gsungs nas de'i tshe na skye bo dbang po rnon po dag de'i 'og tu chos nyan pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi spyan sngar lhags te /
translated: In the past, the BhagavƒÅn taught the s≈´tra that explains the four truths with their benefits to the bhik·π£us. At that time, those of sharp faculties came before the Buddha to listen to the Dharma.

original: gzhan dag la 'di skad du bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan snga 'dir ci zhig mdzad ces dris pa dang / bcom ldan 'das mkhyen bzhin du mdo sde sngar gsungs pa las yang tshigs su bcad de 'di skad du /üîΩngas sngon byed dang 'dra bar ni //
analyzed: gzhan dag la 'di skad du bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan snga 'dir ci zhig mdzad ces dris pa dang / bcom ldan 'das mkhyen bzhin du mdo sde sngar gsungs pa las yang tshigs su bcad de 'di skad du / ngas sngon byed dang 'dra bar ni //
translated: Others asked, ‚ÄúWhat did the BhagavƒÅn do in front of the Buddha?‚Äù The BhagavƒÅn, knowing, spoke this verse in summary of the previously taught s≈´tra:üîΩ‚ÄúI did not see the four truths

original: bden pa bzhi po ma mthong ste //üîΩde bas 'khor bar @195a * //
analyzed: bden pa bzhi po ma mthong ste // de bas 'khor bar @195a * //
translated: as if they were done before.

original: yongs su 'khor //
analyzed: yongs su 'khor //
translated: Therefore, I fully transmigrated in sa·πÉsƒÅra,

original: sdug bsngal chen po'i rgya mtshor lhung //
analyzed: sdug bsngal chen po'i rgya mtshor lhung //
translated: sinking into the great ocean of suffering.

original: gang gis bden pa bzhi rtogs na //
analyzed: gang gis bden pa bzhi rtogs na //
translated: But when one realizes the four truths,

original: 'khor ba yongs su gcod par 'gyur //
analyzed: 'khor ba yongs su gcod par 'gyur //
translated: one will cut off sa·πÉsƒÅra.

original: skye ba'i srid pa kun zad na //
analyzed: skye ba'i srid pa kun zad na //
translated: When all existences of birth are exhausted,

original: srid pa thams cad len mi srid //
analyzed: srid pa thams cad len mi srid //
translated: it is impossible to take up all existences.‚Äù

original: ces gsungs pa dang / de 'dra ba'i rigs can dag go //
analyzed: ces gsungs pa dang / de 'dra ba'i rigs can dag go //
translated: Those of that type are called ‚Äúinterpretable‚Äù.

original: yang drang ba'i don gyi mdo sde rtogs par byed pas dbyangs kyis bsnyad pa'o zhes kyang bstan bcos dag las gsungs so //
analyzed: yang drang ba'i don gyi mdo sde rtogs par byed pas dbyangs kyis bsnyad pa'o zhes kyang bstan bcos dag las gsungs so //
translated: Also, the treatises teach that the scriptures of interpretable meaning are the melodies of the scriptures.

original: lung du bstan pa'i sde ni mdo sde dang 'dul ba las lha dang mi rnams sangs rgyas su lung bstan pa ste /
analyzed: lung du bstan pa'i sde ni mdo sde dang 'dul ba las lha dang mi rnams sangs rgyas su lung bstan pa ste /
translated: The scriptures of prediction are the scriptures and the discipline which predict the enlightenment of gods and men.

original: ji ltar byams pa lung bstan pa la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ji ltar byams pa lung bstan pa la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the prediction of Maitreya, etc.

original: gzhan yang nyan thos 'das te shi ba'i dus byas pa dang 'byung ba lung bstan pa dang / nges pa'i don gyi mdo sde yang yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang nyan thos 'das te shi ba'i dus byas pa dang 'byung ba lung bstan pa dang / nges pa'i don gyi mdo sde yang yin te /
translated: Moreover, the scriptures of prediction are the scriptures of definitive meaning which predict the passing away and death of the disciples, and their future.

original: des nges pa'i don nyid lung ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des nges pa'i don nyid lung ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they predict the very definitive meaning.

original: tshigs su bcad pa'i sde ni mdo sde dang 'dul ba gang las lhag par tshigs su bcad ba'i tshig bzhi pa 'di dag smos pa ste /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa'i sde ni mdo sde dang 'dul ba gang las lhag par tshigs su bcad ba'i tshig bzhi pa 'di dag smos pa ste /
translated: The scriptures of verse are the scriptures and the discipline which mention these verses of four lines:

original: sdig pa thams cad yongs su spang //
analyzed: sdig pa thams cad yongs su spang //
translated: Abandon all evil,

original: dge ba'i chos ni rdzogs par bya //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos ni rdzogs par bya //
translated: perfect the good,

original: bdag gi sems kyang yongs su 'dul //
analyzed: bdag gi sems kyang yongs su 'dul //
translated: I will also subdue my own mind.

original: 'di ni sangs rgyas bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sangs rgyas bstan pa'o //
translated: This is the teaching of the Buddha.

original: zhes smos pa dang / de'i rang bzhin can rnams so //
analyzed: zhes smos pa dang / de'i rang bzhin can rnams so //
translated: And those who have that nature.

original: snga ma dang gnyis kyi khyad par bstan pa la /
analyzed: snga ma dang gnyis kyi khyad par bstan pa la /
translated: The difference between the former and the latter is taught.

original: snga ma ni 'khor thams cad 'phral du dga' bar 'gyur ba yin la /üîΩ'di ni 'phral du snyan nam /
analyzed: snga ma ni 'khor thams cad 'phral du dga' bar 'gyur ba yin la / 'di ni 'phral du snyan nam /
translated: The former is that all retinues are delighted immediately.

original: mi snyan yang bla'i yul du phan par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: mi snyan yang bla'i yul du phan par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: This is that whether it is pleasant or unpleasant, it becomes beneficial in the field.

original: ched du brjod pa'i sde ni sus kyang zhus pa med par de bzhin gshegs pa nyid rjes su yi rangs nas brjod pa ste /
analyzed: ched du brjod pa'i sde ni sus kyang zhus pa med par de bzhin gshegs pa nyid rjes su yi rangs nas brjod pa ste /
translated: The category of expressions of joy is that the Tathagata himself expresses joy without being requested by anyone.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: dge slong dag 'di ltar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong dag 'di ltar shes par bya'o //
translated: Monks, it should be known like this.

original: lhar skyes pa thams cad ni shin tu yang tshe ring ngo //
analyzed: lhar skyes pa thams cad ni shin tu yang tshe ring ngo //
translated: All those born as gods have extremely long lives.

original: dge slong khyed la pha rol po gzhan gyi phyir rnyed pa mi 'tshol ba legs so //
analyzed: dge slong khyed la pha rol po gzhan gyi phyir rnyed pa mi 'tshol ba legs so //
translated: Monks, it is good that you do not seek gain for the sake of others.

original: 'dod pa nyung ba legs so //
analyzed: 'dod pa nyung ba legs so //
translated: It is good to have few desires.

original: chog shes pa legs so //
analyzed: chog shes pa legs so //
translated: It is good to be content.

original: dur khrod na gnas pa yang legs so zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dur khrod na gnas pa yang legs so zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: It is good to live in a charnel ground.

original: gling gzhi'i sde ni mdo sde las nyes pa 'byung ba dgag pa'i don du tshigs su bcad pa gsungs pa sngon gyi gleng gzhi dang bcas te 'byed cing bstan pa ste /
analyzed: gling gzhi'i sde ni mdo sde las nyes pa 'byung ba dgag pa'i don du tshigs su bcad pa gsungs pa sngon gyi gleng gzhi dang bcas te 'byed cing bstan pa ste /
translated: The Nidana-varga is the explanation of the sutras, which are divided into sections with their previous stories, for the purpose of preventing faults.

original: de yang sngon mnyan du yod pa na skyes bu gcig gis bya rgyas bya bzung nas gsel por bcug ste /
analyzed: de yang sngon mnyan du yod pa na skyes bu gcig gis bya rgyas bya bzung nas gsel por bcug ste /
translated: In the past, in Shravasti, a man caught a bird in a net and put it in a cage.

original: @195b chu dang 'bras bsnyod nas phyir btang ngo //
analyzed: @195b chu dang 'bras bsnyod nas phyir btang ngo //
translated: He fed it water and rice and let it go.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis de'i rgyu dang rkyen mkhyen pas de gleng gzhir byas te tshigs su bcad pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis de'i rgyu dang rkyen mkhyen pas de gleng gzhir byas te tshigs su bcad pa /
translated: The Bhagavan, knowing the cause and condition of that, made it the nidana and spoke this verse:

original: sdig pa phra mo chung du la //
analyzed: sdig pa phra mo chung du la //
translated: Do not despise a small, minor sin,

original: mi gnod snyam du brnyas mi bya //
analyzed: mi gnod snyam du brnyas mi bya //
translated: thinking it does not harm.

original: chu yi thigs pa zag pa yang //
analyzed: chu yi thigs pa zag pa yang //
translated: Even a drop of water falling

original: snod chen yongs su gang bar 'gyur //üîΩzhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: snod chen yongs su gang bar 'gyur // zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: will fill a large vessel.

original: rtogs pa brjod pa zhes bya ba ni 'dul ba las dpe bstan pa rnams te /
analyzed: rtogs pa brjod pa zhes bya ba ni 'dul ba las dpe bstan pa rnams te /
translated: The Avadana is the examples taught in the Vinaya.

original: rtogs pa'i don dpe du ma gsal bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: rtogs pa'i don dpe du ma gsal bar byed pa'o //
translated: The meaning of the realization is clarified by many examples.

original: de lta bur byung ba zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong dag 'di ltar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bur byung ba zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong dag 'di ltar rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus it happened means that the Blessed One said, Monks, it should be known thus.üîΩWhat I, having come to the world, have taught is called the Element Sutra. Thus it happened. And the Blessed One, having come to the world, taught the Five Amrita Sounds.

original: nga 'jig rten du gshegs te gsungs pa rnams ni khams kyi mdo zhes bya ba de lta bur byung ba dang / bcom ldan 'das bsod skyabs 'jig rten du gshegs te gsungs pa ni bdud rtsi lnga sgra zhes pa dang / sangs rgyas rnam par gzigs 'jig rten du gshegs te gsungs pa ni chos kyi me long zhes pa dang /
analyzed: nga 'jig rten du gshegs te gsungs pa rnams ni khams kyi mdo zhes bya ba de lta bur byung ba dang / bcom ldan 'das bsod skyabs 'jig rten du gshegs te gsungs pa ni bdud rtsi lnga sgra zhes pa dang / sangs rgyas rnam par gzigs 'jig rten du gshegs te gsungs pa ni chos kyi me long zhes pa dang /
translated: The Buddha Vipashyin, having come to the world, taught the Dharma Mirror.

original: bcom ldan 'das 'od srungs 'jig rten du gshegs te gsungs pa ni stong pa rnam par 'byed pa zhes bya ba de lta bu byung ngo zhes pa ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'od srungs 'jig rten du gshegs te gsungs pa ni stong pa rnam par 'byed pa zhes bya ba de lta bu byung ngo zhes pa ste /
translated: The Blessed One Kashyapa, having come to the world, taught the Emptiness Analysis.

original: de 'dra ba'i rang bzhin can sngon gyi sbyor ba ston pa'o //
analyzed: de 'dra ba'i rang bzhin can sngon gyi sbyor ba ston pa'o //
translated: Thus it happened. This shows the nature of the past teachings.

original: skyes pa'i rabs zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das sngon byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa na skye ba'i gnas 'di dang 'di dag tu skyes shing dka' ba'i spyod pa 'di dag spyod ces ston pa ste /
analyzed: skyes pa'i rabs zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das sngon byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa na skye ba'i gnas 'di dang 'di dag tu skyes shing dka' ba'i spyod pa 'di dag spyod ces ston pa ste /
translated: The Jataka Tales are the teachings that the Lord, when he was practicing the bodhisattva way, was born in such and such a place and practiced such and such austerities.

original: ri bong gi lus dang / rgyal po'i lus la sogs pa blangs zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ri bong gi lus dang / rgyal po'i lus la sogs pa blangs zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is said that he took the body of a hare, the body of a king, and so on.

original: shin tu rgyas pa zhes bya ba ni theg pa chen po shin tu rgyas pa'i mdo sde don shin tu rgya che la yangs pa nam mkha' dang 'dra ba ston pa rnams so //
analyzed: shin tu rgyas pa zhes bya ba ni theg pa chen po shin tu rgyas pa'i mdo sde don shin tu rgya che la yangs pa nam mkha' dang 'dra ba ston pa rnams so //
translated: The Vaipulya is the teaching of the extensive sutras of the Great Vehicle, which are very extensive and vast in meaning, like space.

original: rmad du byung ba zhes bya ba ni nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba'i bstan pa ste /
analyzed: rmad du byung ba zhes bya ba ni nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba'i bstan pa ste /
translated: The Adbhutadharma is the teaching of the marvels of the sravakas, pratyekabuddhas, and perfect buddhas.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: byang chub sems dpa' thog ma btsas ma thag tu sus kyang ma bstan par gom pa bdun song ba dang / spre'us sbrang rtsi phul ba la sogs pa bstan pa lta bu'o //üîΩgtan la phab par bstan pa zhes bya ba ni ji tsam du don la 'bab par bye brag phye ste mtshan nyid bstan pa'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' thog ma btsas ma thag tu sus kyang ma bstan par gom pa bdun song ba dang / spre'us sbrang rtsi phul ba la sogs pa bstan pa lta bu'o // gtan la phab par bstan pa zhes bya ba ni ji tsam du don la 'bab par bye brag phye ste mtshan nyid bstan pa'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: For example, the Bodhisattva, immediately after his birth, took seven steps without being held by anyone, and the offering of honey by the monkey.

original: de la mdo sde 'di dang / @196a * //üîΩmya ngan las 'das par dgur bstan pa ni rtogs pa brjod pa dang / gleng gzhi ni de lta bu byung ba'i sde nyid du bsdus te /
analyzed: de la mdo sde 'di dang / @196a * // mya ngan las 'das par dgur bstan pa ni rtogs pa brjod pa dang / gleng gzhi ni de lta bu byung ba'i sde nyid du bsdus te /
translated: The Jataka tales are included in the Avadanas.üîΩThe Jatakas are included in the Avadanas, because they are stories of the Bodhisattva‚Äôs previous births.

original: nga'i rtogs pa de dang de lta bur byung zhes pa dang / sngon gyi dus na gzhi 'di las nyes pa 'di ltar byung bas zhes ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nga'i rtogs pa de dang de lta bur byung zhes pa dang / sngon gyi dus na gzhi 'di las nyes pa 'di ltar byung bas zhes ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The Nidana Sutras are included in the Vaipulya, because they are stories of the Buddha‚Äôs previous lives.

original: gtan la phab pa ni shin tu rgyas pa nyid kyi nang du bsdus te /
analyzed: gtan la phab pa ni shin tu rgyas pa nyid kyi nang du bsdus te /
translated: The Vaipulya Sutras are included in the Vaipulya itself.

original: des shin tu rgyas pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i dgongs don 'ga' zhig 'chad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des shin tu rgyas pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i dgongs don 'ga' zhig 'chad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it explains some of the intended meaning of the Perfection of Wisdom in Extensive Form.

original: de yang mdo sde 'di dang / dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: de yang mdo sde 'di dang / dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: And that is like this Sutra and the Sa·πÉdhinirmocana.

original: 'di rnams sde snod gsum du 'dus te /
analyzed: 'di rnams sde snod gsum du 'dus te /
translated: These are included in the Three Baskets.

analyzed: lta ba gnyis ni sgro 'dogs pa dang skur ba'i lta ba'o //

analyzed: yid spangs pa ni rtog pa @196b dang bcas pa'i yid spangs pa'o //

translated: The meaning of ‚ÄúIn what way? What?‚Äù and so on is: In what way? What is its nature? By what causes and conditions? Whose incorrect conceptualization arises? The repeated word ‚Äúarising‚Äù shows that it arises continuously.

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das zhes pa la sogs pas rang gi ngo bo ci zhig ces pa'i don bstan to //
translated: The BhagavƒÅn, etc. teaches the meaning of ‚Äúwhat is its own essence?‚Äù

translated: In what, etc. teaches the cause of the continuous occurrence of the examination of what object.

original: brtags pa'i don la rgyun chags su zhen pa'i tshul gyis phyin ci log gi rnam par rtog pa rgyun chags su 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: brtags pa'i don la rgyun chags su zhen pa'i tshul gyis phyin ci log gi rnam par rtog pa rgyun chags su 'byung ba'o //
translated: The meaning of the reply is that the continuous occurrence of mistaken conceptuality arises in the manner of continuous adherence to the meaning of the examination of the meaning of the appearance of the various apprehended objects and apprehending subjects as real entities.

original: blo gros chen po gzung ba dang zhes pa la sogs pas snga ma'i don rgyas par 'chad de /
analyzed: blo gros chen po gzung ba dang zhes pa la sogs pas snga ma'i don rgyas par 'chad de /
translated: MahƒÅmati, etc. explains the meaning of the former in detail.

original: de la rang gi sems snang ba tsam du ma rtogs shing /
analyzed: de la rang gi sems snang ba tsam du ma rtogs shing /
translated: Therein, those who have not realized that [appearances] are merely one‚Äôs own mind,
