analyzed: gzung 'dzin la mngon par chags pa ni nyan thos kyi rigs can rnams te /
translated: and who are attached to apprehended objects and apprehending subjects, are those of the ≈õrƒÅvaka type.

original: de ltar chags pa'i bag chags shin tu rgyas pa rnams phyi rol gyi don sna tshogs dmigs pa la mngon par chags pa dang zhes 'og tu sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar chags pa'i bag chags shin tu rgyas pa rnams phyi rol gyi don sna tshogs dmigs pa la mngon par chags pa dang zhes 'og tu sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: In this way, the very extensive latent propensities of attachment should be applied to the statement ‚Äúattachment to the observation of various external objects.‚Äù

original: yod pa dang med par lta ba'i phyogs su lhung ba mu stegs byed kyi lta ba la so sor rnam par rtog pa'i bag chags shin tu rgyas pa rnams bdag dang bdag gir mngon par chags zhes sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: yod pa dang med par lta ba'i phyogs su lhung ba mu stegs byed kyi lta ba la so sor rnam par rtog pa'i bag chags shin tu rgyas pa rnams bdag dang bdag gir mngon par chags zhes sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The very extensive latent propensities of discursive investigation into the views of the tƒ´rthikas, which fall into the positions of the views of existence and nonexistence, should be applied to the statement ‚Äúattachment to ‚ÄòI‚Äô and ‚Äòmine.‚Äô‚Äù

original: sems ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: sems ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khyad par ro //
translated: ‚ÄúMind‚Äù is a particular of the mental consciousness.

original: sems las byung ba ni dad pa dang / khong khro ba la sogs pa rnam par rtog pa'i phyogs kyis bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: sems las byung ba ni dad pa dang / khong khro ba la sogs pa rnam par rtog pa'i phyogs kyis bsdus pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúMental factors‚Äù are faith, anger, and so on, which are included in the category of conceptuality.

original: blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pas don de nyid brtsad pa spang ba'i sgo nas de'i de bzhin nyid rgyas par 'chad pa'o //
analyzed: blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pas don de nyid brtsad pa spang ba'i sgo nas de'i de bzhin nyid rgyas par 'chad pa'o //
translated: The line ‚ÄúMahƒÅmati, the mind is the root of all dharmas‚Äù and so on is the extensive explanation of its suchness through the elimination of objections to that point.

original: de la brtsad pa'i don ni gal te de ltar rnam par rtog pa 'byung bar 'gyur na kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs mi ldog pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la brtsad pa'i don ni gal te de ltar rnam par rtog pa 'byung bar 'gyur na kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs mi ldog pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: The point of debate is this: if such conceptualization were to occur, the side of affliction would not be reversed.

original: ji ste phyi'i dngos po dang dngos po med pa sna tshogs su brtags pa'i don yang dag pa'i shes rab kyis rnam par bzlog ste /
analyzed: ji ste phyi'i dngos po dang dngos po med pa sna tshogs su brtags pa'i don yang dag pa'i shes rab kyis rnam par bzlog ste /
translated: If the meaning of the various imputed external entities and nonentities is reversed by authentic wisdom,üîΩand

original: gnyis su med pa'i @197a * //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i @197a * //
translated: nondual

original: rang rig pa don dam pa'i bden pa rtogs pas de ltar rnam par rtog pa'i rgyun las bzlog par bya ba yin zhing 'dogs par 'gyur bas nyes pa snga ma las grol lo zhe na /
analyzed: rang rig pa don dam pa'i bden pa rtogs pas de ltar rnam par rtog pa'i rgyun las bzlog par bya ba yin zhing 'dogs par 'gyur bas nyes pa snga ma las grol lo zhe na /
translated: self-awareness realizes ultimate truth, then it would be reversed from the continuum of conceptualization in that way and would be imputed, so it is free from the previous fault.

original: de lta na bcom ldan 'das gnyis su med pa'i rang rig pa don dam pa yang spyir tshad ma'i yul las bzlog pa dang / khyad par du dbang po'i yul las 'das pa ste /
analyzed: de lta na bcom ldan 'das gnyis su med pa'i rang rig pa don dam pa yang spyir tshad ma'i yul las bzlog pa dang / khyad par du dbang po'i yul las 'das pa ste /
translated: If so, then the nondual self-awareness of the BhagavƒÅn would be generally reversed from the domain of valid knowledge and, in particular, would transcend the domain of the sense faculties.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: mig dang rna ba sna yang tshad ma min //
analyzed: mig dang rna ba sna yang tshad ma min //
translated: The eye, ear, and nose are not valid cognitions.

original: zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs pas don dam pa'i de kho na nyid de 'dra ba dbang po'i mngon sum la sogs pas ma grub cing /
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs pas don dam pa'i de kho na nyid de 'dra ba dbang po'i mngon sum la sogs pas ma grub cing /
translated: As it is said, the ultimate reality is not established by the direct perception of the senses and so forth.

original: shes byed kyi rgyu tshul gsum dang ldan pa'i rtags dang / gtan tshigs kyi yan lag dpe las 'das pas rjes su dpag pa'i yul yang ma yin la /
analyzed: shes byed kyi rgyu tshul gsum dang ldan pa'i rtags dang / gtan tshigs kyi yan lag dpe las 'das pas rjes su dpag pa'i yul yang ma yin la /
translated: It is not an object of inference, because it transcends the trimodal logical reason that proves it and the example that illustrates it.

original: yang cha shas las rnam par log pa ste /
analyzed: yang cha shas las rnam par log pa ste /
translated: It is also free from parts.

original: sna tshogs su snang ba'i rnam pa'am /
analyzed: sna tshogs su snang ba'i rnam pa'am /
translated: It is free from the aspects that appear as various things,

original: shes pa skad cig ma'i cha shas las log pa ste /
analyzed: shes pa skad cig ma'i cha shas las log pa ste /
translated: or from the parts of the momentary consciousness.

original: gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma sngar bstan pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma sngar bstan pa lta bu'o //
translated: The valid cognition that refutes it is as explained above.

original: de'i phyir de 'dra ba'i yul rnam par bzlog pa na de ltar rtog cing 'jal ba'i shes rab nyid du 'dod pa yang bzlog par bya zhing ldog pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir de 'dra ba'i yul rnam par bzlog pa na de ltar rtog cing 'jal ba'i shes rab nyid du 'dod pa yang bzlog par bya zhing ldog pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, when such an object is refuted, the wisdom that conceives of and measures it is also refuted and ceases to exist.

original: gal te de 'dra pa'i don dam pa las rnam par rtog pa mi 'byung zhing de nyid kyis bzlog par bya ba med do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de 'dra pa'i don dam pa las rnam par rtog pa mi 'byung zhing de nyid kyis bzlog par bya ba med do zhe na /
translated: If you say that conceptualization does not arise from such an ultimate and that it is not to be refuted by it,

original: bcom ldan 'das phyi'i don sna tshogs su snang ba la rtog cing zhen pa'i tshul gyis rnam par rtog pa 'byung bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das phyi'i don sna tshogs su snang ba la rtog cing zhen pa'i tshul gyis rnam par rtog pa 'byung bar 'gyur la /
translated: The BhagavƒÅn, you must accept the reason for the distinction that conceptual thoughts arise in the manner of conceiving and clinging to the various external objects that appear,

original: don dam pa'i mtshan nyid la chags shing rtogs pas ni rnam rtog rgyun chags su mi 'byung ba'i khyad par gyi rgyu mtshan khas len dgos par 'gyur na /
analyzed: don dam pa'i mtshan nyid la chags shing rtogs pas ni rnam rtog rgyun chags su mi 'byung ba'i khyad par gyi rgyu mtshan khas len dgos par 'gyur na /
translated: but conceptual thoughts do not arise continuously due to attachment to and conception of the characteristics of ultimate reality.

original: de yang mi 'thad ces pa'o //
analyzed: de yang mi 'thad ces pa'o //
translated: But that is untenable.

original: de'i phyir phyin ci log gam yang dag pa'i shes rab kyis bsdus pa'i shes pa yang rung ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir phyin ci log gam yang dag pa'i shes rab kyis bsdus pa'i shes pa yang rung ste /
translated: Therefore, whether it is a mistaken consciousness or a consciousness subsumed by correct wisdom,

original: sngar ma byung ba las byung zhing byung nas kyang 'jig pa nyid don dam pa'i dngos por khas len na /
analyzed: sngar ma byung ba las byung zhing byung nas kyang 'jig pa nyid don dam pa'i dngos por khas len na /
translated: if you accept that it arises from what did not previously exist and that having arisen it is destroyed, then it is an ultimate thing.

original: 'di ni 'jig rten rgyang 'phen pa'i phyogs la brten par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ni 'jig rten rgyang 'phen pa'i phyogs la brten par 'gyur te /
translated: This would be based on the position of the LokƒÅyata.

original: de dag gis mngon par gsal ba'i sems can sngar med pa las 'byung ba 'dus pa'i stobs kyis byung zhing de nyid yang ldog pa nyid du 'dod pa dang / thar pa mya ngan las 'das pa khas mi len pa dang mtshungs par 'gyur ba'i @197b phyir ro zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gis mngon par gsal ba'i sems can sngar med pa las 'byung ba 'dus pa'i stobs kyis byung zhing de nyid yang ldog pa nyid du 'dod pa dang / thar pa mya ngan las 'das pa khas mi len pa dang mtshungs par 'gyur ba'i @197b phyir ro zhes pa'o //
translated: Because it would be similar to asserting that sentient beings who are clearly manifest arise from a non-existent cause and that they arise by the power of a collection and that they cease again.

original: lan gyi don ni don dam pa'i de kho na nyid du phyin ci log gam yang dag pa'i shes rab kyang rung ste /
analyzed: lan gyi don ni don dam pa'i de kho na nyid du phyin ci log gam yang dag pa'i shes rab kyang rung ste /
translated: The meaning of the reply is that in terms of the ultimate thatness, whether it is mistaken or correct wisdom,

original: sems kyi ngo bo ma byung ba las byung ba dang / ldog pa nyid du khas mi len pas de 'dra ba'i nyes pa las grol ba'o //
analyzed: sems kyi ngo bo ma byung ba las byung ba dang / ldog pa nyid du khas mi len pas de 'dra ba'i nyes pa las grol ba'o //
translated: since the essence of mind is not asserted to arise from a non-arisen or to cease again, one is free from such faults.

original: gzhan yang phyi'i don ni sngar bstan pa ltar yang dag pa'i kun rdzob tu yang ma grub pas de ltar 'dzin pa'i blo ni phyin ci log yin pa dang / log pa gzhan gyi yang rgyur 'gyur la /
analyzed: gzhan yang phyi'i don ni sngar bstan pa ltar yang dag pa'i kun rdzob tu yang ma grub pas de ltar 'dzin pa'i blo ni phyin ci log yin pa dang / log pa gzhan gyi yang rgyur 'gyur la /
translated: Moreover, as was previously explained, external objects are not established even in the correct relative. Therefore, the mind that apprehends them is mistaken, and it becomes the cause of other errors.

original: de'i rang bzhin shes pas ldog par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin shes pas ldog par 'gyur gyi /
translated: By knowing their nature, they cease.

original: don dam pa'i mtshan nyid ni phyin ci ma log pa so so rang rig pa'i ye shes sgyu ma lta bu yin la de'i phyir phyin ci log pa'am ma log pa gzhan gyi rgyur mi 'thad cing rgyun las nyams par mi 'gyur bas mtshungs pa ma yin no
analyzed: don dam pa'i mtshan nyid ni phyin ci ma log pa so so rang rig pa'i ye shes sgyu ma lta bu yin la de'i phyir phyin ci log pa'am ma log pa gzhan gyi rgyur mi 'thad cing rgyun las nyams par mi 'gyur bas mtshungs pa ma yin no
translated: The definition of the ultimate is the unmistaken, individually reflexive awareness that is illusionlike. Therefore it is not tenable that it is the cause of the other, the mistaken, and since it does not degenerate, it is not similar.

original: // 'dir tshig gi don ni 'byung ba 'byung na zhes pa yan chad kyis ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i tshul lugs rjes su brjod nas de lta na kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs ldog par mi 'gyur ro zhes brtsad pa dang / de'i lan gyi don sngar bstan pa ltar rnam par rtog pa bzlog par bya zhing ldog pa nyid du bstan pa la /
analyzed: // 'dir tshig gi don ni 'byung ba 'byung na zhes pa yan chad kyis ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i tshul lugs rjes su brjod nas de lta na kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs ldog par mi 'gyur ro zhes brtsad pa dang / de'i lan gyi don sngar bstan pa ltar rnam par rtog pa bzlog par bya zhing ldog pa nyid du bstan pa la /
translated: Here the meaning of the words is as follows. The passage beginning ‚ÄúIf the elements were to arise‚Äù presents an objection, namely, that if the TathƒÅgata‚Äôs system were like that, then the side of affliction would not be reversed. The meaning of the reply is as previously explained. The reply is that conceptualization is to be reversed, and it is taught that it is to be reversed.

original: yod pa dang med pa ni gzugs la sogs pa rang rang gi bdag nyid du yod cing /
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa ni gzugs la sogs pa rang rang gi bdag nyid du yod cing /
translated: Existence and nonexistence refer to the existence of form and so on in their own nature.

original: phan tshun gyi bdag nyid du med par lta ba'i phyogs su ltung ba de 'dra ba'i dngos po dang dngos po med par 'dzin pa las dben pa de ltar lta ba'i mtshan nyid las ji ltar bzlog pa ste /
analyzed: phan tshun gyi bdag nyid du med par lta ba'i phyogs su ltung ba de 'dra ba'i dngos po dang dngos po med par 'dzin pa las dben pa de ltar lta ba'i mtshan nyid las ji ltar bzlog pa ste /
translated: The view that is free from such grasping at things and non-things is the opposite of the characteristics of the view.

original: de'i yul bkag pa'i sgo nas bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: de'i yul bkag pa'i sgo nas bzlog pa'o //
translated: The object of that is negated.

original: gcig la zhes pa ni phyi'i don no //
analyzed: gcig la zhes pa ni phyi'i don no //
translated: ‚ÄúOne‚Äù refers to external objects.

original: yod pa dang med pa'i phyogs ni sngar bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa'i phyogs ni sngar bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: The positions of existence and non-existence are as previously explained.

original: khyod la zhes pa ni khyod kyi grub pa'i mtha' phyogs la'o //
analyzed: khyod la zhes pa ni khyod kyi grub pa'i mtha' phyogs la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúYours‚Äù refers to your philosophical position.

original: yang dag pa ma yin zhes pa la sogs pas sngar gyi don bsdus te bstan pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin zhes pa la sogs pas sngar gyi don bsdus te bstan pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúNot real‚Äù and so on summarizes and teaches the previous meaning.

original: sgyu ma'i yan lag gi skyes bu ni yan lag 'dus pa'i skyes pa dang bud med la sogs par snang ba'o //
analyzed: sgyu ma'i yan lag gi skyes bu ni yan lag 'dus pa'i skyes pa dang bud med la sogs par snang ba'o //
translated: The illusory person of the limbs appears as a man or woman composed of limbs.

original: tha dad pa rnam pa sna tshogs ni sngags dang sman la sogs pa'i rgyu rkyen no //
analyzed: tha dad pa rnam pa sna tshogs ni sngags dang sman la sogs pa'i rgyu rkyen no //
translated: The various different aspects are the causes and conditions of mantra, medicine, and so on.

original: de rnams las sgyu ma'i gzugs gcig grub cing /
analyzed: de rnams las sgyu ma'i gzugs gcig grub cing /
translated: From those, one illusory form is produced.

original: yang ldog par 'gyur ba de bzhin du rtog pas sna tshogs su brtags pa la brten nas dngos po dang dngos po med par rnam par rtog pa rgyun chags su @198a * //
analyzed: yang ldog par 'gyur ba de bzhin du rtog pas sna tshogs su brtags pa la brten nas dngos po dang dngos po med par rnam par rtog pa rgyun chags su @198a * //
translated: Just as in the case of the CƒÅrvƒÅkas, in the same way, on the basis of the various conceptual imputations, the continuum of the conceptualization of things and nonthings occurs.

original: 'byung ba las /
analyzed: 'byung ba las /
translated: From that,

original: sngar bstan pa ltar de'i yul bkag pa'i sgo nas rtog pa'i rgyun bzlog pa'i phyir rgyang 'phen pa dang mtshungs zhes pa'o //
analyzed: sngar bstan pa ltar de'i yul bkag pa'i sgo nas rtog pa'i rgyun bzlog pa'i phyir rgyang 'phen pa dang mtshungs zhes pa'o //
translated: as was previously explained, in order to stop the continuum of conceptualization by way of refuting its objects, it is said to be similar to the CƒÅrvƒÅka.

original: 'dir sgyu ma dper byas pa ni byang chub sems dpa' blo gros chen pos 'byung ba dang / ldog pa sgyu ma dang 'dra bar rtogs shing /
analyzed: 'dir sgyu ma dper byas pa ni byang chub sems dpa' blo gros chen pos 'byung ba dang / ldog pa sgyu ma dang 'dra bar rtogs shing /
translated: Here, the example of an illusion is in order to show that the great bodhisattva MahƒÅmati understands arising and ceasing to be like an illusion.

original: shugs la de ltar ston pa'o //
analyzed: shugs la de ltar ston pa'o //
translated: The force of that is what teaches this.

original: gzhan du na zhes pa la sogs pa'i don ni 'byung ba dang ldog pa sgyu ma lta bur ston pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan du na zhes pa la sogs pa'i don ni 'byung ba dang ldog pa sgyu ma lta bur ston pa'o //
translated: Otherwise, the meaning of ‚Äúand so on‚Äù is that arising and ceasing are taught to be like an illusion.

original: lo rgyus las byung ba sngon du 'gro zhes pa ni nang gi mngon par chags pa'i sa bon dang / phyi rol du snang ba mi dge ba'i grogs po la sogs pas bstan pa'i sgra las thog mar rnam par rtog pa 'byung zhing /
analyzed: lo rgyus las byung ba sngon du 'gro zhes pa ni nang gi mngon par chags pa'i sa bon dang / phyi rol du snang ba mi dge ba'i grogs po la sogs pas bstan pa'i sgra las thog mar rnam par rtog pa 'byung zhing /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúarising from what has occurred in the past‚Äù refers to the seed of internal manifest clinging, and the sound that is taught by external nonvirtuous friends, and so on. First, conceptualization arises from that.

original: de sngon du 'gro ba can gyi rgyun gzhan yang 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: de sngon du 'gro ba can gyi rgyun gzhan yang 'byung ba'o //
translated: And from that as a prior condition, another continuum arises.

original: ji ltar na zhes pa la sogs pa kun rdzob tu rnam par rtog pa la ldog pa'i tshul gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar na zhes pa la sogs pa kun rdzob tu rnam par rtog pa la ldog pa'i tshul gsungs pa'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúhow is it‚Äù and so on explains the method of reversing conceptualization in the relative.

original: 'bras bu'i nyes pa na de dag tu sgro 'dogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i nyes pa na de dag tu sgro 'dogs pa'o //
translated: The fault of the result is the superimposition of those.

original: gzhan ni phal cher go bar zad do //üîΩgang na'ang yod med yod min nang //
analyzed: gzhan ni phal cher go bar zad do // gang na'ang yod med yod min nang //
translated: The rest is mostly self-evident.

original: zhes pa ni yod pa dang med pa'i rang gi ngo bo nyid kyang ma grub pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni yod pa dang med pa'i rang gi ngo bo nyid kyang ma grub pa'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúneither existent nor nonexistent‚Äù means that even the nature of existence and nonexistence is not established.

original: sems kyang rnam rtog zhes pa ni sa bon spangs pas phyin ci log gi sems med pa'o //
analyzed: sems kyang rnam rtog zhes pa ni sa bon spangs pas phyin ci log gi sems med pa'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe mind is also conceptualization‚Äù means that since the seed is abandoned, the mind of error does not exist.

original: gang phyir rkyen las byung bas na //
analyzed: gang phyir rkyen las byung bas na //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúbecause it arises from conditions‚Äù means that since it arises from conditions, it is not truly existent.

original: zhes pa la sogs pa'i don ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i gtan tshigs kyi rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po don dam pa pa 'gog pa ste /üîΩ'di'i chos can dang dgag bya la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa'i don ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i gtan tshigs kyi rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po don dam pa pa 'gog pa ste / 'di'i chos can dang dgag bya la sogs pa ni /
translated: The meaning of this and the rest is that the reason of dependent origination refutes the ultimate existence of things that are causes and effects.

original: sngar bstan pa bzhin no //üîΩgtan tshigs kyi don ni rkyen las skye bar snang ba sgyu ma lta bu'i rten 'brel te /
analyzed: sngar bstan pa bzhin no // gtan tshigs kyi don ni rkyen las skye bar snang ba sgyu ma lta bu'i rten 'brel te /
translated: The subject, the object of refutation, and so forth in this context are as they were explained above.

original: mngon sum la sogs pa'i tshad mas grub pa'o //üîΩgtan tshigs nyid du nye bar 'god pa na /
analyzed: mngon sum la sogs pa'i tshad mas grub pa'o // gtan tshigs nyid du nye bar 'god pa na /
translated: The meaning of the reason is that the dependent origination of illusionlike appearances arising from conditions is established by such valid cognitions as direct perception.

original: sgyu ma la sogs pas khyad par du ma byas par rkyen las skya bar snang ba'i phyir zhes pa'o //üîΩde nyid la don dam par ma skyes pas khyab pa grub pa'i tshul ni /
analyzed: sgyu ma la sogs pas khyad par du ma byas par rkyen las skya bar snang ba'i phyir zhes pa'o // de nyid la don dam par ma skyes pas khyab pa grub pa'i tshul ni /
translated: When the reason is stated, it is stated as ‚Äúbecause of appearing to arise from conditions without being specified by such things as ‚Äòillusion.‚Äù

original: rkyen rnams thams cad ces pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: rkyen rnams thams cad ces pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The way to establish the pervasion that whatever is dependently originated is ultimately non-arisen is stated in the lines beginning with ‚ÄúAll these conditions . . .‚Äù

original: gang 'ga' zhig kho na'i rjes thogs su 'ga' zhig byung ba ni snga ma de'i 'bras bu ste /
analyzed: gang 'ga' zhig kho na'i rjes thogs su 'ga' zhig byung ba ni snga ma de'i 'bras bu ste /
translated: The arising of some things only after some other things is the effect of the former.

original: des na 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid ni ltos pa yin la /
analyzed: des na 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid ni ltos pa yin la /
translated: Therefore, the definition of effect is dependence.

original: 'bras bu 'bras bu'i dus su ma grub na /
analyzed: 'bras bu 'bras bu'i dus su ma grub na /
translated: If the effect does not exist at the time of the effect,

original: rgyu snga ma de nyid gang gi rgyur 'gyur te /
analyzed: rgyu snga ma de nyid gang gi rgyur 'gyur te /
translated: then what would be the cause of the prior cause?

original: de la ltos pa'i rgyu'i ngo bor mi @198b 'thad do //
analyzed: de la ltos pa'i rgyu'i ngo bor mi @198b 'thad do //
translated: It is not tenable that it is the entity of the cause that depends on it.

original: des ni de nyid rgyu'i ngo bor grub pa 'bras bu la ltos pas /
analyzed: des ni de nyid rgyu'i ngo bor grub pa 'bras bu la ltos pas /
translated: Since that which is established as the entity of the cause depends on the effect,

original: de'i 'bras bu nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: it becomes the effect of that.

original: gal te de lta na yang 'bras bu ma skyes nas med pa'i dus su /
analyzed: gal te de lta na yang 'bras bu ma skyes nas med pa'i dus su /
translated: But even if that is so, since the effect does not exist because it has not arisen,

original: rgyu rang gi rgyu snga ma las grub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rgyu rang gi rgyu snga ma las grub pa'i phyir /
translated: the cause is established from its own prior cause.

original: de la ltos pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de la ltos pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: Therefore it does not depend on it.

original: de bzhin du rgyu 'gags nas med pa'i dus na /
analyzed: de bzhin du rgyu 'gags nas med pa'i dus na /
translated: In the same way, when the cause has ceased and does not exist,

original: 'bras bu rang gi 'bras bu phyi ma la ltos nas grub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'bras bu rang gi 'bras bu phyi ma la ltos nas grub pa'i phyir /
translated: since the effect is established in dependence on its own subsequent effect,

original: de la ltos pa ma yin par 'gyur ro //üîΩgal te rang gi 'bras bu phyi ma ma skyes nas med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la ltos pa ma yin par 'gyur ro // gal te rang gi 'bras bu phyi ma ma skyes nas med pa'i phyir /
translated: it would not depend on it.

original: de la ltos nas grub pa mi 'thad do zhe na /
analyzed: de la ltos nas grub pa mi 'thad do zhe na /
translated: But if you say that it is not tenable that it is established in dependence on it because its own subsequent effect does not exist because it has not arisen,üîΩthen in that case,

original: de bzhin du rang gi rgyu snga ma yang 'gags nas med pa'i phyir de la ltos nas grub pa mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de bzhin du rang gi rgyu snga ma yang 'gags nas med pa'i phyir de la ltos nas grub pa mi 'thad do //
translated: Likewise, since its own previous cause has ceased and does not exist, it is untenable that it is established in dependence on that.

original: gzhan yang gal te /
analyzed: gzhan yang gal te /
translated: Moreover, if

original: 'dir 'bras bu phyi ma'i dus na /
analyzed: 'dir 'bras bu phyi ma'i dus na /
translated: the effect exists at a later time,

original: rgyu 'gags nas med kyang sngar rgyu'i dus na yod pa la brten nas /
analyzed: rgyu 'gags nas med kyang sngar rgyu'i dus na yod pa la brten nas /
translated: even though the cause has ceased and does not exist,

original: 'bras bu phyi ma grub pa yin la /
analyzed: 'bras bu phyi ma grub pa yin la /
translated: the later effect is established in dependence on the earlier cause.

original: rgyu sngar gyi dus na med na 'bras bu yang phyi ma'i dus su mi 'byung bas /
analyzed: rgyu sngar gyi dus na med na 'bras bu yang phyi ma'i dus su mi 'byung bas /
translated: If the cause did not exist at the earlier time, the effect would not occur at the later time.

original: de la ltos par 'thad la /
analyzed: de la ltos par 'thad la /
translated: Therefore it is tenable that it depends on that.

original: rgyu ni de ltar 'bras bu la ltos pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu ni de ltar 'bras bu la ltos pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But the cause does not depend on the effect in that way.

original: mtshungs te / 'bras bu phyis kyi dus su yod pas rgyu sngar gyi dus su byung zhing /
analyzed: mtshungs te / 'bras bu phyis kyi dus su yod pas rgyu sngar gyi dus su byung zhing /
translated: This is similar, because since the effect exists at a later time, the cause occurred at an earlier time.

original: gal te 'bras bu phyis kyi dus su ma grub na /
analyzed: gal te 'bras bu phyis kyi dus su ma grub na /
translated: If the effect is not established at a later time,

original: rgyu yang sngar gyi dus su mi 'grub pas /
analyzed: rgyu yang sngar gyi dus su mi 'grub pas /
translated: the cause is not established at an earlier time.

original: de yang 'bras bu la ltos pa nyid du mtshungs so //
analyzed: de yang 'bras bu la ltos pa nyid du mtshungs so //
translated: Therefore it is similar that it depends on the effect.

original: de ltar na rkyen rnams ni rang gi 'bras bu las skye bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: de ltar na rkyen rnams ni rang gi 'bras bu las skye bar 'gyur na /
translated: Thus, if conditions arise from their effects,

original: de ni skye ba mi srid de /
analyzed: de ni skye ba mi srid de /
translated: It is impossible for it to arise.

original: 'bras bu de nyid kyang rgyu dang 'bras bu gnyis su 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'bras bu de nyid kyang rgyu dang 'bras bu gnyis su 'gyur la /
translated: The effect itself would be both cause and effect.

original: de bzhin du rgyu yang gnyis su 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: de bzhin du rgyu yang gnyis su 'gyur bas so //
translated: And likewise, the cause would be both.

original: de ni 'dod pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: de ni 'dod pa nyid yin te /
translated: This is precisely what we accept.

original: 'bras bu gcig po de nyid snga ma'i 'bras bur 'gyur la ;
analyzed: 'bras bu gcig po de nyid snga ma'i 'bras bur 'gyur la ;
translated: The very same single effect would be the former effect and

original: / phyi ma'i rgyur 'gyur bas so zhe na /
analyzed: / phyi ma'i rgyur 'gyur bas so zhe na /
translated: the latter cause.

original: ma yin te /üîΩ'dir 'bras bur 'dod pa gcig po de nyid dus gcig tu rang gi rgyu snga ma gcig po la ltos te /
analyzed: ma yin te / 'dir 'bras bur 'dod pa gcig po de nyid dus gcig tu rang gi rgyu snga ma gcig po la ltos te /
translated: This is not so.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu gnyi gar 'gyur la /üîΩrgyu snga ma gcig po yang 'bras bu phyi ma gcig po la ltos te /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu gnyi gar 'gyur la / rgyu snga ma gcig po yang 'bras bu phyi ma gcig po la ltos te /
translated: The very same single effect that is accepted here would be both cause and effect in relation to its own former single cause at the same time.

original: dus gcig tu rgyu 'bras gnyis kar 'gyur na /
analyzed: dus gcig tu rgyu 'bras gnyis kar 'gyur na /
translated: And the very same former single cause would be both cause and effect in relation to its own latter single effect at the same time.

original: de 'dra ba ni 'gal bas mi srid ces pa'o //
analyzed: de 'dra ba ni 'gal bas mi srid ces pa'o //
translated: But such a thing is contradictory and impossible.

original: des na 'dir khyab pa'i don ni /
analyzed: des na 'dir khyab pa'i don ni /
translated: Therefore, the meaning of the pervasion here is this:

original: rten cing 'brel bar snang ba don dam par bden na /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar snang ba don dam par bden na /
translated: If dependent appearances were ultimately real,

original: snang ba dang mthun par rgyu dang rkyen las skye bas khyab la /
analyzed: snang ba dang mthun par rgyu dang rkyen las skye bas khyab la /
translated: they would necessarily arise from causes and conditions in accordance with appearances.

original: de yang rgyu dang 'bras bu phan tshun ma 'chol @199a * //üîΩbas khyab pa las /
analyzed: de yang rgyu dang 'bras bu phan tshun ma 'chol @199a * // bas khyab pa las /
translated: Moreover, cause and effect are not confused with each other.

original: 'dir rgyu 'bras 'chol bar 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dir rgyu 'bras 'chol bar 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: In this case, cause and effect would be confused.

original: rgyu 'bras don dam pa bar mi 'thad ces pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu 'bras don dam pa bar mi 'thad ces pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is not tenable that cause and effect are ultimate.

original: dmigs pa dang / dmigs bya zhes pa la sogs pas sems nyid rig pa'i gzhan gyi dbang sgyu ma lta bur ston te /
analyzed: dmigs pa dang / dmigs bya zhes pa la sogs pas sems nyid rig pa'i gzhan gyi dbang sgyu ma lta bur ston te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe object of observation and the observer‚Äù and so forth teaches that the mind itself is the dependent consciousness that is like an illusion.

original: de las dang po rnam par dag pa mthar thug pa sems tsam ni kun rdzob tu dri ma rnams sa bon dang bcas te spangs pa gnyis su med pa rang rig pa tsam gyi ngo bo ye shes bzhis bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: de las dang po rnam par dag pa mthar thug pa sems tsam ni kun rdzob tu dri ma rnams sa bon dang bcas te spangs pa gnyis su med pa rang rig pa tsam gyi ngo bo ye shes bzhis bsdus pa'o //
translated: First, the mind only that is the ultimate of complete purity is the essence of mere self-awareness that is not dualistic, in which the stains together with their seeds are conventionally abandoned, and it is included within the four exalted wisdoms.

original: sems med pa'i sems tsam zhes pa ni sngar bstan pa ltar zung 'jug gi don no //üîΩgal te 'di tsam zhes pa de las gzhan pa'i dngos por ni ma grub la /
analyzed: sems med pa'i sems tsam zhes pa ni sngar bstan pa ltar zung 'jug gi don no // gal te 'di tsam zhes pa de las gzhan pa'i dngos por ni ma grub la /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúmind only that is without mind‚Äù is the meaning of union, as was previously explained.

original: de nyid bden pa'i dngos por yod pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: de nyid bden pa'i dngos por yod pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: If it is asked, ‚ÄúIs this mind only not established as an entity that is other than that, and is it not that it itself exists as a real entity?‚Äù

original: tsam de ngo bo nyid kyi dbyings //
analyzed: tsam de ngo bo nyid kyi dbyings //
translated: The answer is that mere mind is the basic space of the nature of phenomena.

original: zhes pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ste /
translated: üîΩüîΩ

original: don dam par chos nyid stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin du 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: don dam par chos nyid stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin du 'gyur ba'o //
translated: This is the ultimate, the nature of emptiness.

original: de nyid gsal bar ston pa ni /
analyzed: de nyid gsal bar ston pa ni /
translated: This is clarified:

original: rkyen dang dngos po spangs zhes pa'o //
analyzed: rkyen dang dngos po spangs zhes pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúFree from conditions and entities.‚ÄùüîΩThe ultimate entity is the supreme Brahma.

original: mthar thug dngos po tshangs pa'i mchog / ces pa ni ye shes mthar thug pa dri ma thams cad sa bon dang bcas te spangs pa'o //
analyzed: mthar thug dngos po tshangs pa'i mchog / ces pa ni ye shes mthar thug pa dri ma thams cad sa bon dang bcas te spangs pa'o //
translated: This is the ultimate pristine awareness, free from all stains together with their seeds.

original: bden par zhes pa la sogs pas ni gnas skabs thams cad du bdag med pa nyid du ston pa ste /
analyzed: bden par zhes pa la sogs pas ni gnas skabs thams cad du bdag med pa nyid du ston pa ste /
translated: In all situations, there is no self.

original: de la gang zag gi bdag ni phung po lnga'i rgyun rgyud la btags pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de la gang zag gi bdag ni phung po lnga'i rgyun rgyud la btags pa yin gyi /
translated: The personal self is imputed to the continuum of the five aggregates.

original: rdzas su grub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rdzas su grub pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not substantially established.

original: de bzhin du phung po nyid kyang de ltar snang ba tsam gyi rang bzhin la btags pa yin gyi rdzas su grub pa med do //
analyzed: de bzhin du phung po nyid kyang de ltar snang ba tsam gyi rang bzhin la btags pa yin gyi rdzas su grub pa med do //
translated: Likewise, the aggregates themselves are imputed to the nature of mere appearance. They are not substantially established.

original: de'i phyir 'dus byas thams cad mnyam pa nyid rnam pa bzhis mnyam pa ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dus byas thams cad mnyam pa nyid rnam pa bzhis mnyam pa ste /
translated: Therefore, all conditioned things are the same in four ways.

original: kun rdzob tu skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'jig pa'i mtshan nyid kyis mnyam pa dang / rgyu dang rkyen gyi dngos po las byung bar mnyam pa dang / don dam par bdag med par mnyam pa ste /
analyzed: kun rdzob tu skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'jig pa'i mtshan nyid kyis mnyam pa dang / rgyu dang rkyen gyi dngos po las byung bar mnyam pa dang / don dam par bdag med par mnyam pa ste /
translated: and the same in being ultimately selfless.

original: shes bya'i dbang du byas pa'o //üîΩbzhi pa ni snga ma ltar rnal 'byor ba'i ye shes mthar thug pa 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa'i dri ma dang / rtog pa dang rtog pa'i gzung ba sna tshogs su snang ba spangs pa ste /
analyzed: shes bya'i dbang du byas pa'o // bzhi pa ni snga ma ltar rnal 'byor ba'i ye shes mthar thug pa 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa'i dri ma dang / rtog pa dang rtog pa'i gzung ba sna tshogs su snang ba spangs pa ste /
translated: This is in terms of the objects of cognition.

original: mthar thug pa'i sems tsam mo //
analyzed: mthar thug pa'i sems tsam mo //
translated: The fourth is the ultimate mind-only, which is the wisdom of the yogi/nƒ´, free from the stains of the view of the transitory collection and so on, as well as the various appearances of the apprehended and apprehender, as explained above.

original: dngos po med ces pa la sogs pas ni spyir de kho na nyid kyi sems tsam ston te /
analyzed: dngos po med ces pa la sogs pas ni spyir de kho na nyid kyi sems tsam ston te /
translated: The line ‚Äúnonexistent things‚Äù and so on teaches the mind-only of suchness in general.

original: don dam pa'i dngos por med cing ri bong gi rva ltar rnam pa thams cad du med pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: don dam pa'i dngos por med cing ri bong gi rva ltar rnam pa thams cad du med pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not that suchness is ultimately nonexistent and nonexistent in all ways, like the horns of a rabbit.

original: @199b rig pa ma 'gags pa zung 'jug gi bdag nyid de /
analyzed: @199b rig pa ma 'gags pa zung 'jug gi bdag nyid de /
translated: It is the nature of the union of unceasing awareness,

original: sngar bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: sngar bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: as explained above.

original: de bzhin nyid ces pa la sogs pas stong ba nyid kyi rnam grangs sems tsam du ston pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid ces pa la sogs pas stong ba nyid kyi rnam grangs sems tsam du ston pa'o //
translated: The phrase suchness and so forth indicates the synonyms of emptiness, which are taught to be mind only.

original: mtha' ni yang dag pa'i mtha'o //
analyzed: mtha' ni yang dag pa'i mtha'o //
translated: The limit is the limit of reality.

original: rnam rtog ces pa la sogs pas 'jig rten pa'i sems tsam ston te /
analyzed: rnam rtog ces pa la sogs pas 'jig rten pa'i sems tsam ston te /
translated: The phrase conceptualization and so forth indicates the mind only of the world.

original: dri ma dang bcas pa'i gnas skabs na rnam par rtog pa'i bag chags kyi dbang gis sna tshogs su snang ba ni sems nyid de /
analyzed: dri ma dang bcas pa'i gnas skabs na rnam par rtog pa'i bag chags kyi dbang gis sna tshogs su snang ba ni sems nyid de /
translated: When it is in a state that is still defiled, the various appearances are due to the power of the latent impressions of conceptualization, and they are the mind itself.

original: 'on kyang 'jig rten pas de ltar ma rtogs zhes pa'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang 'jig rten pas de ltar ma rtogs zhes pa'o //
translated: However, the world does not understand it in this way.

original: gzhan ni shes par zad do //
analyzed: gzhan ni shes par zad do //
translated: The rest is easily understood.

original: yang 'dir rnam par rtog pa 'byung ba'i tshul la brtsad pa spangs pa'i gzhung gi don ni phyi rol gyi don sna tshogs su snang ba la rtog cing chags pas rnam par rtog pa rgyun chags su 'byung ba 'byung na /
analyzed: yang 'dir rnam par rtog pa 'byung ba'i tshul la brtsad pa spangs pa'i gzhung gi don ni phyi rol gyi don sna tshogs su snang ba la rtog cing chags pas rnam par rtog pa rgyun chags su 'byung ba 'byung na /
translated: Here, the meaning of the text that eliminates objections to the way in which conceptualization arises is as follows: When the various external objects appear, conceptualization arises continuously due to thought and attachment to them.

original: bcom ldan 'das gcig la yang dag pa ma yin pa'i don sna tshogs su zhes pa la sogs pa'i gzhung gi dum bu 'og ma dang sbyar bar bya ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gcig la yang dag pa ma yin pa'i don sna tshogs su zhes pa la sogs pa'i gzhung gi dum bu 'og ma dang sbyar bar bya ste /
translated: The BhagavƒÅn, with the passage beginning ‚ÄúIf, in the case of a single BhagavƒÅn,‚Äù should be applied to the following passage.

original: de'i don ni phyi rol gyi don sna tshogs su snang ba la rtog cing chags pas rnam par rtog pa 'byung na /
analyzed: de'i don ni phyi rol gyi don sna tshogs su snang ba la rtog cing chags pas rnam par rtog pa 'byung na /
translated: The meaning of that is as follows: If discursive thought arises through conceptualizing and being attached to the appearance of various external objects,

original: don dam pa'i mtshan nyid la chags shing rtog pas kyang ji ltar mi 'byung zhes pa la sogs pa snga ma bzhin te /
analyzed: don dam pa'i mtshan nyid la chags shing rtog pas kyang ji ltar mi 'byung zhes pa la sogs pa snga ma bzhin te /
translated: then why would it not arise through being attached to and conceptualizing the characteristics of the ultimate?

original: des na kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs ldog par mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: des na kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs ldog par mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: As before, this is saying that in that case, the side of affliction would not be reversed.

original: yang bcom ldan 'das phyi rol gyi don sna tshogs zhes pa la sogs pas de ltar brtags shing zhen pa las rnam par rtog pa 'byung yang /
analyzed: yang bcom ldan 'das phyi rol gyi don sna tshogs zhes pa la sogs pas de ltar brtags shing zhen pa las rnam par rtog pa 'byung yang /
translated: Again, the BhagavƒÅn, with the passage beginning ‚ÄúIf, in the case of various external objects,‚Äù and so on, it is said that discursive thought arises from conceptualizing and clinging in that way.

original: de'i yul bkag pa'i sgo nas bzlog par bya zhing lhag pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhe na ni /
analyzed: de'i yul bkag pa'i sgo nas bzlog par bya zhing lhag pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhe na ni /
translated: But if one were to think that it is to be reversed by way of refuting its object, then it would be left over.

original: de bzhin du bcom ldan 'das zhes pa la sogs pa'i don snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du bcom ldan 'das zhes pa la sogs pa'i don snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The meaning of the BhagavƒÅn, with the passage beginning ‚ÄúIn the same way,‚Äù and so on, is as before.

original: dpe dang rgyu'i mtshan nyid las rnam par bzlog pa na /
analyzed: dpe dang rgyu'i mtshan nyid las rnam par bzlog pa na /
translated: When one turns away from the characteristics of examples and causes,

original: de ltar ldog pa'i phyir 'jig rten rgyang 'phen gyi lta ba dang bsam par lhung bar 'gyur zhes 'og ma dang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar ldog pa'i phyir 'jig rten rgyang 'phen gyi lta ba dang bsam par lhung bar 'gyur zhes 'og ma dang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: in that way, one falls into the view and thought of the LokƒÅyatas.

original: de'i don ni phyi na ci log gi rnam par rtog pa dang / de'i gnyen po yang dag pa'i shes rab tu khas len pa'i rnam pa gnyis char kyang ma byung ba las byung ba dang / byung nas kyang bzlog par bya ba nyid du mtshungs shing ldog par 'gyur bas rgyang 'phen pa dang mtshungs zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de'i don ni phyi na ci log gi rnam par rtog pa dang / de'i gnyen po yang dag pa'i shes rab tu khas len pa'i rnam pa gnyis char kyang ma byung ba las byung ba dang / byung nas kyang bzlog par bya ba nyid du mtshungs shing ldog par 'gyur bas rgyang 'phen pa dang mtshungs zhes pa'o //
translated: The meaning of that is as follows: Both the aspect of accepting the arising of the two kinds of misconceptions about external reality and the antidote to those, which is right wisdom, are the same in that they are to be reversed, and they are reversed. Therefore, [the YogƒÅcƒÅra] is similar to the LokƒÅyatas.

original: de nas yang byang chub sems dpa' zhes pa la sogs pas sngar bstan pa gsal byed kyis @200a * //
analyzed: de nas yang byang chub sems dpa' zhes pa la sogs pas sngar bstan pa gsal byed kyis @200a * //
translated: Then, beginning with ‚ÄúNext, the bodhisattva,‚Äù the text clarifies what was taught above.

original: rkyen gyi khyad par tshul gzhan gyi sgo nas rgyas par 'chad pa ste /
analyzed: rkyen gyi khyad par tshul gzhan gyi sgo nas rgyas par 'chad pa ste /
translated: It explains it extensively by way of another method, which is a special condition.

original: de la tshig dang yi ger phrang ba ni go rims kyi tshul gyis 'dus pa'o //
analyzed: de la tshig dang yi ger phrang ba ni go rims kyi tshul gyis 'dus pa'o //
translated: There, ‚Äúthe arrangement of words and letters‚Äù is the collection in the manner of a sequence.

original: bag chags kyi rgyu las skyes pa ni de las don du snang ba'i bsam pa dang de las brjod par 'dod pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bag chags kyi rgyu las skyes pa ni de las don du snang ba'i bsam pa dang de las brjod par 'dod pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: That which arises from the cause of habitual propensities is the thought that appears as an object from that and the desire to express it, and so forth.

original: rang gi blo ni mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam ste /
analyzed: rang gi blo ni mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam ste /
translated: One‚Äôs own mind is the paths of seeing and cultivation.

original: de mthong ba dang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i bag chags kyis gnas rab tu gyur zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de mthong ba dang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i bag chags kyis gnas rab tu gyur zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The transformation of the basis is due to the habitual propensities of the discards of seeing and cultivation.

original: 'dir don la mkhas pa'i yul de nyid don ji lta ba yin pas dris pa'i lan du 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'dir don la mkhas pa'i yul de nyid don ji lta ba yin pas dris pa'i lan du 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Here, the object of expertise in the meaning is suchness, so it is the answer to the question.

original: sgra'i don la mkhas zhes pa ni sgra dang don gnyis ka'i don la mkhas pa ste /
analyzed: sgra'i don la mkhas zhes pa ni sgra dang don gnyis ka'i don la mkhas pa ste /
translated: Expertise in the meaning of words is expertise in both the words and their meaning.

original: de dag don dam par de nyid dang gzhan du brjod du med pas stong ba nyid de /
analyzed: de dag don dam par de nyid dang gzhan du brjod du med pas stong ba nyid de /
translated: Since those are empty of being thatness or other ultimately, they are inexpressible.

original: de ltar rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar rtogs pa'o //
translated: That is the realization.

original: sgra dang don gcig pa dgag pa ni rgyas par sngar bstan no //
analyzed: sgra dang don gcig pa dgag pa ni rgyas par sngar bstan no //
translated: The refutation of the sameness of words and their meaning is taught extensively above.

original: gzhan yang blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pas sgra ji bzhin du mngon par zhen pa'i nyes pa ston te /
analyzed: gzhan yang blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pas sgra ji bzhin du mngon par zhen pa'i nyes pa ston te /
translated: Moreover, ‚ÄúMahƒÅmati, those who are attached to the literal meaning‚Äù and so on teaches the fault of attachment to the literal meaning.

original: sgyu ma sna tshogs mthong ba'i rnam par rtog pa lta bur zhes pa sgyu ma'i glang po la sogs pa sna tshogs su snang ba la rta glang yang dag par sgro 'dogs pa lta bur gzugs la sogs pa sna tshogs su snang ba la yang dag pa duüîΩmar sgro 'dogs pa dang / snang zhing myong ba tsam yang med //üîΩces skur ba ste /

translated: just as the thought that sees various illusions is,üîΩjust as the thought that sees various illusions is,üîΩjust as the thought that sees various illusions is,

original: rnam pa gzhan du lta ba yin zhes pa mkhas pa rnams byis pa dang mi mthun par lta ba'o //üîΩphung po rnams la bdag med de //üîΩzhes pa de rnams bdag gi rang bzhin ma yin te /üîΩbdag dang mtshan nyid mi mthun pa'i phyir ro //

original: de'i don bdag ni rtag pa dang gcig pu la sogs pa'i bdag nyid yin la /
analyzed: de'i don bdag ni rtag pa dang gcig pu la sogs pa'i bdag nyid yin la /
translated: just as the thought that sees various illusions is,üîΩjust as the thought that sees

original: phung po rnams ni de las bzlog pas so //
analyzed: phung po rnams ni de las bzlog pas so //
translated: The aggregates are the opposite of that.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de la brten pa'i tshul du yang med la /üîΩphung po rnams kyang bdag la brten pa'am /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de la brten pa'i tshul du yang med la / phung po rnams kyang bdag la brten pa'am /
translated: Therefore, the self does not exist in the manner of being the basis of the aggregates,

original: de'i bdag nyid kyi tshul gyis med pas te /
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid kyi tshul gyis med pas te /
translated: nor do the aggregates exist in the manner of being the self or having the nature of the self.

original: byis pas rtog pa bzhin du de dag med pa'o //
analyzed: byis pas rtog pa bzhin du de dag med pa'o //
translated: They do not exist as they are imagined by childish beings.

original: yang bdag tu brtags pa'i rten phung por snang ba ni kun rdzob tu med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yang bdag tu brtags pa'i rten phung por snang ba ni kun rdzob tu med pa ma yin no //
translated: However, the appearance of the aggregates as the basis for the imputation of self does not not exist conventionally.

original: de las gzhan du byis pas brtags pa bzhin dngos po bden na /
analyzed: de las gzhan du byis pas brtags pa bzhin dngos po bden na /
translated: If it were true that things exist as they are imagined by childish beings,

original: byis pa'i skye bo thams @200b cad yang dag pa'i don mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byis pa'i skye bo thams @200b cad yang dag pa'i don mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then all childish beings would see the meaning of reality.

original: phung po la sogs par snang ba sems kyi ngo bor gyur ba kun rdzob pa tsam yang med na /
analyzed: phung po la sogs par snang ba sems kyi ngo bor gyur ba kun rdzob pa tsam yang med na /
translated: If the mere conventional appearance of the aggregates and so on as the essence of the mind did not exist,

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba med par 'gyur te /
translated: then affliction and purification would not exist.

original: sems nyid dri ma dang bcas pa dang / de dang bral ba la de ltar rnam par 'jog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems nyid dri ma dang bcas pa dang / de dang bral ba la de ltar rnam par 'jog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the mind itself is posited as being both defiled and being free from defilements.

original: rkang pa gnyis kyis ni don bsdus pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: rkang pa gnyis kyis ni don bsdus pa bstan pa'o //
translated: The second line indicates the summary of the meaning.

original: gzhan yang blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pas sngar rnam par shes pa dang ye shes bstan pa la /
analyzed: gzhan yang blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pas sngar rnam par shes pa dang ye shes bstan pa la /
translated: Moreover, MahƒÅmati, and so on. In the previous teaching on consciousness and gnosis,

original: gdul bya rnams kyis de dag gi bye brag ma rtogs shing the tshom du gyur bas de dgag pa'i don du de dag gi bye brag gsal bar ston to //
analyzed: gdul bya rnams kyis de dag gi bye brag ma rtogs shing the tshom du gyur bas de dgag pa'i don du de dag gi bye brag gsal bar ston to //
translated: the disciples did not understand the distinction between them and had doubts. In order to eliminate those, the distinction between them is clearly shown.

original: skyes nas 'jig pa ni ji ltar rigs pa bzhin rgyun dang skad cig gi dbang du byas pa ste /
analyzed: skyes nas 'jig pa ni ji ltar rigs pa bzhin rgyun dang skad cig gi dbang du byas pa ste /
translated: Arising and ceasing is in terms of continuity and momentariness, as appropriate.

original: sngar rgyas pa nyid du bstan no //
analyzed: sngar rgyas pa nyid du bstan no //
translated: It was previously taught extensively.

original: ma skyes mi 'jig pa ni ye shes so zhes pa la /
analyzed: ma skyes mi 'jig pa ni ye shes so zhes pa la /
translated: Non-arising and non-ceasing is gnosis.

original: gzhan dag de lta na ye shes rgyu las skye ba gzhan gyi dbang nyid du sngar bstan pa dang / de bzhin du rigs pas kyang grub pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gzhan dag de lta na ye shes rgyu las skye ba gzhan gyi dbang nyid du sngar bstan pa dang / de bzhin du rigs pas kyang grub pa ma yin nam /
translated: Others say, If so, is it not the case that gnosis is previously taught to be dependent origination arising from causes, and is also established by reasoning in that way?

original: gal te ye shes kyi chos nyid de bzhin nyid ma skyes shing mi 'jig pas de ltar bstan no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te ye shes kyi chos nyid de bzhin nyid ma skyes shing mi 'jig pas de ltar bstan no zhe na /
translated: If the reality of gnosis is suchness, non-arising, and non-ceasing, it is taught in that way.

original: de ltar rnam par shes pa'i chos nyid kyang ma skyes shing mi 'jig pas mtshungs pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar rnam par shes pa'i chos nyid kyang ma skyes shing mi 'jig pas mtshungs pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Thus, the reality of consciousness is also similar in being unborn and unceasing.

original: skyon med de /
analyzed: skyon med de /
translated: There is no error here.

original: 'dir me long lta bu'i ye shes chos kyi sku'i rang bzhin gyi dbang du byas pa ste /
analyzed: 'dir me long lta bu'i ye shes chos kyi sku'i rang bzhin gyi dbang du byas pa ste /
translated: This is from the perspective of mirror-like wisdom, which is the nature of the dharmakƒÅya.

original: de'i rigs tsam thog ma med pa nas yod pas glo bur du snga na med pa'i rgyun gzhan gyis bskyed pa ma yin la /
analyzed: de'i rigs tsam thog ma med pa nas yod pas glo bur du snga na med pa'i rgyun gzhan gyis bskyed pa ma yin la /
translated: Since its mere type has existed from beginningless time, it is not generated by another continuum that did not exist before.

original: rtag tu rgyun dang ldan pas mi 'jig pa ste /
analyzed: rtag tu rgyun dang ldan pas mi 'jig pa ste /
translated: Since it always has a continuum, it is unceasing.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: slar yang gzhan du mi 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: slar yang gzhan du mi 'gyur zhing //
translated: It does not change into something else.

original: rtag dang chad pa spong byed pa'i //
analyzed: rtag dang chad pa spong byed pa'i //
translated: It abandons eternalism and nihilism.

original: 'chi med de nyid ye shes brjod //
analyzed: 'chi med de nyid ye shes brjod //
translated: This is said to be the wisdom of immortality.

original: ces gsungs pa'am /
analyzed: ces gsungs pa'am /
translated: This is what he said.üîΩüîΩ

original: ye shes 'chi med dam pa de las gzhal med thob //üîΩces gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ye shes 'chi med dam pa de las gzhal med thob // ces gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: From that wisdom of immortality, the immeasurable is attained.

original: yang rnam grangs gcig tu na skye 'gag la sogs pa'i mtshan mar 'dzin pa med pas de ltar bstan pa'o //
analyzed: yang rnam grangs gcig tu na skye 'gag la sogs pa'i mtshan mar 'dzin pa med pas de ltar bstan pa'o //
translated: Or, in another enumeration, it is taught in this way because there is no apprehension of the signs of arising, ceasing, and so on.

original: rnam par shes pa ni de ltar ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni de ltar ma yin te /
translated: Consciousness is not like that.

original: de dag gi mtshan mar 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gi mtshan mar 'dzin pa'o //
translated: It is the apprehension of their signs.

original: mtshan ma med par lhung zhes pa ni mtshan ma med pa'i mtshan mar 'dzin pa'i phyogs su lhung ba ste /
analyzed: mtshan ma med par lhung zhes pa ni mtshan ma med pa'i mtshan mar 'dzin pa'i phyogs su lhung ba ste /
translated: Falling into the extreme of signlessness is falling into the extreme of apprehending the sign of signlessness.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid ni kun gzhi bag chags thams cad kyi rten du gyur @201a * //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid ni kun gzhi bag chags thams cad kyi rten du gyur @201a * //
translated: The characteristics of mental consciousness and so on are that they are the support of the alaya for all habitual tendencies and

original: pa'am / 'jug pa'i rnam shes gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam pa sna tshogs 'dus pa'o //
analyzed: pa'am / 'jug pa'i rnam shes gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam pa sna tshogs 'dus pa'o //
translated: the various aspects of the consciousnesses of engagement are the collection of the various aspects of apprehendeds and apprehenders.

original: bri ba'i mtshan nyid ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i sa bon bri zhing 'gag pa'o //
analyzed: bri ba'i mtshan nyid ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i sa bon bri zhing 'gag pa'o //
translated: The characteristic of decrease is the decrease and cessation of the seeds of that which is contaminated.

original: rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid la sogs pa'i rnam par dbye ba rags par rtogs pa ni /
analyzed: rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid la sogs pa'i rnam par dbye ba rags par rtogs pa ni /
translated: The coarse realization of the divisions of general and specific characteristics and so on isüîΩthe consciousness of those whose minds have not been affected by philosophy.üîΩThe subtle realization of their divisions is

original: grub pa'i mthas blo ma bsgyur ba rnams kyi rnam par shes pa yin la de dag gi bye brag zhib tu rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: grub pa'i mthas blo ma bsgyur ba rnams kyi rnam par shes pa yin la de dag gi bye brag zhib tu rtogs pa ste /
translated: the consciousness of those whose minds have been affected by philosophy.

original: gzugs ni gzhig cing gzhom du rung ba'i mtshan nyid ces pa nas /
analyzed: gzugs ni gzhig cing gzhom du rung ba'i mtshan nyid ces pa nas /
translated: Form has the characteristic of being destructible and

original: 'du byed skad cig la skye zhing 'jig pa dang don dam par skye ba med pa la sogs bar spyi'i tshul du rtog par byed pa byis pa'i skye bo rnams kyi rgyud kyis bsdus pa ni grub mthas bsgyur ba'i rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'du byed skad cig la skye zhing 'jig pa dang don dam par skye ba med pa la sogs bar spyi'i tshul du rtog par byed pa byis pa'i skye bo rnams kyi rgyud kyis bsdus pa ni grub mthas bsgyur ba'i rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: The consciousness transformed by philosophical systems is the consciousness included in the mental continuum of ordinary beings who conceive in general terms that compounded phenomena arise and disintegrate in an instant and that ultimately there is no arising and so on.üîΩThose who are attached to the positions of existence and nonexistence are non Buddhists who are attached to the self as having the nature of permanence.üîΩThey are attached to the self as having the nature of impermanence.

original: yod dang med pa'i phyogs la mngon par chags pa ni phyi rol pa rnams kyis bdag rtag pa'i ngo bor ni yod la /
analyzed: yod dang med pa'i phyogs la mngon par chags pa ni phyi rol pa rnams kyis bdag rtag pa'i ngo bor ni yod la /
translated: They are attached to the self as having the nature of both permanence and impermanence.üîΩThey are attached to the self as having the nature of neither permanence nor impermanence.üîΩThey are attached to the self as having the nature of existence.üîΩThey are attached to the self as having the nature of nonexistence.üîΩThey are attached to the self as having the nature of both existence and nonexistence.

original: de las gzhan gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos por med pa'am /üîΩgzhan yang byis pa'i skye bo rnams kyis dngos po rnams rang rang gi ngo bor yod la /
analyzed: de las gzhan gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos por med pa'am / gzhan yang byis pa'i skye bo rnams kyis dngos po rnams rang rang gi ngo bor yod la /
translated: They are attached to the self as having the nature of neither existence nor nonexistence.üîΩThey are attached to the self as having the nature of permanence in the past.üîΩThey are attached to the self as having the nature of impermanence in the past.üîΩThey are attached to the self as having the nature of both permanence and impermanence in the past.üîΩThey are attached to the self as having the nature of neither permanence nor impermanence in the past.üîΩThey are attached to the self as having the nature of permanence in the future.üîΩThey are attached to the self as having the nature of impermanence in the future.üîΩThey are attached to the self as having the nature of both permanence and impermanence in the future.üîΩThey are attached to the self as having the nature of neither permanence nor impermanence in the future.üîΩThey are attached to the self as having the nature of existence in the present.üîΩThey are attached to the self as having the nature of nonexistence in the present.üîΩThey are attached to the self as having the nature of both existence and nonexistence in the present.

original: phan tshun gyi dngos por med do zhes mngon par zhen pa dang bcas pa'i ye shes ni 'jig rten pa'i'o //üîΩgal te de lta na de ni rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs pa nyid du 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: phan tshun gyi dngos por med do zhes mngon par zhen pa dang bcas pa'i ye shes ni 'jig rten pa'i'o // gal te de lta na de ni rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs pa nyid du 'gyur zhing /
translated: They are attached to the self as having the nature of neither existence nor nonexistence in the present.üîΩThey are attached to the self as having the nature of existence in the past.

original: gzhan yang de 'dra ba ye shes nyid du mi 'thad de /
analyzed: gzhan yang de 'dra ba ye shes nyid du mi 'thad de /
translated: They are attached to the self as having the nature of nonexistence in the past.

original: de nyid shes phyir ye shes dang // zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid shes phyir ye shes dang // zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is said, ‚ÄúIn order to know reality, there is wisdom.‚Äù

original: de ltar bden mod kyi //
analyzed: de ltar bden mod kyi //
translated: This is certainly true.

original: 'dir rnam par shes pa rnams kyis kyang phyi rol gyi don tha dad pa'am /
analyzed: 'dir rnam par shes pa rnams kyis kyang phyi rol gyi don tha dad pa'am /
translated: However, consciousness does not apprehend or cognize external objects as different from itself,

original: dngos po med pa'i ri bong gi rva lta bur 'dzin cing rig pa ni ma yin zhing /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ri bong gi rva lta bur 'dzin cing rig pa ni ma yin zhing /
translated: or as nonexistent, like the horns of a rabbit.

original: 'on kyang rang gi rang bzhin kun rdzob pa 'dzin cing rig pa yin la /
analyzed: 'on kyang rang gi rang bzhin kun rdzob pa 'dzin cing rig pa yin la /
translated: Rather, it apprehends and cognizes its own nature, which is conventional.

original: de yang sgyu ma lta bur don dam pa'i bden pa dang dbyer med cing gcig pas /
analyzed: de yang sgyu ma lta bur don dam pa'i bden pa dang dbyer med cing gcig pas /
translated: And since that is like an illusion, it is inseparable from and the same as ultimate truth.üîΩThus, the object‚Äôs own nature is the same as

original: don gyi rang gi ngo bo gcig / bdag nyid mngon sum yin pa la //üîΩtshad ma rnams kyis brtag bya gang //
analyzed: don gyi rang gi ngo bo gcig / bdag nyid mngon sum yin pa la // tshad ma rnams kyis brtag bya gang //
translated: one‚Äôs own nature, which is directly perceived.

original: ma mthong cha gzhan ci zhig yod //
analyzed: ma mthong cha gzhan ci zhig yod //
translated: What other part of it, not seen,üîΩis there for valid cognitions to investigate?

original: ces gsungs pa'i tshul du shes pa'i rang gi ngo bo rig cing snang ban de dang tha dad pa ma yin pa'i de bzhin nyid kyang rig cing snang bas de 'dra ba'i ldog pa nas 'jig rten pa'i ye shes zhes kyang bya la /
analyzed: ces gsungs pa'i tshul du shes pa'i rang gi ngo bo rig cing snang ban de dang tha dad pa ma yin pa'i de bzhin nyid kyang rig cing snang bas de 'dra ba'i ldog pa nas 'jig rten pa'i ye shes zhes kyang bya la /
translated: In other words, the essence of consciousness is aware and manifest, and the suchness that is not different from that is also aware and manifest. From that point of view, it is called worldly wisdom.

original: yang de bzhin nyid la phyin ci log gi sgro 'dogs gcod par mi nus shing /
analyzed: yang de bzhin nyid la phyin ci log gi sgro 'dogs gcod par mi nus shing /
translated: Moreover, suchness cannot eliminate the superimpositions of error.

original: chos can kun rdzob kyi ngo bo rig pa'i cha nas rnam par shes pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: chos can kun rdzob kyi ngo bo rig pa'i cha nas rnam par shes pa zhes bya ste /
translated: From the point of view of the aspect of awareness of the nature of the relative, the phenomena of the world, it is called consciousness.

original: @201b de la sgro 'dogs pa yang ji skad du /
analyzed: @201b de la sgro 'dogs pa yang ji skad du /
translated: As for the superimpositions that are made about that, it is said:

original: gzugs chos mthun pa mthong ba las //
analyzed: gzugs chos mthun pa mthong ba las //
translated: Through seeing the similarity of attributes,

original: nya phyis la dngul rnam pa ltar //
analyzed: nya phyis la dngul rnam pa ltar //
translated: like seeing a mother-of-pearl shell as silver,

original: gal te 'khrul pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis //
analyzed: gal te 'khrul pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis //
translated: if, due to the cause of error,

original: yon tan gzhan sbyor zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: yon tan gzhan sbyor zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: the attributes of another are added, and so on.

original: de ltar sgro 'dogs pa'i ldog pa nas rang ngam gzhan gang yang rig pa med pas shes pa nyid dang ma yin la /
analyzed: de ltar sgro 'dogs pa'i ldog pa nas rang ngam gzhan gang yang rig pa med pas shes pa nyid dang ma yin la /
translated: From the point of view of such superimpositions, there is no awareness of anything, either of itself or of something other. Therefore, it is not consciousness.

original: 'on kyang rang gi bdag nyid rig pa'i cha nas shes pa nyid du rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: 'on kyang rang gi bdag nyid rig pa'i cha nas shes pa nyid du rnam par gzhag go //
translated: However, from the point of view of the aspect of self-awareness, it is posited as consciousness itself.

original: de ltar na byis pa dang 'phags pa'i ye shes kyi khyad par ni myong ba'i don la sgro 'dogs pa sel bar nus pa dang / mi nus pa'i sgo nas rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: de ltar na byis pa dang 'phags pa'i ye shes kyi khyad par ni myong ba'i don la sgro 'dogs pa sel bar nus pa dang / mi nus pa'i sgo nas rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Thus, the difference between the wisdom of the childish and the ƒÅryas is posited in terms of whether or not the superimposition on the meaning of experience can be eliminated.

original: yang 'phags pa nyan thos la sogs pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa'i khyad par ni /
analyzed: yang 'phags pa nyan thos la sogs pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa'i khyad par ni /
translated: Moreover, the difference between the ƒÅrya ≈õrƒÅvakas and so on and the bodhisattvas and so on is

original: sgro 'dogs phyogs gcig gam mtha' dag sa bon dang bcas te sel ba'i sgo nas so //
analyzed: sgro 'dogs phyogs gcig gam mtha' dag sa bon dang bcas te sel ba'i sgo nas so //
translated: in terms of whether or not all superimpositions, along with their seeds, are eliminated.

original: gzhan yang rnam par shes pas de'i de bzhin nyid 'dzin par gsungs te ;
analyzed: gzhan yang rnam par shes pas de'i de bzhin nyid 'dzin par gsungs te ;
translated: Moreover, it is said that consciousness apprehends its suchness:

original: / rnam shes yul 'dzin pa yi chos //üîΩde ni ji ltar yod pa bzhin //
analyzed: / rnam shes yul 'dzin pa yi chos // de ni ji ltar yod pa bzhin //
translated: The defining characteristic of consciousness is the apprehension of objects.

original: 'dzin 'gyur zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: 'dzin 'gyur zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: It is said that it apprehends in accordance with what exists.

original: rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid du lhung zhes pa la /
analyzed: rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid du lhung zhes pa la /
translated: It is said that it falls into the characteristics of the particular and the general.

original: phung po la sogs pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid dang / de rnams nyid mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal pa la sogs pa gang zag gi bdag med pa dang / bzung ba ngo bo nyid med pa'i chos nyid ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs shing phyin ci log gi sgro 'dogs dgag pa ste /
analyzed: phung po la sogs pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid dang / de rnams nyid mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal pa la sogs pa gang zag gi bdag med pa dang / bzung ba ngo bo nyid med pa'i chos nyid ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs shing phyin ci log gi sgro 'dogs dgag pa ste /
translated: The reality of the aggregates and so forth, their impermanence, suffering, and so forth, the selflessness of persons, and the apprehended, which is reality devoid of intrinsic reality, are realized just as they are, and the superimpositions of error are stopped.

original: des na 'jig rten pa'i ye shes dang mtshungs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na 'jig rten pa'i ye shes dang mtshungs pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not the same as mundane wisdom.

original: gzhan yang zhes pa la sogs pa sngar bstan pa ye shes dang rnam shes khyad med par dogs pa sel ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes pa la sogs pa sngar bstan pa ye shes dang rnam shes khyad med par dogs pa sel ba'o //
translated: Moreover, the above-mentioned wisdom and consciousness are not differentiated.

original: gal te ye shes snga ma de nyid gnyis kyang yul sna tshogs la chags pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: gal te ye shes snga ma de nyid gnyis kyang yul sna tshogs la chags pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: If the former wisdom itself is also attached to various objects, is it not the same as consciousness?

original: de ltar chags pa'i sems dang 'brel mod kyi gang la ye shes su 'gro ba'i ldog pa de nyid nas mngon par chags pa'i mtshan nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar chags pa'i sems dang 'brel mod kyi gang la ye shes su 'gro ba'i ldog pa de nyid nas mngon par chags pa'i mtshan nyid ma yin no //
translated: Although it is connected with a mind of such attachment, the very state of being wisdom is not characterized by manifest attachment.

original: mngon par chags pa de yang khyad par du yid kyi rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par chags pa de yang khyad par du yid kyi rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: Moreover, this manifest attachment is especially the mental consciousness.

original: gsum 'dus pa ni dbang po dang yul dang yid la byed pa snga ma ste /
analyzed: gsum 'dus pa ni dbang po dang yul dang yid la byed pa snga ma ste /
translated: The convergence of the three is the prior sense faculty, object, and attention.

original: de rnams kyi las su bya ba skyes pa dang ldan pa'i mtshan nyid ni sgo lnga'i rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi las su bya ba skyes pa dang ldan pa'i mtshan nyid ni sgo lnga'i rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: The function of these is the five sense consciousnesses, which are characterized by the arising of the object.

original: thob pa med pa'i mtshan nyid ni sngar @202a * //
analyzed: thob pa med pa'i mtshan nyid ni sngar @202a * //
translated: The characteristic of non-acquisition is as previously explained.

original: bstan pa ltar me long lta bu'i ye shes kyi rigs thog ma med pa nas yod pas lam gyi stobs kyis glo bur du thob pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: bstan pa ltar me long lta bu'i ye shes kyi rigs thog ma med pa nas yod pas lam gyi stobs kyis glo bur du thob pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: Since the mirror-like pristine wisdom has existed from beginningless time, it is not newly acquired through the power of the path.

original: 'on kyang phyin ci log gi dri ma glo bur ba lam gyis sbyangs pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
analyzed: 'on kyang phyin ci log gi dri ma glo bur ba lam gyis sbyangs pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
translated: However, it is simply the purification of the adventitious stains of error through the path.

original: des na de 'dra ba'i ye shes glo bur du 'jug cing ldog pa med pa ste /
analyzed: des na de 'dra ba'i ye shes glo bur du 'jug cing ldog pa med pa ste /
translated: Therefore, such pristine wisdom is not newly engaged and disengaged.

original: chu la zla ba'i dkyil 'khor glo bur du zhugs shing ldog pa med pa dang mtshungs so //
analyzed: chu la zla ba'i dkyil 'khor glo bur du zhugs shing ldog pa med pa dang mtshungs so //
translated: It is similar to the moon‚Äôs orb, which is not newly engaged and disengaged in the water.

original: tshigs su bcad pa'i don ni kun gzhi dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa la sogs pas sngar bstan pa ltar las sog cing rnam par smin pa 'byin par byed la /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa'i don ni kun gzhi dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa la sogs pas sngar bstan pa ltar las sog cing rnam par smin pa 'byin par byed la /
translated: The meaning of the verse is that, as previously explained, the foundation consciousness, the mental consciousness, and so on, accumulate karma and produce the karmic maturation.

original: ye shes kyis de rnams kyi rang bzhin stong pa nyid du rtogs pas ji lta ba bzhin rnam par 'byed cing las chud zos par byed pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes kyis de rnams kyi rang bzhin stong pa nyid du rtogs pas ji lta ba bzhin rnam par 'byed cing las chud zos par byed pa'o //
translated: But wisdom realizes that their nature is emptiness, and thus it thoroughly discerns them and causes the exhaustion of karma.

original: ye shes dang shes rab ni rnam grangs su gtogs pa'am /
analyzed: ye shes dang shes rab ni rnam grangs su gtogs pa'am /
translated: Wisdom and knowledge are synonyms.

original: yang na sngar bshad pa ltar ro //
analyzed: yang na sngar bshad pa ltar ro //
translated: Or, as previously explained,

original: de ltar na shes rab kyis snang ba med pa'i ye shes chos kyi sku'i ngo bo thob par byed cing /
analyzed: de ltar na shes rab kyis snang ba med pa'i ye shes chos kyi sku'i ngo bo thob par byed cing /
translated: Thus, wisdom causes the attainment of the nonapparent wisdom that is the essence of the body of truth.

original: de las sems can gyi don byed pa'i mthu yang rab tu thob par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de las sems can gyi don byed pa'i mthu yang rab tu thob par byed pa'o //
translated: And it causes the attainment of the power to act for the benefit of sentient beings.

original: yang na ye shes ni sngar bstan pa'i skye ba med pa dang 'gag pa med par spyi'i tshul du rtogs pa med par shes pas bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: yang na ye shes ni sngar bstan pa'i skye ba med pa dang 'gag pa med par spyi'i tshul du rtogs pa med par shes pas bsdus pa'o //
translated: Or, wisdom is the knowledge that is not the realization of the nonarising and noncessation of the previously explained general mode.

original: sems kyi las ji ltar sog ce na /
analyzed: sems kyi las ji ltar sog ce na /
translated: How does it accumulate mental karma?

original: yul sna tshogs su snang ba dang 'brel cing de ltar brtags pas so //
analyzed: yul sna tshogs su snang ba dang 'brel cing de ltar brtags pas so //
translated: It is related to the appearance of various objects and is investigated in that way.

original: ye shes kyis rnam par 'byed pa yang /
analyzed: ye shes kyis rnam par 'byed pa yang /
translated: The discernment by intuition is

original: de ltar brtags pa'i don la ji lta ba bzhin shes pa'i ye shes 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar brtags pa'i don la ji lta ba bzhin shes pa'i ye shes 'jug pa'o //
translated: the engagement of the intuition that knows things as they are in the meaning that is investigated in that way.

original: yang don dam pa shes pa'i shes rab ni snang ba med pa'i de bzhin nyid la 'jug cing /
analyzed: yang don dam pa shes pa'i shes rab ni snang ba med pa'i de bzhin nyid la 'jug cing /
translated: Moreover, the wisdom that knows the ultimate engages suchness free from appearance,

original: kun rdzob shes pa ni chos kyi bye brag ma 'dres pa la 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob shes pa ni chos kyi bye brag ma 'dres pa la 'jug pa'o //
translated: and the knowledge of the conventional engages the distinct categories of phenomena.

original: snang ba med par rtogs pa'i shes rab dang ye shes ni /
analyzed: snang ba med par rtogs pa'i shes rab dang ye shes ni /
translated: The wisdom and intuition that realize the absence of appearance

original: sems dang yid la sogs pa spangs pa ste /
analyzed: sems dang yid la sogs pa spangs pa ste /
translated: are free from mind, mentality, and so on,

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa mchog gi ye shes so //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa mchog gi ye shes so //
translated: and are the supramundane, supreme intuition.

original: gzung 'dzin du rtog pa'i chos dang 'brel ba ni nyan thos la sogs pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: gzung 'dzin du rtog pa'i chos dang 'brel ba ni nyan thos la sogs pa'i ye shes so //
translated: The intuition of the ≈õrƒÅvakas and so on is related to the phenomena that are the concepts of apprehender and apprehended.

original: gal te de lta na nyan thos la sogs pa rnams kyang rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes dang ldan pa nyid du sngar gsungs pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de lta na nyan thos la sogs pa rnams kyang rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes dang ldan pa nyid du sngar gsungs pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: If that is so, were the ≈õrƒÅvakas and so on not previously said to possess nonconceptual intuition?

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: No, they were not.

original: de ni rnam par rtog pa la skyon du lta ba'i sgo nas man ngag gi stobs kyis de 'dra ba bkag cing mnyam par gzhag pa'i gnas skabs su yin la /
analyzed: de ni rnam par rtog pa la skyon du lta ba'i sgo nas man ngag gi stobs kyis de 'dra ba bkag cing mnyam par gzhag pa'i gnas skabs su yin la /
translated: That is the case when, by the power of instruction, one has stopped such discursive thought by seeing it as a fault, and one is in a state of meditative equipoise.

original: @202b brtag bya'i yul stong par ma rtogs pas rjes kyi ye shes la ni rnam par rtog pa 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: @202b brtag bya'i yul stong par ma rtogs pas rjes kyi ye shes la ni rnam par rtog pa 'byung ba'o //
translated: But in the subsequent state of understanding, discursive thought arises, because one has not realized the emptiness of the object of discursive thought.

original: zhe dang bzod pa'i zhes pa la sogs pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes khyad par 'phags par ston pa ste /
analyzed: zhe dang bzod pa'i zhes pa la sogs pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes khyad par 'phags par ston pa ste /
translated: The verse beginning ‚ÄúThe patience of the ultimate‚Äù shows the superiority of the transcendent wisdom of the tathƒÅgatas.

original: gong nas gong du phyin ci log zhi ba dang / zab mo'i don la bzod pa'i ye shes khyad par du gyur cing mthar thug pas khyad par du 'phags pa'o //
analyzed: gong nas gong du phyin ci log zhi ba dang / zab mo'i don la bzod pa'i ye shes khyad par du gyur cing mthar thug pas khyad par du 'phags pa'o //
translated: The patience of the ultimate, the profound, and the vast, is the transcendent wisdom that is superior and ultimate because it is the pacification of error in ever higher ways and because it is the transcendent wisdom that is patient with the profound meaning.

original: dge ba ni nyes pa'i bag chags thams cad dang bral ba ste /
analyzed: dge ba ni nyes pa'i bag chags thams cad dang bral ba ste /
translated: Virtuous means free from all habitual tendencies to error.

original: gzhan las bye brag tu gyur pa'i don nyid du skyes pa /
analyzed: gzhan las bye brag tu gyur pa'i don nyid du skyes pa /
translated: It is born with the meaning of being distinct from others.

original: mtshan ma dang nyon mongs pa'i kun du spyod pa spangs pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma dang nyon mongs pa'i kun du spyod pa spangs pa'o //
translated: It is the abandonment of the conduct of signs and afflictions.

original: shes rab rnam pa gsum ni 'phags pa'i gang zag gi bye brag shes pa dang / chos kyi mtshan nyid ji lta bar rtogs pa dang / dngos po'i bye brag ji snyed pa shes pa'o //
