analyzed: shes rab rnam pa gsum ni 'phags pa'i gang zag gi bye brag shes pa dang / chos kyi mtshan nyid ji lta bar rtogs pa dang / dngos po'i bye brag ji snyed pa shes pa'o //
translated: The three kinds of wisdom are: knowing the distinctions of the noble persons, realizing the characteristics of phenomena as they are, and knowing the varieties of things as they are.

original: thos pa dang bsam pa dang bsgom pa'i shes rab gsum la yang slob dpon ye shes dpal gyis bshad de //
analyzed: thos pa dang bsam pa dang bsgom pa'i shes rab gsum la yang slob dpon ye shes dpal gyis bshad de //
translated: The three wisdoms of hearing, thinking, and meditation are also explained by the master Jnanapada.

original: de ltar na nga yis sngar sbyangs pa'am bshad pa'i shes rab ces sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na nga yis sngar sbyangs pa'am bshad pa'i shes rab ces sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Thus, one should apply the wisdom of hearing, contemplation, and meditation that I have previously trained in or explained.

original: de 'dra ba'i shes rab de nyid nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa gnyis dang mi ldan zhing gnyis su snang ba rnam par spangs pa ste /
analyzed: de 'dra ba'i shes rab de nyid nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa gnyis dang mi ldan zhing gnyis su snang ba rnam par spangs pa ste /
translated: That very wisdom is not possessed by the two vehicles of the ≈õrƒÅvakas and pratyekabuddhas, and it is free from dualistic appearances.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa mchog gi ye shes so //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa mchog gi ye shes so //
translated: It is the supreme supramundane wisdom.

original: tshig gzhan ni shes par zad do //
analyzed: tshig gzhan ni shes par zad do //
translated: The meaning of the other words is exhausted.

original: gzhan yang zhes pa la sogs pa 'jig rten pa'i ye shes kyi khyad par mu stegs byed rnams kyi 'dod pa 'gyur bar lta ba ston te /
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes pa la sogs pa 'jig rten pa'i ye shes kyi khyad par mu stegs byed rnams kyi 'dod pa 'gyur bar lta ba ston te /
translated: Moreover, and so on and so forth teach the distinctions of mundane wisdom, the tƒ´rthikas' view of change.

original: de la mtshan nyid ni mtshan ma ste kha dog la sogs pa'i mtshan ma gzhan du 'gyur ba'o //üîΩrgyu ni phyi rol pas brtags pa'i byed pa ste /
analyzed: de la mtshan nyid ni mtshan ma ste kha dog la sogs pa'i mtshan ma gzhan du 'gyur ba'o // rgyu ni phyi rol pas brtags pa'i byed pa ste /
translated: The characteristic is the sign, such as color, etc., which is transformed.

original: 'bras bu byung ba'i tshe gzhan du 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu byung ba'i tshe gzhan du 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The cause is the activity imagined by the non-Buddhist schools, which is transformed when the effect arises.

original: sbyor ba ni rkyen mang po 'dus pa ste des dri dang ro la sogs pa gzhan du 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba ni rkyen mang po 'dus pa ste des dri dang ro la sogs pa gzhan du 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The application is the assembly of many conditions, which is transformed by smell, taste, etc.

original: lta ba ni mthong ba'i rnam pa ste yul 'ga' zhig 'dod bya'i rnam par mthong ba las phyis 'dod bya ma yin pa'i rnam par snang ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: lta ba ni mthong ba'i rnam pa ste yul 'ga' zhig 'dod bya'i rnam par mthong ba las phyis 'dod bya ma yin pa'i rnam par snang ba lta bu'o //
translated: The view is the aspect of seeing, such as the appearance of a certain object as desirable, and later its appearance as undesirable.

original: skye ba ni sa bon gyi dus na myu gu mi snang zhing ma skyes pa las de'i rjes thogs su skye zhing /
analyzed: skye ba ni sa bon gyi dus na myu gu mi snang zhing ma skyes pa las de'i rjes thogs su skye zhing /
translated: Birth is the non-appearance and non-arising of the sprout at the time of the seed, and its subsequent arising.

original: de yang gzhan dang gzhan du skye zhing 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de yang gzhan dang gzhan du skye zhing 'gyur ba'o //
translated: And that arises and transforms as one thing after another.

original: dngos por 'gyur ba ni ljon shing ngam 'gro ba gzhon nu'i lus rim gyis ches cher 'phel ba ni /
analyzed: dngos por 'gyur ba ni ljon shing ngam 'gro ba gzhon nu'i lus rim gyis ches cher 'phel ba ni /
translated: The transformation of things is the gradual and continuous increase of a tree or the body of a young person.

original: sngar gyi de kho na nyid yin no zhes ngo shes kyi blo'i yul du byed pa @203a * //
analyzed: sngar gyi de kho na nyid yin no zhes ngo shes kyi blo'i yul du byed pa @203a * //
translated: It is like the case of recognizing the object of a cognition that thinks, ‚ÄúThis is the same reality as before.‚Äù

original: lta bu'o // rkyen snang bar byed pa 'gyur ba ni ji ltar shing gtsubs pa las me dang / til rnams las mar 'byung ba la sogs pa lta bu'o //üîΩbya ba snang bar byed pa'i 'gyur ba ni ji ltar sprul gyi so so skyes bu'i lus la gzung bas nyams pa la /
analyzed: lta bu'o // rkyen snang bar byed pa 'gyur ba ni ji ltar shing gtsubs pa las me dang / til rnams las mar 'byung ba la sogs pa lta bu'o // bya ba snang bar byed pa'i 'gyur ba ni ji ltar sprul gyi so so skyes bu'i lus la gzung bas nyams pa la /
translated: The transformation of the appearance of conditions is like the arising of fire from the rubbing of sticks and the arising of oil from sesame seeds.üîΩThe transformation of the appearance of action is like the case of a person bitten by a black snake.üîΩThe transformation of the appearance of life is like the case of a person who is revived by mantras, medicine, and so on, after the life has been extinguished by the seizing of the life force by a black snake.

original: sngags dang sman la sogs pas srog chags snang bar byed cing dbugs 'byin pa la sogs par byed pa'i 'gyur ba'o zhes slob dpon ye shes dpal gyis bshad do //üîΩyang mtshan nyid 'gyur ba ni ji ltar gdu bu la sogs pa'i dbyibs 'gyur ba na /
analyzed: sngags dang sman la sogs pas srog chags snang bar byed cing dbugs 'byin pa la sogs par byed pa'i 'gyur ba'o zhes slob dpon ye shes dpal gyis bshad do // yang mtshan nyid 'gyur ba ni ji ltar gdu bu la sogs pa'i dbyibs 'gyur ba na /
translated: Master J√±ƒÅna≈õrƒ´ explains that the transformation of the appearance of action is like the case of a person bitten by a black snake.üîΩThe transformation of characteristics is like the case of the shape of a bracelet and so on.

original: de dag gi mtshams nyid kyang gzhan du 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de dag gi mtshams nyid kyang gzhan du 'gyur ba'o //
translated: When the shape changes, the parts themselves also change.

original: rigs pa 'gyur ba ni ji ltar nye bar 'jal ba'i tshad mas ba men ni ba lang 'dra'o zhes pa'i tshig las bzho dgal gyi bya bar byed par rtogs pa la /
analyzed: rigs pa 'gyur ba ni ji ltar nye bar 'jal ba'i tshad mas ba men ni ba lang 'dra'o zhes pa'i tshig las bzho dgal gyi bya bar byed par rtogs pa la /
translated: The reason of transformation is like the following example. A person has the thought, ‚ÄúI will do the action of milking the cow.‚Äù

original: phyis de mngon sum du mthong ba na sngar gyi tshad ma las gzhan du 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: phyis de mngon sum du mthong ba na sngar gyi tshad ma las gzhan du 'gyur ba'am /
translated: Later, when he sees the cow directly, the former valid knowledge is transformed into direct perception.üîΩOr, for example, a person has the thought, ‚ÄúThere is fire on the mountain pass,‚Äù through the valid knowledge that infers fire from smoke.

original: la rgyab kyi me rjes su dbag pa'i tshad mas rtogs pa las de'i drung du phyin pas me mngon sum du rtog pa na /
analyzed: la rgyab kyi me rjes su dbag pa'i tshad mas rtogs pa las de'i drung du phyin pas me mngon sum du rtog pa na /
translated: Later, when he arrives at the mountain pass and sees the fire directly, the former valid knowledge that realized the object is transformed into direct perception.

original: gang zag de'i sems kyi rang bzhin la 'gyur ba med kyang don de rtogs pa'i tshad ma snga ma las gzhan mngon sum nyid du 'gyur ba la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: gang zag de'i sems kyi rang bzhin la 'gyur ba med kyang don de rtogs pa'i tshad ma snga ma las gzhan mngon sum nyid du 'gyur ba la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: The nature of the mind of that person does not change, but the former valid knowledge that realized that object is transformed into direct perception.

original: rkyen snang bar byed pa ni sgron ma dang / nyi ma dang zla ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin la 'gyur ba med kyang yul gzhan dang gzhan du 'pho zhing /
analyzed: rkyen snang bar byed pa ni sgron ma dang / nyi ma dang zla ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin la 'gyur ba med kyang yul gzhan dang gzhan du 'pho zhing /
translated: The reason of the appearance of conditions is like the following example. The nature of a lamp, the sun, the moon, and so on does not change, but they appear to move from one place to another.

original: dngos po gzhan dang gzhan snang bar byed pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dngos po gzhan dang gzhan snang bar byed pa lta bu'o //
translated: They appear to be different things.

original: bya ba snang bar byed pa ni ji ltar sta res shing gcod par byed pa'am /
analyzed: bya ba snang bar byed pa ni ji ltar sta res shing gcod par byed pa'am /
translated: The function of illumination is like an axe cutting down a tree.

original: rdza mkhan gyis bum pa byed pa ni /
analyzed: rdza mkhan gyis bum pa byed pa ni /
translated: The activity of making something appear is like an axe cutting a tree or a potter making a pot.

original: de dag gi bya ba gyen du lding ba dang thur du 'bab pa dang / lag pa'i 'du byed gzhan du 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: de dag gi bya ba gyen du lding ba dang thur du 'bab pa dang / lag pa'i 'du byed gzhan du 'gyur zhing /
translated: The activity of those is the upward leaping, the downward falling, the transformation of the activity of the hand,

original: de'i las su bya ba yang gzhan du 'gyur ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: de'i las su bya ba yang gzhan du 'gyur ba lta bu'o //
translated: and the transformation of the object of its action.üîΩThey assert that those are just the transformation of the state, but the nature does not transform.

original: de rnams kyang gnas skabs 'gyur ba nyid du 'dod pa yin gyi rang bzhin ni 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes grub mtha' smra ba phal cher de ltar 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyang gnas skabs 'gyur ba nyid du 'dod pa yin gyi rang bzhin ni 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes grub mtha' smra ba phal cher de ltar 'dod pa'o //
translated: Most proponents of tenets assert that.

original: de dag la bsams nas grangs can pa rnams ni 'bras bu'i rang bzhin sngar nas yod pa dang / gnas skabs med pa las glo bur du skye bar 'gyur ba nyid du smra la /
analyzed: de dag la bsams nas grangs can pa rnams ni 'bras bu'i rang bzhin sngar nas yod pa dang / gnas skabs med pa las glo bur du skye bar 'gyur ba nyid du smra la /
translated: Thinking of those, SƒÅ·πÉkhyas say that the nature of the effect existed previously and that it arises from a state that did not exist.

original: yang rgyu'i rang bzhin rtag tu yod pa dang / gnas skabs 'bras bu'i dus na med pa las 'bras bu skye bar smra ba'o //
analyzed: yang rgyu'i rang bzhin rtag tu yod pa dang / gnas skabs 'bras bu'i dus na med pa las 'bras bu skye bar smra ba'o //
translated: They also say that the effect arises from the cause that always exists and that does not exist at the time of the effect.

original: gzhan yang sngar bstan pa ltar yod pa dang med pa @203b las ji ltar rigs pa bzhin 'bras bu skye bar smra ba ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang sngar bstan pa ltar yod pa dang med pa @203b las ji ltar rigs pa bzhin 'bras bu skye bar smra ba ste /
translated: Moreover, as previously explained, they are proponents of the arising of effects in accordance with what is logically possible from existence and nonexistence.

original: gtso cher 'bras bu'i phyogs la yang dag pa'i dngos por rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: gtso cher 'bras bu'i phyogs la yang dag pa'i dngos por rtogs pa'o //
translated: They are primarily those who understand the side of effects to be real things.

original: 'di lta ste zhes pa la sogs pas ngag snga ma'i don gsal bar ston pa'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste zhes pa la sogs pas ngag snga ma'i don gsal bar ston pa'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúit is like this‚Äù and so on clarifies the meaning of the previous statement.

original: mu stegs byed kha cig ces pa grangs can la sogs pa'o //üîΩkha cig ni rgyu la rtog ces pa rgyu yod pa gtso bo'i rang bzhin dang dbang phyug la sogs pa'am /
analyzed: mu stegs byed kha cig ces pa grangs can la sogs pa'o // kha cig ni rgyu la rtog ces pa rgyu yod pa gtso bo'i rang bzhin dang dbang phyug la sogs pa'am /
translated: ‚ÄúSome tƒ´rthikas‚Äù are the SƒÅ·πÉkhya and so on.

original: dus dang rang bzhin gyis 'bras bu bskyed pa ste /
analyzed: dus dang rang bzhin gyis 'bras bu bskyed pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúSome conceive of the cause‚Äù means that they conceive of the cause, the nature of the primary nature, ƒ™≈õvara, and so on, or time and nature, to be the producer of effects.

original: gtso bor rgyu'i phyogs la dngos por rtog pa'o //
analyzed: gtso bor rgyu'i phyogs la dngos por rtog pa'o //
translated: They are primarily those who conceive of the side of the cause to be real things.

original: de ltar rgyu dang 'bras bu la rtog pa de dag ni /
analyzed: de ltar rgyu dang 'bras bu la rtog pa de dag ni /
translated: Those who conceive of causes and effects in this way

original: yongs su brtag par bya ba'i don blo yis nyes par bzung nas /
analyzed: yongs su brtag par bya ba'i don blo yis nyes par bzung nas /
translated: grasp with their mind the meaning that is to be examined incorrectly.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu de dag ni gnas skabs mi gsal ba'i sgo nas tha dad pas de bzhin du gcig pa nyid kyang ma yin la /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu de dag ni gnas skabs mi gsal ba'i sgo nas tha dad pas de bzhin du gcig pa nyid kyang ma yin la /
translated: Since those causes and effects are different in terms of their non-manifest states, they are not the same.

original: rang bzhin nam spyi'i sgo nas gcig pas gzhan du tha dad pa yang ma yin no zhes rtogs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin nam spyi'i sgo nas gcig pas gzhan du tha dad pa yang ma yin no zhes rtogs par byed pa'o //
translated: Since they are the same in terms of their nature or general characteristics, they are not different.

original: de la chang dang chang gi myos pa dang de'i rgyur gyur pa dang / me tog dang 'bras bu dang / 'jim pa dang bum pa la sogs pa de dag ni mu stegs byed pa dag gis 'gyur ba re re rnam par brtags te de la phyi rol gyi ngo bor gyur pa'i 'gyur ba ni kun rdzob tsam du yang mi 'thad la /
analyzed: de la chang dang chang gi myos pa dang de'i rgyur gyur pa dang / me tog dang 'bras bu dang / 'jim pa dang bum pa la sogs pa de dag ni mu stegs byed pa dag gis 'gyur ba re re rnam par brtags te de la phyi rol gyi ngo bor gyur pa'i 'gyur ba ni kun rdzob tsam du yang mi 'thad la /
translated: In this regard, the tƒ´rthikas imagine each of the following to be a transformation: beer and the intoxication of beer and its cause, a flower and its fruit, and clay and a pot, and so on. In this regard, a transformation that is an external entity is untenable even as a mere convention.

original: zho dang 'o ma la sogs par snang ba shes pa'i ngo bo gyur pa yang re re ba nyid du mi 'thad de /
analyzed: zho dang 'o ma la sogs par snang ba shes pa'i ngo bo gyur pa yang re re ba nyid du mi 'thad de /
translated: A transformation that is the nature of the consciousness that appears as yogurt, milk, and so on is also untenable as an individual.

original: shes pa'i bdag nyid skad cig tu skye zhing 'gag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes pa'i bdag nyid skad cig tu skye zhing 'gag par 'gyur ro //
translated: The nature of consciousness arises and ceases in a moment.

original: skad cig ma nyid du yang sngar bshad pa ltar don dam par grub pa med do //
analyzed: skad cig ma nyid du yang sngar bshad pa ltar don dam par grub pa med do //
translated: As explained above, even momentariness does not ultimately exist.

original: de bzhin du zhes pa la sogs pa'i don ni phyi rol bzhin du rnam par rtog pa'i bdag nyid goms pa rgyun gyis 'jug cing sdog pa yang don dam par ngo bo nyid med par blta ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes pa la sogs pa'i don ni phyi rol bzhin du rnam par rtog pa'i bdag nyid goms pa rgyun gyis 'jug cing sdog pa yang don dam par ngo bo nyid med par blta ste /
translated: The meaning of ‚Äújust so‚Äù and so forth is that, just as external things are, the stream of the familiarization with the nature of conceptualization, when it enters and stops, is seen to be ultimately without entityness.

original: blo gros chen po ji ltar sgyu ma dang rmi lam gyi gzugs 'byung ba dang ldog pa mthong ba bzhin du phyi rol gyi ngo bo 'am rnam par rtog pa'i bdag nyid du snang ba 'di la /
analyzed: blo gros chen po ji ltar sgyu ma dang rmi lam gyi gzugs 'byung ba dang ldog pa mthong ba bzhin du phyi rol gyi ngo bo 'am rnam par rtog pa'i bdag nyid du snang ba 'di la /
translated: MahƒÅmati, just as the arising and ceasing of forms in an illusion or dream are seen, so in this appearance as external entities or the nature of conceptualization,

original: chos gang 'jug pa'am ldog pa med do //
analyzed: chos gang 'jug pa'am ldog pa med do //
translated: no phenomenon enters or stops.

original: tshigs su bcad pa'i don ni sa la sogs pa'i 'byung ba dang / 'byung ba las gyur pa gzugs la sogs pa'i phyi'i skye mched dang / nang gi skye mched rnams dang / dus kyi dbang gis khyad par du 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa'i don ni sa la sogs pa'i 'byung ba dang / 'byung ba las gyur pa gzugs la sogs pa'i phyi'i skye mched dang / nang gi skye mched rnams dang / dus kyi dbang gis khyad par du 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The meaning of the verse is that the external sources, such as the elements of earth and so on and the form and so on that are derived from the elements, the internal sources, and the distinctions due to time, change.

original: de las gzhan pa'i rgyus khyad par du 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i rgyus khyad par du 'gyur ba'o //
translated: It is distinguished by other causes.

original: de bzhin du gru bzhi la @204a * //
analyzed: de bzhin du gru bzhi la @204a * //
translated: Similarly, the shapes of squares, etc.üîΩ, the changes of shape, etc.

original: sogs pa'i dbyibs dang / dbyibs kyi 'gyur ba la sogs pa sngar bstan pa rnams dang / srid pa bar ma bsdu ba ste /
analyzed: sogs pa'i dbyibs dang / dbyibs kyi 'gyur ba la sogs pa sngar bstan pa rnams dang / srid pa bar ma bsdu ba ste /
translated: , and the intermediate existence are included.üîΩWhen the mind-streams of sentient beings are connected to another life, they pass from one birth-state to another and the aggregates of the intermediate existence are formed.

original: sems can rnams kyi sems rgyud 'gro ba gzhan du nying mtshams 'brel par byed pa na skye gnas gzhan nas 'phos te bar do'i phung po 'grub pa dang / de las las ji lta ba bzhin du 'gro ba gzhan du nying mtshams 'brel bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi sems rgyud 'gro ba gzhan du nying mtshams 'brel par byed pa na skye gnas gzhan nas 'phos te bar do'i phung po 'grub pa dang / de las las ji lta ba bzhin du 'gro ba gzhan du nying mtshams 'brel bar byed pa'o //
translated: From that, they are connected to another life in accordance with their karma.

original: de la bsdu ba ni sems kyi rgyud la 'brel ba'o //
analyzed: de la bsdu ba ni sems kyi rgyud la 'brel ba'o //
translated: Here, ‚Äúincluded‚Äù means connected to the mind-stream.

original: yang na de nyid bsdus te /
analyzed: yang na de nyid bsdus te /
translated: Or, ‚Äúincluded‚Äù means

original: tshe 'pho ba'o //
analyzed: tshe 'pho ba'o //
translated: the transference of life.

original: de 'dra ba la sogs pa'i dngos por rtog pa ni phyin ci log pa'o //
analyzed: de 'dra ba la sogs pa'i dngos por rtog pa ni phyin ci log pa'o //
translated: The conception of things as having such a nature is erroneous.

original: de nas tshigs su bcad pa gcig gis ni 'gyur ba dang bcas pa'i rten 'brel sgyu ma lta bur ston to //
analyzed: de nas tshigs su bcad pa gcig gis ni 'gyur ba dang bcas pa'i rten 'brel sgyu ma lta bur ston to //
translated: Then, in one verse, he teaches that dependent arising with its changes is like an illusion.

original: de rnams kyang ji ltar khyed kyi skad cig 'jig ces dris pa'i lan du sbyar te /
analyzed: de rnams kyang ji ltar khyed kyi skad cig 'jig ces dris pa'i lan du sbyar te /
translated: These are also applied as the answer to the question, ‚ÄúHow do you say that they disintegrate moment by moment?‚Äù

original: zhib tu ni 'og nas kyang ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhib tu ni 'og nas kyang ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will be taught in detail below.

original: de nas yang byang chub sems dpa' zhes pa la sogs pas rten 'brel gyis bsdus pa mtshams sbyor ba 'jug pa dang / ldog pa'i tshul rgyas par ston to //
analyzed: de nas yang byang chub sems dpa' zhes pa la sogs pas rten 'brel gyis bsdus pa mtshams sbyor ba 'jug pa dang / ldog pa'i tshul rgyas par ston to //
translated: Then, beginning with ‚ÄúThen the bodhisattva,‚Äù the text extensively teaches the mode of engagement and disengagement, which are included in dependent origination.

original: 'di rnams kyang bcings pa su lags gang gis grol zhes dris pa'i lan du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'di rnams kyang bcings pa su lags gang gis grol zhes dris pa'i lan du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: These are also applied as the answer to the question, ‚ÄúWho is bound? Who is liberated?‚Äù

original: de la mtshams sbyor ba ni gang gis rigs phyi ma skyed par byed pa ste /
analyzed: de la mtshams sbyor ba ni gang gis rigs phyi ma skyed par byed pa ste /
translated: In this regard, engagement is that which produces the next type of being.

original: 'dir chos thams cad ni sems tsam du 'dus la /
analyzed: 'dir chos thams cad ni sems tsam du 'dus la /
translated: Here, all phenomena are included in mind only.

original: de yang phyin ci log dang phyin ci log ma yin pa gnyis las /
analyzed: de yang phyin ci log dang phyin ci log ma yin pa gnyis las /
translated: Moreover, there are two types: distorted and undistorted.

original: phyin ci log gi rnam par rtog pa gang gis rigs phyi ma nying mtshams 'brel par byas shing srid pa'i yan lag lugs su 'jug par 'gyur la /
analyzed: phyin ci log gi rnam par rtog pa gang gis rigs phyi ma nying mtshams 'brel par byas shing srid pa'i yan lag lugs su 'jug par 'gyur la /
translated: The distorted conception that engages the next type of being and causes the limbs of existence to enter into a system.

original: phyin ci ma log pa'i sems gang gis de'i rang bzhin yongs su shes pa ni srid pa'i yan lag lugs las ldog cing mtshams sbyor ba med par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: phyin ci ma log pa'i sems gang gis de'i rang bzhin yongs su shes pa ni srid pa'i yan lag lugs las ldog cing mtshams sbyor ba med par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The unmistaken mind is the one that fully knows its nature, and that is the one that turns away from the limbs of existence and does not link up with them.

original: mtshams sbyor ba dang mtshams sbyor pa ma lags pa thams cad kyi thabs la mkhas pa ni gal te sems can gyi don du srid par nying mtshams sbyor ba de lta na yang bden pa gnyis kyi thabs la mkhas pas bdag nyid 'ching bar mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: mtshams sbyor ba dang mtshams sbyor pa ma lags pa thams cad kyi thabs la mkhas pa ni gal te sems can gyi don du srid par nying mtshams sbyor ba de lta na yang bden pa gnyis kyi thabs la mkhas pas bdag nyid 'ching bar mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Skill in all the links and non-links is the skill in means of the Bodhisattva who, if he links up with existence for the sake of beings, does not get bound by it, because of his skill in the two truths.

original: sgra ji bzhin gyi don ni bung po la sogs pa yod par bstan pa'i don la'o //
analyzed: sgra ji bzhin gyi don ni bung po la sogs pa yod par bstan pa'i don la'o //
translated: The literal meaning is the one that is taught in the sense of the existence of the aggregates, etc.

original: stobs ni rnam pa bcu ste de yang sngar bstan pa ltar /
analyzed: stobs ni rnam pa bcu ste de yang sngar bstan pa ltar /
translated: The powers are of ten kinds, as taught above.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'i rigs tsam byang chub sems dpa'i sa @204b brgyad pa nas thob par gsungs pa'am /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'i rigs tsam byang chub sems dpa'i sa @204b brgyad pa nas thob par gsungs pa'am /
translated: It is said that the Bodhisattva obtains on the eighth stage the mere family of the powers, fearlessnesses, etc. of the Tathagata,

original: gzhan yang 'phags pa rnam par 'phrul pa'i rgyal pos zhus pa las byang chub sems dpa' nyid kyi stobs bcu la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: gzhan yang 'phags pa rnam par 'phrul pa'i rgyal pos zhus pa las byang chub sems dpa' nyid kyi stobs bcu la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Moreover, in the noble S≈´tra Requested by the King of Good Gestures, the ten powers of the bodhisattvas themselves are taught.

original: gzungs kyi phyag rgyas btab pa ni gang gis ji lta de kho na nyid kyi don ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pa rnams chud mi gson cing 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: gzungs kyi phyag rgyas btab pa ni gang gis ji lta de kho na nyid kyi don ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pa rnams chud mi gson cing 'dzin pa ste /
translated: The seal of dhƒÅra·πáƒ´ is that by which those who have realized reality just as it is do not waste it and hold it.

original: dran pa dang shes rab kyis bsdus pa'i phyag rgyas rgyas btab pa'o //
analyzed: dran pa dang shes rab kyis bsdus pa'i phyag rgyas rgyas btab pa'o //
translated: It is sealed with the seal that includes mindfulness and wisdom.

original: de nyid rim gyis mthar thug pa'i gnas bcu dang shin tu 'brel pa'i blo ste /
analyzed: de nyid rim gyis mthar thug pa'i gnas bcu dang shin tu 'brel pa'i blo ste /
translated: That itself is the mind that is very much connected with the ten stages that culminate in the end.

original: chos kyi sku'i ye shes la brten nas zla ba dang nyi ma la sogs pa ltar rtogs pa med cing /
analyzed: chos kyi sku'i ye shes la brten nas zla ba dang nyi ma la sogs pa ltar rtogs pa med cing /
translated: Based on the wisdom of the dharmakƒÅya, like the moon and sun, there is no conceptualization.

original: lhun gyis grub par sprul pa'i 'od zer sna tshogs kyis sems can gyi don byed cing /
analyzed: lhun gyis grub par sprul pa'i 'od zer sna tshogs kyis sems can gyi don byed cing /
translated: Through various emanated light rays that are spontaneously present, the welfare of sentient beings is accomplished.

original: chos thams cad la rang gi rnam par rtog pa zhes pa la sogs pa sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad la rang gi rnam par rtog pa zhes pa la sogs pa sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: With regard to all phenomena, one should apply ‚Äúone‚Äôs own conceptualization‚Äù and so on.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sa yang chos kyi sku'i ye shes de nyid do //üîΩsgra gzhan gyi rnam grangs la 'jug pa'i gnas kyis rab tu 'god par 'gyur zhes pa ni chos so so yang dag par rig pa'am /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sa yang chos kyi sku'i ye shes de nyid do // sgra gzhan gyi rnam grangs la 'jug pa'i gnas kyis rab tu 'god par 'gyur zhes pa ni chos so so yang dag par rig pa'am /
translated: The level of buddhahood is also that gnosis of the body of truth.üîΩIt is presented by means of the bases for engaging in other terms, which is the discernment of phenomena.

original: nges pa'i tshig so so yang dag par rig pas go rims bzhin du don gcig nyid rnam grangs du ma'i sgo nas ston par mkhyen pa dang / 'gro ba sna tshogs kyi skad mkhyen pa'i sgo nas so so'i skad du chos ston pa ste /
analyzed: nges pa'i tshig so so yang dag par rig pas go rims bzhin du don gcig nyid rnam grangs du ma'i sgo nas ston par mkhyen pa dang / 'gro ba sna tshogs kyi skad mkhyen pa'i sgo nas so so'i skad du chos ston pa ste /
translated: Or it is presented by means of the discernment of expression, for it is the knowledge that teaches the same meaning in many different ways and it is the teaching of the Dharma in the languages of the various beings of the world.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: 'gro ba kun gyi skad rnams ji tsam par //
analyzed: 'gro ba kun gyi skad rnams ji tsam par //
translated: To the extent that there are languages in the world,

original: thams cad skad du bdag gis chos bstan to //üîΩzhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: thams cad skad du bdag gis chos bstan to // zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: I teach the Dharma in all those languages.

original: yang gdul bya'i mos pa ji lta ba bzhin du don sna tshogs ston pa'i sgra sna tshogs bstan pa'i sgo nas kyang ngo //
analyzed: yang gdul bya'i mos pa ji lta ba bzhin du don sna tshogs ston pa'i sgra sna tshogs bstan pa'i sgo nas kyang ngo //
translated: Moreover, it is presented by means of the teaching of various sounds that teach various meanings in accordance with the inclinations of those to be trained.

original: de la gnas ni de ltar mkhyen par spyod pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: de la gnas ni de ltar mkhyen par spyod pa'i ye shes so //
translated: The basis for that is the gnosis that engages in such knowledge.

original: lam gyi skabs su sems can rnams kyi log pa'i lam la mtha' med mod kyi /
analyzed: lam gyi skabs su sems can rnams kyi log pa'i lam la mtha' med mod kyi /
translated: In the context of the path, the wrong paths of sentient beings are endless.

original: de dag las phyogs 'ga' tsam bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de dag las phyogs 'ga' tsam bstan pa ni /
translated: However, a few of them are taught here:

original: mtshan nyid la mngon par chags pa zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: mtshan nyid la mngon par chags pa zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúAttachment to characteristics‚Äù and so on.

original: don go par  zad do //üîΩrang gi rnam par rtog pa mngon par rtogs pa'i mtshams sbyor ba dang / theg pa mngon par rtogs pa rnam par rtog pa'i mtshams sbyor ba ni /
analyzed: don go par  zad do // rang gi rnam par rtog pa mngon par rtogs pa'i mtshams sbyor ba dang / theg pa mngon par rtogs pa rnam par rtog pa'i mtshams sbyor ba ni /
translated: The meaning is clear.

original: gnyen po la mngon par zhen pa'i rtog pa'o //
analyzed: gnyen po la mngon par zhen pa'i rtog pa'o //
translated: The connection to the realization of one‚Äôs own concepts and the connection to the realization of the vehicle are concepts that are fixated on antidotes.

original: yod pa dang med pa'i phyogs mu stegs can gyi gnas ni sngar bstan pa ltar bdag rtag pa zhi ba'i ngo bor ni yod la de las gzhan pa'i ngo bor med ces rtog pa'o //
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa'i phyogs mu stegs can gyi gnas ni sngar bstan pa ltar bdag rtag pa zhi ba'i ngo bor ni yod la de las gzhan pa'i ngo bor med ces rtog pa'o //
translated: The position of the tƒ´rthikas, which is the position of existence and nonexistence, is as was previously explained: ‚ÄúThe self exists in the nature of peace, but it does not exist in a nature that is other than that.‚Äù

original: @205a * // mtshams sbyor ba de dag la mtshams sbyar zhes pa ni rang gi rigs kyi rgyu snga ma de dag la mtshams sbyar nas rigs mthun pa'i rtog pa phyi ma rnams mtshams sbyor ba'i mtshan nyid la yang dngos po dang dngos po med par mngon par chags shing zhen
analyzed: @205a * // mtshams sbyor ba de dag la mtshams sbyar zhes pa ni rang gi rigs kyi rgyu snga ma de dag la mtshams sbyar nas rigs mthun pa'i rtog pa phyi ma rnams mtshams sbyor ba'i mtshan nyid la yang dngos po dang dngos po med par mngon par chags shing zhen
translated: ‚ÄúThose who are connected‚Äù means that they are connected to their previous causes of the same type. The characteristic of connecting to subsequent thoughts of the same type is to be attached to and fixated on things and nonthings.

original: pas ji ltar dar gyi srin bu rang gi lus las byung ba'i spu yis bcings pa ltar rtog pa'i ngo bor gyur pa'i rnam par shes pa las byung ba'i rnam par rtog pas rang nyid bcings shing gzhan yang 'ching par 'gyur pa'o //
analyzed: pas ji ltar dar gyi srin bu rang gi lus las byung ba'i spu yis bcings pa ltar rtog pa'i ngo bor gyur pa'i rnam par shes pa las byung ba'i rnam par rtog pas rang nyid bcings shing gzhan yang 'ching par 'gyur pa'o //
translated: Just as a silkworm is bound by its own body with the hairs that emerge from it, consciousness, which is the essence of thought, is bound by the thoughts that emerge from it, and it binds others as well.

original: gal te de ltar na thar pa nyid mi 'thad do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar na thar pa nyid mi 'thad do zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then liberation itself is not tenable.

original: blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pa smos te /
translated: To respond, it is said, ‚ÄúMahƒÅmati, those who are free from the two kinds of nonentities . . .‚Äù

original: rtog pa dang brtag par bya ba'i don dben par mthong bas de dag las grol ba'o //
analyzed: rtog pa dang brtag par bya ba'i don dben par mthong bas de dag las grol ba'o //
translated: Liberation is seeing the emptiness of thought and the object of thought.

original: chos thams cad la dben par lta zhing gnas zhes pa ni don dam par shes pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i chos kyang dben par lta zhing /
analyzed: chos thams cad la dben par lta zhing gnas zhes pa ni don dam par shes pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i chos kyang dben par lta zhing /
translated: Looking at and abiding in the emptiness of all phenomena means looking at even phenomena that are the nature of consciousness in the ultimate as empty,

original: yun ring du bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: yun ring du bsgom par bya'o //
translated: and meditating on that for a long time.

original: gzhan yang zhes pa la sogs pa la don ni phyi'i don yang dag pa'i kun rdzob tsam du yang dben pa nyid du mthong zhing goms pas mtshams sbyor ba ldog pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes pa la sogs pa la don ni phyi'i don yang dag pa'i kun rdzob tsam du yang dben pa nyid du mthong zhing goms pas mtshams sbyor ba ldog pa'o //
translated: Moreover, and so on and so forth means that by seeing and cultivating the external object as empty even as a mere correct conventionality, the connection is reversed.üîΩMoreover, and so on and so forth means that by seeing and cultivating the external object as empty even as a mere correct conventionality, the connection is reversed.

original: gzhan yang blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs kyis bsdus pas 'gro ba gzhan dang gzhan du nyid mtshams 'brel par byed pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gzhan yang blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs kyis bsdus pas 'gro ba gzhan dang gzhan du nyid mtshams 'brel par byed pa gsungs te /
translated: Moreover, the BhagavƒÅn says that by the side of affliction, it connects to other transmigrations and other transmigrations.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa ni go rims bzhin du khams gsum gyi mngon par zhen pa dang / sdug bsngal lam sdug bsngal gyi gnas su snang ba la /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa ni go rims bzhin du khams gsum gyi mngon par zhen pa dang / sdug bsngal lam sdug bsngal gyi gnas su snang ba la /
translated: Attachment and so on are the three realms, respectively, the manifest clinging to the three realms and the appearance of suffering or the basis of suffering.

original: sems khong nas 'khrugs pa kun nas mnar sems can dang / ma rtogs pa dang / log par rtogs pa dang / the tshom gyis bsdus pa khams gsum gyi mi shes pa'o //
analyzed: sems khong nas 'khrugs pa kun nas mnar sems can dang / ma rtogs pa dang / log par rtogs pa dang / the tshom gyis bsdus pa khams gsum gyi mi shes pa'o //
translated: envy, and so on, which torment the mind, as well as ignorance, which is the non-understanding, misunderstanding, and doubt of the three realms.

original: nyon mongs pa de rnams kyis kun nas bslang ba'i mi dge ba'i las sam /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa de rnams kyis kun nas bslang ba'i mi dge ba'i las sam /
translated: The karma that is motivated by those mental afflictions is nonvirtuous karma.üîΩOr, the seeds of karma are made powerful by the craving that is accompanied by the desire for existence and by the existence that is accompanied by craving.

original: las kyi sa bon la dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang ldan pa yang srid pa can gyi srid pas mthu dang ldan par byas pa dang / de bzhin du ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis zag pa dang bcas pa'i las dge ba la sogs pa la yang sbyar bar bya ste /
analyzed: las kyi sa bon la dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang ldan pa yang srid pa can gyi srid pas mthu dang ldan par byas pa dang / de bzhin du ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis zag pa dang bcas pa'i las dge ba la sogs pa la yang sbyar bar bya ste /
translated: In the same way, the karma that is accompanied by the condition of ignorance and that is virtuous and so on should be applied.

original: de lta na sa bon dang ldan pa'i kun gzhi la sogs pa gang la mtshams sbyar nas 'gro ba rnams kyi mtshams sbyor bar 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: de lta na sa bon dang ldan pa'i kun gzhi la sogs pa gang la mtshams sbyar nas 'gro ba rnams kyi mtshams sbyor bar 'byung ba ste /
translated: In that case, the consciousness that is accompanied by the seeds, such as the all-base, and so on, is the link of becoming.

original: 'bras bus bsdus pa'i rnam par shes pa dang / ming dang gzugs la sogs pa mngon par grub pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bus bsdus pa'i rnam par shes pa dang / ming dang gzugs la sogs pa mngon par grub pa'o //
translated: The establishment of the result that is included in consciousness and name-and-form and so on is the link of birth.

original: de @205b ltar na thar par mi 'thad do zhe na /
analyzed: de @205b ltar na thar par mi 'thad do zhe na /
translated: Thus, liberation is not tenable.

original: blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: To respond: ‚ÄúMahƒÅmati,üîΩthe cessation of the mind, mental events, and views is not liberation.

original: yang dag pa'i shes rab kyis gti mug rnam par bzlog ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i shes rab kyis gti mug rnam par bzlog ste /
translated: Liberation is the reversal of delusion through right wisdom.

original: chags sdang la sogs pa'i yul stong pa nyid du rtogs pa na de 'dra ba'i mtshams sbyor ba chad nas thar par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: chags sdang la sogs pa'i yul stong pa nyid du rtogs pa na de 'dra ba'i mtshams sbyor ba chad nas thar par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: When one realizes that the objects of attachment, aversion, and so on are emptiness, the connection to such things is severed and one is liberated.‚Äù

original: gzhan yang blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pas da ltar ba'i tshe 'di nyid las ma 'ongs pa'i tshe gzhan du mtshams sbyor ba ston te /
analyzed: gzhan yang blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pas da ltar ba'i tshe 'di nyid las ma 'ongs pa'i tshe gzhan du mtshams sbyor ba ston te /
translated: Moreover, from ‚ÄúMahƒÅmati, the mind, mental events, and views‚Äù up to ‚Äúthe mind, mental events, and views are not liberation‚Äù teaches that in the future, one is connected to another life from this very present life.

original: yul dang dbang po dang / rnam par shes pa gsum 'dus pa'i tshul gyis yul yongs su gcod pa'i reg pa dang / de'i bya ba sbyor ba ste /
analyzed: yul dang dbang po dang / rnam par shes pa gsum 'dus pa'i tshul gyis yul yongs su gcod pa'i reg pa dang / de'i bya ba sbyor ba ste /
translated: The way the three‚Äîthe object, the sense faculty, and the consciousness‚Äîcome together is the contact that defines the object, and its function is to connect.

original: reg pa'i rkyen gyis byung ba'i tshor ba dang / tshor ba'i rgyu la mngon par chags pa'i srid pa dang len pas ma 'ongs pa'i skye ba 'grub pa'i las mthu dang ldan par byas pa'i srid pas ma 'ongs pa'i skye ba la sogs pa 'grub pa'i tshul gyis mtshams sbyor ba ste /
analyzed: reg pa'i rkyen gyis byung ba'i tshor ba dang / tshor ba'i rgyu la mngon par chags pa'i srid pa dang len pas ma 'ongs pa'i skye ba 'grub pa'i las mthu dang ldan par byas pa'i srid pas ma 'ongs pa'i skye ba la sogs pa 'grub pa'i tshul gyis mtshams sbyor ba ste /
translated: Contact as a condition gives rise to feeling, and craving for the cause of feeling gives rise to grasping. Existence, which is the karma that has the power to bring about future birth, gives rise to future birth, and so on.

original: de ltar na kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam pa gsum gyi tshul gyis par chad med par sred pa mtshams sbyor bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam pa gsum gyi tshul gyis par chad med par sred pa mtshams sbyor bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, craving links to future birth by means of the three aspects of affliction.

original: de'i phyir mdo 'dis kyang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba tshe gsum la rdzogs pa nyid du bstan te /
analyzed: de'i phyir mdo 'dis kyang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba tshe gsum la rdzogs pa nyid du bstan te /
translated: Therefore, this sutra also teaches that dependent origination is completed in three lifetimes.

original: 'di'i don rgyas par ni sngar bstan to //
analyzed: 'di'i don rgyas par ni sngar bstan to //
translated: The meaning of this has been explained above.

original: rnam par shes pa rnams kyis zhes pa la sogs pas de dag lugs las bzlog pa nyid ston te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa rnams kyis zhes pa la sogs pas de dag lugs las bzlog pa nyid ston te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúby the consciousnesses‚Äù and so on teaches the reverse order of dependent origination.

original: don sngar bstan pa bzhin shes par bya'o //
analyzed: don sngar bstan pa bzhin shes par bya'o //
translated: The meaning should be understood as explained above.

original: tshigs su bcad pa'i don ni phal cher go bar zad do //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa'i don ni phal cher go bar zad do //
translated: The meaning of the verses is for the most part self-evident.

original: dngos por shes pa'i sgra 'dzin pas zhes pa ni sgra dang 'dres pa'i don 'dzin pa'am /
analyzed: dngos por shes pa'i sgra 'dzin pas zhes pa ni sgra dang 'dres pa'i don 'dzin pa'am /
translated: The phrase by apprehending sound as an entity means apprehending the object mixed with sound,

original: yang na sgra las ma gtogs pa'i dngos po med pas de ltar 'dzin pa ni ming gi rang bzhin gyi sgra nyid 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: yang na sgra las ma gtogs pa'i dngos po med pas de ltar 'dzin pa ni ming gi rang bzhin gyi sgra nyid 'dzin pa'o //
translated: or else, since there is no entity apart from sound, apprehending it in that way is apprehending sound itself, which is the nature of the name.

original: yang blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pas brtsad pa spong ba'i sgo nas sngar bstan pa'i don rgyas par 'chad de /
analyzed: yang blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pas brtsad pa spong ba'i sgo nas sngar bstan pa'i don rgyas par 'chad de /
translated: Again, beginning with MahƒÅmati, he explains in detail the meaning taught above by way of rejecting objections, saying,

original: mtshan nyid mi rig ces pa ni rtog pa'i blo yis so //
analyzed: mtshan nyid mi rig ces pa ni rtog pa'i blo yis so //
translated: not knowing the characteristics means with conceptual mind.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis de skad bka' stsal zhes pa la sogs pa'i don ni le'u dang por 'bod 'grogs la gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis de skad bka' stsal zhes pa la sogs pa'i don ni le'u dang por 'bod 'grogs la gsungs pa'o //
translated: The meaning of the passage beginning with The Blessed One spoke thus was spoken in the first chapter in the dialogue.

original: de la 'phags pa'i ye shes la sogs pa gsum ni go rims bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi spyan chos thams cad kyi yul can dang / chos kyi spyan 'phags pa'i gang zag gi rnam par dbye ba rtogs pa dang / shes rab kyi spyan dang sbyar par bya'o //üîΩyang na ye shes dang mthong pa ni 'khrul pa @206a * //
analyzed: de la 'phags pa'i ye shes la sogs pa gsum ni go rims bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi spyan chos thams cad kyi yul can dang / chos kyi spyan 'phags pa'i gang zag gi rnam par dbye ba rtogs pa dang / shes rab kyi spyan dang sbyar par bya'o // yang na ye shes dang mthong pa ni 'khrul pa @206a * //
translated: The three, beginning with the knowledge of the noble ones, should be connected respectively with the Buddha eye, the subject of all dharmas, the Dharma eye, the realization of the classification of noble persons, and the wisdom eye.

original: med pa dang / rtog pa med pa ste rtog pa dang bral zhing ma 'khrul pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: med pa dang / rtog pa med pa ste rtog pa dang bral zhing ma 'khrul pa'i ye shes so //
translated: Or else, knowledge and seeing are non-erroneous and non-conceptual, that is, non-conceptual and non-mistaken wisdom.

original: de nyid don ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pas shes rab ces kyang bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid don ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pas shes rab ces kyang bya'o //
translated: That itself is called wisdom because it realizes the meaning as it is.

original: yang rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las shes pa ni rab tu 'byed pa'i don to //
analyzed: yang rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las shes pa ni rab tu 'byed pa'i don to //
translated: Moreover, in the YogƒÅcƒÅrabh≈´mi, knowledge is the meaning of discernment,

original: mthong ba ni rab tu tshol ba'i don te /
analyzed: mthong ba ni rab tu tshol ba'i don te /
translated: and seeing is the meaning of thorough investigation.

original: 'di ltar zag pa med pa 'phags pa'i ye shes kyis rab tu rnam par 'byed cing /
analyzed: 'di ltar zag pa med pa 'phags pa'i ye shes kyis rab tu rnam par 'byed cing /
translated: Thus, it is thoroughly discerned by the uncontaminated noble wisdom.

original: yongs su tshol ba'i phyir 'phags pa'i shes pa dang mthong ba zhes bya'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: yongs su tshol ba'i phyir 'phags pa'i shes pa dang mthong ba zhes bya'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: Because of thorough search, it is called the knowledge and vision of the noble ones.

original: gzhan yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rdo rje gcod pa'i 'grel pa las slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis /
analyzed: gzhan yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rdo rje gcod pa'i 'grel pa las slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis /
translated: Moreover, in the commentary on the Diamond-Cutter Perfection of Wisdom, the master Vasubandhu says:

original: 'phags pa'i ye shes mngon sum gyi tshad ma ni shes pa dang mthong ba zhes pa'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i ye shes mngon sum gyi tshad ma ni shes pa dang mthong ba zhes pa'o //
translated: The valid knowledge of direct perception of the noble ones‚Äô wisdom is called knowledge and vision.

original: shes pa 'ba' zhig bstan pa gang yin pa de ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: shes pa 'ba' zhig bstan pa gang yin pa de ni 'di lta ste /
translated: That which is taught as mere knowledge is as follows:

original: shes pa 'di yis shes par 'gyur pa'o //
analyzed: shes pa 'di yis shes par 'gyur pa'o //
translated: It is known by this knowledge.

original: des kyang tha mal pa'i mig gis blta ba las kyang rnam par 'byed do //
analyzed: des kyang tha mal pa'i mig gis blta ba las kyang rnam par 'byed do //
translated: It is distinguished from the view of ordinary eyes.

original: mthong pa kho na bstan pa gang yin pa de ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: mthong pa kho na bstan pa gang yin pa de ni 'di lta ste /
translated: That which is taught as mere seeing is as follows:

original: sha'i mig la sogs pas mthong bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: sha'i mig la sogs pas mthong bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: It is seen by the fleshly eye and so on.

original: des kyang rjes su dpag pa'i shes pa las rnam par 'byed do zhes gsungs te /üîΩ'dir ni de rnams rjes su 'brel pa ma yin te /
analyzed: des kyang rjes su dpag pa'i shes pa las rnam par 'byed do zhes gsungs te / 'dir ni de rnams rjes su 'brel pa ma yin te /
translated: It is distinguished from inferential knowledge.

original: gzhung dang mi mthun pas so //
analyzed: gzhung dang mi mthun pas so //
translated: Here they are not related because they are not in accord with the text.

original: blo gros chen pos gsol pa zhes pa la sogs pas ni sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa'i don rjes su brjod pa ste /
analyzed: blo gros chen pos gsol pa zhes pa la sogs pas ni sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa'i don rjes su brjod pa ste /
translated: The passage beginning MahƒÅmati made a request expresses the Buddha's reply.

original: de la 'phrul gyi mig ni lha'i spyan te /
analyzed: de la 'phrul gyi mig ni lha'i spyan te /
translated: Here, divine eye refers to the divine eye of the gods.

original: gtso bor sngon gyi rnam par smin pa las byung zhing ye shes la brten pa ste /
analyzed: gtso bor sngon gyi rnam par smin pa las byung zhing ye shes la brten pa ste /
translated: It is primarily derived from the ripening of past karma and is based on wisdom.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las /
translated: In the Perfection of Wisdom it is said:

original: byang chub sems dpa' lha'i spyan gyis ni sum cu rtsa gsum pa la sogs pa'i lha rnams kyi lha'i mig shes la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' lha'i spyan gyis ni sum cu rtsa gsum pa la sogs pa'i lha rnams kyi lha'i mig shes la /
translated: The divine eye of the bodhisattvas is aware of the divine eye of the gods of the Thirty-Three and so forth,

original: lha rnams kyi mig gis ni byang chub sems dpa'i lha'i spyan shes par mi nus so zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: lha rnams kyi mig gis ni byang chub sems dpa'i lha'i spyan shes par mi nus so zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: but the gods are unable to know the divine eye of the bodhisattvas.

original: sha'i mig ni ji skad du /
analyzed: sha'i mig ni ji skad du /
translated: As for the flesh eye, it is said:

original: 'phags pa nyan thos rnams kyi dbang du byas na /
analyzed: 'phags pa nyan thos rnams kyi dbang du byas na /
translated: In the case of the noble ≈õrƒÅvakas,

original: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams la thug pa'i bar du mthong ba dang / dbang po la brten pa'o zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams la thug pa'i bar du mthong ba dang / dbang po la brten pa'o zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: and it is based on the sense faculties.

original: de dag gis mthong ba ma yin pa 'phags pa'i ye shes la sogs pas dngos po'i ngo bo nyid rtogs pa de bzhin du bden gyi /
analyzed: de dag gis mthong ba ma yin pa 'phags pa'i ye shes la sogs pas dngos po'i ngo bo nyid rtogs pa de bzhin du bden gyi /
translated: Just as the nature of entities is realized by the wisdom of the noble ones and so forth, which is not seeing, so it is.üîΩIt is not as it is imagined by foolish beings.

original: byis pa'i skye bos ji ltar brtags pa de ltar ma lags na zhes sngar @206b gsungs pa'i don rjes su brjod pa'o //
analyzed: byis pa'i skye bos ji ltar brtags pa de ltar ma lags na zhes sngar @206b gsungs pa'i don rjes su brjod pa'o //
translated: This is a repetition of the meaning stated earlier.

original: bcom ldan 'das zhes pa la sogs pas byis pa'i skye bo'i dogs pa dang bstun nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das zhes pa la sogs pas byis pa'i skye bo'i dogs pa dang bstun nas /
translated: With the words ‚ÄúBlessed One‚Äù and so forth, in accordance with the doubts of foolish beings,

original: de nyid bsal ba'i don du skyon brjod pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid bsal ba'i don du skyon brjod pa'o //
translated: he states the faults in order to dispel them.

original: de'i don yang ji ltar byis pas 'phags pas rtogs par bya ba'i ngo bo khong du ma chud pa'i phyir phyin ci log gi rnam par rtog pa ldog par mi 'gyur ba dang / gzhan yang de lta na byis pa'i blo phyin ci log 'ba' zhig tu ma nges te /
analyzed: de'i don yang ji ltar byis pas 'phags pas rtogs par bya ba'i ngo bo khong du ma chud pa'i phyir phyin ci log gi rnam par rtog pa ldog par mi 'gyur ba dang / gzhan yang de lta na byis pa'i blo phyin ci log 'ba' zhig tu ma nges te /
translated: Moreover, in that case, the minds of childish beings are not ascertained to be only mistaken.

original: 'phags pas rtogs par bya ba'i dngos po'i ngo bo'i rang bzhin khong du ma chud pas phyin ci ma log pa yang ma lags shing /
analyzed: 'phags pas rtogs par bya ba'i dngos po'i ngo bo'i rang bzhin khong du ma chud pas phyin ci ma log pa yang ma lags shing /
translated: Because they do not comprehend the essence of the nature of things that is to be realized by the ƒÅryas, they are also not nonmistaken.

original: yang kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gzhan dbang rnam par rtog pa'i bdag nyid yod pa dang med pa'i mtha' gnyis las log pa so so rang gi rig pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yang kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gzhan dbang rnam par rtog pa'i bdag nyid yod pa dang med pa'i mtha' gnyis las log pa so so rang gi rig pa'i phyir /
translated: Moreover, because the dependent afflicted class of phenomena, which is the nature of conceptualization, is the opposite of the two extremes of existence and nonexistence and is to be personally experienced,

original: phyin ci log pa yang ma lags zhes pa'o //
analyzed: phyin ci log pa yang ma lags zhes pa'o //
translated: it is also not mistaken.

original: gal te de lta na byis pa'i skye bo thams cad grol ba nyid du 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de lta na byis pa'i skye bo thams cad grol ba nyid du 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If that is so, all childish beings would be liberated.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: dngos po'i ngo bo ji lta ba bzhin du rig cing yul du byas mod kyi /
analyzed: dngos po'i ngo bo ji lta ba bzhin du rig cing yul du byas mod kyi /
translated: Although they do know and take as an object the essence of things just as it is,

original: sngar bstan pa ltar /
analyzed: sngar bstan pa ltar /
translated: As was previously explained,

original: gzugs chos mthun pa mthong ba las //
analyzed: gzugs chos mthun pa mthong ba las //
translated: the similarity of form is seen

original: nya phyis la dngul rnam pa ltar //
analyzed: nya phyis la dngul rnam pa ltar //
translated: like a mother-of-pearl shell is seen as silver

original: phyin ci log gi sgro 'dogs ma chod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyin ci log gi sgro 'dogs ma chod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: by one who has not eliminated the superimposition of error.

original: bcom ldan 'das zhes pa la sogs pas ni 'phags pa nyan thos la sogs pa rnams kyis phung po la sogs pa'i dngos po mi rtag pa dang du ma'i rang bzhin la sogs par rnam par brtags shing /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das zhes pa la sogs pas ni 'phags pa nyan thos la sogs pa rnams kyis phung po la sogs pa'i dngos po mi rtag pa dang du ma'i rang bzhin la sogs par rnam par brtags shing /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe BhagavƒÅn, the TathƒÅgata, the Arhat, the Perfect and Complete Buddha‚Äù and so on refers to the fact that the noble ≈õrƒÅvakas and so on have imputed the entities of the aggregates and so on to be impermanent and to have the nature of being manifold and so on.

original: de ltar rtogs pa'i blo yang /üîΩrang gi mtshan nyid don dam pa'i yul la /
analyzed: de ltar rtogs pa'i blo yang / rang gi mtshan nyid don dam pa'i yul la /
translated: The mind that realizes them in that way

original: spyod yul du byed cing rtogs pa ma lags pa'i phyir /
analyzed: spyod yul du byed cing rtogs pa ma lags pa'i phyir /
translated: does not engage in the ultimate object that is characterized by its own characteristics.

original: ji ltar brtags pa de bzhin du bden par mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: ji ltar brtags pa de bzhin du bden par mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Therefore, it is not the case that they are true in the way that they are imputed.

original: bcom ldan 'das zhes pa la sogs pas byis pa dang 'phags pa de dag gis yul du byas pa'i gzhan gyi dbang gi dngos po'i rang bzhin dang / mtshan nyid de yang rgyu ma bstan pas zhes pa ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das zhes pa la sogs pas byis pa dang 'phags pa de dag gis yul du byas pa'i gzhan gyi dbang gi dngos po'i rang bzhin dang / mtshan nyid de yang rgyu ma bstan pas zhes pa ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe BhagavƒÅn, the TathƒÅgata, the Arhat, the Perfect and Complete Buddha‚Äù and so on refers to the fact that the nature and characteristics of the dependent entity that is the object of those fools and the noble ones are not taught to be the cause.

original: rnam grangs kyi kun du brtags pa'i rang bzhin sgyu ma lta bu'i rgyu las byung gi / dngos po yang dag pa'i rgyu las ma byung ba la /
analyzed: rnam grangs kyi kun du brtags pa'i rang bzhin sgyu ma lta bu'i rgyu las byung gi / dngos po yang dag pa'i rgyu las ma byung ba la /
translated: The imagined nature that is a conceptual distinction does not arise from a cause that is an illusion-like thing, but from a cause that is a real thing.

original: de ltar ma bstan cing ma rtogs te /
analyzed: de ltar ma bstan cing ma rtogs te /
translated: It is not taught and not realized in that way.

original: dngos po yang dag pa'i rgyu las byung ba nyid du kun brtags pas mi bden pa'i don blo yis gzhag pa'i phyir kun brtags pa'i rang bzhin nyid snang ba'o //
analyzed: dngos po yang dag pa'i rgyu las byung ba nyid du kun brtags pas mi bden pa'i don blo yis gzhag pa'i phyir kun brtags pa'i rang bzhin nyid snang ba'o //
translated: Because it is imagined to arise from a cause that is a real thing, the meaning of unreality is posited by the mind. Therefore, the imagined nature itself appears.

original: de ltar na dngos po'i mtshan nyid la lta bar lhung bas phyin ci log pa'i blo @207a * //
analyzed: de ltar na dngos po'i mtshan nyid la lta bar lhung bas phyin ci log pa'i blo @207a * //
translated: Thus, because of falling into the view of the characteristics of things, the mind is mistaken.

original: las gzhan dag gi spyod yul du 'gyur te /
analyzed: las gzhan dag gi spyod yul du 'gyur te /
translated: It becomes the domain of others.

original: de'i phyir de ltar 'dzin pa'i blo yis dngos po'i rang gi mtshan nyid khong du ma chud pa'i phyir phyin ci log phyi ma'i mtha'i thug pa ma mchis par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar 'dzin pa'i blo yis dngos po'i rang gi mtshan nyid khong du ma chud pa'i phyir phyin ci log phyi ma'i mtha'i thug pa ma mchis par 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, because the mind that apprehends in that way does not understand the characteristics of things, mistakenness will be endless.

original: rnam pa thams cad du ldog pa med par 'gyur zhes pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du ldog pa med par 'gyur zhes pa'o //
translated: It will be without any end.

original: bcom ldan 'das zhes pa la sogs pa don de rnams nyid rgyas par ston te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das zhes pa la sogs pa don de rnams nyid rgyas par ston te /
translated: The Blessed One teaches these points extensively.

original: kun brtags pa'i rang bzhin gyi rgyu las skyes pa ni sngar bshad pa ltar rnam grangs kyi kun du brtags pa ste /
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i rang bzhin gyi rgyu las skyes pa ni sngar bshad pa ltar rnam grangs kyi kun du brtags pa ste /
translated: The nature that is imagined, which arises from causes, is the nominal imagination, as explained above.

original: de ltar rtog pa'i gzhan dbang snga ma rnams kyi rgyu las skyes pa don dam pa'i dngos po'i rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid ma lags pa na zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar rtog pa'i gzhan dbang snga ma rnams kyi rgyu las skyes pa don dam pa'i dngos po'i rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid ma lags pa na zhes pa'o //
translated: Since the former dependent nature arises from causes, it is not the characteristic of the nature of ultimate things.

original: de ltar ma lags bzhin du yang dag pa'i dngos po'i rgyu las skyes shing /
analyzed: de ltar ma lags bzhin du yang dag pa'i dngos po'i rgyu las skyes shing /
translated: Although it is not like that, it arises from the causes of real things.

original: de 'dra ba'i dngos por kun brtags pas ji ltar na kun brtags pa'i rang bzhin du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de 'dra ba'i dngos por kun brtags pas ji ltar na kun brtags pa'i rang bzhin du mi 'gyur te /
translated: Since it is imagined to be such a thing, how could it not be the imagined nature?

original: de 'dra ba'i gzhan dbang ni kun du brtags pa 'ba' zhig tu 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de 'dra ba'i gzhan dbang ni kun du brtags pa 'ba' zhig tu 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Such a dependent nature would be only the imagined.

original: de'i don yang sgyu ma lta bu'i gzhan dbang la don dam pa'i dngos por brtags pa ni mi bden pa'i don blos brtags pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i don yang sgyu ma lta bu'i gzhan dbang la don dam pa'i dngos por brtags pa ni mi bden pa'i don blos brtags pa'i phyir /
translated: The meaning of that is as follows: The imagination of a real thing in the illusion-like dependent nature is imagined by the mind to be the meaning of unreality.

original: brtags pa 'ba' zhig tu 'gyur zhes pa'o //
analyzed: brtags pa 'ba' zhig tu 'gyur zhes pa'o //
translated: It would be mere imagination.

original: brtags pa ji lta bur /
analyzed: brtags pa ji lta bur /
translated: What kind of imagination?

original: brtags pa de bzhin zhes pa ni don gcig pa ste snga ma'i bshad pa nyid du phyi ma sbyar bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: brtags pa de bzhin zhes pa ni don gcig pa ste snga ma'i bshad pa nyid du phyi ma sbyar bar bya ba'o //
translated: The same as the imagination, that is, the same meaning, the latter should be applied as the explanation of the former.

original: bcom ldan 'das zhes pa la sogs pas ni sgyu ma lta bu'i gzhan dbang don dam pa'i dngos po'i rang bzhin ma yin te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das zhes pa la sogs pas ni sgyu ma lta bu'i gzhan dbang don dam pa'i dngos po'i rang bzhin ma yin te /
translated: The Blessed One, etc. means that the illusion-like relative is not the nature of ultimate things,

original: de dag rgyu mi mthun pa'i phyir zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de dag rgyu mi mthun pa'i phyir zhes pa'o //
translated: because they are incompatible causes.

original: de'i don ni sgyu ma lta bu'i gzhan dbang rnam par rtog pa snga ma las byung ba dang / dngos po'i rang bzhin don dam pa pa yod na don dam pa'i rgyu las 'byung bar 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i don ni sgyu ma lta bu'i gzhan dbang rnam par rtog pa snga ma las byung ba dang / dngos po'i rang bzhin don dam pa pa yod na don dam pa'i rgyu las 'byung bar 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The meaning of that is as follows: The illusion-like relative arises from previous conceptualization, and if the nature of ultimate things exists, it is tenable that it arises from ultimate causes.

original: de la 'dir byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyis sgyu ma lta bu'i gzhan dbang so sor rnam par rtog pa'i mtshan nyid kyang /
analyzed: de la 'dir byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyis sgyu ma lta bu'i gzhan dbang so sor rnam par rtog pa'i mtshan nyid kyang /
translated: Here, childish ordinary beings imagine the illusion-like relative, which has the characteristic of individual conceptualization,

original: don dam pa'i dngos po'i rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid du brtags la /
analyzed: don dam pa'i dngos po'i rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid du brtags la /
translated: to be the characteristic of the nature of ultimate things.

original: de yang so sor rnam par rtog pa'i mtshan nyid du brtags pa na phan tshun du ji ltar brtags pa 'ba' zhig tu 'gyur te /
analyzed: de yang so sor rnam par rtog pa'i mtshan nyid du brtags pa na phan tshun du ji ltar brtags pa 'ba' zhig tu 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, when one analyzes the characteristics of individual conceptualization, it is only what is mutually imputed.

original: mi bden pa'i don blo yis sgro btags pa'i phyir ro zhes skabs kyi don bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: mi bden pa'i don blo yis sgro btags pa'i phyir ro zhes skabs kyi don bstan par bya'o //
translated: The meaning of this passage is that the mind superimposes a false meaning.

original: 'di ltar zhes pa la sogs pas brtsad pa'i don bsdu ba ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes pa la sogs pas brtsad pa'i don bsdu ba ste /
translated: The summary of the argument is stated in ‚ÄúThus, etc.‚Äù

original: phyin ci log gi rtog pa bzlog pa'i don du ji ltar 'phags pa'i ye @207b shes la sogs pa'i yul yod pa nyid du so sor rnam par rtog pas brtags pa de bzhin du med do zhes bgyi 'am /
analyzed: phyin ci log gi rtog pa bzlog pa'i don du ji ltar 'phags pa'i ye @207b shes la sogs pa'i yul yod pa nyid du so sor rnam par rtog pas brtags pa de bzhin du med do zhes bgyi 'am /
translated: For the purpose of reversing mistaken conceptions, one may ask, ‚ÄúIs it the case that the object of the ƒÅrya‚Äôs gnosis and so on does not exist in the way it is conceived by individual conceptualization?‚Äù

original: gzhan yang sngar bya rgod phung po'i ri la yod pa dang med pa'i mtha' gnyis su lta ba bzlog pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang sngar bya rgod phung po'i ri la yod pa dang med pa'i mtha' gnyis su lta ba bzlog pa ste /
translated: Moreover, earlier on the Vulture Peak the Buddha refuted the two extremes of existence and nonexistence.

original: yang mdo sde 'di dang dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa la sogs pas dngos po'i rang bzhin la mngon par chags pa ste /
analyzed: yang mdo sde 'di dang dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa la sogs pas dngos po'i rang bzhin la mngon par chags pa ste /
translated: In this s≈´tra and in the S≈´tra Unraveling the Intention, he refuted the extreme of superimposition that reifies the nature of things.

original: byis pa'i skye bo rnams kyi spyod yul rnam par rtog pa'i gzhan dbang yod par bstan pas de la mngon par chags pa dang / 'phags pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul dang / yul yod par bstan pas yod par lta ba la 'god cing /
analyzed: byis pa'i skye bo rnams kyi spyod yul rnam par rtog pa'i gzhan dbang yod par bstan pas de la mngon par chags pa dang / 'phags pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul dang / yul yod par bstan pas yod par lta ba la 'god cing /
translated: The childish are taught that the domain of experience is under the power of conceptuality, and so they become attached to it, and they are taught that the domain of experience of the wisdom of the ƒÅryas and the object of that exist, and so they are led to the view of existence.

original: ye shes kyi ngo bo nyid kyang yod par bstan pas sngar rab tu dben pa'i chos bstan pa ma mchis par bgyi'am ci lags zhes ma rangs pa'i tshul gyis brtsad pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes kyi ngo bo nyid kyang yod par bstan pas sngar rab tu dben pa'i chos bstan pa ma mchis par bgyi'am ci lags zhes ma rangs pa'i tshul gyis brtsad pa'o //
translated: Since the entity of wisdom is also taught to exist, is it the case that the previously taught Dharma of complete isolation does not exist?‚Äù

original: lan gyi don ni de ltar bstan pa ni gzhug pa la ldem por dgongs pa yin gyi /
analyzed: lan gyi don ni de ltar bstan pa ni gzhug pa la ldem por dgongs pa yin gyi /
translated: The meaning of the reply is that such teachings are provisional meanings for the purpose of guiding disciples.

original: sgra ji bzhin gyi don du ma yin zhes pa'o //
analyzed: sgra ji bzhin gyi don du ma yin zhes pa'o //
translated: They are not literal.

original: rnam pa gcig tu na 'phags pa'i shes rab kyi mig gis dngos po'i rang bzhin ji ltar rtogs pa de lta bur dngos po'i rang bzhin no zhes pa'i don ni dngos por snang ba rnams kyi rang bzhin sgyu ma lta bur rtogs pa de lta bur dngos po'i
analyzed: rnam pa gcig tu na 'phags pa'i shes rab kyi mig gis dngos po'i rang bzhin ji ltar rtogs pa de lta bur dngos po'i rang bzhin no zhes pa'i don ni dngos por snang ba rnams kyi rang bzhin sgyu ma lta bur rtogs pa de lta bur dngos po'i
translated: In one sense, the meaning of ‚Äúthe nature of things is just as it is realized by the eye of noble wisdom‚Äù is that the nature of things that appear as entities is realized to be like an illusion.

original: chos nyid yin no zhes sgra ji bzhin gyi don du yang 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: chos nyid yin no zhes sgra ji bzhin gyi don du yang 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúthe nature of things‚Äù is also taken literally as ‚Äúthe reality of entities.‚Äù

original: 'on kyang dngos po'i sgra smos pas don dam pa'i dngos por yang byis pa'i skye bo dag dogs par 'gyur bas /
analyzed: 'on kyang dngos po'i sgra smos pas don dam pa'i dngos por yang byis pa'i skye bo dag dogs par 'gyur bas /
translated: However, because the word ‚Äúentity‚Äù is used, childish beings might suspect that it is an ultimate entity.

original: de 'dra ba'i sgra ni dgongs pa can nyid yin zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de 'dra ba'i sgra ni dgongs pa can nyid yin zhes pa'o //
translated: Therefore, such a word is said to be ‚Äúintentional.‚Äù

original: mngon par chags pa'i mtshan nyid du lta bas rab tu bden pa'i chos ston zhes pa ni de 'dra ba'i thabs la brten nas mthar gyis rab tu dben pa rtogs par byed ces pa ste /
analyzed: mngon par chags pa'i mtshan nyid du lta bas rab tu bden pa'i chos ston zhes pa ni de 'dra ba'i thabs la brten nas mthar gyis rab tu dben pa rtogs par byed ces pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThe teaching of the true Dharma by the view that has the characteristic of attachment‚Äù means that by relying on such a method, one will eventually realize complete seclusion.

original: 'di'i don ni sngar rgyas par bstan no //
analyzed: 'di'i don ni sngar rgyas par bstan no //
translated: The meaning of this has been extensively explained above.

original: dngos po'i rang bzhin bstan pa ni ma byas mod kyi zhes pa la /
analyzed: dngos po'i rang bzhin bstan pa ni ma byas mod kyi zhes pa la /
translated: The teaching of the nature of things is not done without reason.

original: de nyid mthar thug pa'i don yin zhing de 'dra ba'i rtogs pa la dgod par bya ba'i don du ma bstan zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid mthar thug pa'i don yin zhing de 'dra ba'i rtogs pa la dgod par bya ba'i don du ma bstan zhes pa'o //
translated: This is the ultimate meaning, and the teaching is not done for the sake of setting forth such a realization.

original: blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pas de bzhin gshegs pa bdag nyid kyis dben pa'i chos rtogs pa na yang /
analyzed: blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pas de bzhin gshegs pa bdag nyid kyis dben pa'i chos rtogs pa na yang /
translated: With MahƒÅmati, and so on, it is that when the TathƒÅgata realizes the Dharma of self-absence,

original: thog mar dngos por 'dzin pa'i thabs la brten nas /
analyzed: thog mar dngos por 'dzin pa'i thabs la brten nas /
translated: at first he relies on the method of grasping things,

original: mthar gyis dben pa'i chos rtogs pas gzhan la yang de bzhin du ston pa ste /
analyzed: mthar gyis dben pa'i chos rtogs pas gzhan la yang de bzhin du ston pa ste /
translated: and in the end he realizes the Dharma of absence. Therefore, he teaches others in the same way.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: skyob pa nyid gzigs lam gsung ba //üîΩ'bras med phyir na @208a * //
analyzed: skyob pa nyid gzigs lam gsung ba // 'bras med phyir na @208a * //
translated: The Protector teaches the path he has seenüîΩBecause it is not false,

original: brdzun mi gsung //üîΩzhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: brdzun mi gsung //üîΩzhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: it is not fruitless.

original: gzhan yang blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pas sngar chos thams cad skye ba med pa la sogs par dam bcas pa na byis pa'i skye bo dag de ltar na mngon sum la sogs pa dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro snyam du dogs pas de dag bsal
analyzed: gzhan yang blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pas sngar chos thams cad skye ba med pa la sogs par dam bcas pa na byis pa'i skye bo dag de ltar na mngon sum la sogs pa dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro snyam du dogs pas de dag bsal
translated: Moreover, in the passage beginning ‚ÄúMahƒÅmati, . . .‚Äù

original: ba'i don du de bzhin gshegs pas kun rdzob kyi skye ba la sogs pa med do zhes dam bca' bar mi bya ba ste /
analyzed: ba'i don du de bzhin gshegs pas kun rdzob kyi skye ba la sogs pa med do zhes dam bca' bar mi bya ba ste /
translated: the Buddha advises that the TathƒÅgata should not make the assertion that there is no conventional arising, etc.,

original: byis pa'i smra ba bden par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes nye bar gdams pa'o //
analyzed: byis pa'i smra ba bden par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes nye bar gdams pa'o //
translated: because if he did, the na√Øve would think that this would contradict direct perception and so on.

original: de'i don ni dam bca' ba'am /
analyzed: de'i don ni dam bca' ba'am /
translated: The meaning of this is that the assertion,üîΩor the words of the assertion, are included among all phenomena and so would not be arising even conventionally.

original: dam bca' ba'i tshig kyang chos thams cad kyi nang du 'dus pas kun rdzob du yang ma skyes par 'gyur pa dang / yang dam bca' ba'i don de ltar shes shing 'dod pa'i rgyu yis tshig 'jug par 'dod pas shugs la skye ba khas blangs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dam bca' ba'i tshig kyang chos thams cad kyi nang du 'dus pas kun rdzob du yang ma skyes par 'gyur pa dang / yang dam bca' ba'i don de ltar shes shing 'dod pa'i rgyu yis tshig 'jug par 'dod pas shugs la skye ba khas blangs pa'i phyir /
translated: And because the assertion is made with the intention of engaging in speech with the desire to understand and assert the meaning of the assertion, one would implicitly accept arising.

original: dngos kyi dam bca' ba dang / shugs kyi dam bca' ba gnyis 'gal bar 'gyur bas dam bcas pa las nyams pa'o //üîΩgzhan yang dam bca' ba'i tshig las pha rol po la rtogs pa skye bar 'dod la /
analyzed: dngos kyi dam bca' ba dang / shugs kyi dam bca' ba gnyis 'gal bar 'gyur bas dam bcas pa las nyams pa'o // gzhan yang dam bca' ba'i tshig las pha rol po la rtogs pa skye bar 'dod la /
translated: Since it would be contradictory to have both an explicit and an implicit thesis, one would be in violation of one‚Äôs thesis.üîΩMoreover, one would be in violation of one‚Äôs thesis because one would be in contradiction with one‚Äôs own words, since one wishes for the other party to understand the words of the thesis,

original: de yang chos thams cad kyi nang du 'dus pas ma skyes par yang khas blangs pa'i phyir bdag nyid kyi tshig 'gal bas dam bcas pa las nyams pa'o //üîΩdam bcas pa'ang zhes pa la sogs pas don de nyid rgyas par ston te ;
analyzed: de yang chos thams cad kyi nang du 'dus pas ma skyes par yang khas blangs pa'i phyir bdag nyid kyi tshig 'gal bas dam bcas pa las nyams pa'o // dam bcas pa'ang zhes pa la sogs pas don de nyid rgyas par ston te ;
translated: and since one has accepted that all phenomena are included in the thesis, and so are unarisen.üîΩThe same point is explained extensively in the lines beginning with ‚ÄúMoreover, the words of the thesis . . .‚Äù

original: / dam bca' ba'i tshig dam bca' ba'i don shes pa dang de ltar bstan par 'dod pa las byung bar don gyis khas blangs pas zhes pa ste /
analyzed: / dam bca' ba'i tshig dam bca' ba'i don shes pa dang de ltar bstan par 'dod pa las byung bar don gyis khas blangs pas zhes pa ste /
translated: The meaning of the thesis is understood, and one wishes to teach it in that way. Since one accepts the meaning,

original: sngar bstan pa bzhin no //üîΩde ste zhes pa la sogs pas dam bca' ba'am /
analyzed: sngar bstan pa bzhin no // de ste zhes pa la sogs pas dam bca' ba'am /
translated: one is in contradiction with one‚Äôs own words, as explained above.üîΩIf one says ‚Äúif‚Äù and so on, one accepts the thesis

original: de'i tshig kun rdzob tu ma skyes par 'dod na /
analyzed: de'i tshig kun rdzob tu ma skyes par 'dod na /
translated: or the words of the thesis as being conventionally unarisen.

original: de dag rang gi ngo bo ma thob pa'i nyams pa nyid du 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: de dag rang gi ngo bo ma thob pa'i nyams pa nyid du 'gyur ba ste /
translated: They are impaired, in that they do not obtain their own nature.

original: bdag nyid la bdag nyid slu bar byed pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
analyzed: bdag nyid la bdag nyid slu bar byed pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
translated: They are only deceiving themselves.

original: dam bcas pa yang mtshan nyid tha mi dad zhes pa ni chos thams cad kyi nang du 'dus pas de rnams las mtshan nyid gzhan med pa'o //
analyzed: dam bcas pa yang mtshan nyid tha mi dad zhes pa ni chos thams cad kyi nang du 'dus pas de rnams las mtshan nyid gzhan med pa'o //
translated: The thesis is ‚Äúwithout a different characteristic,‚Äù because all phenomena are included in it, and there is no other characteristic than those.

original: dam bca' ba'i yan lag gi rgyus zhes pa la sogs pas na don de nyid rnam par phye ste ston pa'o //
analyzed: dam bca' ba'i yan lag gi rgyus zhes pa la sogs pas na don de nyid rnam par phye ste ston pa'o //
translated: The reason for the thesis is stated by ‚Äúbecause of the reason of the part,‚Äù and so on, which analyzes and teaches that very meaning.

original: de'i don ni dam bca' ba'i yan lag dang / gtan tshigs kyi yan lag dang / dpe'i yan lag ste rnam pa gsum las /
analyzed: de'i don ni dam bca' ba'i yan lag dang / gtan tshigs kyi yan lag dang / dpe'i yan lag ste rnam pa gsum las /
translated: The meaning of that is as follows: From among the three parts of the thesis, the part of the reason, and the part of the example,

original: 'dir dam bca' pa'i yan lag ste /
analyzed: 'dir dam bca' pa'i yan lag ste /
translated: here it is the part of the thesis.

original: chos thams cad ni yod pa dang med pa las ma skyes so zhes dam bca' ba yin la /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni yod pa dang med pa las ma skyes so zhes dam bca' ba yin la /
translated: The thesis is ‚Äúall phenomena are not produced from existence or nonexistence.‚Äù

original: @208b de nyid rgyu mtshan gyi rgyu yang yin pas yan lag gi rgyus zhes gzhi mthun pa'i bsdu ba nyid du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: @208b de nyid rgyu mtshan gyi rgyu yang yin pas yan lag gi rgyus zhes gzhi mthun pa'i bsdu ba nyid du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Since that is also the reason, it is connected as a common locus by ‚Äúbecause of the reason of the part.‚Äù

original: rgyu mtshan des na ma thob pa'i nyams pa'am /
analyzed: rgyu mtshan des na ma thob pa'i nyams pa'am /
translated: For that reason, there is no fault of non-establishment or

original: 'gal ba khas blangs pas nyams pa nyid du 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'gal ba khas blangs pas nyams pa nyid du 'gyur ba'o //
translated: contradiction in the thesis.

original: blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pas dam bca' ba'i don de ltar 'dod pa'i blo dang / dam bca' ba'i tshig ma skyes pa de yis dngos po thams cad ma skyes pa'o zhes dam bca' bar byed na zhes pa dam bca' ba'i don 'jog cing rtogs pa skyed par byed pa na yang /
analyzed: blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pas dam bca' ba'i don de ltar 'dod pa'i blo dang / dam bca' ba'i tshig ma skyes pa de yis dngos po thams cad ma skyes pa'o zhes dam bca' bar byed na zhes pa dam bca' ba'i don 'jog cing rtogs pa skyed par byed pa na yang /
translated: ‚ÄúMahƒÅmati, if you think like this‚Äù and so on. If you think that the meaning of the thesis is like that, and you posit the thesis, ‚ÄúAll things are non-arisen,‚Äù and generate the understanding of the meaning of the thesis,

original: dam bcas pa las nyams par 'gyur te /
analyzed: dam bcas pa las nyams par 'gyur te /
translated: then you will be at fault in your thesis.

original: skye ba'i khyad par blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye ba'i khyad par blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because you have accepted a particular arising.

original: dam bcas pa zhes pa la sogs pas ni gzhan dag dam bcas pa'i tshig la sogs pa ma skyes pa'i dngos po'i mtshan nyid du grub pas ma thob pa'i nyams par mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
