analyzed: dam bcas pa zhes pa la sogs pas ni gzhan dag dam bcas pa'i tshig la sogs pa ma skyes pa'i dngos po'i mtshan nyid du grub pas ma thob pa'i nyams par mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: ‚ÄúThe thesis‚Äù and so on. Others say, ‚ÄúSince the words of the thesis and so on are established as having the characteristic of non-arisen things, there is no fault of non-establishment.‚Äù

original: ma skyes pa'i dngos po ni 'gal bas de ltar dam bca' bar mi bya zhes pa'o //
analyzed: ma skyes pa'i dngos po ni 'gal bas de ltar dam bca' bar mi bya zhes pa'o //
translated: Non-arisen things are contradictory. Therefore, one should not posit a thesis like that.

original: blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pa de nyid rgyas par 'chad pa'o //
analyzed: blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pa de nyid rgyas par 'chad pa'o //
translated: The meaning of the passage beginning with ‚ÄúMahƒÅmati, the four parts‚Äù is explained extensively.

original: yan lag phan tshun zhes pa la sogs pa'i don ni de ltar dam bcas pa'i yan lag las gtan tshigs dang dpe'i yan lag 'jug cing /
analyzed: yan lag phan tshun zhes pa la sogs pa'i don ni de ltar dam bcas pa'i yan lag las gtan tshigs dang dpe'i yan lag 'jug cing /
translated: The meaning of the passage beginning with ‚ÄúThe parts mutually‚Äù is as follows: In that way, the parts of the thesis are engaged by the parts of the reason and example.

original: de dag las kyang dam bca' ba'i yan lag gi don rtogs pa dang / de 'dra ba'i tshig 'jug pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de dag las kyang dam bca' ba'i yan lag gi don rtogs pa dang / de 'dra ba'i tshig 'jug pa'i phyir /
translated: And from those, the meaning of the part of the thesis is understood, and because such words are engaged,

original: phan tshun du rgyur gyur pa'i mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba dang / de dag gis kyang 'bras bu'i bye brag mi 'dra bar byas shing /
analyzed: phan tshun du rgyur gyur pa'i mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba dang / de dag gis kyang 'bras bu'i bye brag mi 'dra bar byas shing /
translated: they have the characteristic of being different causes for each other, and they make different effects different.

original: de ltar khas len pa'i phyir 'gal bar 'gyur pas yan lag rnams dam bca' bar mi bya'o zhes gdams pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar khas len pa'i phyir 'gal bar 'gyur pas yan lag rnams dam bca' bar mi bya'o zhes gdams pa'o //
translated: Because of accepting it in that way, there is a contradiction, and therefore the parts should not be taken as the thesis.

original: gal te de lta na de bzhin gshegs pa nyid kyis sngar gsungs pa dang 'gal lo zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de lta na de bzhin gshegs pa nyid kyis sngar gsungs pa dang 'gal lo zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then it contradicts what the TathƒÅgata himself said previously?

original: blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The passage beginning with ‚ÄúMahƒÅmati, the four parts‚Äù is stated.

original: de ltar kun rdzob tsam du yang chos thams cad ma skyes pa dang stong pa la sogs par dam bca' bar mi bya mod kyi sngar bstan pa'i don ni sgyu ma la sogs pa ltar don dam pa'i dngos por ma skyes shing ngo bo nyid med pa la
analyzed: de ltar kun rdzob tsam du yang chos thams cad ma skyes pa dang stong pa la sogs par dam bca' bar mi bya mod kyi sngar bstan pa'i don ni sgyu ma la sogs pa ltar don dam pa'i dngos por ma skyes shing ngo bo nyid med pa la
translated: Thus, although one should not make assertions such as ‚Äúall things are unproduced‚Äù and ‚Äúare empty,‚Äù etc., even conventionally, the meaning taught above is that, like illusions, etc., they are unproduced as ultimate entities and are essenceless, etc.,

original: sogs pa dang / kun rdzob tu de ltar snang ba ste /
analyzed: sogs pa dang / kun rdzob tu de ltar snang ba ste /
translated: and they appear in that way conventionally.

original: zung du 'jug pa nyid du bstan pa'o //
analyzed: zung du 'jug pa nyid du bstan pa'o //
translated: Thus, it is taught that they are unities.

original: gzhan du na zhes pa la sogs pa'i don ni kun rdzob tu ma skyes pa la sogs pa las gzhan no //
analyzed: gzhan du na zhes pa la sogs pa'i don ni kun rdzob tu ma skyes pa la sogs pa las gzhan no //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúotherwise,‚Äù etc. is that they are other than unproduced, etc. conventionally.

original: don dam par ma skyes pa la sogs par bstan pas byis pa rnams yod par 'dzin pa'i phyogs su lhung ba de dag skrag par mi 'gyur ba dang / @209a * //
analyzed: don dam par ma skyes pa la sogs par bstan pas byis pa rnams yod par 'dzin pa'i phyogs su lhung ba de dag skrag par mi 'gyur ba dang / @209a * //
translated: By teaching them to be unproduced, etc. ultimately, the childish who fall into the extreme of grasping things as existent will not be frightened,

original: med par 'dzin pa'i phyogs su lhung ba rnams kyang skrag par mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: med par 'dzin pa'i phyogs su lhung ba rnams kyang skrag par mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: and those who fall into the extreme of grasping things as nonexistent will not be frightened.

original: yang na kun rdzob dang don dam pa la dgongs te /
analyzed: yang na kun rdzob dang don dam pa la dgongs te /
translated: Alternatively, it is with reference to the conventional and the ultimate thatüîΩ.

original: skye ba dang skye ba med pa la sogs par bstan pas byis pa rnams go rims bzhin du yod pa dang med par 'dzin pa'i skrag pa spong bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: skye ba dang skye ba med pa la sogs par bstan pas byis pa rnams go rims bzhin du yod pa dang med par 'dzin pa'i skrag pa spong bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: By teaching the non-production of the produced, etc., the childish are made to abandon fear of existence and non-existence, respectively.

original: snang ba dang mi snang ba'i mtshan nyid zhes pa ni gzhan gyi dbang gi bdag nyid kun rdzob tsam du snang ba dang / rigs pas dpyad pa'i don mi snang ba'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: snang ba dang mi snang ba'i mtshan nyid zhes pa ni gzhan gyi dbang gi bdag nyid kun rdzob tsam du snang ba dang / rigs pas dpyad pa'i don mi snang ba'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The characteristic of appearance and non-appearance is that the nature of the relative is merely the appearance of conventionalities, and the object of rational analysis is the characteristic of non-appearance.

original: de 'dra bas bsdus pa'i chos thams cad sgyu ma dang rmi lam lta bu'o //
analyzed: de 'dra bas bsdus pa'i chos thams cad sgyu ma dang rmi lam lta bu'o //
translated: All phenomena included in such a nature are like illusions and dreams.

original: lta ba dang blo slu bar byed pa ni gzhan gyi dbang la dngos po'i bdag nyid du lta ba dang / de ltar 'dzin pa'i blo slu bar byed pa'i phyir yang chos thams cad sgyu ma lta bu zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: lta ba dang blo slu bar byed pa ni gzhan gyi dbang la dngos po'i bdag nyid du lta ba dang / de ltar 'dzin pa'i blo slu bar byed pa'i phyir yang chos thams cad sgyu ma lta bu zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The deception of views and the deception of the mind is that the nature of the relative is viewed as the nature of things, and the mind that apprehends it in that way is deceived. Therefore, all phenomena are like illusions, etc.

original: tshigs su bcad pa'i don ni phal cher shes par zad do //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa'i don ni phal cher shes par zad do //
translated: The meaning of the verses is for the most part self-evident.

original: rang bzhin ni kun du brtags pa la sogs pa gsum mo //
analyzed: rang bzhin ni kun du brtags pa la sogs pa gsum mo //
translated: The nature is the three: the imagined, etc.

original: dngos po ni phyi dang nang gi skye mched gzugs can no //
analyzed: dngos po ni phyi dang nang gi skye mched gzugs can no //
translated: Things are the inner and outer sense-spheres which have form.

original: med kyang de ltar snang ba ni shes rab kyi g-yo ba med pas /
analyzed: med kyang de ltar snang ba ni shes rab kyi g-yo ba med pas /
translated: They appear as such even though they do not exist, because of the movement of the intellect.

original: ro dang 'dra ba'i byis pa log pa'i rtog pa can rnams kyis brtags pa'o //
analyzed: ro dang 'dra ba'i byis pa log pa'i rtog pa can rnams kyis brtags pa'o //
translated: They are imagined by the childish who are like corpses, and who have false ideas.üîΩIf that is so,

original: gal te de ltar na /üîΩrnam rtog rjes su 'brel pa las //
analyzed: gal te de ltar na / rnam rtog rjes su 'brel pa las //
translated: then it is said:

original: don gsal snang ba yod ma yin //
analyzed: don gsal snang ba yod ma yin //
translated: ‚ÄúThe appearance of an object is not due to the connection with a concept.‚Äù

original: zhes gsungs pas brtags pa yin na /
analyzed: zhes gsungs pas brtags pa yin na /
translated: If it is imagined,

original: gsal bar snang ba mi 'thad do zhe na /
analyzed: gsal bar snang ba mi 'thad do zhe na /
translated: then the clear appearance is not tenable.

original: skyon med do gsal bar snang ba ni dngos su brtags pa ma yin zhing brtags pa'i dbang gis snang bar 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyon med do gsal bar snang ba ni dngos su brtags pa ma yin zhing brtags pa'i dbang gis snang bar 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: There is no fault, because the clear appearance is not imagined directly, but is asserted to appear due to the power of imagination.

original: gzhan yang bden pa gnyis kyi dbye ba la ma ltos par /
analyzed: gzhan yang bden pa gnyis kyi dbye ba la ma ltos par /
translated: Moreover, without depending on the division of the two realities,

original: chos thams cad ma skyes pa la sogs par bstan pa ni don dam par skye ba nyid du lta ba'i mu stegs can gyi blo bzlog pa'i phyir bstan pa dang / gzhan yang don dam par rkyen las skye ba med pas so //
analyzed: chos thams cad ma skyes pa la sogs par bstan pa ni don dam par skye ba nyid du lta ba'i mu stegs can gyi blo bzlog pa'i phyir bstan pa dang / gzhan yang don dam par rkyen las skye ba med pas so //
translated: The teaching that all phenomena are unarisen and so forth is given in order to reverse the minds of tƒ´rthikas who view them as truly arisen.üîΩMoreover, since ultimately they do not arise from conditions,

original: yang kun rdzob tu dngos po thams cad mi skye bar dam bca' ba'i don la bden pa nyid du mi brtags te /
analyzed: yang kun rdzob tu dngos po thams cad mi skye bar dam bca' ba'i don la bden pa nyid du mi brtags te /
translated: one should not impute true existence to the meaning of the thesis that all things are nonarisen conventionally.

original: de 'dra pa'i dam bca' ba 'grub pa'am /
analyzed: de 'dra pa'i dam bca' ba 'grub pa'am /
translated: Because it is necessary to establish such a thesis,

original: de'i tshig rgyu dang ldan par 'dod pa'i phyir 'gal ba'am /
analyzed: de'i tshig rgyu dang ldan par 'dod pa'i phyir 'gal ba'am /
translated: it is contradictory to assert that its words are valid.

original: gal te tshig dang dam bca' ba'i don 'grub par 'dod na /
analyzed: gal te tshig dang dam bca' ba'i don 'grub par 'dod na /
translated: If one asserts that the words and the meaning of the thesis are established,

original: de dag blo yang nyams par 'gyur zhes pa ste /
analyzed: de dag blo yang nyams par 'gyur zhes pa ste /
translated: then one‚Äôs mind is impaired.

original: ma thob pa'i nyams pa'o //
analyzed: ma thob pa'i nyams pa'o //
translated: This is the impairment of not attaining.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas sgyu ma la sogs pa bzhin du ma skyes par bstan pa @209b la ni 'gal ba'i skyon med de /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas sgyu ma la sogs pa bzhin du ma skyes par bstan pa @209b la ni 'gal ba'i skyon med de /
translated: The TathƒÅgata taught that things are unarisen like illusions and so on.

original: don dam par ma skyes shing kun rdzob tu de'i tshig la sogs pa skye bar 'dod pa mi 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don dam par ma skyes shing kun rdzob tu de'i tshig la sogs pa skye bar 'dod pa mi 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no contradiction in asserting that ultimately there is no arising, and conventionally there is arising of the word, etc.

original: ji ltar zhes pa la sogs pas med bzhin du snang ba dpe'i sgo nas ston pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar zhes pa la sogs pas med bzhin du snang ba dpe'i sgo nas ston pa'o //
translated: As for ‚Äújust as,‚Äù etc., it shows by way of example that there is appearance even though there is no existent thing.

original: rnam par thar pa gsum ni stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab ste /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa gsum ni stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab ste /
translated: The three liberations are the concentrations and wisdoms of emptiness, etc.

original: de goms pa las dag pa skyes pa'o //üîΩji ltar dngos po dngos med dang // mnyam pa nyid du ji ltar byed //
analyzed: de goms pa las dag pa skyes pa'o // ji ltar dngos po dngos med dang // mnyam pa nyid du ji ltar byed //
translated: From the cultivation of those, the pure ones arise.üîΩAs for ‚Äúhow can there be a thing and a non-thing,‚Äù etc., it is asking, ‚ÄúHow can there be a thing and a non-thing, and how can there be a sameness of those two?‚ÄùüîΩIt is asking, ‚ÄúHow can there be a thing and a non-thing, and how can there be a sameness of those two?‚Äù

original: ces pa ni dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i mtshan mar 'dzin pa spangs shing /üîΩrig pa dang stong pa zung du 'jug par rtogs shing /
analyzed: ces pa ni dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i mtshan mar 'dzin pa spangs shing / rig pa dang stong pa zung du 'jug par rtogs shing /
