original: 'od gsal ba'i rang bzhin du ji ltar 'gyur zhes dris pa'o //üîΩ'jig par byed pa ni phyin ci log gi dmigs pa dang / dmigs par bya ba'i mtshan ma nye bar zhi ba'o //
analyzed: 'od gsal ba'i rang bzhin du ji ltar 'gyur zhes dris pa'o //üîΩ'jig par byed pa ni phyin ci log gi dmigs pa dang / dmigs par bya ba'i mtshan ma nye bar zhi ba'o //
translated: It is asking, ‚ÄúHow can there be a thing and a non-thing, and how can there be a sameness of those two?‚ÄùüîΩIt is asking, ‚ÄúHow can there be a thing and a non-thing, and how can there be a sam

original: blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pas dmigs bya dmigs byed la sogs pa'i mtshan ma med pa'i rnam par rig pa tsam la brtsad pa spang ba'o //
analyzed: blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pas dmigs bya dmigs byed la sogs pa'i mtshan ma med pa'i rnam par rig pa tsam la brtsad pa spang ba'o //
translated: The passage beginning MahƒÅmati, etc., is a refutation of the objection that the mere representation of consciousness, which is devoid of the signs of object and subject, etc., is untenable.

original: de la tha mi dad par khong du ma chud pa ni sna tshogs sems su ro gcig pa dang / de yang stong pa nyid du ma rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la tha mi dad par khong du ma chud pa ni sna tshogs sems su ro gcig pa dang / de yang stong pa nyid du ma rtogs pa'o //
translated: Therein, not understanding non-difference means not understanding that the various things are of one taste in the mind, and not understanding that even that is emptiness.

original: gzhan yang mtshan nyid sna tshogs su snang bas shes pa gnyis su med pa'i ngo bo nyid zil gyis mnan nas shes pas mi dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang mtshan nyid sna tshogs su snang bas shes pa gnyis su med pa'i ngo bo nyid zil gyis mnan nas shes pas mi dmigs pa ste /
translated: Moreover, due to the appearance of various characteristics, the nature of non-dual consciousness is overwhelmed and not perceived by consciousness.

original: ji ltar nyin mo'i dus na skar ma sna tshogs yod bzhin du nyi ma'i 'od zer gyis zil gyis mnan nas mi dmigs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ji ltar nyin mo'i dus na skar ma sna tshogs yod bzhin du nyi ma'i 'od zer gyis zil gyis mnan nas mi dmigs pa lta bu'o //
translated: Just as at the time of day, while various stars exist, they are overwhelmed by the light of the sun and not perceived.

original: yang na 'di rnams kyi don ni rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid sna tshogs su snang ba /
analyzed: yang na 'di rnams kyi don ni rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid sna tshogs su snang ba /
translated: Or, the meaning of these is as follows: The various appearances of specific and general characteristics

original: gtso po'am bdag shes pa rig pa tsam du rig par khong du ma chud pa'am /
analyzed: gtso po'am bdag shes pa rig pa tsam du rig par khong du ma chud pa'am /
translated: are not understood as the mere representation of consciousness, the principal or self.

original: de 'dra ba la sogs pa'i dngos po'i ngo bo 'ga' zhig gis mtshan nyid sna tshogs kyis zil du brlag pa'i phyir mi dmigs zhes sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de 'dra ba la sogs pa'i dngos po'i ngo bo 'ga' zhig gis mtshan nyid sna tshogs kyis zil du brlag pa'i phyir mi dmigs zhes sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: In such cases, one should say that the object is not perceived because it is overwhelmed by some other entity of a different type.

original: shes pa ma lags zhes pa'i don ni gal te shes bya yod bzhin du shes pas mi dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: shes pa ma lags zhes pa'i don ni gal te shes bya yod bzhin du shes pas mi dmigs pa ste /
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúit is not consciousness‚Äù is as follows: If the object of consciousness exists, but is not perceived by consciousness,

original: dmigs pa bkag pa'i med dgag nam mkha'i pad ma lta bu yin na de shes pa nyid du mi 'thad la /üîΩyang dmigs pa med pa'i myong rig tsam gyi ngo bo yin yang yul de la ltos te /
analyzed: dmigs pa bkag pa'i med dgag nam mkha'i pad ma lta bu yin na de shes pa nyid du mi 'thad la / yang dmigs pa med pa'i myong rig tsam gyi ngo bo yin yang yul de la ltos te /
translated: then it is an external negation, the negation of perception, like a sky flower. In that case, it is not tenable that it is consciousness.

original: shes pa nyid du mi 'thad de /
analyzed: shes pa nyid du mi 'thad de /
translated: Moreover, even if it is the entity of mere experiential awareness without an object, it is not tenable that it is consciousness in relation to that object.

original: yul yod bzhin du ma shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul yod bzhin du ma shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For, even though the object exists, it is not cognized.

original: gal te myong ba'i ngo bo yin pas shes par 'thad do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te myong ba'i ngo bo yin pas shes par 'thad do zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is tenable that it is consciousness because it is the entity of experience,üîΩ  that is true.

original: de ltar na bden mod kyi /üîΩde @210a * //
analyzed: de ltar na bden mod kyi /üîΩde @210a * //
translated: But

original: kho na nyid ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa med pas yang dag pa'i shes rab kyis bsdus pa lam dang 'bras bu mthar thug pa nyid du mi 'thad ces pa'o //
analyzed: kho na nyid ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa med pas yang dag pa'i shes rab kyis bsdus pa lam dang 'bras bu mthar thug pa nyid du mi 'thad ces pa'o //
translated: Since there is no knowledge of the nature of things as they are, it is not tenable that the ultimate path and fruition are subsumed within authentic wisdom.

original: bcom ldan 'das zhes pa la sogs pas yul med pa la /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das zhes pa la sogs pas yul med pa la /
translated: The line ‚ÄúThe Transcendent Conqueror‚Äù and so forth explains that, in the absence of an object,üîΩthe mind that appears as such does not exist either.

original: de ltar snang ba'i blo byung ba yang med pa'i yul de la ltos te /
analyzed: de ltar snang ba'i blo byung ba yang med pa'i yul de la ltos te /
translated: In dependence upon that nonexistent object,

original: shes pa nyid du mi 'thad de /
analyzed: shes pa nyid du mi 'thad de /
translated: it is not tenable that there is consciousness.

original: ci yang shes pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ci yang shes pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is nothing whatsoever that is cognized.

original: des na yul ji lta ba bzhin shes pa ni shes bya'i don ji lta ba dang ldan pas shes pa zhes bya'o //üîΩblo ma tshang zhes pa ni blo'i 'gal rkyen nye bar gnas pa'am /
analyzed: des na yul ji lta ba bzhin shes pa ni shes bya'i don ji lta ba dang ldan pas shes pa zhes bya'o // blo ma tshang zhes pa ni blo'i 'gal rkyen nye bar gnas pa'am /
translated: Therefore, the cognition that is in accordance with the object is called ‚Äúcognition‚Äù because it is endowed with the object that is to be cognized.

original: mthun rkyen ma tshang bas so //
analyzed: mthun rkyen ma tshang bas so //
translated: The line ‚ÄúThe mind is incomplete‚Äù means that the opposing conditions for the mind are present or that the conducive conditions are incomplete.

original: 'dir lan gyi don ni gnyis su med pa'i ye shes de nyid de ltar bstan pa'i rgyu mtshan gyi sgo nas mi shes pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dir lan gyi don ni gnyis su med pa'i ye shes de nyid de ltar bstan pa'i rgyu mtshan gyi sgo nas mi shes pa ma yin te /
translated: Here the meaning of the reply is this: The nondual wisdom itself is not unknowable from the perspective of the reasons that have been presented.

original: blo gros chen po ngas shes bya'i don yod bzhin du shes pas mi dmigs pa la dgongs te /
analyzed: blo gros chen po ngas shes bya'i don yod bzhin du shes pas mi dmigs pa la dgongs te /
translated: ‚ÄúMahƒÅmati, I have in mind that the object of cognition exists but is not observed by cognition.

original: dmigs bya'i don shes pas mi dmigs pa'i tshe rnam par rig pa tsam du gzhag pa yin no zhes ma bshad de /
analyzed: dmigs bya'i don shes pas mi dmigs pa'i tshe rnam par rig pa tsam du gzhag pa yin no zhes ma bshad de /
translated: Mahamati, I do not explain that the non-apprehension of the object of cognition by the cognizer is due to the non-existence of the object of cognition, but rather to the non-apprehension of the object of cognition by the cognizer.

original: 'on kyang dmigs bya'i don dam pa stong pa nyid du rtogs pas mi dmigs shing myong ba 'gags pa ni rnam par rig pa tsam mo //
analyzed: 'on kyang dmigs bya'i don dam pa stong pa nyid du rtogs pas mi dmigs shing myong ba 'gags pa ni rnam par rig pa tsam mo //
translated: However, when the object of cognition is realized as ultimate emptiness, there is no apprehension and experience ceases, which is mere representation.

original: yod pa dang med pa las phyi rol gyi dngos po med ces pa ni de dag las skye ba'i tshul gyis phyi'i dngos po grub pa med pa'o //
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa las phyi rol gyi dngos po med ces pa ni de dag las skye ba'i tshul gyis phyi'i dngos po grub pa med pa'o //
translated: The non-existence of external things apart from existence and non-existence means that external things are not established by the mode of arising from them.

original: rtog pa can zhes pa la sogs pas rang gi sde pa phyi'i don du mngon par zhen pa rnams kyis de ltar mi rtogs shing /
analyzed: rtog pa can zhes pa la sogs pas rang gi sde pa phyi'i don du mngon par zhen pa rnams kyis de ltar mi rtogs shing /
translated: Those with conceptual thoughts, and so on, refers to those of our own group who cling to external objects, who do not realize it in that way.

original: ma rtogs pas phyi rol yan lag can gyi rdzas la sogs pa ni med do zhes rtogs par byas nas /
analyzed: ma rtogs pas phyi rol yan lag can gyi rdzas la sogs pa ni med do zhes rtogs par byas nas /
translated: Not realizing it, they think, External things, such as substances with parts, do not exist, and they realize it in that way.

original: de 'dra ba'i rtog pa mi 'byung ba ni sems tsam du ston to //
analyzed: de 'dra ba'i rtog pa mi 'byung ba ni sems tsam du ston to //
translated: The non-occurrence of such a conceptualization is shown to be mind-only.

original: de dag ni rtag pa dang chad pa'i mtha' gnyis su ltung bar 'gyur ro zhes ston pa ni /
analyzed: de dag ni rtag pa dang chad pa'i mtha' gnyis su ltung bar 'gyur ro zhes ston pa ni /
translated: It is shown that they fall into the two extremes of eternalism and nihilism:

original: bdag dang zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bdag dang zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe self, etc.‚Äù

original: rnam par 'byed pa mi dmigs zhes pa ni 'byed pa'i shes rab mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par 'byed pa mi dmigs zhes pa ni 'byed pa'i shes rab mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe non-apprehension of differentiation‚Äù is the non-apprehension of the wisdom of differentiation.

original: tshigs su bcad pa'i don ni phal cher go bar zad do //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa'i don ni phal cher go bar zad do //
translated: The meaning of the verse is for the most part self-evident.

original: de dag rtog can rnams kyi tshul //
analyzed: de dag rtog can rnams kyi tshul //
translated: Those are the ways of the conceptualizers.

original: gzhan min zhes mtshams bcad de /
analyzed: gzhan min zhes mtshams bcad de /
translated: ‚ÄúNot other‚Äù is the conclusion.

original: de 'dra ba log pa'i rtog gis brtags pa'i tshul yin gyi /
analyzed: de 'dra ba log pa'i rtog gis brtags pa'i tshul yin gyi /
translated: Such is the way of the conceptualization of error.

original: gnyis su med pa'i shes pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i shes pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not non-dual cognition,

original: de'i mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it does not have that characteristic.

original: log pa'i shes pa zhes pa ni shes bya la ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa 'jug pa log pa'o //
analyzed: log pa'i shes pa zhes pa ni shes bya la ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa 'jug pa log pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúErroneous cognition‚Äù is the error in the engagement of cognition in accordance with the cognandum.

original: gzhan yang blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pas grub pa'i @210b mtha' dang bshad pa'i tshul shin du rgyas par ston te /
analyzed: gzhan yang blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pas grub pa'i @210b mtha' dang bshad pa'i tshul shin du rgyas par ston te /
translated: Moreover, the teaching of the very extensive method of the tenets and explanation by the words ‚ÄúMoreover, Mahamati‚Äù and so on is as follows.

original: de la thog ma med pa'i dus kyi spros pa lus kyi gnas ngan len ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i lus kyi gnas ngan pa len par byed pa /
analyzed: de la thog ma med pa'i dus kyi spros pa lus kyi gnas ngan len ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i lus kyi gnas ngan pa len par byed pa /
translated: The physical negative reflex is the taking up of the negative physical reflex with the outflows, which is the conceptualization of beginningless time.

original: rang gi so sor rnam par rtog pa rgya mtsho'i rlabs ltar sna tshogs su 'jug cing /
analyzed: rang gi so sor rnam par rtog pa rgya mtsho'i rlabs ltar sna tshogs su 'jug cing /
translated: It is the individual‚Äôs own conceptualization, which engages in the various like waves on the ocean.

original: gar thabs su gar byed pa'o //
analyzed: gar thabs su gar byed pa'o //
translated: It is the dance of the dance master.

original: thabs su bstan pa ni dben par rtogs pa'i yan lag tu bdag dang phung po la sogs pa yod par bstan pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: thabs su bstan pa ni dben par rtogs pa'i yan lag tu bdag dang phung po la sogs pa yod par bstan pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The teaching by means of the method is the teaching of the existence of the self, the aggregates, and so on as a branch of the realization of solitude.

original: slu bar mi 'gyur ba ni log pa'i lam la 'jug par mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: slu bar mi 'gyur ba ni log pa'i lam la 'jug par mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The nondeceptive is the nonengagement in the entry to the false path.

original: sna tshogs kyi mdo ni sngar bshad pa ltar gsung rab yan lag dgu'i chos bstan pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sna tshogs kyi mdo ni sngar bshad pa ltar gsung rab yan lag dgu'i chos bstan pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The sutra of the various is the teaching of the Dharma of the nine branches of scripture and so on, as previously explained.

original: rgyu dang lta ba dang rig pa'i mtshan nyid ni phyi rol pa la sogs pas brtags pa'i dbang phyug la sogs pa 'gro ba thams cad kyi rgyur 'dod pa'am /
analyzed: rgyu dang lta ba dang rig pa'i mtshan nyid ni phyi rol pa la sogs pas brtags pa'i dbang phyug la sogs pa 'gro ba thams cad kyi rgyur 'dod pa'am /
translated: The characteristics of cause, view, and reasoning are as follows:üîΩThe cause is what is imagined to be the ultimate, such as the creator, etc.,

original: de las gzhan pa rnams kyis kyang rung ste rgyu don dam pa nyid du brtags pa'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa rnams kyis kyang rung ste rgyu don dam pa nyid du brtags pa'o //
translated: which is asserted by non-Buddhists to be the cause of all beings, or else, anything else that is imagined to be the cause.

original: lta ba ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: lta ba ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The view is the view of the transitory collection, etc.

original: rigs pa ni tha snyad pa'i tshad ma ste /
analyzed: rigs pa ni tha snyad pa'i tshad ma ste /
translated: Reasoning is conventional valid cognition.

original: de'i yul las bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: de'i yul las bzlog pa'o //
translated: The object of that is reversed.

original: de nas yang zhes pa la sogs pas grub pa'i mtha' phyin ci log dgag pa rgyas par ston te /
analyzed: de nas yang zhes pa la sogs pas grub pa'i mtha' phyin ci log dgag pa rgyas par ston te /
translated: Then, the extensive teaching of the refutation of the erroneous tenets begins with ‚ÄúThen, again, etc.‚Äù

original: de la sngags dang spobs pa sna tshogs ni ke ba lang sna tshogs smra ba thod le kor kyi rig pa dang / de las gzhan shes rab la sogs pa'i mthu sna tshogs so //
analyzed: de la sngags dang spobs pa sna tshogs ni ke ba lang sna tshogs smra ba thod le kor kyi rig pa dang / de las gzhan shes rab la sogs pa'i mthu sna tshogs so //
translated: There, the various incantations and eloquence are the knowledge of the mirror of the various assertions of the KƒìvŒ±cilla, and the various powers of wisdom, etc., other than that.

original: rgyu dang tshig ces pa la sogs pa ni log pa'i gtan tshigs dang dpe sna tshogs dang / tshig dang yi ge rnar snyan pa sna tshogs so //
analyzed: rgyu dang tshig ces pa la sogs pa ni log pa'i gtan tshigs dang dpe sna tshogs dang / tshig dang yi ge rnar snyan pa sna tshogs so //
translated: The words causes, words, and so on refer to various false reasons and examples, and to various pleasant sounding words and letters.

original: rigs pa dang ldan pa ni 'brel ba'i rtsa ba can gyi tshul gsum dang ldan pa'i rtags tshad mas grub pa ste /
analyzed: rigs pa dang ldan pa ni 'brel ba'i rtsa ba can gyi tshul gsum dang ldan pa'i rtags tshad mas grub pa ste /
translated: The reasonable is the valid reason which has the three modes that are based on the relation.

original: de 'dra ba med ces pa'o //
analyzed: de 'dra ba med ces pa'o //
translated: It is said that there is no such thing.

original: tshig dang yi ge rnams kyang bden pa'i don dang ldan pa ma yin te /
analyzed: tshig dang yi ge rnams kyang bden pa'i don dang ldan pa ma yin te /
translated: The words and letters also do not have a true meaning.

original: yang dag pa'i tshul la rab tu 'jug pas ma yin gyi log pa'i tshul la 'jug par byed pa'o //üîΩgzhan yang zlos pa'i mya ngan ni 'chi zhing 'bral ba'i tshe /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i tshul la rab tu 'jug pas ma yin gyi log pa'i tshul la 'jug par byed pa'o // gzhan yang zlos pa'i mya ngan ni 'chi zhing 'bral ba'i tshe /
translated: It is not that they are engaged in the correct method, but that they are engaged in the incorrect method.üîΩMoreover, the sorrow of repetition is the mental torment that occurs at the time of death and separation,

original: myos shing chags par 'gyur bas sems yongs su gdungs pa'o //
analyzed: myos shing chags par 'gyur bas sems yongs su gdungs pa'o //
translated: due to being intoxicated and attached.

original: mya ngan las byung ba'i tshig tu brjod pa ni smre sngags 'don pa'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las byung ba'i tshig tu brjod pa ni smre sngags 'don pa'o //
translated: The words that arise from sorrow are the lamentations.

original: dbang po lnga'i nyams su bab pa ni sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: dbang po lnga'i nyams su bab pa ni sdug bsngal lo //
translated: The impairment of the five senses is suffering.

original: yid kyi yul la lta ba'i nyams su bab pa ni yid mi bde ba'o //
analyzed: yid kyi yul la lta ba'i nyams su bab pa ni yid mi bde ba'o //
translated: The mental object that is seen as unpleasant is mental dissatisfaction.

original: sdug bsngal dang yid mi bde ba mang po byung ba ni 'khrug pa ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang yid mi bde ba mang po byung ba ni 'khrug pa ste /
translated: The many sufferings and mental dissatisfactions that arise are disturbances.

original: de la @211a * //
analyzed: de la @211a * //
translated: In this regard,

original: sogs pa srid pa'i yan lag rnams so //
analyzed: sogs pa srid pa'i yan lag rnams so //
translated: the limbs of existence are the above and so forth.

original: gtsug lag mang po la mkhas pa ni rig pa'i gnas dang sgyu rtsal la sogs pa la mkhas par byed pa ste /
analyzed: gtsug lag mang po la mkhas pa ni rig pa'i gnas dang sgyu rtsal la sogs pa la mkhas par byed pa ste /
translated: Skill in the many scriptures is the skill in the branches of knowledge, arts and so forth.

original: lha rnams kyi dbang po brgya byin no //
analyzed: lha rnams kyi dbang po brgya byin no //
translated: ≈öakra is the lord of the gods.

original: de'i 'khor 'dus pa'i nang du rdzu 'phrul gyis song ste /
analyzed: de'i 'khor 'dus pa'i nang du rdzu 'phrul gyis song ste /
translated: He went by his magical power into the assembly of his retinue

original: kho bo rtsod pa las rgyal bar gyur na khyod kyi shing rta rtsib ma stong dang ldan pa bcag par bya zhing /
analyzed: kho bo rtsod pa las rgyal bar gyur na khyod kyi shing rta rtsib ma stong dang ldan pa bcag par bya zhing /
translated: and said, ‚ÄúIf I win the debate, I will break your chariot with its thousand spokes.

original: khyed rgyal bar gyur na nga'i lus re re nas gcad do zhes so sor dam bcas pa'o //
analyzed: khyed rgyal bar gyur na nga'i lus re re nas gcad do zhes so sor dam bcas pa'o //
translated: If you win, you will cut up my body piece by piece.‚Äù

original: chos dang ldan pa ni tshig dor dang ltag chod la sogs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: chos dang ldan pa ni tshig dor dang ltag chod la sogs pa ma yin te /
translated: The righteous one does not use words like lies and slander,

original: rig pa'i sgo nas so //
analyzed: rig pa'i sgo nas so //
translated: but by means of knowledge.

original: byol song las bslabs pa ni klu'i skye gnas ni byol song gi 'gro bar gtogs pas so //
analyzed: byol song las bslabs pa ni klu'i skye gnas ni byol song gi 'gro bar gtogs pas so //
translated: The training of the nƒÅgas is included in the animal realm.

original: blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pas ni de'i grub pa'i mtha' dang bshad pa'i tshul ston to //
analyzed: blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pas ni de'i grub pa'i mtha' dang bshad pa'i tshul ston to //
translated: ‚Äú MahƒÅmati‚Äù and so forth teach their tenets and the way they explain things.

original: de la rab tu grags pa'i 'jig rten rgyang pan pa ni /
analyzed: de la rab tu grags pa'i 'jig rten rgyang pan pa ni /
translated: The most famous LokƒÅyata is as follows.

original: chang dang chang gi nus pa ltar sems can gyi lus nyid sems kyi rang bzhin du gsal ba 'jig rten snga ma nas ma 'phos pa /
analyzed: chang dang chang gi nus pa ltar sems can gyi lus nyid sems kyi rang bzhin du gsal ba 'jig rten snga ma nas ma 'phos pa /
translated: Just as beer and the potency of beer, the body of sentient beings is clear as the nature of mind, not transferred from a previous world,

original: phyi mar mi 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: phyi mar mi 'gro ba'o //
translated: and not going to a later world.

original: blo ni de dang tha mi dad pa mig gi blo la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: blo ni de dang tha mi dad pa mig gi blo la sogs pa'o //
translated: The mind is not different from that, such as the mind of the eye, and so forth.

original: yul ni mngon par mi gsal ba'i sems can phyi'i 'byung ba chen po bzhi'o //
analyzed: yul ni mngon par mi gsal ba'i sems can phyi'i 'byung ba chen po bzhi'o //
translated: The object is the unclear mind, the external four great elements of sentient beings.

original: de las gzhan pa'i skye ba dang 'gag pa'i khyad par khas len pa'am /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i skye ba dang 'gag pa'i khyad par khas len pa'am /
translated: They accept that there are other births and cessations.

original: gzhan yang rung ste grub pa'i mtha' phyin ci log khas len pa thams cad ni nye bar brtags pa'i sgo nas 'jig rten rgyang pan pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang rung ste grub pa'i mtha' phyin ci log khas len pa thams cad ni nye bar brtags pa'i sgo nas 'jig rten rgyang pan pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Moreover, all those who assert a perverse philosophical position are called Lokayata, materialists, from the point of view of their investigation.

original: 'du ba dang zad par khas len par mthun pa dang / phyin ci log tu gyur pa nyid kyis mya ngan las mi 'da' ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: 'du ba dang zad par khas len par mthun pa dang / phyin ci log tu gyur pa nyid kyis mya ngan las mi 'da' ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: They are materialists because they agree in asserting the collection of the perishable and because they do not transcend misery due to their perverse state.

original: de'i phyir de 'dra ba'i 'jig rten rgyang pan pa ni 'bum zhes pa nye bar mtshon pa ste /üîΩgrangs mang ba nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir de 'dra ba'i 'jig rten rgyang pan pa ni 'bum zhes pa nye bar mtshon pa ste / grangs mang ba nyid do //
translated: Therefore, such Lokayata are said to be one hundred thousand, which is to say they are numerous.

original: lnga brgya tha ma ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa lo lnga brgya phrag brgyad dam bzhir gnas pa las de'i tha mar gyur pa ste /
analyzed: lnga brgya tha ma ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa lo lnga brgya phrag brgyad dam bzhir gnas pa las de'i tha mar gyur pa ste /
translated: The final five hundred refers to the final five hundred of the five thousand years that the teachings of the Tathagata remain.

original: de yang bzhi'i tha mar gyur pa la sbyar na 'grig par snang ngo //
analyzed: de yang bzhi'i tha mar gyur pa la sbyar na 'grig par snang ngo //
translated: If one applies this to the final four, it seems to be correct.

original: de la ngan pa'i rtog ge pa rnams kyis 'byung ba 'phrod pa 'du pa'i rgyur lta ba bstan pas snga ma lta bu'i lus bsdus par gyur pa la /
analyzed: de la ngan pa'i rtog ge pa rnams kyis 'byung ba 'phrod pa 'du pa'i rgyur lta ba bstan pas snga ma lta bu'i lus bsdus par gyur pa la /
translated: The bad logicians teach that the cause of the coming together of the elements is the conjunction of the elements.

original: de nyid shi ba'i dus su gyes shing dengs par 'gyur ro zhes rang gi slob ma rnams la ston cing /
analyzed: de nyid shi ba'i dus su gyes shing dengs par 'gyur ro zhes rang gi slob ma rnams la ston cing /
translated: They teach their students that when that [conjunction] is destroyed at the time of death, the body is destroyed.

original: sngar slob ma ma yin pa rnams kyang tshig dang yi ge snyan pas yongs su bzung nas de ltar ston pa'o //
analyzed: sngar slob ma ma yin pa rnams kyang tshig dang yi ge snyan pas yongs su bzung nas de ltar ston pa'o //
translated: They also attract non-students with pleasant words and letters and teach them in that way.

original: de yang @211b rgyang pan pa dngos kyi bstan pa'i tshul lo //
analyzed: de yang @211b rgyang pan pa dngos kyi bstan pa'i tshul lo //
translated: That is the way of teaching of the actual CƒÅrvƒÅka.

original: gzhan ni de dang rjes su mthun pa mya ngan las 'da' ba'i gegs su 'gyur ba ston par byed do //
analyzed: gzhan ni de dang rjes su mthun pa mya ngan las 'da' ba'i gegs su 'gyur ba ston par byed do //
translated: Others teach in a way that is similar to that, which becomes an obstacle to attaining nirvƒÅ·πáa.

original: rnam pa gcig tu na /
analyzed: rnam pa gcig tu na /
translated: In one way,

original: rgyur lta ba bstan pas nyan pa po'i 'khor bsdus shing gyes par 'gyur zhes pa ste /
analyzed: rgyur lta ba bstan pas nyan pa po'i 'khor bsdus shing gyes par 'gyur zhes pa ste /
translated: they attract an audience by teaching the view of causes and then disperse.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas chos ston pa na lha la sogs pa'i 'khor 'dus shing slar rang rang gi gnas su gyes par 'gyur ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas chos ston pa na lha la sogs pa'i 'khor 'dus shing slar rang rang gi gnas su gyes par 'gyur ba lta bu'o //
translated: When the Tathagata teaches the Dharma, the assembly of gods and so forth gather, and then they disperse to their own abodes.üîΩThe meaning of the words of the Lokayatas is explained by the tirthikas who are attached to their own causes, because they are connected with various words.

original: 'jig rten rgyang pan gyi zhes pa la sogs pa'i don ni de'i tshig sna tshogs su 'brel pas snga ma ltar 'phrod pa 'du ba'i rgyu las sems can gyi lus bsdus shing gyes par bstan pa de nyid /
analyzed: 'jig rten rgyang pan gyi zhes pa la sogs pa'i don ni de'i tshig sna tshogs su 'brel pas snga ma ltar 'phrod pa 'du ba'i rgyu las sems can gyi lus bsdus shing gyes par bstan pa de nyid /
translated: The teaching that the body of sentient beings is gathered and dispersed from the cause of the assembly of the previous one is explained.

original: rang gi rgyu la chags shing zhen pa'i mu stegs byed rnams 'chad de /
analyzed: rang gi rgyu la chags shing zhen pa'i mu stegs byed rnams 'chad de /
translated: Those who are attached to their own causes are the tirthikas.

original: de dang rjes su mthun pa ston pa'o //
analyzed: de dang rjes su mthun pa ston pa'o //
translated: The teaching is in accordance with them.

original: de rnams kyang rang rang gi grub pa'i mtha'i tshul ni 'jig rten snga phyi yod cing /
analyzed: de rnams kyang rang rang gi grub pa'i mtha'i tshul ni 'jig rten snga phyi yod cing /
translated: Those who have their own way of establishing the philosophical system accept that there is a past and future world,

original: mtho ris dang mya ngan las 'das pa yang khas len mod kyang /
analyzed: mtho ris dang mya ngan las 'das pa yang khas len mod kyang /
translated: and also heaven and nirvana.

original: de dang 'dra bar mya ngan las 'das pa nyid mi thob pas rang gi tshul las nyams shing rgyang pan pa dang mthun par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de dang 'dra bar mya ngan las 'das pa nyid mi thob pas rang gi tshul las nyams shing rgyang pan pa dang mthun par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: However, because they do not attain nirvana in that way, they fall from their own way and become in accordance with the Lokayatas.

original: blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pas de nyid rgyas par 'chad de /üîΩrgyu'i sgo ni rgyu mtshan gyi rgyu'am /
analyzed: blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pas de nyid rgyas par 'chad de / rgyu'i sgo ni rgyu mtshan gyi rgyu'am /
translated: The passage beginning with ‚ÄúMahƒÅmati, the TathƒÅgata, the Arhat, the Perfect and Complete Buddha‚Äù explains this in detail.

original: skyed pa'i rgyu'i khyad par du ma'i sgo nas dngos po sna tshogs 'du zhing skyed pa dang / zad par 'gyur ba nyid du ston pa'o //
analyzed: skyed pa'i rgyu'i khyad par du ma'i sgo nas dngos po sna tshogs 'du zhing skyed pa dang / zad par 'gyur ba nyid du ston pa'o //
translated: The ‚Äúcause‚Äù is the causal process, or the various specific causes that give rise to and produce the various things that come together and are produced, and it shows that they are exhausted.

original: blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pas de nyid la brtsad pa spong ba ste /üîΩgzhan dag de lta na de bzhin gshegs pa yang las dang nyon mongs pa'i rgyu las /
analyzed: blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pas de nyid la brtsad pa spong ba ste / gzhan dag de lta na de bzhin gshegs pa yang las dang nyon mongs pa'i rgyu las /
translated: The passage beginning with ‚ÄúMahƒÅmati, the TathƒÅgata, the Arhat, the Perfect and Complete Buddha‚Äù rejects objections to that.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa'i phung po skye ba dang / de nyid 'jig pa la sogs pa phyi dang nang gi rten 'brel gsungs pas 'jig rten rgyang pan pa nyid du 'gyur zhes pa'o //
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa'i phung po skye ba dang / de nyid 'jig pa la sogs pa phyi dang nang gi rten 'brel gsungs pas 'jig rten rgyang pan pa nyid du 'gyur zhes pa'o //
translated: Others say, ‚ÄúIf that is so, then because the TathƒÅgata taught the internal and external dependent origination, such as the arising of the contaminated aggregates from the causes of karma and afflictions, and their destruction, he would be a LokƒÅyata.‚Äù

original: lan gyi don ni de 'dra ba'i rgyu 'bras don dam pa'i dngos por khas mi len pas /
analyzed: lan gyi don ni de 'dra ba'i rgyu 'bras don dam pa'i dngos por khas mi len pas /
translated: The meaning of the reply is that because we do not accept such causes and effects as ultimate things,

original: skyon med ces pa'o //
analyzed: skyon med ces pa'o //
translated: there is no fault.

original: 'dus pa 'ong pa las 'byung zhes pa ni snga ma nas 'dir 'ong ba'i tshul gyis 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: 'dus pa 'ong pa las 'byung zhes pa ni snga ma nas 'dir 'ong ba'i tshul gyis 'byung ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúArising from the coming together of the assembly‚Äù means arising in the manner of coming from the previous to this.

original: 'jug pa rnam pa gnyis ni dngos po med pa'am /
analyzed: 'jug pa rnam pa gnyis ni dngos po med pa'am /
translated: The two kinds of engagement are non-entity or

original: yang na gnas pa dang 'jug pa gnyis la sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: yang na gnas pa dang 'jug pa gnyis la sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: alternatively, abiding and engagement should be applied.

original: blo gros chen po ngas zhes pa la sogs pas /
analyzed: blo gros chen po ngas zhes pa la sogs pas /
translated: ‚ÄúMahƒÅmati, I‚Äù and so on.

original: phyin ci log gleng gzhi dang bcas te bstan pa'o //
analyzed: phyin ci log gleng gzhi dang bcas te bstan pa'o //
translated: The mistaken is taught together with its basis.

original: 'thad pa'i gtan tshigs sna tshogs pa ni spyi gcig rjes su 'gro ba 'am /
analyzed: 'thad pa'i gtan tshigs sna tshogs pa ni spyi gcig rjes su 'gro ba 'am /
translated: The various tenable reasons are that a single generality is a subsequent generality or

original: nges shes kyi blo 'jug pa dmigs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: nges shes kyi blo 'jug pa dmigs pa'i phyir /
translated: because the engagement of the mind of ascertainment is observed.

original: thams cad gcig @212a * //
analyzed: thams cad gcig @212a * //
translated: Everything is one.

original: pa'am / gzhan yang gnas skabs dang gsal ba'i bye brag 'gal bar dmigs pas tha dad pa'am /
analyzed: pa'am / gzhan yang gnas skabs dang gsal ba'i bye brag 'gal bar dmigs pas tha dad pa'am /
translated: Moreover, because the specific states and manifestations are observed to be contradictory, they are different.

original: de nyid kyi phyir dngos po rnams spyi dang rang bzhin gyi sgo nas gcig pa yang yin la /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir dngos po rnams spyi dang rang bzhin gyi sgo nas gcig pa yang yin la /
translated: For that reason, because things are the same in terms of their generality and nature,

original: gnas skabs sam gsal ba'i sgo nas tha dad pa yang yin pas gnyis ka zhes pa'o //
analyzed: gnas skabs sam gsal ba'i sgo nas tha dad pa yang yin pas gnyis ka zhes pa'o //
translated: and they are different in terms of their states and manifestations, they are both.

original: gnyis ka ma yin pa yang de nyid las mtshon pas shes par zad do //
analyzed: gnyis ka ma yin pa yang de nyid las mtshon pas shes par zad do //
translated: The answer that it is neither can be understood from that itself.

original: lung bstan pa ni gcig dang tha dad pa la sogs par dris pa la lung ston pa'o //
analyzed: lung bstan pa ni gcig dang tha dad pa la sogs par dris pa la lung ston pa'o //
translated: The answer is to declare that it is one or different, etc.

original: thams cad lung ma bstan pa ni sngar bstan pa ltar ram /
analyzed: thams cad lung ma bstan pa ni sngar bstan pa ltar ram /
translated: The answer that it is all is as previously explained.

original: yang na mtha' gcig tu nges par lung bstan du med pas dris pa la lung bstan par bya ba ma yin zhes pa'o //
analyzed: yang na mtha' gcig tu nges par lung bstan du med pas dris pa la lung bstan par bya ba ma yin zhes pa'o //
translated: Or, it is not to be declared because it cannot be declared with certainty.

original: 'jig rten pha rol yod med gnyi ga zhes pa ni sngar gnyid kyis log pa las sad pa na sngar gyi gnas skabs de nyid kyang pha rol gyi grangs su gtogs pa'am /
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol yod med gnyi ga zhes pa ni sngar gnyid kyis log pa las sad pa na sngar gyi gnas skabs de nyid kyang pha rol gyi grangs su gtogs pa'am /
translated: The answer that it is both existence and nonexistence in the next world is that when one awakens from sleep, the previous state belongs to the category of the next world.

original: yang tshe snga mas bsdus pa'i pha rol med pa yod med gnyis ka zhes pa'o //
analyzed: yang tshe snga mas bsdus pa'i pha rol med pa yod med gnyis ka zhes pa'o //
translated: Or, the nonexistence of the next world that is included in a previous life is both existence and nonexistence.

original: kye bram ze zhes pa la sogs pas kun rdzob tu skye ba dang 'gag pa'i tshul gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: kye bram ze zhes pa la sogs pas kun rdzob tu skye ba dang 'gag pa'i tshul gsungs pa ste /
translated: The statement that ‚ÄúO Brahmin‚Äù and so on is the conventional way of birth and cessation.

original: de la phyi rol gyi dngos por 'gyur ba'i dmigs pa'i yul med pas de las skye ba ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la phyi rol gyi dngos por 'gyur ba'i dmigs pa'i yul med pas de las skye ba ma yin pa'o //
translated: Since there is no objective referent that could be an external entity, it does not arise from that.

original: 'di gnyi ga yang zhes pa ni rgyu las skyes pa'i dngos po'am /
analyzed: 'di gnyi ga yang zhes pa ni rgyu las skyes pa'i dngos po'am /
translated: Both of these refer to entities that arise from causes

original: rgyu med pa'i mtshan mar 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu med pa'i mtshan mar 'dzin pa'o //
translated: or to the apprehension of signs that are causeless.

original: yid la rnam par g-yos pa ni sems nyid gnyug mar gnas pa'i chos nyid las so //
analyzed: yid la rnam par g-yos pa ni sems nyid gnyug mar gnas pa'i chos nyid las so //
translated: Mental agitation is from the dharmatƒÅ of the mind itself abiding in its natural state.

original: de ltar na de kho na nyid kyi don las phyin ci log tu gyur pa thams cad ni sngar bstan pa ltar nye bar brtags pa'i sgo nas 'jig rten rgyang pan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na de kho na nyid kyi don las phyin ci log tu gyur pa thams cad ni sngar bstan pa ltar nye bar brtags pa'i sgo nas 'jig rten rgyang pan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, as previously explained, all that is contrary to the meaning of thatness is called ‚Äúthe philosophy of nihilism‚Äù from the perspective of thorough investigation.

original: gal te de lta na nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams la thar ba mi 'thad par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de lta na nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams la thar ba mi 'thad par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then it would be untenable for ≈õrƒÅvakas and pratyekabuddhas to attain liberation.

original: sems ni dmigs dang bcas rnams kyi //üîΩmya ngan 'das pa dka' bar gnas //
analyzed: sems ni dmigs dang bcas rnams kyi // mya ngan 'das pa dka' bar gnas //
translated: For those whose minds are referential,üîΩnirvƒÅ·πáa is difficult to attain.

original: zhes gsungs pas mthar thug pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa mi thob pa'o //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pas mthar thug pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa mi thob pa'o //
translated: Thus, they do not attain ultimate nirvƒÅ·πáa.

original: yang blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pas tshul gzhan gyi sgo nas brtsad pa spang ba ste /
analyzed: yang blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pas tshul gzhan gyi sgo nas brtsad pa spang ba ste /
translated: Also, Mahamati, and so forth, abandons the dispute from another perspective.

original: de'i don ni bram ze rgyang pan pa gang dag gi grags pa ste /üîΩgrub pa'i don bsdus pa dang gyes pa ni mu stegs byed thams cad kyis dpe dang gtan tshigs du mas nye bar sgrub pa'i sgo nas ston pa ste /
analyzed: de'i don ni bram ze rgyang pan pa gang dag gi grags pa ste / grub pa'i don bsdus pa dang gyes pa ni mu stegs byed thams cad kyis dpe dang gtan tshigs du mas nye bar sgrub pa'i sgo nas ston pa ste /
translated: The meaning of that is as follows: The Brahmins, the Charvakas, and so forth, who are renowned for their knowledge of the treatises on logic,üîΩare the ones who, by means of many examples and reasons, teach the meaning of the established conclusion.

original: tshad mas grub pa'i don nyid ston pa yin la /
analyzed: tshad mas grub pa'i don nyid ston pa yin la /
translated: They are the ones who teach the meaning that is established by valid cognition.üîΩIf teaching in that way is Charvaka, then is there any that is not Charvaka?

original: de 'dra ba ston pa yang 'jig rten rgyang pan pa yin na rgyang pan pa ma yin pa gang yang yod dam zhes 'khyog po'i dri ba ste /
analyzed: de 'dra ba ston pa yang 'jig rten rgyang pan pa yin na rgyang pan pa ma yin pa gang yang yod dam zhes 'khyog po'i dri ba ste /
translated: This is a crooked question.

original: @212b thams cad kyang rgyang pan par 'gyur ro zhes brtsad pa'o //
analyzed: @212b thams cad kyang rgyang pan par 'gyur ro zhes brtsad pa'o //
translated: The dispute is, All would become Charvaka!

original: lan gyi don ni khyod kyi tshad mas grub par 'dod pa de 'dra ba yang ma yin la /
analyzed: lan gyi don ni khyod kyi tshad mas grub par 'dod pa de 'dra ba yang ma yin la /
translated: The meaning of the answer is that what you assert as established by valid cognition is not like that.

original: rnam pa thams cad du tshad mas ma grub cing tshig dang yi ge sna tshogs kyis nye bar bris nas tshad mas grub pa'i don mi ston pa yang ma yin la /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du tshad mas ma grub cing tshig dang yi ge sna tshogs kyis nye bar bris nas tshad mas grub pa'i don mi ston pa yang ma yin la /
translated: It is not that it is not established by valid cognition in any way, and that it does not teach the meaning that is established by valid cognition, having been written down with various words and letters.

original: de 'dra ba ston pa'i theg pa chen po'i gsung rab don dang mi ldan pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de 'dra ba ston pa'i theg pa chen po'i gsung rab don dang mi ldan pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not that the Mahayana scriptures that teach such a thing are devoid of meaning.

original: don dang yang ldan pa yod la de 'dra ba'i don du mu stegs byed thams cad dang / khyod kyi blo yis mi rtogs pa rig pa dang stong pa zung du 'jug pa'i don spros pa dang bral zhing 'od gsal ba ni de bzhin du bden pa yin la /
analyzed: don dang yang ldan pa yod la de 'dra ba'i don du mu stegs byed thams cad dang / khyod kyi blo yis mi rtogs pa rig pa dang stong pa zung du 'jug pa'i don spros pa dang bral zhing 'od gsal ba ni de bzhin du bden pa yin la /
translated: They do have meaning, and the meaning of the Mahayana scriptures is the union of awareness and emptiness, which is beyond conceptual elaborations and is clear light. This meaning is not understood by the minds of all the tirthikas and you. It is the truth in that way.

original: de 'dra ba rnam par 'jog pa ni rgyang pan pa nyid du ji ltar 'gyur zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de 'dra ba rnam par 'jog pa ni rgyang pan pa nyid du ji ltar 'gyur zhes pa'o //
translated: How could the positing of such a meaning be the same as the Lokayata?

original: de la 'jig rten rgyang pan ni gang tshad mas ma grub cing gnod pa'i don ston pa de 'dra ba ma yin nam zhes pa ste /
analyzed: de la 'jig rten rgyang pan ni gang tshad mas ma grub cing gnod pa'i don ston pa de 'dra ba ma yin nam zhes pa ste /
translated: In this regard, is not the Lokayata that which teaches a meaning that is not established by valid cognition and is undermined?

original: de yang 'khyog po'i dri ba yin pas tshad mas gnod pa de 'dra ba ston pa ni rgyang pan pa yin la /
analyzed: de yang 'khyog po'i dri ba yin pas tshad mas gnod pa de 'dra ba ston pa ni rgyang pan pa yin la /
translated: Since this is a crooked question, the assertion that it is undermined by valid cognition is a nihilistic view.

original: kho bo cag ni de 'dra ba ston pa ma yin pas de ltar mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: kho bo cag ni de 'dra ba ston pa ma yin pas de ltar mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: But we do not make such an assertion, so this is not the case.

original: 'gro ba dang zhes pa la sogs pas 'gro ba lnga'am drug gi bye brag la sogs pa dngos po'i chos thams cad du 'du ba dang zad pas bsdus pa ston par byed pa ni rgyang pan pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'gro ba dang zhes pa la sogs pas 'gro ba lnga'am drug gi bye brag la sogs pa dngos po'i chos thams cad du 'du ba dang zad pas bsdus pa ston par byed pa ni rgyang pan pa nyid do //
translated: The assertion that the teaching that all things are included in and exhausted by the five or six kinds of transmigrators, such as going and so on, is a nihilistic view.

original: 'dod pa ni 'dun pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa ni 'dun pa'o //
translated: Desire is longing.

original: snyems pa ni sems khengs pa'o //üîΩbram ze de nyid 'jig rten pha rol ma yin nam zhes pa'i don ni gling de yang snod kyi 'jig rten gzhan yin la /
analyzed: snyems pa ni sems khengs pa'o // bram ze de nyid 'jig rten pha rol ma yin nam zhes pa'i don ni gling de yang snod kyi 'jig rten gzhan yin la /
translated: Conceit is a swollen mind.üîΩThe meaning of the question, ‚ÄúIs that brahmin not the next world?‚Äù is that the continent is another world system, and the aggregates of your life there are different from your present aggregates.

original: de la gnas pa'i dus kyi khyod kyi phung po yang da ltar gyi phung po las gzhan yin pas de nyid dang de ltar gyi 'jig rten la ltos nas 'jig rten pha rol zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la gnas pa'i dus kyi khyod kyi phung po yang da ltar gyi phung po las gzhan yin pas de nyid dang de ltar gyi 'jig rten la ltos nas 'jig rten pha rol zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, in terms of that very world and that very person, it is called the next world.

original: gal te de 'dra ba'i pha rol ni yod med kyi tshe snga mas bsdus pa'i pha rol ni med do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de 'dra ba'i pha rol ni yod med kyi tshe snga mas bsdus pa'i pha rol ni med do zhe na /
translated: If you say that the other side is not included in the former side of existence or nonexistence,

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: that is not so.

original: de yang sngar bsgrubs zin to //
analyzed: de yang sngar bsgrubs zin to //
translated: That has already been established earlier.

original: nga la ma dris par zhes pa la sogs pas ni gzhan gyi tshul gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: nga la ma dris par zhes pa la sogs pas ni gzhan gyi tshul gsungs pa ste /
translated: The line, ‚ÄúWithout asking me, they think‚Ä¶‚Äù and so forth, states the system of others.

original: gzhan po de dag gi bsam pa'i tshul ni nga la ma dris par dge sbyong goo ta ma rang gi grub mtha'i tshul so sor rnam par gzhag pa brjod par sems te /
analyzed: gzhan po de dag gi bsam pa'i tshul ni nga la ma dris par dge sbyong goo ta ma rang gi grub mtha'i tshul so sor rnam par gzhag pa brjod par sems te /
translated: The system of thought of those others is that without asking me, the ascetic Gautama, they think that the system of my tenets is to be stated individually.

original: de ni nga'i tshul lugs zab mo las phyi rol tu gyur ba'i don te /üîΩnyon mongs sdug ge de ni 'jug pa med pa la sogs par smra zhing rang gi rnam par rtog pa'i mtshan nyid khong du chud par rlom pas rnam par rtog pa mi 'jug pa zab mo'i don la /üîΩrang gis rtogs shing @213a * //
analyzed: de ni nga'i tshul lugs zab mo las phyi rol tu gyur ba'i don te / nyon mongs sdug ge de ni 'jug pa med pa la sogs par smra zhing rang gi rnam par rtog pa'i mtshan nyid khong du chud par rlom pas rnam par rtog pa mi 'jug pa zab mo'i don la / rang gis rtogs shing @213a * //
translated: That is to say, they are outside of my profound system.üîΩThey say that the afflictions and suffering do not engage and so forth, and they presume to comprehend the characteristics of their own thoughts.

original: gzhan la smra ba'o snyam du sems pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan la smra ba'o snyam du sems pa'o //
translated: They think that they have realized the profound meaning of the nonengagement of conceptualization and that they will explain it to others.

original: gzhan yang blo gros chen po khyod kyang ci'i phyir de ltar ngal 'dri zhes pa'i don ni rgyang pa na pa bsnyen cing bstan na zang zing sdud kyi chos sdud pa min no zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: gzhan yang blo gros chen po khyod kyang ci'i phyir de ltar ngal 'dri zhes pa'i don ni rgyang pa na pa bsnyen cing bstan na zang zing sdud kyi chos sdud pa min no zhes gsungs te /
translated: Moreover, O Mahamati, why do you ask that? means If you approach and teach the tirthikas, you will gather material things, but not the Dharma.

original: ci'i phyir de ltar gsungs zhes nga la 'dri ste /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de ltar gsungs zhes nga la 'dri ste /
translated: Why did I say that? means You should ask me that.

original: dri bar mi 'os zhes pa'o //
analyzed: dri bar mi 'os zhes pa'o //
translated: It is not proper to ask.

original: bcom ldan 'das zhes ba la sogs pas ni chos dang zang zing gi bye brag so sor ston pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das zhes ba la sogs pas ni chos dang zang zing gi bye brag so sor ston pa'o //
translated: The Blessed One, and so on, shows the individual distinctions of Dharma and material things.

original: zang zing dang zhes pa ni spyir 'du 'dzi sna tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: zang zing dang zhes pa ni spyir 'du 'dzi sna tshogs pa'o //
translated: Material things generally means various kinds of busyness.

original: reg pa dang zhes pa la sogs pas 'khrig pa'i 'dod chags kyis kun nas bslang ba'i zang zing ste /
analyzed: reg pa dang zhes pa la sogs pas 'khrig pa'i 'dod chags kyis kun nas bslang ba'i zang zing ste /
translated: Touch and so on refer to material things motivated by sexual desire.

original: yul la lus kyis reg pa dang / lag pas 'dren pa dang / thal mos nyug pa dang thob pa bdag gir byas pas sems khengs pa dang / de dag gi bde ba'i ro myong pa dang / de las gzhan phyi'i yul sna tshogs la mngon par chags pa'o //
analyzed: yul la lus kyis reg pa dang / lag pas 'dren pa dang / thal mos nyug pa dang thob pa bdag gir byas pas sems khengs pa dang / de dag gi bde ba'i ro myong pa dang / de las gzhan phyi'i yul sna tshogs la mngon par chags pa'o //
translated: and pride in the superiority of pride, when one is proud of one's superiority over others.

original: ye shes su dbang bskur ba ni chos kyi rgyal po'i rgyal mtshan tu dbang bskur ba rang rig pa'i tshul gyis rtogs pa ste thob pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes su dbang bskur ba ni chos kyi rgyal po'i rgyal mtshan tu dbang bskur ba rang rig pa'i tshul gyis rtogs pa ste thob pa'o //
translated: The consecration of gnosis is the realization, or attainment, of the consecration of the banner of the king of the Dharma by the method of self-awareness.

original: de bzhin du shes bya'i gnas thug pa med pa mkhyen pa dang / 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos thams cad la ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin lhun gyis grub par dbang byed pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du shes bya'i gnas thug pa med pa mkhyen pa dang / 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos thams cad la ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin lhun gyis grub par dbang byed pa'o //
translated: Similarly, it is the knowledge of the infinite bases of the knowable, and the mastery of all mundane and supramundane dharmas, spontaneously and as one wishes.

original: rgyu'i dngos po med pa'i phyir 'bras bu'i rgyun kyang ldog pas chad par lta ba dang / de 'dra ba'i 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid skye ba la sogs pas mi mthong ba ni chos zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu'i dngos po med pa'i phyir 'bras bu'i rgyun kyang ldog pas chad par lta ba dang / de 'dra ba'i 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid skye ba la sogs pas mi mthong ba ni chos zhes bya'o //
translated: The nonseeing of such characteristics of conditioned states as arising is called the Dharma.

original: tshigs su bcad pa'i don ni bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi la dang po sbyin pa dang snyan par smra bas ni sems can 'dul ba ste /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa'i don ni bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi la dang po sbyin pa dang snyan par smra bas ni sems can 'dul ba ste /
translated: The meaning of the verse is this: The first two of the four principles for attracting a following generosity and speaking pleasantly are for taming sentient beings.

original: dang pos snod du rung bar byas shing de la pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi chos bstan pa'i sgo nas so //
analyzed: dang pos snod du rung bar byas shing de la pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi chos bstan pa'i sgo nas so //
translated: The first makes them suitable recipients and then the Dharma of the six perfections is taught to them.

original: tshul khrims dang shes rab ni don mthun pa dang don spyod pa mtshon pa ste /
analyzed: tshul khrims dang shes rab ni don mthun pa dang don spyod pa mtshon pa ste /
translated: Moral discipline and wisdom are indicated by having a common goal and by working for the welfare of others.

original: de la tshul khrims kyis ni gzhan la ston pa ji lta ba bzhin du rang nyid bsgrub pas sems can dbang du byed pa'am /
analyzed: de la tshul khrims kyis ni gzhan la ston pa ji lta ba bzhin du rang nyid bsgrub pas sems can dbang du byed pa'am /
translated: Of these, moral discipline is for controlling sentient beings, because it is the practice of teaching others just as it is taught.

original: de las ting nge 'dzin skye bas rang gi sems dbang du byed pa'o //
analyzed: de las ting nge 'dzin skye bas rang gi sems dbang du byed pa'o //
translated: Or it is for controlling one's own mind, because concentration arises from it.

original: shes rab kyis ni rang dang gzhan gyi lta ba phyin ci log 'joms par byed la /
analyzed: shes rab kyis ni rang dang gzhan gyi lta ba phyin ci log 'joms par byed la /
translated: Wisdom conquers the false views of self and others.

original: rnam thar sgo gsum gyi ting nge 'dzin nam shes rab goms pas de nyid shin tu spel ba'o //
analyzed: rnam thar sgo gsum gyi ting nge 'dzin nam shes rab goms pas de nyid shin tu spel ba'o //
translated: The concentration and wisdom of the three doors of liberation greatly increase through cultivation.

original: de rnams kyis kyang rim pa bzhin du ma bsdus pa sdud pa dang / bsdus pa smin pa dang / smin pa grol bar byed pa nyid du yang gsungs so //
analyzed: de rnams kyis kyang rim pa bzhin du ma bsdus pa sdud pa dang / bsdus pa smin pa dang / smin pa grol bar byed pa nyid du yang gsungs so //
translated: They are also said to respectively gather the ungathered, ripen the gathered, and liberate the ripened.

original: de las gzhan sngar bstan pa'i tshul 'di kun 'jig rten rgyang pan @213b pa zhes pa la sogs pa ste pa la cher go bar zad do //üîΩrtag dang chad pa spangs pa yi //
analyzed: de las gzhan sngar bstan pa'i tshul 'di kun 'jig rten rgyang pan @213b pa zhes pa la sogs pa ste pa la cher go bar zad do // rtag dang chad pa spangs pa yi //
translated: The rest of this is easy to understand.

original: sems ni gzung dang 'dzin pa yi //
analyzed: sems ni gzung dang 'dzin pa yi //
translated: The mind is free from eternalism and nihilism.

original: dngos po rnam pa gnyis su snang //
analyzed: dngos po rnam pa gnyis su snang //
translated: It appears as the two kinds of things,

original: zhes sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: zhes sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: the apprehended and the apprehender.

original: sems 'jug pa ni rtog pa dang bcas pa'i yid kyi g-yo ba sna tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: sems 'jug pa ni rtog pa dang bcas pa'i yid kyi g-yo ba sna tshogs pa'o //
translated: The engagement of the mind is the various movements of the conceptual mind.

original: de nas yang zhes pa la sogs pas thob bya'i 'bras bu mya ngan las 'das pa nyid du rgyas par ston te /
analyzed: de nas yang zhes pa la sogs pas thob bya'i 'bras bu mya ngan las 'das pa nyid du rgyas par ston te /
translated: Next, the extensive teaching on the result of nirvana, which is to be attained, is presented by ‚ÄúThen, again‚Ä¶‚Äù and so on.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it says:

original: rgyang phan pa las gzhan pa'i mu stegs byed rnams kyang mya ngan las 'das pa khas len na /
analyzed: rgyang phan pa las gzhan pa'i mu stegs byed rnams kyang mya ngan las 'das pa khas len na /
translated: ‚ÄúIf the tƒ´rthikas other than the CƒÅrvƒÅkas also accept nirvana,

original: de dag gi mya ngan las 'das pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa nyid kyi mya ngan las 'das pa'i tshul ji ltar lags zhes zhus pa las /
analyzed: de dag gi mya ngan las 'das pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa nyid kyi mya ngan las 'das pa'i tshul ji ltar lags zhes zhus pa las /
translated: how is their nirvana like the TathƒÅgata‚Äôs way of nirvana?‚Äù

original: lan gyi skabs su mu stegs byed ni sngar bstan pa ltar grub mtha' phyin ci log khas len pa thams cad yin la /
analyzed: lan gyi skabs su mu stegs byed ni sngar bstan pa ltar grub mtha' phyin ci log khas len pa thams cad yin la /
translated: In the context of the answer, the tƒ´rthikas are as previously explained, all of those who assert wrong views.

original: de ltar na nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i phung po la sogs pa sdug bsngal gyi bden pa 'gog pa dang / yul la 'dod chags dang bral ba ste /
analyzed: de ltar na nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i phung po la sogs pa sdug bsngal gyi bden pa 'gog pa dang / yul la 'dod chags dang bral ba ste /
translated: Thus the hearers and solitary realizers stop the aggregates and so on that are associated with defilements, which is the truth of suffering, and they are free from attachment to objects.

original: rgyu kun 'byung gi bden pa spangs pa dang / de dag spong ba'i rgyu rtag pa dang chos mi mthun pa /
analyzed: rgyu kun 'byung gi bden pa spangs pa dang / de dag spong ba'i rgyu rtag pa dang chos mi mthun pa /
translated: The truth of the origin of suffering, the cause, is eliminated, and the cause of its elimination is the sixteen aspects of the impermanence and so on that are incompatible with the origin of suffering.

original: mi rtag pa la sogs pa chos bcu drug gi rnam pa mthong bas kun nas nyon mongs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba mang po mi 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: mi rtag pa la sogs pa chos bcu drug gi rnam pa mthong bas kun nas nyon mongs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba mang po mi 'byung ba ste /
translated: By seeing these, the many minds and mental factors that are concomitant with the afflictions do not arise.

original: dus gsum gyi yul las dran pa'i rnam par rtog pa mi 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: dus gsum gyi yul las dran pa'i rnam par rtog pa mi 'byung ba'o //
translated: And because the objects of the three times do not arise, the conceptual thoughts of memory do not occur.

original: de yang mar me shi bar gyur pa la sogs pa bzhin du rgyu zad pas mi 'byung ba yin gyi /
analyzed: de yang mar me shi bar gyur pa la sogs pa bzhin du rgyu zad pas mi 'byung ba yin gyi /
translated: Moreover, just as a lamp goes out, they do not arise due to the exhaustion of the cause.

original: brtag bya'i yul stong pa nyid du rtogs pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: brtag bya'i yul stong pa nyid du rtogs pas ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not that they do not arise due to the realization that the object of investigation is emptiness.

original: de yang sngar bden pa'i dngos por yod pa'i sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung glo bur du zad pa dang / mi skye ba'o zhes zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa'i ye shes kyi dngos po 'jig par lta bas /
analyzed: de yang sngar bden pa'i dngos por yod pa'i sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung glo bur du zad pa dang / mi skye ba'o zhes zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa'i ye shes kyi dngos po 'jig par lta bas /
translated: Furthermore, the knowledge of elimination and the knowledge of nonarising are views that destroy the entities of the knowledge of suffering and the knowledge of the origin that previously existed as real things.

original: phyin ci log tu gyur pa'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa ma yin no //
analyzed: phyin ci log tu gyur pa'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa ma yin no //
translated: Because they are mistaken, they do not attain nirvana.

original: gzhan yang lam gyi dus na yang /
analyzed: gzhan yang lam gyi dus na yang /
translated: Moreover, even at the time of the path,

original: de dag 'jig par lta bas phyin ci log tu gyur pa'i phyir mya ngan las mi 'da' ba'o //
analyzed: de dag 'jig par lta bas phyin ci log tu gyur pa'i phyir mya ngan las mi 'da' ba'o //
translated: because they view those as being destroyed, they are mistaken and do not attain nirvana.

original: gzhan dag ni man ngag gi stobs kyi yul las rnam par rtog pa zad pas mda' dang rlung bzhin du bdag dam pa yul gzhan gyi gnas su song ste /
analyzed: gzhan dag ni man ngag gi stobs kyi yul las rnam par rtog pa zad pas mda' dang rlung bzhin du bdag dam pa yul gzhan gyi gnas su song ste /
translated: Others assert that the self goes to another place, like an arrow or the wind, because the conceptual thoughts that are the domain of the power of instruction are exhausted.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said,

original: phyi rol ba rnams kyis khams gsum po thams cad kyi steng na thar pa'i gnas dpag tshad 'bum phrag bzhi bcu rtsa lnga pa gdugs lta bu yod do zhes te /
analyzed: phyi rol ba rnams kyis khams gsum po thams cad kyi steng na thar pa'i gnas dpag tshad 'bum phrag bzhi bcu rtsa lnga pa gdugs lta bu yod do zhes te /
translated: ‚ÄúNon-Buddhists assert that above the three realms there is a place of liberation, 45,000 yojanas in size, like an umbrella.

original: der song bas thar par @214a * //üîΩ'dod pa la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: der song bas thar par @214a * // 'dod pa la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: By going there, one attains liberation.‚Äù

original: blo dang rig par bya ba ni gzung 'dzin sna tshogs pa ste /
analyzed: blo dang rig par bya ba ni gzung 'dzin sna tshogs pa ste /
translated: The object of cognition is the various apprehender and apprehended.

original: de lta bur snang ba med pas bdag rtag pa thar par 'dod pa ste /
analyzed: de lta bur snang ba med pas bdag rtag pa thar par 'dod pa ste /
translated: Since that does not appear, they assert that the permanent self is liberated.

original: zhi ba pa rnams kyis 'dod pa'am /
analyzed: zhi ba pa rnams kyis 'dod pa'am /
translated: This is asserted by the ≈öƒÅ·πÉkhyas and so on.

original: sngar bstan pa'i mtshan ma sna tshogs kyi dngos po med pas mya ngan las 'das pa'o zhes gsungs pa dang yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: sngar bstan pa'i mtshan ma sna tshogs kyi dngos po med pas mya ngan las 'das pa'o zhes gsungs pa dang yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Since the various signs taught previously do not exist, it is nirvana.

original: rtag pa dang mi rtag par mthong bas ni bdag la sogs pa 'ga' zhig ni rtag la /
analyzed: rtag pa dang mi rtag par mthong bas ni bdag la sogs pa 'ga' zhig ni rtag la /
translated: Since it is seen as permanent and impermanent, some such as the self is permanent,

original: gzhan gyi gzugs la sogs pa mi rtag par mthong ba'o //üîΩgzhan yang 'phags pa tshangs pa'i dra bas zhus pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: gzhan gyi gzugs la sogs pa mi rtag par mthong ba'o // gzhan yang 'phags pa tshangs pa'i dra bas zhus pa'i mdo las /
translated: but others such as form are seen as impermanent.

original: kha cig rtag par rtog pa'i lta ba rnam pa bzhi gsungs pa dang yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: kha cig rtag par rtog pa'i lta ba rnam pa bzhi gsungs pa dang yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Moreover, it should be applied to the four views that some conceive permanence in the Questions of Brahma‚Äôs Net Sutra.

original: mtshan ma mthong bas bde ba 'dod //
analyzed: mtshan ma mthong bas bde ba 'dod //
translated: Seeing signs, one desires pleasure.

original: ces pa la sogs pa ni mtshan ma rnam par rtog pa ni skran dang zug rdul sogs pa lta bur mthong bas des 'jigs pas de rnams spangs pa'i bdag rtag pa ni mchog tu dga' ba'i gnas kyi mya ngan las 'das par rig byed kyi mtha' gsang barüîΩsmra ba rnams rtog go //
analyzed: ces pa la sogs pa ni mtshan ma rnam par rtog pa ni skran dang zug rdul sogs pa lta bur mthong bas des 'jigs pas de rnams spangs pa'i bdag rtag pa ni mchog tu dga' ba'i gnas kyi mya ngan las 'das par rig byed kyi mtha' gsang barüîΩsmra ba rnams rtog go //
translated: The VedƒÅntins imagine that the self, which is permanent and the supreme abode of joy, is nirvana, since it is frightened by the view that signs are conceptualized, like a tumor, pain, pus, and so on.

original: 'dod pa'i phyir zhes pa ni 'dod pa'i yul de 'dra ba la mya ngan las 'das pa'i blo 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i phyir zhes pa ni 'dod pa'i yul de 'dra ba la mya ngan las 'das pa'i blo 'gyur ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause of desire‚Äù means that the mind of nirvana turns to such a desired object.

original: yang kha cig ste zhi ba pa dang gtogs 'dod pa dang / tshangs pa la sogs par smra ba rnams kyis dus gsum gyis bsdus pa'i bdag gi dngos po mi 'jig ste yod pa yin la /
analyzed: yang kha cig ste zhi ba pa dang gtogs 'dod pa dang / tshangs pa la sogs par smra ba rnams kyis dus gsum gyis bsdus pa'i bdag gi dngos po mi 'jig ste yod pa yin la /
translated: Again, some, such as the ≈öƒÅ·πÉkhyas, Mƒ´mƒÅ·πÉsakas, and BrahmavƒÅdins, say that the nature of the self is not destroyed and exists in the three times.

original: de 'dra ba su dag gis rig pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
analyzed: de 'dra ba su dag gis rig pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
translated: The knowledge of such a self is nirvana.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: gtogs 'dod kyis yang smras pa /üîΩ'byung po kun la bdag gnas pa //
analyzed: gtogs 'dod kyis yang smras pa / 'byung po kun la bdag gnas pa //
translated: Mƒ´mƒÅ·πÉsaka:üîΩI abide in all beings,

original: bdag la'ang 'byung po thams cad de //
analyzed: bdag la'ang 'byung po thams cad de //
translated: and all beings abide in me.

original: bdag ldan de ltar sus rig pa //
analyzed: bdag ldan de ltar sus rig pa //
translated: One who knows that I exist in that way

original: kun du mnyam par mthong ba'o //
analyzed: kun du mnyam par mthong ba'o //
translated: sees all things as equal.

original: gzhan yang / thams cad 'di ni zhi bdag ste //
analyzed: gzhan yang / thams cad 'di ni zhi bdag ste //
translated: Moreover: All this is peace,

original: zhi ba nyid las rab tu byung //
analyzed: zhi ba nyid las rab tu byung //
translated: and peace is the supreme departure.

original: 'byung po kun la zhi ba ste //
analyzed: 'byung po kun la zhi ba ste //
translated: Peace is all beings,

original: gang zhi de ni bdag nyid do //
analyzed: gang zhi de ni bdag nyid do //
translated: and peace is the self.

original: zhes pa dang / bstan pa byin 'gro de bzhin du //
analyzed: zhes pa dang / bstan pa byin 'gro de bzhin du //
translated: And: The gift of teaching is like that.

original: zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs pa'o //
translated: This and more is said.

original: gzhan yang rang gi sde pa bye brag tu smra ba rnams kyang phyi nang gi chos rnams kyi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid khong du chud cing /üîΩde dang kyang dus gsum gyis bsdus la /
analyzed: gzhan yang rang gi sde pa bye brag tu smra ba rnams kyang phyi nang gi chos rnams kyi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid khong du chud cing / de dang kyang dus gsum gyis bsdus la /
translated: Moreover, the VaibhƒÅ·π£ika, who are of our own Buddhist faction, understand the general and specific characteristics of outer and inner phenomena.üîΩThey also assert that all phenomena are subsumed by the three times.

original: dus gsum yang rdzas su grub pa ste /
analyzed: dus gsum yang rdzas su grub pa ste /
translated: The three times are also substantially established.

original: 'das pa ni 'das pa'i sa na yod cing /
analyzed: 'das pa ni 'das pa'i sa na yod cing /
translated: The past exists in the past,

original: ma 'ongs pa yang ma 'ongs pa las na yod pas de dag 'jig pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa yang ma 'ongs pa las na yod pas de dag 'jig pa ma yin te /
translated: and the future exists in the future. Therefore they do not disintegrate.

original: 'on kyang byed pa @214b zhig pa dang ma skyes pa'i sgo nas 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa nyid du 'jog cing /
analyzed: 'on kyang byed pa @214b zhig pa dang ma skyes pa'i sgo nas 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa nyid du 'jog cing /
translated: However, they posit the past and future in terms of the cessation of activity and nonarising.

original: byed pa da ltar ba ni da ltar ba nyid de 'dra bar su yis rtogs pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa nyid du rtog go //
analyzed: byed pa da ltar ba ni da ltar ba nyid de 'dra bar su yis rtogs pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa nyid du rtog go //
translated: The present activity is the present. Whoever understands it in this way is considered to be liberated.

original: chos thams cad mi 'jig ces pa ni thams cad bdag rtag pa'i rang bzhin yin pas mi 'jig pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad mi 'jig ces pa ni thams cad bdag rtag pa'i rang bzhin yin pas mi 'jig pa'o //
translated: The statement ‚Äúno phenomenon disintegrates‚Äù means that since all are the nature of a permanent self, they do not disintegrate.

original: de ltar su yis rtogs shing rig pa ni /
analyzed: de ltar su yis rtogs shing rig pa ni /
translated: Whoever understands and knows this

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'o zhes rtog pa'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'o zhes rtog pa'o //
translated: and nirvana.

original: yang grangs can gtso bo dbang phyug dang bcas par smra ba rnams ni /
analyzed: yang grangs can gtso bo dbang phyug dang bcas par smra ba rnams ni /
translated: Moreover, the SƒÅ·πÉkhya who propound a primal substance along with ƒ™≈õvaraüîΩsay that the twenty-four principles, the specific qualities of the person, and one-third of the qualities of the primal substance

original: rang bzhin nyi shu rtsa bzhi dang / skyes bu'i bye brag mthong ba dang / yon tan sum cha mnyam pa gtso bo'i rang bzhin dang / dbang phyug rtag pa rnam 'gyur sna tshogs kyi byed pa po yin la /
analyzed: rang bzhin nyi shu rtsa bzhi dang / skyes bu'i bye brag mthong ba dang / yon tan sum cha mnyam pa gtso bo'i rang bzhin dang / dbang phyug rtag pa rnam 'gyur sna tshogs kyi byed pa po yin la /
translated: are the creator of the various transformations.

original: de ltar rig cing dbang phyug mnyes par byas pa ni /
analyzed: de ltar rig cing dbang phyug mnyes par byas pa ni /
translated: They think that one who knows this and pleases ƒ™≈õvara

original: mya ngan las 'das par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das par rtog pa'o //
translated: attains nirvana.

original: yang kha cig ni bdag du dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i rnal 'byor sgom zhing /
analyzed: yang kha cig ni bdag du dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i rnal 'byor sgom zhing /
translated: Moreover, some meditate on yoga that observes the self.üîΩThey think that the mantras, sacrifices, outcasts, untouchables, brahmins, and so on,

original: de las gzhan rig sngags dang mchod sbyin dang / gdol bu dang sme sha can dang bram ze la sogs pa de ni da ltar bden pa ma yin no zhes pa'i shes rab kyis /
analyzed: de las gzhan rig sngags dang mchod sbyin dang / gdol bu dang sme sha can dang bram ze la sogs pa de ni da ltar bden pa ma yin no zhes pa'i shes rab kyis /
translated: are not true.

original: bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa'i las su dmigs pa'i mtshan ma yongs su bsregs shing zad par gyur ba ste /üîΩji ltar gtsub shing dang gtsub gtan la me phyung zhing /
analyzed: bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa'i las su dmigs pa'i mtshan ma yongs su bsregs shing zad par gyur ba ste / ji ltar gtsub shing dang gtsub gtan la me phyung zhing /
translated: The signs of the observation of meritorious and nonmeritorious karma are completely burned up and exhausted.üîΩJust as fire is produced by rubbing two sticks together,

original: me de dag nyid kyis de dag bsregs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: me de dag nyid kyis de dag bsregs pa bzhin no //
translated: and that very fire burns up those two sticks.

original: de ltar zad pas mya ngan las 'das par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar zad pas mya ngan las 'das par rtog pa'o //
translated: In that way, they imagine nirvana through exhaustion.

original: kha cig ni shes rab kyis de khon nyid ji lta ba bzhin rtogs pa med par srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar gyi sems thob pas /
analyzed: kha cig ni shes rab kyis de khon nyid ji lta ba bzhin rtogs pa med par srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar gyi sems thob pas /
translated: Some, without the wisdom that realizes reality just as it is, attain the mind of the peak of existence.

original: ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi bar la 'dod chags dang bral ba na /
analyzed: ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi bar la 'dod chags dang bral ba na /
translated: When they are free from attachment up to the base of nothingness,

original: kho bo ni nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pa'o zhes shes pas mya ngan las 'das par rtog ste /
analyzed: kho bo ni nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pa'o zhes shes pas mya ngan las 'das par rtog ste /
translated: they think, I have abandoned all afflictions and imagine that is nirvana.
